column1: Vājasaneyi-Sam̐hitā (;Sukla-Yajurveda) iṣe tvā / ūrje tvā / vāyava stha / devo vaḥ savitā prārpayatu śreṣṭhatamāya karmaṇa ā pyāyadhvam aghnyā indrāya bhāgaṃ prajāvatīr anamīvā ayakṣmā mā va stena īśata māghaśam̐so dhruvā asmin gopatau syāta bahvīḥ / yajamānasya paśūn pāhi //
column2: THEE for food. Thee for vigour. Ye are breezes. To noblest work God Savitar impel you. Inviolable! swell his share for Indra. No thief, no evil-minded man shall master you rich in off-spring, free from pain and sickness. Be constant, numerous to this lord of cattle. Guard thou the cattle of the Sacrificer.2

column1: vasoḥ pavitram asi / dyaur asi pṛthivy asi / mātariśvano gharmo 'si viśvadhā asi parameṇa dhāmnā dṛm̐hasva mā hvār mā te yajñapatir hvārṣīt //
column2: Strainer of Vasu art thou. Thou art heaven. Earth art thou. Thou art Mâtarisvan's caldron. Thou art the All-container. Stand thou firmly, secure by Law Supreme, and do not totter. Nor be thy Lord of Sacrifice unsteady. 3

column1: vasoḥ pavitram asi śatadhāraṃ vasoḥ pavitram asi sahasradhāram / devas tvā savitā punātu vasoḥ pavitreṇa śatadhāreṇa supvā / kām adhukṣaḥ //
column2: Thou art the strainer, hundred-streamed, of Vasu. Thou art the strainer, thousand-streamed, of Vasu. May Savitar the God with Vasu's strainer, thousand-streamed, rightly cleansing, purify thee. 4

column1: sā viśvāyuḥ / sā viśvakarmā / sā viśvadhāyāḥ / indrasya tvā bhāgam̐ somenā tanacmi / viṣṇo havyam̐ rakṣa //
column2: Which didst thou milk? This is the cow Visvâyu. This Visvakarman. This is Visvadhâyas. Thee, Indra's share, with Soma do I curdle. Be thou protector of the oblation, Vishnu. 5

column1: agne vratapate vrataṃ cariṣyāmi tac chakeyaṃ tan me rādhyatām / idam aham anṛtāt satyam upaimi //
column2: I will observe the vow, Lord of Vows, Agni! May I have strength therefor. Success attend me. Now into truth from untruth do I enter. 6

column1: kas tvā yunakti sa tvā yunakti kasmai tvā yunakti tasmai tvā yunakti / karmaṇe vāṃ veṣāya vām //
column2: Who is it that unites thee? He unites thee. For what doth he yoke thee? For that he yokes thee. You two for work, you two for its completion.7

column1: pratyuṣṭam̐ rakṣaḥ pratyuṣṭā arātayaḥ / niṣṭaptam̐ rakṣo niṣṭaptā arātayaḥ / urv antarikṣam anv emi //
column2: Scorched are the fiends, scorched the malignant beings. Burnt out are fiends, burnt out malignant beings. Throughout the spacious middle air I travel. 8

column1: dhūr asi dhūrva dhūrvantaṃ dhūrva taṃ yo 'smān dhūrvati taṃ dhūrva yaṃ vayaṃ dhūrvāmaḥ / devānām asi vahnitamam̐ samnitamaṃ papritamaṃ juṣṭatamaṃ devahūtamam //
column2: Thou art the yoke. Injure thou him who injures. Harm him who harm us. Harm the man we injure. Thou art the Gods’ best carrier, bound most firmly, filled fullest, welcomest, Gods’ best invoker. 9

column1: ahrutam asi havirdhānaṃ dṛm̐hasva mā hvār mā yajñapatir hvārṣīt / viṣṇus tvā kramatām / uru vātāya / apahatam̐ rakṣaḥ / yacchantāṃ pañca //
column2: Thou art unbent, receiver of oblations. Stand firmly in thy place and do not totter. Nor be thy Lord of sacrifice unsteady. Let Vishnu mount thee. To the wind lie open. The demons are expelled. Let the five grasp it. 10

column1: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / agnaye juṣṭaṃ gṛhṇāmi / agnīṣomābhyāṃ juṣṭaṃ gṛhṇāmi //
column2: By impulse of God Savitar I take thee with arms of Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan, Thee dear to Agni, dear to Agni-Soma. 11

column1: bhūtāya tvā nārātaye / svar abhivi khyeṣam / dṛm̐hantāṃ duryāḥ pṛthivyām / urv antarikṣam anv emi / pṛthivyās tvā nābhau sādayāmy adityā upasthe 'gne havyam̐ rakṣa //
column2: Thee for abundance, not for evil spirit. May mine eye look upon the light of heaven.May those with doors stand on the earth securely. Throughout the spacious middle air I travel. Upon the navel of the earth I place thee, on Aditi's lap. Protect the oblation, Agni! 12

column1: pavitre stho vaiṣṇavyau / savitur vaḥ prasava ut punāmy acchidrena pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ / devīr āpo agreguvo agrepuvo 'gra imam adya yajñaṃ nayatāgre yajñapatim̐ sudhātuṃ yajñapatiṃ devayuvam //
column2: Ye two are strainers that belong to Vishnu. By Savitar's impulse, with this flawless strainer I purify you with the rays of Sûrya. Bright Waters, flowing forward, foremost drinkers, lead forward now this sacrifice, lead forward the Sacrifice's Lord, the God-devoted Lord of the Sacrifice, the liberal giver. 13

column1: yuṣmā indro 'vṛṇīta vṛtratūrye yūyam indram avṛṇīdhvaṃ vṛtratūrye / prokṣitā stha / agnaye tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / agnīṣomābhyāṃ tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / daivyāya karmaṇe śundhadhvaṃ devayajyāyai yad vo 'śuddhāḥ parājaghnur idaṃ vas tac chundhāmi //
column2: Indra elected you in fight with Vritra: in fight with Vritra you elected Indra. By over-sprinkling are ye consecrated. I sprinkle thee agreeable to Agni. I sprinkle thee welcome to Agni-Soma. Pure for the work divine be ye, and holy, pure for the sacrifice to Gods. Whatever of yours the impure have by their touch polluted, hereby I cleanse for you from all defilement. 14

column1: śarmāsi / avadhūtam̐ rakṣo 'vadhūtā arātayaḥ / adityās tvag asi prati tvāditir vettu / adrir asi vānaspatyaḥ / grāvāsi pṛthubudhnaḥ prati tvādityās tvag vettu //
column2: Giver art thou of happiness. Rejected are fiends, rejected are malignant beings. Aditi's akin art thou. May Aditi receive thee. A wooden stone art thou. Thou art a broad-based stone. May the skin of Aditi receive thee. 15

column1: agnes tanūr asi vāco visarjanaṃ devavītaye tvā gṛhṇāmi / bṛhadgrāvāsi vānaspatyaḥ / sa idaṃ devebhyo haviḥ śamīṣva suśami śamīṣva / haviṣkṛd ehi haviṣkṛd ehi haviṣkṛd ehi //
column2: Body of Agni art thou, the releaser of speech. I seize thee for the Gods’ enjoyment. A mighty stone art thou, formed out of timber.Make ready for the Deities this oblation: with careful preparation make it ready. Havishkrit, come! Havishkrit, come! Havishkrit, come! 16

column1: kukkuṭo 'si madhujihva iṣam ūrjam ā vada tvayā vayam̐ saṃghātam̐-saṃghātaṃ jeṣma / varṣavṛddham asi / prati tvā varṣavṛddhaṃ vettu / parāpūtam̐ rakṣaḥ parāpūtā arātayaḥ / apahatam̐ rakṣaḥ / vāyur vo vi vinaktu / devo vaḥ savitā hiraṇyapāṇiḥ prati gṛbhṇātv acchidreṇa pāṇinā //
column2: Thou art a cock whose tongue is sweet with honey. Call to us hither sap and manly vigour. May we with thee in every fight be victors. Rain-grown art thou. May the rain-grown receive thee. Cleared off are fiends, cleared off are evil beings. Expelled are fiends. May Vâyu separate you. May Savitar the God, the golden-handed, with flawless hand unto himself receive you. 17

column1: dhṛṣṭir asi / apāgne agnim āmādaṃ jahi niṣ kravyādam̐ sedha / ā devayajaṃ vaha / dhruvam asi pṛthivīṃ dṛm̐ha brahmavani tvā kṣatravani sajātavany upa dadhāmi bhrātṛvyasya badhāya // agne brahma gṛbhṇīṣva / dharuṇam asy antarikṣaṃ dṛm̐ha brahmavani tvā kṣatravani sajātavany upa dadhāmi bhrātṛvyasya badhāya / dhartram asi divaṃ dṛm̐ha brahmavani tvā kṣatravani sajātavany upa dadhāmi bhrātṛvyasya badhāya / viśvābhyas tvāśābhya upa dadhāmi / cita sthordhvacitaḥ / bhṛgūṇām aṅgirasāṃ tapasā tapyadhvam //
column2: Bold art thou. Cast away the Corpse-consumer. Drive off the fire that eats raw flesh, O Agni. That which makes offerings to the Gods bring hither. Firm art thou. Make earth firm. For the foe's slaughter I set thee on, devoted to the priesthood, devoted to the nobles and the kinsmen. 18 Agni, do thou accept our holy service. Keeper art thou: make firm the Air's mid-region. For the foe's death I set thee on, devoted to priesthood and nobility and kinsmen. Thou art a stay: uphold the sky securely. For the foe's death, etc. I set thee on for sake of all the regions. Formers of layers are ye, and heap-formers, With Bhrigus’ and Angirases’ heat be heated.19

column1: śarmāsi / avadhūtam̐ rakṣo 'vadhūtā arātayaḥ / adityās tvag asi prati tvāditir vettu / dhiṣaṇāsi parvatī prati tvādityās tvag vettu / diva skambhanīr asi / dhiṣaṇāsi pārvateyī prati tvā parvatī vettu //
column2: Giver of happiness art thou. Rejected are fiends, rejected are malignant beings. Aditi's skin art thou, May Aditi receive thee. Bowl, rock art thou. May Aditi's skin receive thee. Thou art the sky's supporting pillar. Bowl from the rock art thou. The rock receive thee. 20

column1: dhānyam asi dhinuhi devān / prāṇāya tvā / udānāya tvā / vyānāya tvā / dīrghām anu prasitim āyuṣe dhāṃ devo vaḥ savitā hiraṇyapāṇiḥ prati gṛbhṇātv acchidreṇa pāṇinā / cakṣuṣe tvā / mahīnāṃ payo 'si //
column2: Grain art thou. Please the Gods. Thee for in-breathing. For out-breath thee. Thee for diffusive breathing. May I impart to life a long extension. May Savitar the God, the golden-handed, with flawless hand unto himself receive you. Thee for the eye. Juice art thou of the Great Ones. 21

column1: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / saṃ vapāmi / sam āpa oṣadhībhiḥ sam oṣadhayo rasena / sam̐ revatīr jagatībhiḥ pṛcyantām̐ saṃ madhumatīr madhumatībhiḥ pṛcyantām //
column2: By impulse of God Savitar I strew thee, with arms of Asvins, with the hands of Basilan. With plants let waters, plants with sap he mingled. United be the rich ones with the moving. The sweet ones and the sweet be joined together. 22

column1: janayatyai tvā saṃ yaumi / idam agneḥ / idam agnīṣomayoḥ / iṣe tvā / gharmo 'si viśvāyuḥ / uruprathā uru prathasvoru te yajñapatiḥ prathatām / agniṣ ṭe tvacaṃ mā him̐sīt / devas tvā savitā śrapayatu varṣiṣṭhe 'dhi nāke //
column2: For generation's sake I join thee. This is Agni's. This Agni-Soma's. Thee for food. Thou art the caldron, life of all that liveth. Spread thyself widely forth, thou, widely spreading. So may thy Lord of sacrifice spread widely. Thy skin let Agni harm not. In highest heaven let the God Savitar hake thee. 23

column1: mā bher mā saṃ vikthāḥ / atamerur yajño 'tamerur yajamānasya prajā bhūyāt / tritāya tvā / dvitāya tvā / ekatāya tvā //
column2: Fear not. Shrink not. Let not the sacrifice be languid, not languid he the Sacrificer's offspring. For Trita thee. For Dvita thee. For Ekata thee.24

column1: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade 'dhvarakṛtaṃ devebhyaḥ / indrasya bāhur asi dakṣiṇaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭiḥ śatatejā vāyur asi tigmatejā dviṣato badhaḥ //
column2: By impulse of God Savitar I take thee, with arms of Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan, thee who for Gods performest sacred service. Indra's right arm art thou: sharp with a thousand spikes, a hundred edges. The keen-edged Wind art thou, the foeman's slayer. 25

column1: pṛthivi devayajany oṣadhyās te mūlaṃ mā him̐siṣam / vrajaṃ gaccha goṣṭhānam / varṣatu te dyauḥ / badhāna deva savitaḥ paramasyāṃ pṛthivyām̐ śatena pāśair yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmas tam ato mā mauk //
column2: O Earth, whereon men serve the Gods with worship, let me not do thy plant's root any damage. Go to the pen, the cowstall. Heaven rain for thee. On this earth's farthest end, God Savitar, bind him, with hundred fetters bind the man who hates us and whom we hate. Thence do not thou him. 26

column1: apāraruṃ pṛthivyai devayajanād badhyāsam / vrajaṃ gaccha goṣṭhānam / varṣatu te dyauḥ / badhāna deva savitaḥ paramasyāṃ pṛthivyām̐ śatena pāśair yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmas tam ato mā mauk / araro divaṃ mā paptaḥ / drapsas te dyāṃ mā skan / vrajaṃ gaccha goṣṭhānam / varṣatu te dyauḥ / badhāna deva savitaḥ paramasyāṃ pṛthivyām̐ śatena pāśair yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmas tam ato mā mauk //
column2: May I drive Araru away from Earth, the seat of men's oblations to the Gods. Go to the pen . . . . . . . release him (as in verse 25). O Araru, thou shalt not soar to heaven. Let not thy drop mount upward to the sky. Go to the pen . . . . . . . release him (as in verse 25). 27

column1: gāyatreṇa tvā chandasā pari gṛhṇāmi / traiṣṭubhena tvā chandasā pari gṛhṇāmi / jagatena tvā chandasā pari gṛhṇāmi / sukṣmā cāsi śivā cāsi / syonā cāsi suṣadā cāsi / ūrjasvatī cāsi payasvatī ca //
column2: I with the metre Gâyatrî enclose thee. I lay the Trishtup metre round about thee. With Jagatî metre I confine and gird thee.Sprung from good soil art thou, and bliss-bestowing. Pleasant art thou, and a fair seat to rest on. Thou hast both strengthening food and drink in plenty. 28

column1: purā krūrasya visṛpo virapśinn udādāya pṛthivīṃ jīvadānum / yām airayam̐ś candramasi svadhābhis tām u dhīrāso anudiśya yajante // prokṣaṇīr ā sādaya / dviṣato badho 'si //
column2: Before the cruel foe's secret departure, Mighty One, raising high earth, life-bestower, which to the Moon they lifted by oblations, that earth the sages still point out and worship. Deposit in its place the sprinkling-water, Thou art the slayer of the man who hates us. 29

column1: pratyuṣṭam̐ rakṣaḥ pratyuṣṭā arātayaḥ / niṣṭaptam̐ rakṣo niṣṭaptā arātayaḥ / aniśito 'si sapatnakṣid vājinaṃ tvā vājedhyāyai saṃ mārjmi / pratyuṣṭam̐ rakṣaḥ pratyuṣṭā arātayaḥ / niṣṭaptam̐ rakṣo niṣṭaptā arātayaḥ / aniśitāsi sapatnakṣid vājinīṃ tvā vājedhyāyai saṃ mārjmi //
column2: Scorched are the demons, scorched the evil beings. Burnt out are fiends, burnt out malignant creatures. Unsharpened, thou art slayer of the foemen. Thee, rich in food, I cleanse for the food's kindling. Scorched . . . . . creatures (as above). Thee rich in food, I cleanse for the food's kindling. 30

column1: adityai rāsnāsi / viṣṇor veṣyo 'si / ūrje tvā / adabdhena tvā cakṣuṣāva paśyāmi / agner jihvāsi suhūr devebhyo dhāmne-dhāmne me bhava yajuṣe-yajuṣe //
column2: A zone for Aditi art thou. Pervader of Vishnu art thou. For great strength I take thee. I look upon thee with an eye uninjured. Thou art the tongue of Agni. Good invoker of Gods be thou at every holy station, at every sacrificial text I utter. 31

column1: savitus tvā prasava ut punāmy acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ / savitur vaḥ prasava ut punāmy acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ / tejo 'si śukram asy amṛtam asi / dhāma nāmāsi priyaṃ devānām anādhṛṣṭaṃ devayajanam asi //
column2: By Savitar's impulsion do I cleanse thee, with flawless strainer, with the rays of Sûrya. By Savitar's impulsion do I cleanse you, with flawless strainer, with the rays of Sûrya. Light art thou; thou art splendid; thou art Amrit. Thou, truly, art the Gods’ beloved station, inviolable means of holy worship.

column1: kṛṣṇo 'sy ākhareṣṭho 'gnaye tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / vedir asi barhiṣe tvā juṣṭāṃ prokṣāmi / barhir asi srugbhyas tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi //
column2: THOU art a black-buck dwelling in the covert. I sprinkle thee agreeable to Agni. Thou art the altar. Thee welcome to the sacred grass I sprinkle. Thou art the sacred covering-grass. I sprinkle thee grateful to the sacrificial ladles. 2

column1: adityai vyundanam asi / viṣṇo stupo 'si / ūrṇamradasaṃ tvā stṝṇāmi svāsasthāṃ devebhyaḥ / bhuvapataye svāhā / bhuvanapataye svāhā / bhūtānāṃ pataye svāhā //
column2: Thou art what giveth Aditi her moisture. Thou art the hair-tuft on the head of Vishnu. I spread thee, wool-soft, good for Gods to sit on. Hail to the Earth's Lord! To the World's Lord Hail! Hail to the Lord of Beings! 3

column1: gandharvas tvā viśvāvasuḥ pari dadhātu viśvasyāriṣṭyai yajamānasya paridhir asy agnir iḍa īḍitaḥ / indrasya bāhur asi dakṣiṇo viśvāvasuḥ pari dadhātu viśvasyāriṣṭyai yajamānasya paridhir asy agnir iḍa īḍitaḥ / mitrāvaruṇau tvottarataḥ pari dhattāṃ dhruveṇa dharmaṇā viśvasyāriṣṭyai yajamānasya paridhir asy agnir iḍa īḍitaḥ //
column2: For safety of this all let the Gandharva Visvâvasu lay thee round as a protection. Thou art the Sacrificer's guard, thou, Agni, lauded and worthy to receive laudation. Indra's right arm art thou. For safety . . . . . . laudation. For safety of This Ail, with firm law, northward let Mitra. Varuna lay thee round as keeper. Thou art the Sacrificer's guard . . . . . . laudation. 4

column1: vītihotraṃ tvā kave dyumantam̐ sam idhīmahi / agne bṛhantam adhvare //
column2: Thee, Sage, who offerest to Gods their banquet, we will enkindle till thou shinest brightly, thee mighty in the sacrifice, O Agni.5

column1: samid asi / sūryas tvā purastāt pātu kasyāś cid abhiśastyai / savitur bāhū sthaḥ / ūrṇamradasaṃ tvā stṝṇāmi svāsasthaṃ devebhyaḥ / ā tvā vasavo rudrā ādityāḥ sadantu //
column2: Thou art a kindler. From the east let Sûrya keep thee secure from every imprecation. You are the arms of Savitar. I spread thee as soft as wool, good for the Gods to sit on. On thee sit Vasus, Rudras, and Âdityas! 6

column1: ghṛtācy asi juhūr nāmnā sedaṃ priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam̐ sada ā sīda / ghṛtācy asy upabhṛn nāmnā sedaṃ priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam̐ sada ā sīda / ghṛtācy asi dhruvā nāmnā sedaṃ priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam̐ sada ā sīda / priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam̐ sada ā sīda / dhruvā asadann ṛtasya yonau tā viṣṇo pāhi / pāhi yajñaṃ / pāhi yajñapatim / pāhi māṃ yajñanyam //
column2: Thou who art called Juhû art rich in fatness. On this dear seat, with the dear home, be seated. Thou, Upabhrit by name, art rich in fatness. On this . . . . . . . . be seated. Thou who art called Dhruvâ, art rich in fatness. On this, etc. In the Law's lap they have sat down in safety Guard these. Guard thou the Sacrifice, O Vishnu. Keep thou the Sacrifice's Lord in safety. 7

column1: agne vājajid vājaṃ tvā sariṣyantaṃ vājajitam̐ saṃ mārjmi / namo devebhyaḥ / svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ / suyame me bhūyāstam //
column2: O Agni, Winner of the Spoil, I cleanse thee, thee who wilt hasten to the spoil, Spoil-winner. Obeisance to the Gods! Svadhâ to Fathers! Be both of you easy for me to handle. 8

column1: askannam adya devebhya ājyam̐ saṃ bhriyāsam / aṅghriṇā viṣṇo mā tvāva kramiṣam / vasumatīm agne te chāyām upa stheṣaṃ viṣṇo sthānam asi / ita indro vīryam akṛṇod ūrdhvo 'dhvara āsthāt //
column2: May I to-day offer Gods unspilt butter. Let me not with my foot offend thee, Vishnu. Agni, may I approach thy shade abounding in store of riches. Thou art Vishnu's mansion, Hence Indra wrought his deed of manly vigour. The sacrifice stood firmly elevated.9

column1: agne ver hotraṃ ver dūtyam / avatāṃ tvāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī / ava tvaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī sviṣṭakṛd devebhyo indra ājyena haviṣā bhūt svāhā / saṃ jyotiṣā jyotiḥ //
column2: O Agni, undertake the Hotar's office, take on thyself the duty of an envoy. Heaven and Earth guard thee! Guard thou Earth and Heaven. May Indra be, by this presented butter, maker to Gods of fair oblation. Svâhâ! Let light combine with light. 10

column1: mayīdam indra indriyaṃ dadhātv asmān rāyo maghavānam̐ sacantām / asmākam̐ santv āśiṣaḥ satyā naḥ santv āśiṣaḥ / upahnutā pṛthivī mātopa māṃ pṛthivī mātā hvayatām / agnir āgnīdhrāt svāhā //
column2: Indra bestow on me that Indra-power! May wealth in full abundance gather round us. Let blessings wait on us, yea, real blessings. Our Mother, Earth, hath been invited hither. May Earth, our Mother, in return invite us. I, through my Kindlership, am Agni. Svâhâ! 11

column1: upahūto dyauṣ pitopa māṃ dyauṣ pitā hvayatām agnir āgnīdhrāt svāhā / devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / prati gṛhṇāmi / agneṣ ṭvāsyena prāśnāmi //
column2: The Father Heaven hath been invited hither. May Heaven the Father in return invite us. By impulse of God Savitar I receive thee with arms of Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan. I feed upon thee with the mouth of Agni. 12

column1: etaṃ te deva savitar yajñaṃ prāhur bṛhaspataye brahmaṇe // tena yajñam ava tena yajñapatiṃ tena mām ava //
column2: God Savitar, this sacrifice of thine have they proclaimed unto Brihaspati the Brahman Priest. Therefore protect the sacrifice, protect the sacrifice's lord, protect thou me. 13

column1: mano jūtir juṣatām ājyasya bṛhaspatir yajñam imaṃ tanotu / ariṣṭaṃ yajñam̐ sam imaṃ dadhātu viśve devāsa iha mādayantām o3ṃ pra tiṣṭha //
column2: The butter's rapid flow delight his spirit! Brihaspati extend this act of worship. May he restore the sacrifice uninjured. Here let all Gods rejoice. OM! Step thou forward. 14

column1: eṣā te agne samit tayā vardhasva cā ca pyāyasva // vardhiṣīmahi ca vayam ā ca pyāsiṣīmahi // agne vājajid vājaṃ tvā sasṛvām̐saṃ vājajitam̐ saṃ mārjmi //
column2: This is the stick for kindling thee, O Agni. By means of this grow strong and swell to greatness. May we too grow in strength and swell to greatness. O Agni, thou who winnest food, I cleanse thee, thee who hast hastened to the food, Food-winner.15

column1: agnīṣomayor ujjitim anūj jeṣaṃ vājasya mā prasavena prohāmi // agnīṣomau tam apa nudatāṃ yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmo vājasyainaṃ prasavenāpohāmi // indrāgnyor ujjitim anūj jeṣaṃ vājasya mā prasavena prohāmi / indrāgnī tam apa nudatāṃ yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmo vājasyainaṃ prasavenāpohāmi //
column2: After the victory of Agni Soma may I obtain the victory. By impulse of sacrificial food I speed me onward. May Agni-Soma drive off him who hates us, drive off the man whom we detest. By impulse of sacrificial food away I drive him. After the victory of Indra-Agni may I obtain the victory. By impulse of sacrificial food I speed me forward. May Indra-Agni . . . . . . I drive him. 16

column1: vasubhyas tvā / rudrebhyas tvā / ādityebhyas tvā / saṃ jānāthāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī / mitrāvaruṇau tvā vṛṣṭyāvatām / vyantu vayo 'ktam̐ rihāṇāḥ / marutāṃ pṛṣatīr gaccha vaśā pṛśnir bhūtvā divaṃ gaccha tato no vṛṣṭim ā vaha / cakṣuṣpā agne 'si cakṣur me pāhi //
column2: For Vasus thee. For Rudras thee. Thee for Âdityas. Be, Heaven and Earth, accordant with each other. With rain may Mitra-Varuna assist thee. May the birds go, licking what is anointed. Go to the Maruts’ speckled mares. Go, having become a speckled cow thyself, to heaven, and from that place bring the rain for us hither. Thou art the eye's guard: guard mine eye, O Agni. I7

column1: yaṃ paridhiṃ paryadhatthā agne deva pāṇibhir guhyamānaḥ / taṃ ta etam anu joṣaṃ bharāmy net tvad apacetayātai // agneḥ priyaṃ pātho 'pītam //
column2: The stick which thou, God Agni, laidest round thee, what time thou wast kept hidden by the Panis, this do I bring to thee for thine enjoyment. May it remain with thee and ne’er be fruitless. Approach, ye two, the place which Agni loveth. 18

column1: sam̐sravabhāgā stheṣā bṛhantaḥ prastareṣṭhāḥ paridheyāś ca devāḥ / imāṃ vācam abhi viśve gṛṇanta āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam //
column2: The residue ye have to be your portion, mighty by food, ye Gods, ye who are stationed on the grass-bunch, and to be laid as fences. All ye, applauding this my speech, be seated on this grass-bunch and there be joyful. Svâhâ! Vât!19

column1: ghṛtācī stho dhuryau pātam̐ sumne sthaḥ sumne mā dhattam / yajña namaś ca ta upa ca yajñasya śive saṃ tiṣṭhasva sv"ṣṭe me saṃtiṣṭhasva //
column2: Rich in oil are ye. Guard the two yoke-fellows. Ye two are full of grace, to grace conduct me. Glory to thee, O Sacrifice, and increase! Stand firm in my auspicious, righteous worship. 20

column1: agne 'dabdhāyo 'śītama pāhi mā didyoḥ / pāhi prasityai / pāhi duriṣṭyai / pāhi duradmanyā aviṣaṃ naḥ pituṃ kṛṇu / suṣadā yonau svāhā vāṭ / agnaye saṃveśapataye svāhā / sarasvatyai yaśobhaginyai svāhā //
column2: O Agni of unweakened strength, far-reaching, protect me from the lightning-flash, protect me from bondage. from defect in sacrificing, from food injurious to health protect me. Make thou the food that feeds us free from poison in the home good to sit in. Svâhâ! Vât! Hail to the Lord of close embracements, Agni! Hail to Sarasvatî enriched with glory! 21

column1: vedo 'si yena tvaṃ deva veda devebhyo vedo 'bhavas tena mahyaṃ vedo bhūyāḥ / devā gātuvido gātuṃ vittvā gātum ita / manasas pata imaṃ deva yajñam̐ svāhā vāte dhāḥ //
column2: Veda art thou, whereby, O godlike Veda, thou hast become for Deities their Veda: thereby mayst thou become for me a Veda. O Deities, ye knowers of the Pathway, walk on the pathway having known the Pathway. God, Lord of Spirit, hail! bestow upon the Wind this sacrifice. 22

column1: saṃ barhir aṅktām̐ haviṣā ghṛtena sam ādityair vasubhiḥ saṃ marudbhiḥ / sam indro viśvadevebhir aṅktāṃ divyaṃ nabho gacchatu yat svāhā //
column2: Blest be the Grass with sacred food and butter. Let Indra be united with the Âdityas, the Vasus, Maruts, and the Visvedevas. Let Svâhâ-offerings rise to heavenly ether.23

column1: kas tvā vi muñcati sa tvā vi muñcati kasmai tvā vi muñcati tasmai tvā vi muñcati / poṣāya // rakṣasāṃ bhāgo 'si //
column2: Who liberates thee from the yoke? He frees thee. For whom? For him he looses thee. For plenty. Thou art the Râkshasas’ allotted portion. 24

column1: saṃ varcasā payasā saṃ tanūbhir aganmahi manasā sam̐ śivena / tvaṣṭā sudatro vi dadhātu rāyo 'numārṣṭi tanvo yad viliṣṭam //
column2: we have united with the blessèd spirit. May Tvashtar, bounteous giver, grant us riches, and clear each fault and blemish from the body. 25

column1: divi viṣṇur vy akram̐sta jāgatena chandasā tato nirbhakto yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ / antarikṣe viṣṇur vy akram̐sta jāgatena chandasā tato nirbhakto yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ / pṛthivyāṃ viṣṇur vy akram̐sta jāgatena chandasā tato nirbhakto yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ / asmād annāt / asyai pratiṣṭhāyai / aganma svaḥ / saṃ jyotiṣābhūma //
column2: By Jagatî metre in the sky strode Vishnu. Therefrom excluded is the man who hates us and whom we detest. By Trishtup metre in the air strode Vishnu. Therefrom, etc. By Gâyatrî upon the earth strode Vishnu. Therefrom, etc. From this food From this resting-place excluded. We have reached heaven. We have combined with lustre. 26

column1: svayambhūr asi śreṣṭho raśmir varcodā asi varco me dehi / sūryasyāvṛtam anv āvarte //
column2: Thou, noblest ray of light, art Self-existent. Giver art thou of splendour. Give me splendour. I move along the path that Sûrya travels. 27

column1: agne gṛhapate sugṛhapatis tvayāgne 'haṃ gṛhapatinā bhūyāsam̐ sugṛhapatis tvaṃ mayāgne gṛhapatinā bhūyāḥ / asthūri ṇau gārhapatyāni santu śatam̐ himāḥ / sūryasyāvṛtam anv āvarte //
column2: Agni, may I become a good householder, through thee, Home-master, O Householder Agni. Mayst thou become an excellent Householder through me the master of the house, O Agni. Through hundred winters may our household matters—not like a one-ox car—be smoothly managed. I move along the path that Sûrya travels. 28

column1: agne vratapate vratam acāriṣaṃ tad aśakaṃ tan me 'rādhi / idam ahaṃ ya evāsmi so 'smi //
column2: I have performed the vow, Lord of Vows, Agni! Full power was mine, and it has proved successful. Now am I he I truly am, no other.29

column1: agnaye kavyavāhanāya svāhā / somāya pitṛmate svāhā / apahatā asurā rakṣām̐si vediṣadaḥ //
column2: To Agni Hail! who bears gifts due to Sages. To Soma Hail! accompanied by Fathers. Expelled are Asuras and fiends who sate upon the covering grass. 30

column1: ye rūpāṇi pratimuñcamānā asurāḥ santaḥ svadhayā caranti / parāpuro nipuro ye bharanty agniṣ ṭān lokāt pra ṇudāty asmāt //
column2: The Asuras, attracted by oblation, who roam at will assuming varied figures, from this our world may Agni drive them, whether they clothe themselves in large or little bodies. 31

column1: atra pitaro mādayadhvaṃ yathābhāgam ā vṛṣāyadhvam / amīmadanta pitaro yathābhāgam ā vṛṣāyiṣata //
column2: O Fathers, here enjoy yourselves. Come hither, like bulls, come each to his allotted portion. The Fathers have enjoyed themselves, and hither, like bulls, come each to his allotted portion. 32

column1: namo vaḥ pitaro rasāya / namo vaḥ pitaro śoṣāya / namo vaḥ pitaro jīvāya / namo vaḥ pitaro svadhāyai / namo vaḥ pitaro ghorāya / namo vaḥ pitaro manyave namo vaḥ pitaraḥ pitaro namo vaḥ / gṛhān naḥ pitaro datta sato vaḥ pitaro deṣma / etad vaḥ pitaro vāsa ā dhatta //
column2: Obeisance to your genial sap, O Fathers! Fathers, obeisance unto you for Ardour! Fathers, obeisance Onto you for Svadhâ! Obeisance unto you for Life, O Fathers! Fathers, to you obeisance for the Awful! Fathers, obeisance unto you for Passion! O Fathers, unto you be adoration. Bestow upon us houses, O ye Fathers, what is ours, O Fathers, will we give you. With this your raiment clothe yourselves, O Fathers. 33

column1: ā dhatta pitaro garbhaṃ kumāraṃ puṣkarasrajam / yatheha puruṣo 'sat //
column2: Fathers, bestow on me a babe, a boy enwreathed with lotuses, so that there may be here a man.34

column1: ūrjaṃ vahantīr amṛtaṃ ghṛtaṃ payaḥ kilālaṃ parisrutam / svadhā stha tarpayata me pitṛn //
column2: Bearers of vigour and immortal fatness, milk and sweet beverage and foaming liquor, ye are a freshening draught. Delight my Fathers.

column1: susamiddhāya śociṣe ghṛtaṃ tīvraṃ juhotana / agnaye jātavedase //
column2: To Agni Jâtavedas, to the flame, the well-enkindled God, Offer thick sacrificial oil. 3

column1: taṃ tvā samidbhir aṅgiro ghṛtena vardhayāmasi / bṛhacchocā yaviṣṭya // upa tvāgne haviṣmatīr ghṛtācīr yantu haryata / juṣasva samidho mama //
column2: Thee, such, O Angiras, with brands and sacred oil we magnify, O very brilliant, Youthfullest. 4 Rich in oblations, dropping oil, to thee, sweet Agni, let them go. Accept with favour these my brands. 5

column1: bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ / dyaur iva bhūmnā pṛthivīva varimṇā // tasyās te pṛthivi devayajani pṛṣṭhe 'gnim annādam annādyāyā dadhe //
column2: Earth! Ether! Sky! Like heaven in plenty and like earth in compass! Upon thy back, Earth, place of sacrificing to Gods, for gain of food I lay food-eating Agni. 6

column1: āyaṃ gauḥ pṛśnir akramīd asadan mātaraṃ puraḥ / pitaraṃ ca prayant svaḥ //
column2: This spotted Bull hath come and sat before the Mother and before The Father, mounting up to heaven.7

column1: antaś carati rocanāsya prāṇād apānatī / vy akhyan mahiṣo divam // trim̐śad dhāma vi rājati vāk pataṅgāya dhīyate / prati vastor aha dyubhiḥ //
column2: As expiration from his breath his radiance penetrates within: The Bull shines out through all the sky. 8 He rules supreme through thirty realms. Song is bestowed upon the Bird Throughout the days at break of morn. 9

column1: agnir jyotir jyotir agniḥ svāhā / sūryo jyotir jyotiḥ sūryaḥ svāhā / agnir varco jyotir varcaḥ svāhā / sūryo varco jyotir varcaḥ svāhā / jyotiḥ sūryaḥ sūryo jyotiḥ svāhā //
column2: Agni is light, and light is Agni. Hail! Sûrya is light, and light is Sûrya. Hail! Agni is splendour, light is splendour. Hail! Sûrya is splendour, light is splendour. Hail! Light is Sûrya, Sûrya is light. Hail! 10

column1: sajūr devena savitrā sajū rātryendravatyā / juṣāṇo agnir vetu svāhā //
column2: Accordant with bright Savitar and Night with Indra at her side, May Agni, being pleased, enjoy. All-hail! 11

column1: upaprayanto adhvaraṃ mantraṃ vocemāgnaye / āre asme ca śṛṇvate //
column2: Approaching sacrifice, may we pronounce a text to Agni who Heareth us even when afar. 12

column1: agnir mūrdhā divaḥ kakut patiḥ pṛthivyā ayam / apām̐ retām̐si jinvati //
column2: Agni is head and height of heaven, the Master of the earth is he: He quickeneth the waters’ seed. 13

column1: ubhā vām indrāgnī āhuvadhyā ubhā rādhasaḥ saha mādayadhyai / ubhā dātārāv iṣām̐ rayīṇām ubhā vājasya sātaye huve vām //
column2: You two will I invoke, O Indra-Agni, will please you both together with oblation. Givers, you twain, of vigorous strength and riches, you twain do I invoke for gain of vigour. 14

column1: ayaṃ te yonir ṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ / taṃ jānann agna ārohāthā no vardhayā rayim //
column2: This is thine ordered place of birth whence, sprung to life, thou shonest forth. Knowing this, Agni, rise thou up and cause our riches to increase. 15

column1: ayam iha prathamo dhāyi dhātṛbhir hotā yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyaḥ / yam apnavāno bhṛgavo virurucur vaneṣu citraṃ vibhvaṃ viśe-viśe //
column2: Here by ordainers was this God appointed first Invoker, best at worship, to be praised at rites, Whom Apnavâna and the Bhrigus caused to shine, bright-coloured in the wood, spreading to every house.16

column1: asya pratnām anu dyutam̐ śukraṃ duduhre ahrayaḥ / payaḥ sahasrasām ṛṣim //
column2: After his ancient splendour they, the bold, have drawn the bright milk from The Sage who wins a thousand gifts. 17

column1: tanūpā agne 'si tanvaṃ me pāhi / āyurdā agne 'sy āyur me dehi / varcodā agne 'si varco me dehi / agne yan me tanvā ūnaṃ tan me ā pṛṇa //
column2: Thou, Agni, art our bodies’ guard. Guard thou my body. Giver of life art thou, O Agni. Give me life. Giver of splendour art thou, Agni. Give me splendour. All that is wanting in my body, Agni, supply for me. 18

column1: indhānās tvā śatam̐ himā dyumantam̐ sam idhīmahi / vayasvanto vayaskṛtam̐ sahasvantaḥ sahaskṛtam / agne sapatnadambhanam adabdhāso adābhyam / citrāvaso svasti te pāram aśīya //
column2: Enkindled we enkindle thee through hundred winters, thee the bright; We healthy, thee who givest health; we strong, thee author of our strength; We, never injured, Agni, thee uninjured injurer of foes. O rich in shining lights, may I in safety rich the end of thee. 19

column1: saṃ tvam agne sūryasya varcasāgathāḥ sam ṛṣīṇām̐ stutena / saṃ priyeṇa dhāmnā sam aham āyuṣā saṃ varcasā saṃ prajayā sam̐ rāyas poṣeṇa gmiṣīya //
column2: Thou hast attained, O Agni, to the splendour of Sûrya, to the eulogy of Rishis, and to the habitation which thou lovest. May I attain to lengthened life, to splendour, to offspring and abundant store of riches. 20

column1: andha sthāndho vo bhakṣīya maha stha maho vo bhakṣīyorja sthorjaṃ vo bhakṣīya rāyas poṣa stha rāyas poṣaṃ vo bhakṣīya //
column2: Ye are food, may I enjoy your food. Ye are might, may I enjoy your might. Ye are energy, may I enjoy your energy. Ye are abundant riches, may I enjoy your abundant riches. 21

column1: revatī ramadhvam asmin yonāv asmin goṣṭhe 'smiṃl loke 'smin kṣaye // ihaiva sta māpagāta //
column2: Sport, wealthy ones, in this abode, this fold, this spot, this dwelling-place. Remain just here, and go not hence. 22

column1: sam̐hitāsi viśvarūpy `ūrjā māviśa gaupatyena / upa tvāgne dive-dive doṣāvastar dhiyā vayam / namo bharanta emasi //
column2: Composed art thou of every form and colour. With sap and. ownership of kine approach me. To thee, dispeller of the night, O Agni, day by day with prayer, Bringing thee reverence, we come;23

column1: rājantam adhvarāṇāṃ gopām ṛtasya dīdivim / vardhamāṇam̐ sve dame //
column2: Ruler of sacrifices, guard of Law eternal, radiant One, Increasing in thine own abode. 24

column1: sa naḥ piteva sūnave 'gne sūpāyano bhava / sacasvā naḥ svastaye //
column2: Be to us easy of approach, even as a father to his son: Agni, be with us for our weal. 25

column1: agne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhavā varūthyaḥ / vasur agnir vasuśravā acchānakṣi dyumattamam̐ rayiṃ dāḥ //
column2: O Agni, be our nearest Friend; be thou a kind deliverer and gracious Friend. Excellent Agni, come thou nigh to us, and give us wealth most splendidly renowned. 26

column1: taṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ / sa no bodhi śrudhī havam uruṣyā ṇo adhāyataḥ samasmāt //
column2: To thee then, O most bright, O radiant God, we come with prayer for happiness for our friends. So hear us, listen to this call of ours, and keep us far from every evil man. 27

column1: iḍa ehy adita ehi // kāmyā eta / mayi vaḥ kāmadharaṇaṃ bhūyāt //
column2: O Ida, come, O Aditi, come hither. Come hither, much-desired! From you may I obtain my heart's desire. 28

column1: somānam̐ svaraṇaṃ kṛṇuhi brahmaṇaspate / kakṣīvantaṃ ya auśijaḥ //
column2: O Brahmanaspati, make him who presses Soma glorious, Even Kakshîvân Ausija. 29

column1: yo revān yo amīvahā vasuvit puṣṭivardhanaḥ / sa naḥ siṣaktu yas turaḥ //
column2: The rich, the healer of disease, who findeth wealth, increaseth store, The prompt,—may he be with us still. 30

column1: mā naḥ śam̐so araruṣo dhūrtiḥ pra ṇaṅ nartyasya / rakṣā ṇo brahmaṇaspate //
column2: Let not the foeman's curse, let not a mortal's treachery fall on us: Preserve us, Brahmanaspati! 31

column1: mahi trīṇām avo 'stu dyukṣaṃ mitrasyāryamṇaḥ / durādharṣaṃ varuṇasya //
column2: Great, heavenly, unassailable, ours be the favour of the Three, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna. 32

column1: nahi teṣām amā cana nādhvasu vāraṇeṣu / īśe ripur aghaśam̐saḥ //
column2: For over them, neither at home nor upon pathways perilous, The evil-minded foe hath power. 33

column1: te hi putrāso aditeḥ pra jīvase martyāya / jyotir yacchanty ajasram //
column2: For they, the Sons of Aditi, bestow eternal light upon A mortal man that he may live.34

column1: kadā cana starīr asi nendra saścasi dāśuṣe / upopen nu maghavan bhūya in nu te dānaṃ devasya pṛcyate //
column2: Ne’er art thou fruitless, Indra, ne’er dost thou forsake thy worshipper. But now. O Liberal Lord, thy bounty as a God is ever poured forth more and more. 35

column1: tat savitur vareṇyaṃ bhargo devasya dhīmahi / dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayat //
column2: May we attain that excellent glory of Savitar the God: So may he stimulate our prayers. 36

column1: pari te dūḍabho ratho 'smām̐ aśnotu viśvataḥ / yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ //
column2: May thine inviolable car wherewith thou guardest worshippers Come near to us from every side. 37

column1: bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ suprajāḥ prajābhi syām̐ suvīro vīraiḥ supoṣaḥ poṣaiḥ / narya prajāṃ me pāhi / śam̐sya paśūn me pāhi / atharya pituṃ me pāhi //
column2: Earth! Ether! Sky! May I be rich in offspring, well-manned with men and opulent with riches. Friendly to men! do thou protect my offspring. Worthy of praise! do thou protect my cattle. O pointed One, protect the food that feeds me. 38

column1: āganma viśvavedasam asmabhyaṃ vasuvittamam / agne samrāḍ abhi dyumnam abhi saha ā yacchasva //
column2: We have approached the Omniscient, best finder-out of wealth for us. Splendour and strength bestow on us, O Agni, thou Imperial Lord. 39

column1: ayam agnir gṛhapatir gārhapatyaḥ prajāyā vasuvittamaḥ / agne gṛhapate 'bhi dyumnam abhi saha ā yacchasva // ayam agniḥ purīṣyo rayimān puṣṭivardhanaḥ / agne purīṣyābhi dyumnam abhi saha ā yacchasva //
column2: Lord of the Home, this Agni Gârhapatya is best at finding riches for our children. Splendour and strength bestow on us, O Agni, Master of the Home. 40 Rich, furtherer of plenty is this Agni, Master-of the Herd. Splendour and strength bestow on us, O Agni, Master of the Herd. 41

column1: gṛhā mā bibhīta mā vepadhvam ūrjaṃ bibhrata emasi / ūrjaṃ bibhrad vaḥ sumanāḥ sumedhā gṛhān aimi manasā modamānaḥ //
column2: Fear not, nor tremble thou, O House. To thee who bearest strength we come.I, bearing strength, intelligent and happy, come to thee, House, rejoicing in my spirit. 42

column1: yeṣām adhyeti pravasan yeṣu saumanaso bahuḥ / gṛhān upa hvayāmahe te no jānantu jānataḥ //
column2: The home on which the wanderer thinks, where cheerfulness and joy abound We call the Home to welcome us. May it know us who know it well. 43

column1: upahūtā iha gāva upahūtā ajāvayaḥ / atho annasya kīlāla upahūto gṛheṣu naḥ / kṣemāya vaḥ śāntyai pra padye śivam̐ śagmam̐ śamyoḥ śamyoḥ //
column2: Here have the cows been called to us, the goats and sheep have been called near, And in our home we have addressed the meath that sweeteneth our food. I come to thee for safety and for quiet. May joy be ours, felicity, and blessing. 44

column1: praghāsino havāmahe marutaś ca riśādasaḥ / karambheṇa sajoṣasaḥ //
column2: We invocate the Maruts, the voracious, eaters of their foes, Delighting in their mess of meal. 45

column1: yad grāme yad araṇye yat sabhāyāṃ yad indriye / yad enaś cakṛmā vayam idaṃ tad ava yajāmahe svāhā //
column2: We expiate by sacrifice each sinful act that we have done, Whether in village or the wild, in company or corporeal sense. Svâhâ! 46

column1: mo ṣū ṇa indrātra pṛtsu devair asti hi ṣmā te śuṣminn avayāḥ / mahaś cid yasya mīḍhuṣo yavyā haviṣmato maruto vandate gīḥ //
column2: Let us not here contend with Gods, O Indra, for, Fierce One! here is thine own sacred portion, Thine, Mighty One, whose friends, the bounteous Maruts, his song who pours oblation, streamlike, honours. 47

column1: akran karma karmakṛtaḥ saha vācā mayobhuvā / devebhyaḥ karma kṛtvāstaṃ preta sacābhuvaḥ //
column2: The skilful workers have performed their work with voice that gives delight. Having performed the work for Gods, go, ye companions, to your home. 48

column1: avabhṛtha nicumpuṇa nicerur asi nicumpuṇaḥ / ava devair devakṛtam eno 'yāsiṣam ava martyair martyakṛtam / pururāvṇo deva riṣas pāhi //
column2: O ever-moving Cleansing Bath, thou movest gliding on thy way.With Gods may I wash out the sin that I have sinned against the Gods, with men the sin against mankind. Preserve me safe from injury, O God, from him who loudly roars. 49

column1: pūrṇā darvi parā pata supūrṇā punar ā pata / vasneva vi krīṇāvahā iṣam ūrjam̐ śatakrato //
column2: Full, fly away, O spoon, and filled completely fly thou back to us. O Satakratu, let us twain barter, like goods, our food and strength. 50

column1: dehi me dadāmi te ni me dhehi ni te dadhe / nihāraṃ ca harāsi me nihāraṃ niharāṇi te svāhā //
column2: Give me, I give thee gifts: bestow on me, and I bestow on thee. To me present thy merchandize, and I to thee will give my wares. 51

column1: akṣann amīmadanta hy ava priyā abhūṣata / astoṣata svabhānavo viprā niviṣṭhayā matī yojā nv "ndra te harī // susaṃdṛśaṃ tvā vayaṃ maghavan vandiṣīmahi / pra nūnaṃ pūrṇabandhura stuto yāsi vaśām̐ anu yojā nv "ndra te harī //
column2: Well have they eaten and regaled: the friends have risen and passed away. The sages, luminous in themselves, have praised thee with their latest hymn. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds. 52 Thee will we reverence, thee, O Lord of Bounty, who art fair to see. Thus praised, according to our wish come now with richly-laden car. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds. 53

column1: mano nv āhvamahe nārāśam̐sena stomena / pitṝṇāṃ ca manmabhiḥ //
column2: We call the spirit hither with a hero-celebrating strain, Yea, with the Fathers’ holy hymns. 54

column1: ā na etu manaḥ punaḥ kratve dakṣāya havise / jmok ca sūryaṃ dṛśe //
column2: The spirit comes to us again for wisdom, energy, and life, That we may long behold the Sun. 55

column1: punar naḥ pitaro mano dadātu daivyo janaḥ / jīvaṃ vrātam̐ sacemahi //
column2: O Fathers, may the Heavenly Folk give us the spirit once again, That we may be with those who live.56

column1: vayam̐ soma vrate tava manas tanūṣu bibhrataḥ / prajāvantaḥ sacemahi //
column2: O Soma, with the spirit still within us, blest with progeny, May we be busied in thy law. 57

column1: eṣa te rudra bhāgaḥ saha svasrāmbikayā taṃ juṣasva svāhā / eṣa te rudra bhāga ākhus te paśuḥ //
column2: O Rudra, this is thine allotted portion. With Ambikâ thy sister kindly take it. This, Rudra, is thy share, the rat thy victim. 58

column1: ava rudramad īmahy ava devaṃ tryambakam / yathā no vasyasas karad yad yathā naḥ śreyasas karad yad yathā no vyavasāyayāt //
column2: We have contented Rudra, yea, put off Tryambaka the God, That he may make us wealthier, may make us yet more prosperous, may make us vigorous to act. 59

column1: bheṣajam asi bheṣajaṃ gave 'śvāya puruṣāya bheṣajam / sukhaṃ meṣāya meṣyai //
column2: Thou art a healing medicine, a balm for cow and horse and man, a happiness to ram and ewe. 60

column1: tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sugandhiṃ puṣṭivardhanam / urvārukam iva bandhanān mṛtyor mukṣīya māmṛtāt // tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sugandhiṃ pativedanam / urvārukam iva bandhanād ito mukṣīya māmutaḥ //
column2: Tryambaka we worship, sweet augmenter of prosperity. As from its stem a cucumber, may I be freed from bonds of death, not reft of immortality. We worship him, Tryambaka, the husband-finder, sweet to smell. As from its stem a cucumber, hence and not thence may I be loosed. 61

column1: etat te rudrāvasaṃ tena paro mūjavato 'tīhi / avatatadhanvā pinākāvasaḥ kattivāsā ahim̐san naḥ śivo 'tīhi //
column2: This, Rudra, is thy food: with this depart beyond the Mûjavâns. With bow unstrung, with staff, clothed in a garment made of skin, gracious, not harming us, depart. 62

column1: tryāyuṣaṃ jamadagneḥ kaśyapasya tryāyuṣam / yad deveṣu tryāyuṣaṃ tan no astu tryāyuṣam //
column2: May Jamadagni's triple life, the triple life of Kasyapa, The triple life of Deities—may that same triple life be ours.63

column1: śivo nāmāsi svadhitis te pitā namas te astu mā mā him̐sīḥ / ni vartayāmy uṣe 'nnādyāya prajananāya rāyas poṣāya suprajāstvāya suvīryāya //
column2: Gracious, thy name; the thunder is thy father. Obeisance be to thee: forbear to harm me. I shave thee for long life, for food to feed thee, for progeny, for riches in abundance, for noble children, for heroic vigour.

column1: edam aganma devayajanaṃ pṛthivyā yatra devāso ajuṣanta viśve / ṛk sāmābhyā saṃtaranto yajurbhī rāyas poṣeṇa sam iṣā madema / imā āpaḥ śam u me santu devīḥ / oṣadhe trāyasva / svadhite mainam̐ him̐sīḥ //
column2: WE have reached this earth's place of sacrificing, the place wherein all Deities delighted. Crossing by Rik, by Sâman, and by Yajus, may we rejoice in food and growth of riches. Gracious to me be these Celestial Waters! Protect me, Plant. O Knife, forbear to harm him. 2

column1: āpo asmān mātaraḥ śundhayantu ghṛtena no ghṛtapvaḥ punantu / viśvam̐ hi ripraṃ pravahanti devīḥ / ud idābhyaḥ śucir ā pūta emi / dīkṣātapasos tanūr asi taṃ tvā śivām̐ śagmāṃ pari dadhe bhadraṃ varṇaṃ puṣyan //
column2: The Mother Floods shall make us bright and shining, cleansers of holy oil, with oil shall cleanse us. For, Goddesses, they bear off all defilement. I rise up from them purified and brightened. The form of Consecration and of Fervour art thou. I put thee on, the kind and blissful, maintaining an agreeable appearance. 3

column1: mahīnāṃ payo 'si varcodā asi varco me dehi / vṛtrasyāsi kanīnakaś cakṣurdā asi cakṣur me dehi //
column2: The Great Ones’ milk art thou. Giver of splendour art thou: bestow on me the gift of splendour. Pupil art thou of Vritra's eye. The giver of eyes art thou. Give me the gift of vision. 4

column1: citpatir mā punātu / vākpatir mā punātu / devo mā savitā punāv acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ / tasya te pavitrapate pavitrapūtasya yatkāmaḥ pune tac chakeyam //
column2: Purify me the Lord of Thought! Purify me the Lord of Speech! Purify me God Savitar with perfect strainer, with the beams of Sûrya!Of thee, Lord of the Strainer! who art by the strainer purified, With what desire I purify myself, may I accomplish it. 5

column1: ā vo devāsa īmahe vāmaṃ prayaty adhvare / ā vo devāsa āśiṣo yajñiyāso havāmahe //
column2: We come to you for precious wealth, O Gods, as sacrifice proceeds. O Gods, we call on you to give blessings that wait on sacrifice. 6

column1: svāhā yajñaṃ manasaḥ / svāhoror antarikṣāt / svāhā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām / svāhā vātād ā rabhe svāhā //
column2: Svâhâ! from mind the sacrifice. Svâhâ! from spacious firmament. Svâhâ! from Dyaus and Prithivî. Svâhâ! from Wind I seize. Svâhâ! 7

column1: ākūtyai prayuje 'gnaye svāhā medhāyai manase 'gnaye svāhā dīkṣāyai tapase 'gnaye svāhā sarasvatyai pūṣṇe 'gnaye svāhā āpo devīr bṛhatīr viśvaśambhuvo dyāvāpṛthivī uro antarikṣa / bṛhaspataye haviṣā vidhema svāhā //
column2: To Resolution, Motive, Agni, Svâhâ! All-hail to Wisdom, and to Mind, and Agni! All-hail to Consecration, Fervour, Agni! Hail to Sarasvatî, Pûshan, and Agni! Ye vast, divine, all-beneficial Waters, ye Heaven and Earth and spacious Air between them, Let us adore Brihaspati with oblation. All-hail! 8

column1: viśvo devasya netur marto vurīta sakhyam / viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṃ vṛṇīta puṣyase svāhā //
column2: May every mortal man elect the friendship of the guiding God. Each one solicits him for wealth: let him seek fame to prosper him. 9

column1: ṛksāmayoḥ śilpe sthas te vām ā rabhe te mā pātamāsya yajñasyodṛcaḥ / śarmāsi śarma me yaccha namas te astu mā mā him̐sīḥ //
column2: Rik's, Sâman's counterparts are ye. I touch you. Protect me till the sacrifice be ended. Thou art a place of refuge. Give me refuge. Obeisance unto thee! Forbear to harm me. 10

column1: ūrg asy āṅgirasyūrṇamradā ūrjaṃ mayi dhehi / somasya nīvir asi / viṣṇoḥ śarmāsi śarma yajamānasya / indrasya yonir asi / susasyāḥ kṛṣīs kṛdhi / uc chrayasva vanaspata ūrdhvo mā pāhy am̐hasa āsya yaj#asyudṛcaḥ //
column2: Strength of Angirases art thou. Wool-soft, bestow thou strength on me. Thou art the garment-knot of Soma. Vishnu's refuge art thou, the Sacrificer's refuge.Thou art the womb of Indra. Make the crops produce abundant grain. Stand up erect, O Tree. Protect me from harm until this sacrifice be ended. 11

column1: vrataṃ kṛṇutāgnir brahmāgnir yajño vanaspatir yajñiyaḥ / daivīṃ dhiyaṃ manāmahe sumṛḍīkām abhiṣṭaye varcodhāṃ yajñavāhasam̐ sutīrthā no asad vaśe / ye devā manojātā manoyujo dakṣakratavas te no 'vantu te naḥ pāntu tebhaḥ svāhā //
column2: Prepare ye vow-food. Agni is the Brahman, Agni is sacrifice, the tree is holy. For aid we meditate divine Intelligence, most merciful, Free-giver, bringing worship May it guide us gently, as we would. Favour us Gods, mind-horn, endowed with mind and intellectual might! All-hail to them! May they be our protectors. 12

column1: śvātrāḥ pītā bhavata yūyam āpo asmākam antar udare suśevāḥ / tā asmabhyam ayakṣmā anamīvā anāgasaḥ svadantu devīr amṛtā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ //
column2: Waters that we have drunk! become refreshing, become auspicious draughts within our belly. Free from all sin and malady and sickness, may they be pleasant to our taste, divine Ones, immortal, strengtheners of eternal Order. 13

column1: iyaṃ te yajñiyā tanūḥ / apo muñcāmi na prajām / am̐homucaḥ svāhākṛtāḥ pṛthivīm āviśata / pṛthivyā saṃbhava //
column2: This is thy sacrificial form. Not offspring, waters I discharge. Freeing from sin and consecrate by Svâhâ enter ye the earth. Be thou united with the earth. 14

column1: agne tvam̐ su jāgṛhi vayam̐ su mandiṣīmahi / rakṣā ṇo aprayucchan prabudhe naḥ punas kṛdhi //
column2: O Agni, watch thou well. May we take joy in most refreshing sleep. Protect us with unceasing care. From slumber waken us again.15

column1: punar manaḥ punar āyur ma āgan punaḥ prāṇaḥ punar ātmā ma āgan punaś cakṣuḥ punaḥ śrotraṃ ma āgan / vaiśvānaro adabdhas tanūpā agnir naḥ pātu duritād avadyāt //
column2: Thought hath returned to me, and life; my breath and soul have come again. Our bodies' guard, unscathed, Vaisvânara Agni preserve us from misfortune and dishonour. 16

column1: tvam agne vratapā asi deva ā martyeṣv ā tvaṃ yajñeṣv īḍyaḥ / rāsveyatsomā bhūyo bhara devo naḥ savitā vasor dātā vasv adāt //
column2: Thou, Agni, art the guardian God of sacred vows among mankind, thou meet for praise at holy rites. Grant this much, Soma! bring yet more. God Savitar who giveth wealth hath given treasure unto us. 17

column1: eṣā te śukra tanūr etad varcas tayā saṃ bhava bhrājaṃ gaccha / jūr asi dhṛtā manasā juṣṭā viṣṇave //
column2: This is thy form, O Bright One, this thy lustre. Combine with this thy form and go to splendour. Impetuous art thou, upheld by mind, and Vishnu loveth thee. 18

column1: tasyās te satyasavasaḥ prasave tanvo yantram aśīya svāhā / śukram asi candram asy amṛtam asi vaiśvadevam asi //
column2: Moved by thine impulse who hast true impulsion, may I obtain a prop to stay my body. Pure art thou, glistering art thou, immortal, dear to all the Gods. 19

column1: cid asi manāsi dhīr asi dakṣiṇāsi kṣatriyāsi yajñiyāsy aditir asy ubhayataḥśīrṣṇī / sā naḥ suprācī supratīcy edhi mitras tvā padi badhnītāṃ pūṣādhvanas pātv indrāyādhyakṣāya //
column2: Thought art thou, mind, intelligence, the Guerdon, royal, worshipful, Aditi with a double head. Succeed for us in going forth, succeed for us in thy return. May Mitra bind thee by the foot. May Pûshan guard thy pathways for Indra whose eye is over all.20

column1: anu tvā mātā manyatām anu pitānu bhrātā sagarbhyo 'nu sakhā sayūthyaḥ // sā devi devam acchehīndrāya somam̐ rudras tvā vartayatu svasti somsakhā punar ehi //
column2: Thy mother give thee leave to go, thy father, thine own brother, and thy friend of the same herd with thee! Go thou, O Goddess, to the God. To Soma go for Indra's sake. May Rudra turn thee back. Return safely with Soma as thy friend. 21

column1: vasvy asy aditir asyādityāsi rudrāsi candrāsi / bṛhaspatiṣ ṭvā sumne ramṇātu rudro vasubhir ā cake //
column2: Thou art a Vasvî, thou art Aditi, thou art an Âdityâ, thou art a Rudrâ, thou art a Chandrâ. Brihaspati vouchsafe thee rest and comfort! Rudra with Vasus looks on thee with favour. 22

column1: adityās tvā mūrdhann ā jigharmi devayajane pṛthivyā iḍāyās padam asi ghṛtavat svāhā / asme ramasva / asme te bandhuḥ / tve rāyaḥ / me rāyaḥ / mā vayam̐ rāyaspoṣeṇa vi yauṣma / toto rāyaḥ //
column2: On Aditi's head I sprinkle thee, on the earth's place of sacrifice. Footstep of Idâ art thou, filled with fatness. Hail! Rejoice in us. Thy kinship is in us. In thee are riches. Mine be riches! Let us not be deprived of abundant riches. Thine, thine are riches. 23

column1: sam akhye devyā dhiyā saṃ dakṣiṇayorucakṣasā / mā ma āyuḥ pra moṣīr mo ahaṃ tava / vīraṃ videya tava devi saṃdṛśi //
column2: I with my thought have commerced with divine far-sighted Dakshinâ. Steal not my life. I will not thine. May I, O Goddess, in thy sight find for myself a hero son. 24

column1: eṣa te gāyatro bhāga iti me somāya brūtād eṣa te traiṣṭubho bhāga iti me somāya brūtād eṣa te jāgato bhāga iti me somāya brūtāc chandonāmānām̐ sāmrājyaṃ gaccheti me somāya brūtāt //
column2: Tell Soma this for me: This is thy share allied with Gâyatrî. For me say this to Soma: This is thine allotted Trishtup share. Tell Soma this for me: This is thy share allied with Jagatî. Tell Soma this for me: Win thou sole lordship of the metres’ names. Ours art thou: pure thy juice for draught. Let separators pick thee out.25

column1: āsmāko 'si śukras te grahyo vicitas tvā vi cinvantu // abhi tyaṃ devam̐ savitāram oṇyoḥ kavikratum arcāmi satyasavam̐ ratnadhām abhi priyaṃ matiṃ kavim // ūrdhvā yasyāmatir bhā adidyutat savīmani hiraṇyapāṇir amimīta sukratuḥ kṛpā svaḥ // prajābhyas tvā //
column2: I sing my song of praise to him, Savitar, God between the Bowls, strong with the wisdom of the wise, of true impulsion, wealth-giver, the well-beloved thoughtful Sage. To him at whose impulsion shone aloft in heaven the splendid light. Most wise, the Golden-handed hath measured the sky with skilled design. For living creatures, thee. Let living creatures breathe after thee. Breathe after living creatures. 26

column1: prajās tvānuprāṇantu prajās tvam anuprāṇihi // śukraṃ tvā śukreṇa krīṇāmi candraṃ candreṇāmṛtam amṛtena / sagme te goḥ / asme te candrāṇi / tapasas tanūr asi prajāpater varṇaḥ parameṇa paśunā krīyase sahasrapoṣaṃ puṣeyam //
column2: Thee who art pure, with what is pure I purchase, the bright with bright, immortal with immortal. The Sacrificer keep thy cow. Let thy gold pieces be with us. Fervour's form art thou, and Prajâpati's nature. With the most noble animal art thou purchased. May I increase with thousandfold abundance. 27

column1: mitro na ehi sumitradhaḥ / indrasyorum ā viśa dakṣiṇam uśann uśantam̐ syonaḥ syonam / svāna bhrājāṅghāre bambhāre hasta suhasta kṛśāno / ete vaḥ somakrayaṇās tān rakṣadhvaṃ mā vo dabhan //
column2: As friend, the giver of good friends, approach us! Take thou thy seat on the right thigh of Indra, yearning on yearning, pleasing on the pleasing. Anghâri, Svâna, Bhrâja, and Bambhâri, O Hasta, and Suhasta and Krisânu, These are your prices for the Soma purchase. Keep them securely, let them never fail you. 28

column1: pari māgne duścaritād bādhasvā mā sucarite bhaja / ud āyuṣā svāyuṣodasthām amṛtām̐ anu //
column2: Keep me, O Agni, from unrighteous conduct: make me a sharer in the path of goodness.I, following Immortals, have arisen with longer life, with a good life before me. 29

column1: prati panthām apadmahi svastigām anehasam / yena viśvāḥ pari dviṣo vṛṇakti vindate vasu //
column2: Now have we entered on the path that leads to bliss without a foe, The path whereon a man escapes all enemies and gathers wealth. 30

column1: adityās tvag asi / adityai sada ā sīda / astabhnād dyāṃ vṛṣabho antarikṣam amimīta varimāṇaṃ pṛthivyāḥ / āsīdad viśvā bhuvanāni samrāḍ viśvet tāni varuṇasya vratāni //
column2: The skin of Aditi art thou. Sit on the lap of Aditi. The Bull hath propped the sky and air's mid-region, the compass of the broad earth hath he measured. He, King Supreme, approached all living creatures. Truly all these are Varuna's ordinances. 31

column1: vaneṣu vy antarikṣaṃ tatāna vājam arvatsu paya usriyāsu / hṛtsu kratuṃ varuṇo vikṣv agniṃ divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau //
column2: Over the woods the air hath he extended, put milk in kine and vigorous speed in horses, Set intellect in hearts and fire in houses, Sûrya in heaven and Soma on the mountain. 32

column1: sūryasya cakṣur ārohāgner akṣṇaḥ kanīnakam / yatraitraśebhir īyase bhrājamāno vipaścitā //
column2: Ascend the eye of Sûrya, mount the pupil set in Agni's eye Where, radiant through the Wise One, thou speedest along with dappled steeds. 33

column1: usrāv etaṃ dhūrṣāhau yujyethām anaśrū avīrahaṇau brahmacodanau / svasti yajamānasya gṛhān gacchatam //
column2: Approach, ye oxen, fit to bear the yoke; be yoked without a tear. Slaying no man, urging the Brahman forward, go happily to the Sacrificer's dwelling. 34

column1: bhadro me 'si pracyavasva bhuvaspate viśvāny abhi dhāmāni // mā tvā paripariṇo vidan mā tvā paripanthino vidan mā vṛkā aghāyavo vidan // śyeno bhūtvā parā pata yajamānasya gṛhān gaccha tan nau sam̐skṛtam //
column2: Lord of the World, thou art my gracious helper: move forward on thy way to all the stations. Let not opponents, let not robbers find thee, let not malignant wolves await thy coming. Fly thou away having become a falcon. Go to the dwelling of the Sacrificer. That is the special place for us to rest in.35

column1: namo mitrasya varuṇasya cakṣase maho devāya tad ṛtam̐ saparyata / dūredṛśe devajātāya ketave divas putrāya sūryāya śam̐sata //
column2: Do homage unto Varuna's and Mitra's eye: offer this solemn worship to the Mighty God, Who seeth far away, the Ensign born of Gods. Sing praises unto Sûrya, to the Son of Dyaus. 36

column1: varuṇasyottambhanam asi / varuṇasya skambhasarjanī sthaḥ / varuṇasya ṛtasadany asi varuṇasya ṛtasadanam asi / varuṇasya ṛtasadanam ā sīda //
column2: Thou art a prop for Varuna to rest on. Ye are the pins that strengthen Varuna's pillar. Thou art the lawful seat where Varuna sitteth. Sit on the lawful seat where Varuna sitteth. 37

column1: yā te dhāmāni haviṣā yajanti tā te viśvā paribhūr astu yajñam / gayasphānaḥ prataraṇaḥ suvīro 'vīrahā pracarā soma duryān //
column2: Such of thy glories as with poured oblations men honour, may they all invest our worship. Wealth-giver, furtherer with troops of heroes, sparing the brave, come, Soma, to our houses.

column1: agnes tanūr asi viṣṇave tvā somasya tanūr asi viṣṇave tvātither ātithyam asi viṣṇave śyenāya tvā somabhṛte viṣṇave tvāgnaye tvā rāyaspoṣade viṣṇave tvā //
column2: BODY of Agni art thou. Thee for Vishnu. Body of Soma art thou. Thee for Vishnu. Thou art the Guest's Reception. Thee for Vishnu. Thee for the Soma-bringing Falcon. Thee for Vishnu. Thee for the giver of abundance, Agni. Thee for Vishnu. 2

column1: agner janitram asi / vṛṣaṇau sthaḥ / urvaśy asi / āyur asi / purūravā asi / gāyatreṇa tvā chandasā manthāmi / traiṣṭubhena tvā chandasā manthāmi / jāgatena tvā chandasā manthāmi //
column2: Birth-place art thou of Agni. Ye are sprinklers. Thou art Urvasi. Thou art Âyu. Thou art Purûravas. I rub and churn thee with Gâyatrî metre. I rub and churn thee with the Trishtup metre. I rub and churn thee with, the Jagatî metre. 3

column1: bhavataṃ naḥ samanasau sacetasāv arepasau / mā yajñam̐ him̐siṣṭaṃ mā yajñapatiṃ jātavedasau śivau bhavatam adya naḥ //
column2: Be ye for us one-minded, be one-thoughted, free from spot and stain. Harm not the sacrifice, harm not the sacrifice's lord. Be kind to us this day, Omniscient Ones! 4

column1: agnāv agniś carati praviṣṭa ṛṣīṇāṃ putro abhiśastipāvā / sa naḥ syonaḥ suyajā yajeha devebhyo havyam̐ sadam aprayucchant svāhā //
column2: Preserver from the curse, Son of the Rishis, Agni is active having entered Agni. Here for us kindly with fair worship offer oblation to the Gods with care unceasing. Svâhâ! 5

column1: āpataye tvā paripataye gṛhṇāmi tanūnaptrye śākvarāya śakvana ojiṣṭhāya / anādhṛṣṭam asy anādhṛṣyaṃ devānām ojo 'nabhiśasty abhiśastipā anabhiśastenyam añjasā satyam upa geṣam̐ svite mā dhāḥ //
column2: For him who flies around and rushes onward I take thee, for Tanûnapât the mighty, the very strong, of all-surpassing vigour.Strength of the Gods, inviolate, inviolable still art thou, the strength that turns the curse away, uncursed and never to be cursed. May I go straight to truth. Place me in comfort. 6

column1: agne vratapās tve vratapā yā tava tanūr iyam̐ sā mayi yo mama tanūr eṣā sā tvayi / saha nau vratapate vratāny anu me dīkṣāṃ dīkṣāpatir manyatām anu tapas tapaspatiḥ //
column2: O Agni, Guardian of the Vow, O Guardian of the Vow, in thee Whatever form there is of thine, may that same form be here on me: un thee be every form of mine. O Lord of Vows, let our vows be united. May Dîkshâ's Lord allow my Consecration, may holy Fervour's Lord approve my Fervour. 7

column1: am̐śur-am̐śuṣ ṭe deva somāpyāyatām indrāyaikadhanavide / ā tubhyam indraḥ pyāyatām ā tvam indrāya pyāyasva / ā pyāyayāsmānt sakhīnt sanyā medhayā svasti te deva soma sutyām aśīya // eṣṭā rāyaḥ preṣe bhagāya ṛtam ṛtavādibhyo namo dyāvāpṛthivībhyām //
column2: May every stalk of thine wax full and strengthen for Indra Ekadhanavid, God Soma! May Indra grow in strength for thee: for Indra mayest thou grow strong. Increase us friends with strength and mental vigour. May all prosperity be thine, God Soma. May I attain the solemn Soma-pressing. May longed-for wealth come forth for strength and fortune. Let there be truth for those whose speech is truthful. To Heaven and Earth be adoration offered. 8

column1: yā te agne 'yaḥśayā tanūr varṣiṣṭhā gahvareṣṭhā / ugraṃ vaco apāvadhīt tveṣaṃ vaco apāvadhīt svāhā / yā te agne rajaḥśayā tanūr varṣiṣṭhā gahvareṣṭhā / ugraṃ vaco apāvadhīt tveṣaṃ vaco apāvadhīt svāhā / yā te agne hariśayā tanūr varṣiṣṭhā gahvareṣṭhā / ugraṃ vaco apāvadhīt tveṣaṃ vaco apāvadhīt svāhā //
column2: That noblest body which is thine, O Agni, laid in the lowest deep, encased in iron, hath chased the awful word, the word of terror. Svâhâ! That noblest . . . . . . encased in silver, etc. Svâhâ That noblest . . . . with gold around it, etc. Svâhâ!9

column1: taptāyanī me 'si / vittāyanī me 'si / avatān mā nāthitāt / avatān mā vyathitāt / vided agnir nabho nāma / agne aṅgira āyunā nāmnehi / yo 'syāṃ pṛthivyām asi yat te 'nādhṛṣṭaṃ nāma yajñiyaṃ tena tvā dadhe / vided agnir nabho nāma / agne aṅgira āyunā nāmnehi / yo dvitīyasyāṃ pṛthivyām asi yat te 'nādhṛṣṭaṃ nāma yajñiyaṃ tena tvā dadhe / vided agnir nabho nāma / agne aṅgira āyunā nāmnehi / yas tṛtīyasyāṃ pṛthivyām asi yat te 'nādhṛṣṭaṃ nāma yajñiyaṃ tena tvā dadhe / anu tvā devavītaye //
column2: For me thou art the home of the afflicted. For me thou art the gathering-place of riches. Protect me from the, woe of destitution. Protect me from the state of perturbation. May Agni know thee, he whose name is Nabhas. Go, Agni, Angiras, with the name of Âyu. Thou whom this earth containeth, down I lay thee with each inviolate holy name thou bearest. Thou whom the second earth, etc. Thou whom the third earth, etc. Thee, further, for the Gods’ delight. 10

column1: sim̐hy asi sapatnasāhī devebhyaḥ kalpasva / sim̐hy asi sapatnasāhī devebhyaḥ śundhasva / sim̐hy asi sapatnasāhī devebhyaḥ śumbhasva //
column2: A foe-subduing lioness art thou: be fitted for the Gods. A foe-subduing lioness art thou: be purified for Gods. A foe-subduing lioness art thou: adorn thyself for Gods. 11

column1: indraghoṣas tvā vasubhiḥ purastāt pātu / pracetās tvā rudraiḥ paścāt pātu / manojavās tvā pitṛbhir dakṣiṇataḥ pātu / viśvakarmā tvādityair uttarataḥ pātu / idam ahaṃ taptaṃ vār bahirdhā yajñān niḥ sṛjāmi //
column2: Indra's shout guard thee in the front with Vasus. The Wise One guard thee from the rear with Rudras. The Thought-swift guard thee on the right with Fathers. The Omnific guard thee, leftward, with Âdityas. This heated water I eject and banish from the sacrifice. 12

column1: sim̐hy asi svāhā / sim̐hy asy ādityavaniḥ svāhā / sim̐hy asi brahmavaniḥ kṣatravaniḥ svāhā / sim̐hy asi suprajāvanī rāyaspoṣavaniḥ svāhā / sim̐hy asy āvaha devān yajamānāya svāhā / bhūtebhyas tvā //
column2: Thou art a lioness. All-hail! Thou art a lioness winning Âdityas. All-hail! Thou art a lioness winning Brâhmans and Nobles. All-hail! Thou art a lioness that wins fair offspring, win abundant wealth. All-hail! A lioness art thou. Bring the Gods hither for him who offers sacrifice. All-hail! To living creatures;

column1: dhruvo 'si pṛthivīṃ dṛm̐ha / dhruvakṣid asy antarikṣaṃ dṛm̐ha / acyutakṣid asi divaṃ dṛm̐ha / agneḥ purīṣam asi //
column2: Firm art thou, steady thou the earth. Firm-seated art thou, steady thou the air. Movelessly set art thou, steady the sky. Agni's completion art thou. 14

column1: yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ / vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ svāhā //
column2: The priests of him the lofty Priest well-skilled in hymns harness their spirits, yea harness their holy thoughts. He only knowing works assigns their priestly tasks. Yea, lofty is the praise of Savitar the God. All-hail! 15

column1: idaṃ viṣṇur vicakrame tredhā ni dadhe padam / samūḍham asya pām̐sare svāhā //
column2: Forth through This All strode Vishnu: thrice his foot he planted, and the whole was gathered in his footstep's dust. All-hail! 16

column1: urāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtam̐ sūyavasinī manave daśasyā / vy askabhnā rodasī viṣṇav ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhito mayūkhaiḥ svāhā //
column2: Rich in sweet food be ye, and rich in milch-kine, with fertile pastures, fair to do men service. Both these worlds, Vishnu, hast thou stayed asunder, and firmly fixed the earth with pegs around it. 17

column1: devaśrutau deveṣv ā ghoṣatam / prācī pretam adhvaraṃ kalpayantī ūrdhvaṃ yajñaṃ nayataṃ mā jihvaratam / svaṃ goṣṭham ā vadataṃ devī durye āyur mā nir vādiṣṭaṃ prajāṃ mā nir vādiṣṭam / atra ramethāṃ varṣman pṛthivyāḥ //
column2: Heard by the Gods, ye twain, to Gods proclaim it. Go eastward, O ye twain, proclaiming worship. Swerve ye not: bear the sacrifice straight upward. To your own cow-pen speak, ye godlike dwellings. Speak not away my life, speak not away my children. On the earth's summit here may ye be joyful.18

column1: viṣṇor nu kaṃ vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yaḥ pārthivāni vimame rajām̐si / yo askabhāyad uttaram̐ sadhasthaṃ vicakramāṇas tredhorugāyaḥ //
column2: Now will I tell the mighty deeds of Vishnu, of him who measured out the earthly regions. Who propped the highest place of congregation, thrice setting down his foot and widely striding. For Vishnu thee. 19

column1: viṣṇave tvā // divo vā viṣṇa uta vā pṛthivyā maho vā viṣṇa uror antarikṣāt / ubhā hi hastā vasunā pṛṇasvā prayaccha dakṣiṇād ota savyāt // viṣṇave tvā //
column2: Either from heaven or from the earth, O Vishnu, or, Vishnu, from the vast wide air's mid-region, Fill both thy hands full with abundant riches, and from the right and from the left bestow them. For Vishnu thee. 20

column1: pra tad viṣṇu stavate vīryeṇa mṛgo na bhīmaḥ kucaro giriṣṭhāḥ / yasyoruṣu triṣu vikramaṇeṣv adhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā //
column2: For this his mighty deed is Vishnu lauded, like some wild beast, dread, prowling, mountain-roaming, He within whose three wide-extended paces all living creatures have their habitation, 21

column1: viṣṇo rarāṭam asi / viṣṇoḥ śnaptre sthaḥ / viṣṇoḥ syūr asi / viṣṇor dhruvo 'si / vaiṣṇavam asi viṣṇave tvā //
column2: Thou art the frontlet for the brow of Vishnu. Ye are the corners of the mouth of Vishnu. Thou art the needle for the work of Vishnu. Thou art the firmly-fastened knot of Vishnu. To Vishnu thou belongest. Thee for Vishnu. 22

column1: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade nāry asi / idam aham̐ rakṣasāṃ grīvā apikṛntāmi / bṛhann asi bṛhadravā bṛhatīm indrāya vācaṃ vada //
column2: By impulse of God Savitar I take thee with arms of Asvins and with hands of Pûshan. Thou art a woman. Here I cut the necks of Râkshasas away. Mighty art thou, mighty the sound thou makest. Utter thy mighty-sounding voice to Indra: 23

column1: rakṣohaṇaṃ valagahanaṃ vaiṣṇavīm / idam ahaṃ taṃ valagam ut kirāmi yaṃ me niṣṭyo yam amātyo nicakhāna / idam ahaṃ taṃ valagam ut kirāmi yaṃ me samāno yam asamāno nicakhāna / idam ahaṃ taṃ valagam ut kirāmi yaṃ me sabandhur yam asabandhur nicakhāna / idam ahaṃ taṃ valagam ut kirāmi yaṃ me sajāto yam asajāto nicakhāna / ut kṛtyāṃ kirāmi //
column2: Fiend-killing, charm-destroying voice of Vishnu. Here I cast out that charm of magic power which stranger or housemate for me hath buried.Here I cast out the charm of magic power buried for me by equal or unequal. Here I cast out the charm that hath been buried for me by non-relation or relation. I cast the charm of magic out. 24

column1: svarāḍ asi / satrarāḍ asy abhimātihā / janarāḍ asi rakṣohā / sarvarāḍ asy amitrahā //
column2: Self-ruler art thou, conquering foes. Ruler for ever art thou, killing enemies. Men's ruler art thou, slaying fiends. All ruler, killing foes, art thou. 25

column1: rakṣohaṇo vo valagahanaḥ prokṣāmi vaiṣṇavān / rakṣohaṇo vo valagahano 'va nayāmi vaiṣṇavān / rakṣohaṇo vo valagahano 'va stṝṇāmi vaiṣṇavān / rakṣohaṇau vāṃ valagahanā upa dadhāmi vaiṣṇavī / rakṣohaṇau tvā valagahanau pary ūhāmi vaiṣṇavī / vaiṣṇavam asi / vaiṣṇavā stha //
column2: I sprinkle you whom Vishnu owns, killers of fiends and evil charms. I buy down you whom Vishnu loves, killers of fiends and wicked charms. I scatter you whom Vishnu loves, killers of fiends and wicked charms. You two whom Vishnu loves, who kill fiends and ill charms do I lay down. You two whom Vishnu loves, who kill fiends and ill charms I compass round. To Vishnu thou belongest. Ye are Vishnu's. 26

column1: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade nāry asi / idam aham̐ rakṣasāṃ grīvā api kṛntāmi / yavo 'si yavayāsmad dveṣo yavayārātīḥ / dive tvāntarikṣāya tvā pṛthivyai tvā / śundhantāṃ lokāḥ pitṛṣadanāḥ / pitṛṣadanam asi //
column2: By impulse of God Savitar I take thee with arms of Asvins, with the hands of Peahen. Thou art a woman. Here I cut the necks of Râkshasas away. Barley art thou. Bar off from us our haters, bar our enemies. Thee for heaven, thee for earth, thee for air's region. Pure be the worlds, the Fathers’ dwelling-places. Thou art the habitation of the Fathers.27

column1: ud divam̐ stabhānāntarikṣaṃ pṛṇa dṛm̐hasva pṛthivyām / dyutānās tvā māruto minotu mitrāvaruṇau dhruveṇa dharmaṇā / brahmavani tvā kṣatravani tvā rāyaspoṣavani pary ūhāmi / brahma dṛm̐ha kṣatraṃ dṛm̐hāyur dṛm̐ha prajāṃ dṛm̐ha //
column2: Prop heaven, fill full the air, on earth stand firmly. Dyutâna, offspring of the Maruts, plant thee!, Mitra and Varuna with firm upholding. I close thee in, thou winner of the Brahmans, winner of Nobles and abundant riches. Strengthen the Brahmans, strengthen thou the Nobler, strengthen our vital power, strengthen our offspring. 28

column1: dhruvāsi dhruvo 'yaṃ yajamāno 'sminn āyatane prajayā paśubhir bhūyāt / ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī pūryethām / indrasya chadir asi viśvajanasya chāyā //
column2: Firm-set art thou. Firm be this Sacrificer within this home with offspring and with cattle. O Heaven and Earth, be ye filled full of fatness. Indra's mat art thou, shelter of all people. 29

column1: pari tvā girvaṇo gira imā bhavantu viśvataḥ / vṛddhāyum anu vṛddhayo juṣṭā bhavantu juṣṭayaḥ //
column2: Lover of song, may these our songs encompass thee on every side; Strengthening thee of lengthened life, may they be dear delights to thee 30

column1: indrasya syūr asi / indrasya dhruvo 'si / aindram asi / vaiśvadevam asi //
column2: Thou art the needle for the work of Indra. Thou art the firmly fastened knot of Indra. Indra's art thou. Thou art the Visvedevas’. 31

column1: vibhūr asi pravāhaṇaḥ / vahnir asi havyavāhanaḥ / śvātro 'si pracetāḥ / tutho 'si viśvavedāḥ //
column2: All-present art thou, carrying off. Oblation-bearing priest art thou. Thou art the Swift, the Very Wise. Tutha art thou, who knoweth all. 32

column1: uśig asi kaviḥ / aṅghārir asi bambhāriḥ / avasyūr asi duvasvān / śundhyūr asi mārjālīyaḥ / samrāḍ asi kṛśānuḥ / pariṣadyo 'si pavamānaḥ / nabho 'si pratakvā / mṛṣṭo 'si havyasūdanaḥ / ṛtadhāmāsi svarjyotiḥ //
column2: Thou art the yearning one, the sage. Angnâri, Bambhâri art thou.Aid-seeker art thou, worshipping. Cleanser art thou, the cleansing-place. Krisânu, Sovran Lord, art thou. Thou art the Pavamâna of the assembly. Thou art the welkin ever moving forward. Swept clean art thou, preparer of oblations. Thou art the seat of Law, heaven's light and lustre. 33

column1: samudro 'si viśvavyacāḥ / ajo 'sy ekapāt / ahir asi budhnyaḥ / vāg asy aindram asi sado 'si / ṛtasya dvārau mā mā saṃtāptam / adhvanām adhvapate pra mā tira svasti me smin pathi devayāne bhūyāt //
column2: A sea art thou of all-embracing compass. Aja art thou, who hath one foot to bear him. Thou art the Dragon of the Depths of ocean. Speech art thou, thou the Sadas, thou art Indra's. Doors of the sacrifice, do not distress me! Lord, Ruler of the pathways, lead me onward. In this God-reaching path may I be happy. 34

column1: mitrasya mā cakṣuṣekṣadhvam / agnayaḥ sagarāḥ sagarā stha sagareṇa nāmnā raudreṇānīkena pāta māgnayaḥ pipṛta māgnayo gopāyata mā namo vo 'stu mā mā him̐siṣṭa //
column2: Look ye upon me with the eye of Mitra. O Agnis, ye, receivers of oblations, are by a lauded name lauded together. Protect me, Agnis! with your glittering army. Fill me with riches, Agnis! be my keepers. To you be adoration. Do not harm me. 35

column1: jyotir asi viśvarūpaṃ viśveṣāṃ devānām̐ samit / tvam̐ soma tanūkṛdbhyo dveṣobhyo 'nyakṛtebhya uru yantāsi varūtham̐ svāhā / juṣāṇo aptur ājyasya vetu svāhā //
column2: Thou art a light that wears all forms and figures, serving the general host of Gods as Kindler.Thou, Soma, wilt withhold thy wide protection from body-wounding hatreds shown by others. All-hail! Let the Swift graciously enjoy the butter. All-hail! 36

column1: agne naya supathā rāya asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān / yuyodhy asmaj juhurāṇam eno bhūyiṣṭhāṃ te namaktiṃ vidhema //
column2: By goodly paths lead us to riches, Agni, thou God who knowest every sacred duty. Remove the sin that makes us stray and wander: most ample adoration will we bring thee. 37

column1: ayaṃ no agnir varivas kṛṇotv ayaṃ mṛdhaḥ pura etu prabhindan / ayaṃ vājān jayatu vājasātāv ayam̐ śatrūn jayatu jarhṛṣāṇaḥ svāhā //
column2: Wide room and comfort may this Agni give us, and go before us cleaving down our foemen. May he win booty in the fight for booty: May he quell foes in his triumphant onset. 38

column1: uru viṣṇo vi kramasvoru kṣayāya nas kṛdhi / ghṛtaṃ ghṛtayone piba pra-pra yajñapatiṃ tira svāhā //
column2: O Vishnu, stride thou widely forth, give ample room for our abode. Drink butter, homed in butter! Still speed on the sacrifice's lord. All-hail! 39

column1: deva savitar eṣa te somas tam̐ rakṣasva mā tvā dabhan / etat tvaṃ deva soma devo devām̐ upāgā idam ahaṃ manuṣyānt saha rāyaspoṣeṇa / svāhā nir varuṇasya pāśān mucye //
column2: To thee, God Savitar, belongs this Soma. Guard him securely: let not demons harm thee. Now hast thou joined the Gods as God, God Soma: men have I joined here through abundant riches. All-hail! from Varuna's noose am I delivered. 40

column1: agne vratapās tve vratapā yā tava tanūr mayy abhūd eṣā sā tvayi yo mama tanūs tvayy abhūd eṣā sā mayi / yathāyathaṃ nau vratapate vratāny anu me dīkṣāṃ dīkṣāpatir amam̐stānu tapas tapaspatiḥ //
column2: O Agni, Guardian of the Vow, O Guardian of the Vow, on me whatever form of thine path been, may that same form be upon thee. Whatever form of mine hath been on thee, may that he here on me. O Lord of Vows, our vows have been accomplished. Dîkshâ's Lord hath approved my Consecration, and holy Fervour's Lord allowed my Fervour. 41

column1: uru viṣṇo vi kramasvoru kṣayāya nas kṛdhi / ghṛtaṃ ghṛtayone piba pra-pra yajñapatiṃ tira svāhā //
column2: O Vishnu, stride thou widely forth, make ample room for our abode. Drink butter, homed in butter! Still speed on the sacrifice's lord. All Hail!42

column1: aty anyām̐ agāṃ nānyām̐ upāgām arvāk tvā parebhyo 'vidaṃ paro 'varebhyaḥ / taṃ tvā juṣāmahe deva vanaspatedevayajyāyai devās tvā devayajyāyai juṣantāṃ viṣṇave tvā / oṣadhe trāyasva / svadhite mainam̐ him̐sīḥ //
column2: I have passed others, not approached to others. On the near side of those that were more distant, and farther than the nearer have I found thee. So, for the worship of the Gods, with gladness we welcome thee God, Sovran of the Forest! Let the Gods welcome thee for the Gods’ service. For Vishnu thee. Plant, guard!! Axe, do not harm it! 43

column1: dyāṃ mā lekhīr antarikṣaṃ mā him̐sīḥ pṛthivyā saṃ bhava / ayam̐ hi tvā svadhitis tetijānaḥ praṇināya mahate saubhagāya / atas tvaṃ deva vanaspate śatavalśo vi roha sahasravalśā vi vayam̐ ruhema //
column2: Graze not the sky. Harm not mid-air. Be in accordance with the earth. For this well-sharpened axe hath led thee forth to great felicity. Hence, with a hundred branches, God, Lord of the Forest, grow thou up. May we grow spreading with a hundred branches.

column1: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade nāry asi / idam aham̐ rakṣasāṃ grīvā api kṛntāmi / yavo 'si yavayāsmad dveṣo yavayārātīḥ / dive tvāntarikṣāya tvā pṛthivyai tvā / śundhantāṃ lokāḥ pitṛṣadanāḥ / pitṛṣadanam asi //
column2: BY impulse of God Savitar I take thee with arms of Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan. Thou art a woman. Here I cut the necks of Râkshasas away. Barley art thou. Bar off from us our haters, bar our enemies. Thee for heaven, thee for earth, thee for the welkin. Pure be the worlds, the Fathers’ dwelling-places. Thou art the habitation of the Fathers. 2

column1: agreṇīr asi svāveśa unnetṝṇām etasya vittād adhi tvā sthāsyati / devas tvā savitā madhv anaktu / supippalābhyas tvauṣadhībhyaḥ / dyām agreṇāspṛkṣa āntarikṣaṃ madhyenāprāḥ pṛthivīm upareṇādṛm̐hīḥ //
column2: Thou art a leader, easy, to Unnetars, of access. Know this. It will stand upon thee. Savitar, God, anoint thee with sweet butter. Thee for the plants laden with goodly fruitage! Thou with thy top hast touched the sky, hast with thy middle filled the air, and steadied with thy base the earth. 3

column1: yā te dhāmāny uśmasi gamadhyai yatra gāvo bhūriśṛṅgā ayāsaḥ / atrāha tad urugāyasya viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam ava bhāri bhūri // brahmavani tvā kṣatravani rāyaspoṣavani pary ūhāmi / brahma dṛm̐ha kṣatraṃ dṛm̐hāyur dṛm̐ha prajāṃ dṛm̐ha //
column2: Those seats of thine which we desire to visit, where there are many-horned and nimble. oxen, There, of a truth, was mightily imprinted the loftiest step of widely-striding Vishnu. I close thee in, the winner of the Brâhmans, winner of Nobles and abundant riches. Strengthen the Brâhmans, strengthen thou the Nobles, strengthen our vital power, strengthen our offspring. 4

column1: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yato vratāni paspaśe / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā //
column2: Look ye on Vishnu's works, whereby the Friend of Indra, close-allied, Hath let his holy ways be seen.5

column1: tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam̐ sadā paśyanti sūrayo div`īva cakṣur ātatam //
column2: The princes evermore behold that loftiest place where Vishnu is, Laid as it were an eye in heaven. 6

column1: parivīr asi pari tvā daivīr viśo vyayantāṃ parīmaṃ yajamānam̐ rāyo manuṣyāṇām / divaḥ sūnur asi / eṣa te pṛthivyāṃ loka āraṇyas te paśuḥ //
column2: Thou art invested. Heavenly hosts invest thee! Riches of men invest this Sacrificer! Heaven's son art thou. This is thine earthly station. Thine is the beast whose home is in the forest. 7
