column2: Ascend the North. Thy guardians be Anushtup, Vairâja psalm, the twenty-onefold praise-song, the season Autumn, that rich treasure Fruitage. 14 Ascend the Zenith. Pankti be thy keeper, Sâkvara, Raivata the pair of Sâmans, Praise-songs the thirty-threefold and thrice-ninefold, both seasons, Winter, Dews, that treasure lustre. The head of Namuchi hath been cast from me. 15

column1: somasya tviṣir asi taveva me tviṣir bhūyāt / mṛtyoḥ pāhi / ojo 'si saho 'sy amṛtam asi //
column2: Brilliance of Soma art thou, may my brilliance grow like thine. Save me from death. Vigour art thou, victory, everlasting life. 16

column1: hiraṇyarūpā uṣaso viroka ubhāv indrā udithaḥ sūryaś ca / ā rohataṃ varuṇa mitra gartaṃ tataś cakṣāthām aditiṃ ditiṃ ca // mitro 'si varuṇo 'si //
column2: With golden bodies, at the flush of morning, ye rise on high, two Sovran Lords, and Sûrya. Ascend your car, O Varuna and Mitra: thence view infinity and limitation. Thou art Mitra, thou art Varuna. 17

column1: somasya tvā dyumnenābhiṣiñcāmy agner bhrājasā sūryasya varcasendrasyendriyeṇa / kṣatrāṇāṃ kṣatrapatir edhy ati didyūn pāhi //
column2: Thee with the strength of Soma, Agni's lustre, with Sûrya's splendour, Indra's might I sprinkle. Be Lord of princes: safe past arrows guard him.18

column1: pra parvatasya vṛṣabhasya pṛṣṭhān nāvaś caranti svasica iyānāḥ / tā āvavṛtrann adharāg udaktā ahiṃ budhnyam anu rīyamāṇāḥ // viṣṇor vikarmaṇam asi / viṣṇor vikrāntam asi / viṣṇoḥ krāntam asi //
column2: Forth from the summit of the bull, the mountain, pouring spontaneously, the ships keep moving. They, lifted up, have turned them back and downward, still flowing onward, after Ahibudhnya. Thou art the stepping-forth of Vishnu: thou art Vishnu's outstep; Vishnu's step art thou. 20

column1: prajāpate na tvad etāny anyo viśvā rūpāṇi pari tā babhūva / yatkāmās te juhumas tan no astu / ayam amuṣya pitāsāv asya pitā / vayam̐ syāma patayo rayīṇām̐ svāhā / rudra yat te krivi paraṃ nāma tasmin hutam asy ameṣṭam asi svāhā //
column2: Prajâpati, thou only comprehendest all these created forms, and none beside thee. Give us our heart's desire when we invoke thee. So-and-So's father is this man. Sire of this man is So-and-So. May we—All-hail!—be lords of rich possessions. What active highest name thou hast, O Rudra, therein thou art an offering, art an offering at home. All-hail! 21

column1: indrasya vajro 'si / mitrāvaruṇayos tvā praśāstroḥ praśiṣā yunajmi / avyathāyai tvā svadhāyai tvāriṣṭo arjunaḥ / marutāṃ prasavena jaya / āpāma manasā / sam indriyeṇa //
column2: Indra's bolt art thou. I by the direction of Mitra-Varuna, Directors, yoke thee. I, the uninjured Arjuna, mount thee for firmness, thee for food. By quickening of the Maruts be thou victor. May we obtain by mind: with power united. 22

column1: mā ta indra te vayaṃ turāṣāḍ ayuktāso abrahmatā vidasāma / tiṣṭhā ratham adhi yaṃ vajrahastā raśmīn deva yuvase svaśvān //
column2: Let us not, Indra, conqueror of the mighty, unfit through lack of prayer fail to obtain thee. Ascend the car which thou whose hand bears thunder controllest, and the reins with noble horses.23

column1: agnaye gṛhapataye svāhā / somāya vanaspataye svāhā / marutām ojase svāhā / indrasyendriyāya svāhā / pṛthivi mātar mā mā him̐sīr mo ahaṃ tvām //
column2: All hail to Agni, Master of the Household! All-hail to Soma, Sovran of the Forest! All-hail to the great vigour of the Maruts! All-hail to the effectual might of Indra! Injure me not, O Mother Earth, and may I never injure thee. 24

column1: ham̐saḥ śuciṣad vasur antarikṣasad dhotā vediṣad atithir duroṇasat / nṛṣad varasad ṛtasad vyomasad abjā gojā ṛtajā adrijā ṛtaṃ bṛhat //
column2: The Hamsa throned in light, the Vasu in mid-air, the Priest beside the altar, Guest within the house, Dwelling in noblest place, mid men, in truth, in sky, born of flood, kine, truth, mountain, be is mighty Law. 25

column1: iyad asyāyur asyāyur mayi dhehi yuṅṅ asi varco 'si varco mayi dhehi / ūrg asy ūrjaṃ mayi dhehi / indrasya vāṃ vīryakṛto bāhū abhyupāva harāmi //
column2: So great art thou: life art thou; give me life, Mate art thou: thou art splendour; give me splendour. Strength art thou: give me strength. I draw you downward, two arms of Indra mighty in achievement. 26

column1: syonāsi suṣadāsi / kṣatrasya yonir asi / syonām ā sīda suṣadām ā sīda kṣatrasya yonim ā sīda //
column2: Fair art thou, good to sit on, womb of kingship. Sit on the fair one, sit on that which offers a pleasant seat: sit in the womb of kingship. 27

column1: ni ṣasāda ghṛtavrato varuṇaḥ pastyāsv ā / sāmrājyāya sukratuḥ //
column2: Varuna, Law's maintainer, hath sat down among his people, he Most wise, for universal sway. 28

column1: abhibhūr asy etās te pañca diśaḥ kalpantām / brahmam̐s tvaṃ brahmāsi savitāsi satyaprasavaḥ / varuṇo 'si satyaujāḥ / indro 'si viśaujāḥ / rudro 'si suśevaḥ / bahukāra śreyaskara bhūyaskara / indrasya vajro 'si tena me radhya //
column2: Supreme Lord art thou. May these five regions of thine be prosperous. Brahman! Thou art Brahman, Savitar art thou, faithful in impulsion, Varuna art thou, he whose power is real. Indra art thou, whose strength is of the people. Rudra art thou, the very kind and gracious.Doer of much, Improver, Wealth-increaser! Indra's holt art thou. Be therewith my vassal. 29

column1: agniḥ pṛthur dharmaṇas patir juṣāṇo agniḥ pṛthur dharmaṇas patir ājyasya vetu svāhā / svāhākṛtāḥ sūryasya raśmibir yatadhvam̐ sajātānāṃ madhyameṣṭhyāya //
column2: May spacious Agni, Lord of Duty, gladly, vast Agni, Duty's Lord, accept the butter. All-hail! Hallowed by Svâhâ, with the beams of Sûrya, strive for his central place among the kinsmen. 30

column1: savitrā prasavitrā sarasvatyā vācā tvaṣṭrā rūpaiḥ pūṣṇā paśubhir indreṇāsme bṛhaspatinā brahmaṇā varuṇenaujasāgninā tejasā somena rājñā viṣṇunā daśamyā devatayā prasūtaḥ pra sarpāmi //
column2: by Brihaspati, Devotion; by Varuna, Power; by Agni, Brilliance; by Soma, the King; by Vishnu the tenth Deity. 31

column1: aśvibhyāṃ pacyasva / sarasvatyai pacyasva / indrāya sutrāmṇe pacyasva / vāyuḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅk somo atisrutaḥ / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā //
column2: Get dressed for the Asvins. Get dressed for Sarasvatî: Get dressed for Indra the Good Deliverer: Soma the Wind, purified by the strainer, Indra's meet friend, hath gone o’erflowing backward. 32

column1: kuvid aṅga yavamanto vayaṃ cid yathā dānty anupūrvaṃ viyūya / ihehaiṣāṃ kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣo namaktiṃ yajanti // upayāmagṛhīto 'sy aśvibhyāṃ tvā sarasvatyai tvendrāya tvā sutrāmṇe //
column2: What then? As men whose fields are full of barley reap the ripe corn, removing it in order, So bring the food of these men, bring it hither, who pay the Sacred Grass their spoken homage. Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for the Asvins. Thee for Sarasvatî, and thee for Indra, for the Excellent Protector.33

column1: vayam̐ surāmam aśvinā namucāv āsure sacā / vipipānā śubhas patī indraṃ karmasv āvatam //
column2: Ye Asvins, Lords of Splendour, drank full draughts of grateful Soma juice, And aided Indra in his deeds with Namuchi of Asura birth. 34

column1: putram iva pitarāv aśvinobhendrāvathuḥ kāvyair dam̐sanābhiḥ / yat surāmaṃ vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatī tvā maghavann abhiṣṇak //
column2: As parents aid a son, both Asvins aided thee, Indra, with their wondrous powers and wisdom. When thou with might hadst drunk the draught that gladdens, Sarasvatî, O Bounteous Lord, refreshed thee.

column1: yuñjānaḥ prathamaṃ manas tatvāya savitā dhiyam / agner jyotir nicāyya pṛthivyā adhy ābharat //
column2: HARNESSING, first of all, the mind, Savitar having stretched the thought With reverent look upon the light of Agni bore them up from earth. 2

column1: yuktena manasā vayaṃ devasya savituḥ save / svargyāya śaktyā //
column2: By impulse of God Savitar we with our spirit harnessed strive With might to win the heavenly. 3

column1: yuktvāya savitā devānt svaryato dhiyā divam / bṛhaj jyotiḥ kariṣyataḥ savitā pra suvāti tān // yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ / vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ //
column2: Savitar, having harnessed Gods who go to light and heavenly thought, Who will create the lofty light—Savitar urge them on their way! 4 The priests of him the lofty priest well skilled in hymns, harness their spirit, yea, harness their holy thoughts. He only, skilled in rules, assigns their priestly tasks. Yea, lofty is the praise of Savitar the God. 5

column1: yuje vāṃ brahma pūrvyaṃ namobhir vi śloka etu pathyeva sūreḥ / śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtasya putrā ā ye dhāmāni divyāni tasthuḥ //
column2: I yoke with prayer your ancient inspiration: may the laud rise as on the prince's pathway. All Sons of the Immortal One shall hear it, who have resorted to celestial dwellings.6

column1: yasya prayāṇam anv anya id yayur devā devasya mahimānam ojasā / yaḥ pārthivāni vimame sa etaśo rajām̐si devaḥ savitā mahitvanā //
column2: Even he, the God whose going forth and majesty the other Deities have followed with their might, He who hath measured the celestial regions out by his great power, he is the Courser Savitar. 7

column1: deva savitaḥ pra suva yajñaṃ pra suva yajñapatiṃ bhagāya / divyo gandharvaḥ ketapūḥ ketaṃ naḥ punātu vācas patir vācaṃ naḥ svadatu //
column2: Our sacrifice, God Savitar! speed forward: speed to his share the sacrifice's patron. May the celestial Gandharva, Cleanser of thought and will, make clean our thoughts and wishes. The Lord of Speech sweeten the words we utter! 8

column1: imaṃ no deva savitar yajñaṃ pra ṇaya devāvyam̐ sakhividam̐ satrājitaṃ dhanajitam̐ svarjitam / ṛcā stomam̐ samardhaya gāyatreṇa rathantaraṃ bṛhad gāyatravartani svāhā //
column2: God Savitar, speed this God-loved sacrifice of ours, friend-finding, ever-conquering, winning wealth and heaven. Speed praise-song with the sacred verse, Rathantara with Gâyatra, Brihat that runs in Gâyatra. All-hail! 9

column1: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade gāyatreṇa chandasāṅgirasvat pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthād agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvad ā bhara traiṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat //
column2: By impulse of God Savitar I take thee, with arms of Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan, in Angiras’ manner, with Gâyatrî metre. From the earth's seat bring thou Purîshya Agni, as Angiras was wont, with Trishtup metre. 10

column1: abhrir asi nāry asi tvayā vayam agnim̐ śakema khanitum̐ sadhastha ā jāgatena chandasāṅgirasvat //
column2: Spade art thou; woman art thou. Ours be power with thee to dig out Agni in his dwelling, as Angiras was wont, with Jagatî metre. 11

column1: hasta ādhāya savitā bibhrad abhrim̐ hiraṇyayīm / agner jyotir nicāyya pṛthivyā adhy ā bhara // ānuṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat //
column2: Savitar, bearing in his hand the gold spade which he took therewith, Looking with reverence on the light of Agni, raised it from the earth, With the Anushtup metre and as Angiras was wont to do. 12

column1: pratūrtaṃ vājinn ā drava variṣṭhām anu samvatam / divi te janma paramam antarikṣe tava nābhiḥ pṛthivyām adhi yonir it //
column2: Run hither, urged to speed, O Horse, along the most extended space.Thy loftiest birthplace is in heaven. thy navel is in air's mid-realm, the womb that bare thee is on earth. 13

column1: yuñjāthām̐ rāsabhaṃ yuvam asmin yāme vṛṣaṇvasū / agniṃ bharantam asmayum //
column2: Upon this course, O lords of wealth, harness; ye twain, the Ass who bears Agni, and kindly favours us. 14

column1: yoge-yoge tavastaraṃ vāje-vāje havāmahe / sakhāya indram ūtaye //
column2: In every need, in every race we call, as friends, to succour us, Indra, the mightiest of all. 15

column1: pratūrvann ehy avakrāmann aśasto rudrasya gāṇapatyaṃ mayobhūr ehi / urv antarikṣaṃ v`īhi / svastigavyūtir abhayāni kṛṇvan pūṣṇā sayujā saha //
column2: Come speeding on and trampling imprecations; come gladdening to the chieftainship of Rudra. Speed through the wide air thou whose paths are pleasant, with Pûshan for thy mate, providing safety. 16

column1: pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthād agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvad ā bhara / agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvad acchemaḥ / agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvad bhariṣyāmaḥ //
column2: From the Earth's seat, like Anginas, bring thou Purîshya Agni forth. After the wont of Angiras we to Purîshya Agni go. Agni Purîshya we will bear after the went of Angiras. 17

column1: anv agnir uṣasām agram akhyad anv ahāni prathamo jātavedāḥ / anu sūryasya purutrā ca raśmīn anu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha //
column2: Agni hath looked along the van of Mornings, looked on the days, the earliest Jâtavedas, And many a time along the beams of Sûrya: along the heaven and earth hast thou extended. 18

column1: āgatya vājy adhvānam̐ sarvā mṛdho vidhūnute / agnim̐ sadhasthe mahati cakṣuṣā ni cikīṣate //
column2: The Courser, started on his way, shakes from him all hostilities. He longs to look with reverent eye on Agni is the mighty. seat.19

column1: ākramya vājin pṛthivīm agnim iccha rucā tvam / bhūmyā vṛktvāya no brūhi yataḥ khanema taṃ vayam //
column2: O Courser, having come to earth, seek Agni with a longing wish. Tell us by trampling on the ground where we may dig him from the earth. 20

column1: dyaus te pṛṣṭhaṃ pṛthivī sadhastham ātmāntarikṣam̐ samudro yoniḥ / vikhyāya cakṣuṣā tvam abhi tiṣṭha pṛtanyataḥ //
column2: Heaven is thy back, the earth thy seat, the air thy soul, the sea thy womb. Looking around thee with thine eye trample the adversaries down. 21

column1: ut krāma mahate saubhagāyāsmād āsthānād draviṇodā vājin / vayam̐ syāma sumatau pṛthivyā agniṃ khananta upasthe asyāḥ // ud akramīd draviṇodā vājy arvākaḥ su lokam̐ sukṛtaṃ pṛthivyām / tataḥ khanema supratīkam agnim̐ svo ruhāṇā adhi nākam uttamam //
column2: Wealth-giver, Courser, from this place step forth to great felicity. May we enjoy Earth's favour while we dig forth Agni from her 22 Down hath he stepped, wealth-giver, racer, courser. Good and auspicious room on earth thou madest. Thence let us dig forth Agni, fair to look on, while to the loftiest vault we mount, to heaven. 23

column1: ā tvā jigharmi manasā ghṛtena pratikṣiyantaṃ bhuvanāni viśvā / pṛthuṃ tiraścā vayasā bṛhantaṃ vyaciṣṭham annai rabhasaṃ dṛśānam //
column2: I thoughtfully besprinkle thee with butter, thee dwelling near to all existing creatures. Broad, vast through vital power that moves transversely, conspicuous, strong with all the food that feeds thee. 24

column1: ā viśvataḥ pratyañcaṃ jigharmy arakṣasā manasā taj juṣeta / maryaśrī spṛhayadvarṇo agnir nābhimṛśe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ //
column2: I sprinkle him who moves in all directions: may he accept it with a friendly spirit. Agni with bridegroom's face and lovely colour may not be touched when all his form is fury. 25

column1: pari vājapatiḥ kavir agnir havyāny akramīt / dadhad ratnāni dāśuṣe //
column2: Round the oblation bath he paced, Agni the wise, the Lord of Strength, Giving the offerer precious boons. 26

column1: pari tvāgne puraṃ vayaṃ vipram̐ sahasya dhīmahi / dhṛṣadvarṇaṃ dive-dive hantāraṃ bhaṅgurāvatām //
column2: We set thee round us as a fort, victorious Agni, thee a Sage, Of hero lineage, day by day destroyer of our treacherous foes. 27

column1: tvam agne dyubhis tvam āśuśukṣaṇis tvam adbhyas tvam aśmanas pari / tvaṃ vanebhyas tvam oṣadhībhyas tvaṃ nṛṇāṃ nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ //
column2: Thou, Agni, with the days, fain to shine hitherward, art brought to life from out the waters, from the stone,From out the forest trees and herbs that grow on ground. thou, Sovran Lord of men, art generated pure. 28

column1: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthād agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvat khanāmi / jyotiṣmantaṃ tvāgne supratīkam ajasreṇa bhānunā dīdyatam / śivaṃ prajābhyo 'him̐santaṃ pṛthivyā sadhasthād agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvat khanāmaḥ //
column2: At Savitar's, the Shining One's, impulsion, with arms of Asvins and with hands of Pûshan, As Angiras was wont to do, I dig thee forth from the seat of Earth, Agni Purîshya. Thee, Agni, luminous and fair of aspect, resplendent with imperishable lustre, gracious to living creatures, never harming, As Angiras was wont to do, we dig thee forth from the seat of Earth, Agni Purîshya. 29

column1: apāṃ pṛṣṭham asi yonir agneḥ samudram abhitaḥ pinvamānam / vardhamāno mahām̐ ā ca puṣkare divo mātrayā varimṇā prathasva //
column2: Thou art the Waters’ back, the womb of Agni, around the ocean as it swells and surges. Waxing to greatness, resting on the lotus, spread thou in amplitude with heaven's own measure. 30

column1: śarma ca stho varma ca stho 'cchidre bahule ubhe / vyacasvatī saṃ vasāthāṃ bhṛtam agniṃ purīṣyam //
column2: Yea are a shelter and a shield, uninjured both, and widely spread. Do ye; expansive, cover him: bear ye Purîshya Agni up. 31

column1: saṃvasāthām̐ svarvidā samīcī urasā tmanā / agnim antar bhariṣyantī jyotiṣmantam ajasram it //
column2: Cover him, finders of the light, united both with breast and self, Bearing between you Agni, the refulgent, everlasting One. 32

column1: purīṣyo 'si viśvabharā atharvā tvā prathamo nir amanthad agne / tvām agne puṣkarād adhy atharvā nir amanthata / mūrdhno viśvasya vāghataḥ //
column2: Thou art Purîshya, thou support of all. Atharvan was the first, Agni, who rubbed thee into life. Agni, Atharvan brought thee forth by rubbing from the lotus, from The head of Visva, of the Priest. 33

column1: tam u tvā dadhyaṅṅ ṛṣiḥ putra īdhe atharvaṇaḥ / vṛtrahaṇaṃ puraṃdaram //
column2: Thee too as Vritra-slayer, thee breaker of forts, the Sage Dadhyach, Son of Atharvan, lighted up.34

column1: tam u tvā pāthyo vṛṣā samīdhe dasyuhantamam / dhanaṃjayam̐ raṇe-raṇe //
column2: Pâthya the Bull, too, kindled thee the Dasyus’ most destructive foe, Winner of spoil in every fight. 35

column1: sīda hotaḥ sva u loke cikitvān sādayā yajñam̐ sukṛtasya yonau / devāvīr devān haviṣā yajāsy agne bṛhad yajamāne vayo dhāḥ //
column2: Sit, Hotar, in the Hotar's place, observant: lay down the sacrifice in the place of worship. Thou, dear to Go is, shalt serve them with oblation. Agni, give long life to the Sacrificer. 36

column1: ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānas tveṣo dīdivām̐ asadat sudakṣaḥ / adabdhavratapramatir vasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śucijihvo agniḥ //
column2: Accustomed to the Hotar's place, the Hotar hath seated him, bright, splendid, passing mighty, Whose foresight keeps the Law from violation, excellent, pure-tongued, bringing thousands, Agni. 37

column1: sam̐ sīdasva mahām̐ asi śocasva devavītamaḥ / vi dhūmam agne aruṣaṃ miyedhya sṛja praśasta darśatam //
column2: Seat thee, for thou art mighty: shine, best entertainer of the Gods. Worthy of sacred food, praised Agni! loose the smoke, ruddy and beautiful to see. 38

column1: apo devīr upasṛja madhumatīr ayakṣmāya prajābhyaḥ / tāsām āsthānād uj jihatām oṣadhayaḥ supippalāḥ //
column2: Pour heavenly Waters honey-sweet here for our health, for progeny. Forth from the place whereon they fall let plants with goodly berries spring. 39

column1: saṃ te vāyur mātariśvā dadhātūttānāyā hṛdayaṃ yad vikastam / yo devānāṃ carasi prāṇathena kasmai deva vaṣaḍ astu tubhyam //
column2: May Vâyu Mâtarisvan heal and comfort thy broken heart as there supine thou liest. Thou unto whom the breath of Gods gives motion, to Ka, yea, unto thee, O God, be Vashat! 40

column1: sujāto jyotiṣā saha śarma varūtham āsadat svaḥ / vāso agne viśvarūpam̐ saṃvyayasva vibhāvaso //
column2: He, nobly born with lustre, shield and refuge, hath sat down in light. O Agni, Rich in Splendour, robe thyself in many-hued attire. 41

column1: ud u tiṣṭha svadhvarāvā no devyā dhiyā / dṛśe ca bhāsā bṛhatā śuśukvanir āgne yāhi suśastibhiḥ // ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇa ūtaye tiṣṭhā devo na savitā / ūrdhvo vājasya sanitā yad añjibhir vāghadbhir vihvayāmahe //
column2: arise! With Godlike thought protect us well.With great light splendid to behold come, Agni, through sweet hymns of praise. 42 Rise up erect to give us aid, stand up like Savitar the God; Erect as strength-bestower when we call aloud, with unguents and with priests on thee. 43

column1: sa jāto garbho asi rodasyor agne cārur vibhṛta oṣadhīṣu / citraḥ śiśuḥ pari tamām̐sy aktūn pra mātṛbhyo adhi kanikradad gāḥ //
column2: Thou, being horn, art Child of Earth and Heaven, parted, fair Babe, among the plants, O Agni. The glooms of night thou, brilliant child, subduest, and art come forth, loud roaring, from the Mothers. 44

column1: sthiro bhava vīḍv aṅga āśur bhava vājy arvan / pṛthur bhava suṣadas tvam agneḥ purīṣavāhaṇaḥ //
column2: Steady be thou, and firm of limb. Steed, be a racer fleet of foot. Broad be thou, pleasant as a seat, bearing the store which Agni needs. 45

column1: śivo bhava prajābhyo mānuṣībhyas tvam aṅgiraḥ / mā dyāvāpṛthivī abhi śocīr māntarikṣaṃ mā vanaspatīn //
column2: Be thou propitious, Angiras, to creatures of the human race. Set not on fire the heaven and earth, nor air's mid-region, nor the trees. 46

column1: praitu vājī kanikradan nānadad rāsabhaḥ patvā / bharann agniṃ purīṣyaṃ mā pādy āyuṣaḥ purā / vṛṣāgniṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ bharann apāṃ garbham̐ samudriyam //
column2: Forth with loud neighing go the Steed, the Ass that shouteth as he runs. Bearing Purîshya Agni on, let him not perish ere his time, Male bearer of male Agni, Child of Waters, Offspring of the Sea. Agni, come hither to the feast. 47

column1: agna āyāhi vītaye // ṛtam̐ satyam ṛtam̐ satyam / agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvad bharāmaḥ / oṣadhayaḥ prati modadhvam agnim etam̐ śivam āyantam abhy atra yuṣmāḥ / vyasyan viśvā anirā amīvā niṣīdan no apa durmatiṃ jahi //
column2: The Law the Truth, the Law the Truth. As Angiras was wont to do, we bear Purîshya Agni on. Ye Plants, with joyous welcome greet this Agni, auspicious One who cometh on to meet you. Removing all distresses and afflictions, here settle down and banish evil purpose.48

column1: oṣadhayaḥ prati gṛbhṇīta puṣpavatīḥ supippalāḥ / ayaṃ vo garbha ṛtviyaḥ pratnam̐ sadhastham āsadat //
column2: Welcome him joyfully, ye Plants, laden with bloom and goodly fruit. This seasonable Child of yours hath settled in his ancient seat. 49

column1: vi pājasā pṛthunā śośucāno bādhasva dviṣo rakṣaso amīvāḥ / suśarmaṇo bṛhataḥ śarmaṇi syām agner aham̐ suhavasya praṇītau //
column2: Resplendent with thy wide-extending lustre dispel the terrors of the fiends who hate us. May lofty Agni be my guide and shelter, ready to hear our call, the good Protector. 50

column1: āpo hi ṣṭhā mayobhuvas tā na ūrje dadhātana / mahe raṇāya cakṣase //
column2: Ye, Waters, are beneficent, so help ye us to energy That we may look on great delight. 51

column1: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasas tasya bhājayateha naḥ / uśatīr iva mātaraḥ //
column2: Give us a portion of the sap, the most propitious that ye have. Like mothers in their longing love. 52

column1: tasmā araṃ gamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha / āpo janayathā ca naḥ //
column2: To you we gladly come for him to whose abode ye lead us on: And, Waters, give us procreant strength. 53

column1: mitraḥ sam̐sṛjya pṛthivīṃ bhūmiṃ ca jyotiṣā saha / sujātaṃ jātavedasam ayakṣmāya tvā sam̐ sṛjāmi prajābhyaḥ //
column2: Mitra, having commingled earth and ground together with the light For health to creatures mix I thee Omniscient and nobly born. 54

column1: rudrāḥ sam̐sṛjya pṛthivīṃ bṛhaj jyotiḥ sam īdhire / teṣāṃ bhānur ajasra ic chukro deveṣu rocate //
column2: The Rudras, having mixed the earth, set all aglow the lofty light. Bright and perpetual their light verily shines among the Gods. 55

column1: sam̐sṛṣṭā vasubhī rudrair dhīraiḥ karmaṇyāṃ mṛdam / hastābhyāṃ mṛdvīṃ kṛtvā sinīvālī kṛṇotu tām //
column2: The lump of clay that hath been mixed by Vasus, Rudras, by the wise, May Sinîvâlî with her hands soften and fit it for the work. 56

column1: sinīvālī sukapardā sukurīrā svaupaśā / sā tubhyam adite mahyokhāṃ dadhātu hastayoḥ //
column2: May Sinîvâlî with fair braids, with beauteous crest, with lovely locks, May she, O mighty Aditi, bestow the Fire-pan in thy hands.57

column1: ukhāṃ kṛṇotu śaktyā bāhubhyām aditir dhiyā / mātā putraṃ yathopasthe sāgniṃ bibhartu garbha ā //
column2: Aditi shape the Fire-pan with her power, her arms, her intellect, And in her womb bear Agni as a mother, in her lap, her son. 58

column1: rudrās tvā kṛṇvantu traiṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvad dhruvāsy antarikṣam asi / dhārayā mayi prajām̐ rāyaspoṣaṃ gaupatyam̐ suvīryam̐ sajātān yajamānāya // ādityās tvā kṛṇvantu jāgatena chandasāṅgirasvad dhruvāsi dyaur asi / dhārayā mayi prajām̐ rāyaspoṣaṃ gaupatyam̐ suvīryam̐ sajātān yajamānāya // viśve tvā devā vaiśvānarāḥ kṛṇvantv ānuṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvad dhruvāsi diśo 'si / dhārayā mayi prajām̐ rāyaspoṣaṃ gaupatyam̐ suvīryam̐ sajātān yajamānāya //
column2: With Gâyatrî, like Angiras the Vasus form and fashion thee! Stedfast art then, thou art the Earth. Establish in me progeny, command of cattle, growth of wealth, kinsmen for me the worshipper. With Trishtup may the Rudras, like Angiras, form and fashion thee. Stedfast art thou, thou art the Air. Establish in me, etc., as above. With Jagatî, like Angiras, Âdityas form and fashion thee! Stedfast art thou, thou art the Sky. Establish in me, etc. Friends of all men, the All-Gods with Anushtup form thee Angiras-like. Stedfast art thou, thou art the Quarters. Establish in me, etc. 59

column1: adityai rāmnāsi / aditiṣ ṭe bilaṃ gṛbhṇātu / kṛtvāya sā mahīm ukhāṃ mṛnmayīṃ yonim agnaye / putrebhyaḥ prāyacchad aditiḥ śrapayān iti //
column2: The zone of Aditi art thou. Aditi seize thy hollow space. She, having made the great Fire-pan, a womb for Agni, formed of clay, Aditi, gave it to her Sons and, Let them bake it, were her words. 60

column1: vasavas tvā dhūpayantu gāyatreṇa chandasāṅgirasvat / rudrās tvā dhūpayantu traiṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat / ādityās tvā dhūpayantu jāgatena chandasāṅgirasvat / viśve tvā devā vaiśvānarā dhūpayantv ānuṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat / indras tvā dhūpayatu / varuṇas tvā dhūpayatu / viṣṇu tvā dhūpayatu //
column2: The Vasus make thee fragrant, as Angiras did, with Gâyatrî! The Rudras make thee fragrant with the Trishtup, as did Angiras! With Gâyatrî, like Angiras, may the Âdityas perfume thee. Dear to all men, may the All-Gods with the Anushtup sweeten thee, as Angiras was wont to do. May Indra make thee odorous. May Varuna make thee odorous. May Vishnu make thee odorous.61

column1: aditiṣ ṭvā devī viśvadevyāvatī pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat khanatv avaṭa / devānām tvā patnīr devīr viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvad dadhatūkhe / dhiṣaṇās tvā devīr viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvad abh`īndhatām ukhe / varūtrīṣ ṭvā devīr viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvac chrapayantūkhe / gnās tvā devīr viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat pacantūkhe / janayas tvācchinnapatrā devīr viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat pacantūkhe //
column2: Pit! Angiras-like may Aditi the Goddess, beloved by all Gods, dig thee in Earth's bosom. Pan! Angiras-like may the Gods’ heavenly Consorts, dear to all Gads, in the Earth's bosom place thee. Pan! Angiras-like may Dhishanâs, Divine Ones, dear to alt Gods, in the Earth's bosom light thee. Pan! Angiras-like may the divine Varûtrîs, dear to all Gods, in the earth's bosom heat thee, Pan! Angiras-like may the celestial Ladies, dear to all Gods, in the earth's bosom bake thee. Angiras-like may the celestial Matrons, beloved by all the Gods, with unclipped pinions, within the lap of Earth, O Fire pan, bake thee. 62

column1: mitrasya carṣaṇīdhṛto 'vo devasya sānasi / dyumnaṃ citraśravastamam //
column2: The gainful grace of Mitra, God, supporter of the race of man, Is glorious, of most wondrous fame. 63

column1: devas tvā savitodvapatu supāṇiḥ svaṅguriḥ subāhur uta śaktyā / avyathamānā pṛthivyām āśā diśa ā pṛṇa //
column2: With lovely arms, with lovely hands, with lovely fingers may the God Savitar make thee clean, yea, by the power be hath. Not trembling on the earth fill thou the regions, fill the Quarters full. 64

column1: utthāya bṛhatī bhavod u tiṣṭha dhrutvā tvam / mitraitāṃ ta ukhāṃ pari dadāmy abhittyā eṣā mā bhedi //
column2: Having arisen wax thou great, yea, stand thou up immovable. To thee, O Mitra, I entrust this Fire-pan for security. May it remain without a break. 65

column1: vasavas tvā chṛndantu gāyatreṇa chandasāṅgirasvat / rudrās tvā chṛndantu traiṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat / ādityās tvā chṛndantu jāgatena chandasāṅgirasvat / viśve tvā devā vaiśvānarā ā chṛndantv ānuṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat //
column2: Thee may the Vasus, Angiras-like, fill with the metre Gâyatrî. Thee may the Rudras, Angiras-like, fill with the Trishtup metre full.Thee may Âdityas, Angiras-like, fill with the metre Jagatî. With the Anushtup metre may the All-Gods, dear to all men, fill thee full, as Angiras was wont. 66

column1: ākūtim agniṃ prayujam̐ svāhā / mano medhām agniṃ prayujam̐ svāhā / cittaṃ vijñātam agniṃ prayujam̐ svāhā / vāco vidhṛtim agniṃ prayujam̐ svāhā / prajāpataye manave svāhā / agnaye vaiśvānarāya svāhā //
column2: Intention, Agni. Motive, Hail! Mind, Wisdom, Agni, Motive, Hail! Thought, Knowledge, Agni, Motive, Hail! Rule of Speech, Agni, Motive, Hail! To Manu Lord of creatures, Hail! To Agni dear to all men, Hail! 67

column1: viśvo devasya netur marto vurīta sakhyam / viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṃ vṛṇīta puṣyase svāhā //
column2: May every mortal man elect the friendship of the guiding God. Each one solicits him for wealth: let him seek fame to prosper him. All-hail! 68

column1: mā su bhitthā mā su riṣo 'mba dhṛṣṇu vīrayasva su / agniś cedaṃ kariṣyathaḥ //
column2: Break not, nor suffer any harm. Endure, O Mother, and be brave; This work will thou and Agni do. 69

column1: dṛm̐hasva devi pṛthivi svastaya āsurī māyā svadhayā kṛtāsi / juṣṭaṃ devebhya idam astu havyam ariṣṭā tvam ud ihi yajñe asmin //
column2: Be firm for weal, O Goddess Earth. Made in the wonted manner thou Art a celestial design. Acceptable to Gods he this oblation. Arise thou in this sacrifice uninjured. 70

column1: drvanna sarpirāsutiḥ pratno hotā vareṇyaḥ / sahasas putro adbhutaḥ //
column2: Wood-fed, bedewed with sacred oil, ancient, Invoker, excellent, The Son of Strength, the Wonderful. 71

column1: parasyā adhi saṃvato 'varām̐ abhy ātara / yatrāham asmi tām̐ ava //
column2: Abandoning the foeman's host, pass hither to this company: Assist the men with whom I stand. 72

column1: paramasyāḥ parāvato rohid aśva ihā gahi / purīṣyaḥ purupriyo 'gne tvaṃ tarā mṛdhaḥ //
column2: From the remotest distance come, Lord of the Red Steeds, hitherward. Do thou Purîshya, Agni, loved of many, overcome our foes.73

column1: yad agne kāni kāni cid ā te dārūṇi dadhmasi / sarvaṃ tad astu te ghṛtaṃ taj juṣasva yaviṣṭhya //
column2: O Agni, whatsoever be the fuel that we lay on thee, May that he butter unto thee. Be pleased therewith, Most Youthful God. 74

column1: yad atty upajihvikā yad vamro atisarpati / sarvaṃ tad astu te ghṛtaṃ taj juṣasva yaviṣṭhya //
column2: That which the termite eats away, that over which the emmet crawls— Butter be all of this to thee. Be pleased therewith, Most Youthful God. 75

column1: ahar-ahar aprayāvaṃ bharanto 'śvāyeva tiṣṭhate ghāsam asmai / rāyaspoṣeṇa sam iṣā madanto 'gne mā te prativeśā riṣāma // nābhā pṛthivyāḥ samidhāne agnau rāyaspoṣāya bṛhate havāmahe / iraṃmadaṃ bṛhadukthyaṃ yajatraṃ jetāram agniṃ pṛtanāsu sāsahim //
column2: Bringing to him, with care unceasing, fodder day after day as to a stabled courser, Joying in food and in the growth of riches, may we thy neighbours, Agni, ne’er be injured. 76 While on earth's navel Agni is enkindled, we call, for ample increase of our riches, On Agni joying in the draught, much-lauded, worshipful; victor conquering in battle. 77

column1: yāḥ senā abhītvarīr āvyādhinīr ugaṇā uta / ye stenā ye ca taskarās tām̐s te agne 'pi dadhāmy āsye //
column2: Whatever hosts there are, fiercely assailant, charging in lengthened lines, drawn up in order, Whatever thieves there are, whatever robbers, all these I cast into thy mouth, O Agni. 78

column1: dam̐ṣṭrābhyāṃ malimlūn jambhyais taskarām̐ uta / hanubhyām̐ stenān bhagavas tām̐s tvaṃ khāda sukhāditān //
column2: Devour the burglars with both tusks, destroy the robbers with thy teeth. With both thy jaws, thou Holy One, eat up those thieves well champed and chewed. 79

column1: ye janeṣu malimlava stenāsas taskarā vane / ye kakṣeṣv aghāyavas tām̐s te dadhāmi jambhayoḥ //
column2: The burglars living among men, the thieves and robbers in the wood, Criminals lurking in their lairs, these do I lay between thy jaws. 80

column1: yo asmabhyam arātīyād yaś ca no dveṣate janaḥ / nindād yo asmān dhipsāc ca sarvaṃ taṃ bhasmasā kuru //
column2: Him who would seek to injure us, the man who looks oh us with hate Turn thou to ashes, and the man who slanders and would injure us.81

column1: sam̐śitaṃ me brahma sam̐śitaṃ vīryaṃ balam / sam̐śitaṃ kṣatraṃ jiṣṇu yasyāham asmi purohitaḥ //
column2: Quickened is this my priestly rank, quickened is manly strength and force, Quickened is his victorious power of whom I am the Household priest. 82

column1: ud eṣāṃ bāhū atiram ud varco atho balam / kṣiṇomi brahmaṇāmitrān un nayāmi svām̐ aham //
column2: The arms of these men have I raised, have raised their lustre and their strength With priestly power I ruin foes and lift my friends to high estate. 83

column1: annapate 'nnasya no dehy anamīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ / pra-pra dātāraṃ tāriṣa ūrjaṃ no dhehi dvipade catuṣpade // dṛśāno rukma urvyā vy adyaud durmarṣam āyuḥ śriye rucānaḥ / agnir amṛto abhavad vayobhir yad enaṃ dyaur janayat suretāḥ //
column2: A share of food, O Lord of Food, vouchsafe us, invigorating food that brings no sickness. Onward, still onward lead the giver. Grant us maintenance both for quadruped and biped. FAR hath he shone abroad like gold to look on, beaming imperishable life for glory. Agni by vital powers became immortal when his prolific Father Dyaus begat him. 2

column1: naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe dhāpayete śiśum ekam̐ samīcī / dyāvākṣāmā rukmo antar vi bhāti devā agniṃ dhārayan draviṇodāḥ //
column2: Night and Dawn, different in hue, accordant, meeting together, suckle one same infant. Golden between the heaven and earth he shineth. The wealth-possessing Gods supported Agni. 3

column1: viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīd bhadraṃ dvipade catuṣpade / vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyo 'nu prayāṇam uṣaso vi rājati //
column2: The Sapient One arrays himself in every form: for quadruped and biped he hath brought forth good. Excellent Savitar hath looked on heaven's high vault: he shineth after the outgoings of the Dawn. 4

column1: suparṇo 'si garutmām̐s trivṛt te śiro gāyatraṃ cakṣur bṛhadrathantare pakṣau / stoma ātmā chandām̐sy aṅgāni yajūm̐ṣi nāma / sāma te tanūr vāmadevyaṃ yajñāyajñiyaṃ pucchaṃ dhiṣṇyāḥ śaphāḥ / suparṇo 'si garutmān divaṃ gaccha svaḥ pata //
column2: Thou art the goodly-pinioned Bird: thou hast the Trivrit for thy head. Gâyatra is thine eye, thy wings are Brihat and Rathantara. The hymn is self, the metres are his limbs, the formulas his name. The Vâmadevya Sâman is thy form, the Yajñâyajñiya thy tail, the fire-hearths are thy hooves. Thou art the goodly-pinioned Bird: go skyward, soar to heavenly light.5

column1: viṣṇoḥ kramo 'si sapatnahā gāyatraṃ chanda ā roha pṛthivīm anu vi kramasva / viṣṇoḥ kramo 'sy abhimātihā traiṣṭubhaṃ chanda ā rohāntarikṣam anu vi kramasva / viṣṇoḥ kramo 'sy arātīyato hantā jāgataṃ chanda ā roha divam anu vi kramasva / viṣṇoḥ kramo 'si śatrūyato hantānuṣṭubhaṃ chanda ā roha diśo 'nu vi kramasva //
column2: Thou art the riyal-slaying stride of Vishnu. Mount the Gâyatra metre: stride along the earth. Thou art the foe-destroying stride of Vishnu. Mount the Trishtup metre: stride along mid-air. Thou art the traitor-slaying stride of Vishnu. Mount the Jagatî metre: stride along the sky. Thou art the foeman-slaying stride of Vishnu. Mount Anushtup metre: stride along the Quarters. 6

column1: akrandad agni stanayann iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihad vīrudhaḥ samañjan / sadyo jajñāno vi hīm iddho akhyad ā rodasī bhānunā bhāty antaḥ //
column2: Agni roared out like Dyaus what time he thunders: licking full oft the earth round plants he flickered. At once, when born, he looked about, enkindled: he shineth forth between the earth and heaven. 7

column1: agne 'bhyāvartinn abhi mā ni vartasvāyuṣā varcasā prajayā dhanena / sanyā medhayā rayyā poṣeṇa //
column2: Return to me, thou still-returning Agni, with life, with lustre, progeny, and treasure, With profit, wisdom, riches, and abundance. 8

column1: agne aṅgiraḥ śataṃ te santv āvṛtaḥ sahasraṃ ta upāvṛtaḥ / adhā poṣasya poṣeṇa punar no naṣṭam ā kṛdhi punar no rayim ā kṛdhi //
column2: A hundred, Agni Angiras! be thy ways, a thousand thy returns. With increment of increase bring thou back to us what we have lost. Again bring hitherward our wealth. 9

column1: punar ūrjā ni vartasva punar agna iṣāyuṣā / punar naḥ pāhy am̐hasaḥ // saha rayyā ni vartasvāgne pinvasva dhārayā / viśvapsnyā viśvatas pari //
column2: Agni, again with food and life. Again preserve us from distress. 10 Agni, return with store of wealth. Swell with thine overflowing stream that feedeth all on every side. 11

column1: ā tvāhārṣam antar abhūr dhruvas tiṣṭhāvicācaliḥ / viśas tvā sarvā vāñchantu mā tvad rāṣṭram adhi bhraśat //
column2: I brought thee: thou hast entered in. Stand stedfast and immovable. Lot all the people long for thee. Let not thy kingship fall away. 12

column1: ud uttamaṃ varuṇa pāśam asmad avādhamaṃ vi madhyamam̐ śrathāya / athā vayam āditya vrate tavānāgaso aditaye syāma //
column2: Varuna, from the upmost bond release us, let down the lowest and remove the midmost. So in thy holy law may we made sinless belong to Aditi, O thou Âditya.13

column1: agre bṛhann uṣasām ūrdhvo asthān nirjaganvān tamaso jyotiṣāgāt / agnir bhānunā ruśatā svaṅga ā jāto viśvā sadmāny aprāḥ //
column2: High hath the Mighty risen before the Mornings, and come to us with light from out the darkness. Fair-shapen Agni with white-shining splendour hath filled at birth all human habitations. 14

column1: ham̐saḥ śuciṣad vasur antarikṣasad dhotā vediṣad atithir dūroṇasat / nṛṣad varasad ṛtasad vyomasad abjā gojā ṛtajā adrijā ṛtam //
column2: The Hamsa homed in light, the Vasu in mid-air, the Priest beside the altar, Guest within the house, Dweller in noblest place, mid men, in truth, in sky, born of flood, kine, truth, mountain, he is holy Law. The Great. 15

column1: sīda tvaṃ mātur asyā upasthe viśvāny agne vayunāni vidvān / maināṃ tapasā mārciṣābhiśocīr antar asyām̐ śukrajyotir vi bhāhi //
column2: Knowing all holy ordinances, Agni, be seated in the lap of this thy mother. Do not with heat or glowing flame consume her: shine thou within her with refulgent lustre. 16

column1: antar agne rucā tvam ukhāyāḥ sadane sve / tasyās tvam̐ harasā tapan jātavedaḥ śivo bhava //
column2: Within this Fire-pan with thy light, O Agni, in thy proper seat, Glowing with warmth, be gracious thou, O Jâtavedas, unto her. 17

column1: śivo bhūtvā mahyam agne atho sīda śivas tvam / śivaḥ kṛtvā diśaḥ sarvāḥ svaṃ yonim ihāsadaḥ //
column2: Being propitious unto me, O Agni, sit propitiously. Having made all the regions blest, in thine own dwelling seat thyself. 18

column1: divas pari prathamaṃ jajñe agnir asmād dvitīyaṃ pari jātavedāḥ / tṛtīyam apsu nṛmaṇā ajasram indhāna enaṃ jarate svādhīḥ //
column2: First Agni sprang to life from out of heaven, the second time from us came Jâtavedas. Thirdly the Manly-souled was in the waters. The pious lauds and kindles him Eternal. 19

column1: vidmā te agne tredhā trayāṇi vidmā te dhāma vibhṛtā purutrā / vidmā te nāma paramaṃ guhā yad vidmā tam utsaṃ yata ājagantha //
column2: Agni, we know thy three powers in three stations, we know thy forms in many a place divided. We know what name supreme thou hast in secret: we know the source from which thou hast proceeded. 20

column1: samudre tvā nṛmaṇā apsv antar nṛcakṣā īdhe divo agna ūdhan / tṛtīye tvā rajasi tasthivām̐sam apām upasthe mahiṣā avardhan //
column2: The Manly-souled lit thee in sea and waters, Man's Viewer lit thee in the breast of heaven. There as thou stoodest in the third high region the Bulls increased thee in the waters’ bosom.21

column1: akrandad agni stanayann iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihad vīrudhaḥ samañjan / sadyo jajñāno vi hīm iddho akhyad ā rodasī bhānunā bhāty antaḥ //
column2: Agni roared out, etc. (verse 6 repeated). 22

column1: śrīṇām udāro dharuṇo rayīṇāṃ manīṣāṇāṃ prārpaṇaḥ somagopāḥ / vasuḥ sūnuḥ sahaso apsu rājā vi bhāty agra uṣasām idhānaḥ //
column2: The spring of glories and support of riches, rouser of thoughts and guardian of the Soma, Good Son of Strength, a King amid the waters, in forefront of the Dawns he shines enkindled. 23

column1: viśvasya ketur bhuvanasya garbha ā rodasī apṛṇāj jāyamānaḥ / vīḍuṃ cid adrim abhinat parāyañ janā yad agnim ayajanta pañca // uśik pāvako aratiḥ sumedhā martyeṣv agnir amṛto ni dhāyi / iyarti dhūmam aruṣaṃ bharibhrad uc chukreṇa śociṣā dyām inakṣan // dṛśāno rukma urvyā vy adyaud durmarṣam āyuḥ śriye rucānaḥ / agnir amṛto abhavad vayobhir yad enaṃ dyaur janayat suretāḥ //
column2: Germ of the world, ensign of all creation, he sprang to life and filled the earth and heaven. Even the firm rock he cleft when passing over, when the Five Tribes brought sacrifice to Agni. 24 So among mortals was immortal Agni stablished as cleansing, wise, and eager envoy. He waves the red smoke that he lifts above him, striving to reach the heaven with radiant lustre. 25 Far hath he shone, etc. (verse 1

column1: yas te adya kṛṇavad bhadraśoce 'pūpaṃ deva ghṛtavantam agne / pra taṃ naya prataraṃ vasyo acchābhi sumnaṃ devabhaktaṃ yaviṣṭha //
column2: Whoso this day, O God whose flames are lovely, makes thee a cake, O Agni, mixed with butter, Lead thou and further him to higher fortune, to bliss bestowed by Gods, O thou Most Youthful. 27

column1: ā taṃ bhaja sauśravaseṣv agna uktha-uktha ā bhaja śasyamāne / priyaḥ sūrye priyo agnā bhavāty uj jātena bhinadad uj janitvaiḥ //
column2: Endow him, Agni, with a share of glory, at every, song of praise sung forth enrich him. Dear let him be to Sûrya, dear to Agni, preëminent with son and children's children. 28

column1: tvām agne yajamānā anu dyūn viśvā vasu dadhire vāryāṇi / tvayā saha draviṇam icchamānā vrajaṃ gomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ //
column2: While, Agni, day by day men pay thee worship they win themselves all treasures worth the wishing. Allied with thee, eager and craving riches, they have disclosed the stable filled with cattle. 29

column1: astāvy agnir narām̐ suśevo vaiśvānara ṛṣibhiḥ somagopāḥ / adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayim asme suvīram //
column2: Agni, man's gracious Friend, the Soma's keeper, Vaisvânara, hath been lauded by the Rishis. We will invoke benignant Earth and Heaven: ye Deities, give us wealth with hero children. 30

column1: samidhāgniṃ duvasyata ghṛtair bodhayatātithim / āsmin havyā juhotana //
column2: Pay service unto Agni with your fuel, rouse your Guest with oil: In him present your offerings.31

column1: ud u tvā viśve devā agne bharantu cittibhiḥ / sa no bhava śivas tvam̐ supratīko vibhāvasuḥ //
column2: May all the Gods, O Agni, bear thee upward with their earnest thoughts: Not to be looked on, rich in light, be thou propitious unto us, 32

column1: pred agne jyotiṣmān yāhi śivebhir arcibhiṣ ṭvam / bṛhadbhir bhānubhir bhāsan mā him̐sīs tanvā prajāḥ //
column2: Agni, go forth resplendent, thou with thine auspicious flames of fire. Shining with mighty beams of light harm not my people with thy form. 33 Agni roared out, etc. (verse 21

column1: pra-prāyam agnir bharatasya śṛṇve vi yat sūryo na rocate bṛhad bhāḥ / abhi yaḥ pūruṃ pṛtanāsu tasthau dīdāya daivyo atithiḥ śivo naḥ //
column2: Far famed is this the Bharata's own Agni: he shineth like the Sun with lofty splendour. He who hath vanquished Pûru in the battle, the heavenly Guest hath shone for us benignly. 35

column2: Receive these ashes, ye celestial Waters, and lay them in a fair place full of fragrance. To him bow down the nobly-wedded Matrons! Bear this on waters as her son a mother. 36

column1: apsv agne sadhiṣ ṭava sauṣadhīr anu rudhyase / garbhe san jāyase punaḥ //
column2: Agni, thy home is in the floods: into the plants thou forcest way, And as their child art born anew. 37

column1: garbho asy oṣadhīnāṃ garbho vanaspatīnām / garbho viśvasya bhūtasyāgne garbho apām asi //
column2: Thou art the offspring of the plants, thou art the offspring of the trees: The offspring thou of all that is, thou, Agni, art the Waters’ Child, 38

column1: prasadya bhasmanā yonim apaś ca pṛthivīm agne / sam̐sṛjya mātṛbhiṣ ṭvaṃ jyotiṣmān punar āsadaḥ // punar āsadya sadanam apaś ca pṛthivīm agne / śeṣe mātur yathopasthe 'ntar asyām̐ śivatamaḥ //
column2: With ashes having reached the womb, the waters, Agni and the earth, United with the mothers, thou blazing hast seated thee again. 39 Seated again upon thy seat, the waters, Agni! and the earth, In her, thou, most auspicious One, liest as in a mother's lap40, 41

column1: punar ūrjā nivartasva punar agna iṣāyuṣā / punar naḥ pāhy am̐hasaḥ //
column2: Return again, etc. Agni, return, etc. (verses 9 and 10 repeated). 42

column1: bodhā me asya vacaso yaviṣṭha mam̐hiṣṭhasya prabhṛtasya svadhāvaḥ / pīyati tvo anu tvo gṛṇāti vandāruṣ ṭe tanvaṃ vande agne //
column2: Mark this my speech, Divine One, thou Most Youthful, offered to thee by him who gives most freely: One hates thee, and another sings thy praises. I thine adorer laud thy form, O Agni. 43

column1: sa bodhi sūrir maghavā vasupate vasudāvan / yuyodhy asmad dveṣām̐si // viśvakarmaṇe svāhā //
column2: Be thou for us a liberal Prince, Giver and Lord of precious things. Drive those who hate us far away. To the Omnific One All-hail! 14

column1: punas tvādityā rudrā vasavaḥ sam indhatāṃ punar brahmāṇo vasunītha yajñaiḥ / ghṛtena tvaṃ tanvaṃ vardhayasva satyāḥ santu yajamānasya kāmāḥ //
column2: Again let the Âdityas, Rudras, Yams, and Brahmans with their rites light thee, Wealth-bringer! Increase thy body with presented butter: effectual be the Sacrificer's wishes. 45

column1: apeta v`īta vi ca sarpatāto ye 'tra stha purāṇā ye ca nūtanāḥ / adād yamo 'vasānaṃ pṛthivyā akrann imaṃ pitaro lokam asmai //
column2: Go hence, depart, creep off in all directions, both ancient visitors and recent comers: Yama hath given a place on earth to rest in. This place for him the Fathers have provided. 46

column1: saṃjñānam asi / kāmadharaṇam / mayi te kāmadharaṇaṃ bhūyāt / agner bhasmāsy agneḥ purīṣam asi / cita stha paricita ūrdhvacitaḥ śnayadhvam //
column2: Knowledge art thou: accomplishment of wishes. In me be the fulfilment of thy wishes. Thou art the ashes, thou the mould of Agni. Rankers are ye, rankers around. Rankers right upward, be ye fixed.47

column1: ayam̐ so agnir yasmint somam indraḥ sutaṃ dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ / sahasriṇaṃ vājam atyaṃ na saptim̐ sasavānt sant stūyase jātavedaḥ //
column2: This is that Agni where the longing Indra took the pressed Soma deep within his body. Winner of spoils in thousands like a courser, with prayer art thou exalted, Jâtavedas. 48

column2: The splendour which is thine in heaven, O Agni, in earth, O Holy One, in plants, in waters, Wherewith thou hast o’erspread mid-air's broad region, that light is brilliant, billowy, man-surveying. 49 O Agni, to the flood of heaven thou mountest, thou tallest hither Gods, the thought-inspirers. The waters, those beyond the light of Sûrya, and those that are beneath it here, approach thee. 50

column1: purīṣyāso agnayaḥ prāvaṇebhiḥ sajoṣasaḥ / juṣantāṃ yajñam adruho 'namīvā iṣo mahīḥ //
column2: May the Purîshya Agnis in accord with those that spring from floods, May they, benevolent, accept the sacrifice, full, wholesome draughts. 51

column1: iḍām agne purudam̐sam̐ saniṃ goḥ śaśvattamam̐ havamānāya sādha / syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme //
column2: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward. 52

column1: ayaṃ te yonir ṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ / taṃ jānann agna ā rohāthā no vardhayā rayim //
column2: This is thine ordered place of birth whence, sprung to life, thou shonest forth. Knowing this, Agni, mount on high and cause our riches to increase. 53

column2: Ranker art thou: Angiras-like sit steady with that Deity. Ranker-round art thou: Angiras-like sit steady with that Deity.54

column1: tā asya sūdadohasaḥ somam̐ śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ / janman devānāṃ viśas triṣv ā rocane divaḥ //
column2: The dappled kine who stream with milk prepare his draught of Soma juice— Clans in the birthplace of the Gods, in the three luminous realms of heaven. 56

column1: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhant samudravyacasaṃ giraḥ / rathītamam̐ rathīnāṃ vājānām̐ satpatiṃ patim //
column2: All sacred songs have magnified Indra expansive as the sea, The best of warriors borne on cars, the Lord, the very Lord of Strength. 57

column1: samitam̐ saṃ kalpethām̐ sampriyau rociṣṇū sumanasyamānau / iṣam ūrjam abhi saṃvasānau //
column2: Combine ye two and harmonize together, dear to each other, brilliant, friendly-minded, Abiding in one place for food and vigour. 58

column1: saṃ vāṃ manām̐si saṃ vratā sam u cittāny ākaram / agne purīṣyādhipā bhava tvaṃ na iṣam ūrjaṃ yajamānāya dhehi //
column2: Together have I brought your minds, your ordinances, and your thoughts. Be thou our Sovran Lord, Agni Purîshya; give food and vigour to the Sacrificer. 59

column1: agne tvaṃ purīṣyo rayimān puṣṭimām̐ asi / śivāḥ kṛtvā diśaḥ sarvāḥ yonim ihāsadaḥ //
column2: Thou art Purîshya Agni, thou art wealthy, thou art prosperous. Having made all the regions blest, here seat thee in thine own abode. 60

column1: bhavataṃ naḥ samanasau sacetasāv arepasau / mā yajñam̐ him̐siṣṭaṃ mā yajñapatiṃ jātavedasau śivau bhavatam adya naḥ //
column2: Be ye one-minded unto us, both of one thought, free from deceit. Harm not the sacrifice, harm not the Patron of the sacrifice. Be gracious unto us to-day, ye knowers of all things that be. 61

column1: māteva putraṃ pṛthivī purīṣyam agnim̐ sve yonāv abhār ukhā / tāṃ viśvair devair ṛtubhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ prajāpatir viśvakarmā vi muñcatu //
column2: Even as a mother bears her son, Earth, Ukhâ hath borne within her womb Purîshya Agni. Maker of all, accordant with the All-Gods and Seasons, may Prajâpati release her. 62

column2: follow the going of the thief and robber.This is thy way; leave us and seek some other. To thee, O Goddess Nirriti, be homage. 63 To thee, sharp-pointed Nirriti, full homage! Loose and detach this iron bond that binds him. Unanimous with Yama and with Yamî to the sublimest vault of heaven uplift him. 64

column1: yasyās te ghora āsan juhomy eṣāṃ bandhānām avasarjanāya / yāṃ tvā jano bhūmir iti pramandate nirṛtiṃ tvāhaṃ pari veda viśvataḥ //
column2: Thou, Awful One, thou in whose mouth I offer for the unloosing of these binding fetters, Whom people hail as Earth with their glad voices, as Nirriti in every place I know thee. 65

column1: yaṃ te devī nirṛtir ābabandha pāśaṃ grīvāsv avicṛtyam / taṃ te vi ṣyāmy āyuṣo na madhyād athaitaṃ pitum addhi prasūtaḥ // namo bhūtyai yedaṃ cakāra //
column2: The binding noose which Nirriti the Goddess hath fastened on thy neck that none may loose it, I loose for thee as from the midst of Âyus. Sped forward now, eat thou the food we offer: To Fortune, her who hath done this, be homage. 66

column1: niveśanaḥ saṃgamano vasunāṃ viśvā rūpābhi caṣṭe śacībhiḥ / deva iva savitā satyadharmendro na tasthau samare pathīnām //
column2: Establisher, the gatherer of treasures, he looks with might on every form and figure. Like Savitar the God whose laws are constant, like Indra, he hath stood where meet the pathways. 67

column1: sīrā yuñjanti kavayo yugā vi tanvate pṛthak / dhīrā deveṣu sumnayā //
column2: Wise, through desire of bliss with Gods, the skilful bind the traces fast, and lay the yokes on either side. 68

column1: yunakta sīrā vi yugā tanudhvaṃ kṛte yonau vapateha bījam / girā ca śruṣṭiḥ sabharā asan no nedīya it sṛṇyaḥ pakvam eyāt // śunam̐ su phālā vi kṛṣantu bhūmim̐ śunaṃ kīnāśā abhi yantu vāhaiḥ / śunāsīrā haviṣā tośamānā supippalā oṣadhīḥ kartanāsme //
column2: Lay on the yokes and fasten well the traces; formed is the furrow sow the seed within it. Through song may we find hearing fraught with plenty: near to the ripened grain approach the sickle.69 Happily let the shares turn up the ploughland, happily go the ploughers with the oxen! Suna and Sîra, pleased with our oblation, cause ye our plants to bear abundant fruitage. 70

column1: ghṛtena sītā madhunā sam ajyatāṃ viśvair devair anumatā marudbhiḥ / ūrjasvatī payasā pinvamānāsmānt sīte payasābhyā vavṛtsva //
column2: Approved by Visvedevas and by Maruts, balmed be the furrow with sweet-flavoured fatness. Succulent, teeming with thy milky treasure, turn hitherward to us with milk, O Furrow. 71

column1: lāṅgalaṃ pavīravat suśevam̐ somapitsaru / tad ud vapati gām aviṃ prapharvyaṃ ca pīvarīṃ prasthāvad rathavāhanam //
column2: The keen-shared plough that bringeth bliss, good for the Soma-drinker's need, Shear out for me a cow, a sheep, a rapid drawer of the car, a blooming woman, plump and strong! 72

column2: Milk out their wish, O Wishing-Cow, to Mitra and to Varuna, To Indra, to the Asvins, to Pûshan, to people and to plants. 73

column1: vi mucyadhvam aghnyā devayānā aganma tamasas pāram asya jyotir āpāma //
column2: Be loosed, inviolable, Godward-farers! We have attained the limit of this darkness: we have won the light. 71

column2: Dawn with the ruddy-coloured cows about her; the Asvins with their wonderful achievements; the Sun together with his dappled Courser; Vaisvânara with Idâ and with butter. Svâhâ! 75

column2: Herbs that sprang up in time of old, three ages earlier than the Gods,— Of these, whose hue is brown, will I declare the hundred powers and seven.76

column2: Ye, Mothers, have a hundred homes, yea, and a thousand are your growths. Do ye who have a thousand powers free this my patient from disease. 77

column2: Be glad and joyful in the Plants, both blossoming and bearing fruit, Plants that will lead us to success like mares who conquer in the race. 78

column2: Plants, by this name I speak to you, Mothers, to you the Goddesses: Steed, cow, and garment may I win, win back thy very self, O man. 79 The Holy Fig tree is your home, your mansion is the Parna tree: Winners of cattle shall ye be if ye regain for me this man. 80

column2: He who hath store of Herbs at hand like Kings amid a crowd of men,— Physician is that sage's name, fiend-slayer, chaser of disease. 81

column2: Herbs rich in Soma, rich in steeds, in nourishment in strengthening power, All these have I provided here, that this man may be whole again. 82

column2: The healing virtues of the Plants stream forth like cattle from the stall,— Plants that shall win me store of wealth, and save thy vital breath, O man. 83

column2: Reliever is your mother's name, and hence Restorers are ye called. Rivers are ye with wings that fly: keep far whatever brings disease. 84

column1: ati viśvāḥ pariṣṭhā stena iva vrajam akramuḥ / oṣadhīḥ prācucyavur yat kiṃ ca tanvo rapaḥ //
column2: Over all fences have they passed, as steals a thief into the fold. The Plants have driven from the frame whatever malady was there. 85

column1: yad imā vājayann aham oṣadhīr hasta ādadhe / ātmā yakṣmasya naśyati purā jīvagṛbho yathā //
column2: When, bringing back the vanished strength, I hold these herbs within my hand, The spirit of disease departs ere he can seize upon the life. 86

column1: yasyauṣadhīḥ prasarpathāṅgam-aṅgaṃ paruṣ-paruḥ / tato yakṣmaṃ vi bādhadhva ugro madhyamaśīr iva // sākaṃ yakṣma prapata cāṣeṇa kikidīvinā / sākaṃ vātasya dhrājyā sākaṃ naśya nihākayā //
column2: He through whose frame, O Plants, ye creep member by member, joint by joint, From him ye drive away disease like some strong arbiter of strife. 87 Fly, Spirit of Disease, begone, with the blue jay and kingfisher. Fly, with the wind's impetuous speed, vanish together with the storm.88

column1: anyā vo anyām avatv anyānyasyā upāvata / tāḥ sarvāḥ saṃvidānā idaṃ me prāvatā vacaḥ //
column2: Help every one the other, lend assistance each of you to each, All of you be accordant, give furtherance to this speech of mine. 89

column1: yāḥ phalinīr yā aphalā apuṣpā yāś ca puṣpiṇīḥ / bṛhaspatiprasūtās tā no muñcantv am̐hasaḥ //
column2: Let fruitful Plants, and fruitless, those that blossom, and the blossomless, Urged onward by Brihaspati, release us from our pain and grief;

column1: muñcantu mā śapathyād atho varuṇyād uta / atho yamasya paḍvīśāt sarvasmād devakilviṣāt //
column2: me from the curse's plague and woe that comes from Varuna; Free me from Yama's fetter, from sin and offence against the Gods. 91

column1: avapatantīr avadan diva oṣadhayas pari / yaṃ jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ //
column2: What time, descending from the sky, the Plants flew earthward, thus they spake: No evil shall befall the man whom while he liveth we pervade. 92

column1: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīr bahvīḥ śatavicakṣaṇāḥ / tāsām asi tvam uttamāraṃ kāmāya śam̐ hṛde //
column2: Of all the many Plants whose King is Soma, Plants of hundred forms, Thou art the Plant most excellent, prompt to the wish, sweet to the heart. 93

column1: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīr viṣṭhitāḥ pṛthivīm anu / bṛhaspatiprasūtā asyai saṃ datta vīryam //
column2: O all ye various Herbs whose King is Soma, that o’erspread the earth, Urged onward by Brihaspati, combine your virtue in this Plant. 94

column1: yāś cedam upaśṛṇvanti yāś ca dūraṃ parāgatāḥ / sarvāḥ saṃgatya vīrudho 'syai saṃ datta vīryam //
column2: All Plants that hear this speech, and those that have departed far away, Come all assembled and confer your healing power upon this Herb. 95

column1: mā vo riṣat khanitā yasmai cāhaṃ khanāmi vaḥ / dvipāc catuṣpād asmākam̐ sarvam astv anāturam //
column2: Unharmed be he who digs you up, unharmed the man for whom I dig: And let no malady attack biped or quadruped of ours. 96

column1: oṣadhayaḥ sam avadanta somena saha rājñā / yasmai kṛṇoti brāhmaṇas tam̐ rājan pārayāmasi //
column2: With Soma as their Sovran Lord the Plants hold colloquy and say: O King, we save from death the man whose cure a Brâhman undertakes. 97

column1: nāśayitrī balāsasyārśasa upacitām asi / atho śatasya yakṣmāṇāṃ pākāror asi nāśanī //
column2: Banisher of catarrh art thou, of tumours and of hemorrhoids; Thou banished Pâkâru and Consumption in a hundred forms.99

column1: tvāṃ gandharvā akhanam̐s tvām indras tvāṃ bṛhaspatiḥ / tvām oṣadhe somo rājā vidvān yakṣmād amucyata //
column2: Thee did Gandharvas dig from earth, thee Indra and Brihaspati. King Soma, knowing thee, O Plant, from his Consumption was made free. 100

column1: sahasva me arātīḥ sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ / sahasva sarvaṃ pāpmānam̐ sahamānāsy oṣadhe //
column2: Conquer mine enemies, the men who challenge me do thou subdue. Conquer thou all unhappiness: victorious art thou, O Plant. 101

column1: dīrghāyus ta oṣadhe khanitā yasmai ca tvā khanāmy aham / atho tvaṃ dīrghāyur bhūtvā śatavalśā vi rohatāt //
column2: Long-lived be he who digs thee, Plant, and he for whom I dig thee up. So mayst thou also, grown long-lived, rise upward with a hundred shoots. 102

column1: tvam uttamāsy oṣadhe tava vṛkṣā upastayaḥ / upastir astu so 'smākaṃ yo asmām̐ abhidāsati //
column2: thy vassals are the trees. Let him be subject to our power, the man who seeks to injure us. 103

column1: mā mā him̐sīj janitā yaḥ pṛthivyā yo vā divam̐ satyadharmā vyānaṭ / yaś cāpaś candrāḥ prathamo jajāna kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema //
column2: May he not harm me who is earth's begetter, nor he whose laws are faithful, sky's pervades; Nor he who first begot the lucid waters. To Ka the God let us present oblation. 104

column1: abhyā vartasva pṛthivi yajñena payasā saha / vapāṃ te agnir iṣito arohat //
column2: Turn thyself hitherward, O Earth, to us with sacrifice and milk. Thy covering skin Agni, urged forth, hath mounted. 105

column1: agne yat te śukraṃ yac candraṃ yat pūtaṃ yac ca yajñiyam / tad devebhyo bharāmasi //
column2: All, Agni, that in thee is bright, pure, cleansed, and meet for sacrifice, That do we bring unto the Gods. 106

column1: iṣam ūrjam aham ita ādam ṛtasya yoniṃ mahiṣasya dhārām / ā mā goṣu viśatvā tanūṣu jahāmi sedim anirām amīvām //
column2: I from this place have fed on strength and vigour, the womb of holy Law, stream of the mighty. In cows let it possess me and in bodies. I quit decline and lack of food, and sickness. 107

column1: agne tava śravo vayo mahi bhrājante arcayo vibhāvaso / bṛhadbhāno śavasā vājam ukthyaṃ dadhāsi dāśuṣe kave //
column2: Agni, life-power and fame are thine: thy fires blaze mightily, thou rich in wealth of beams! Sage, passing bright, thou givest to the worshipper, with strength, the food that merits laud. 108

column1: pāvakavarcāḥ śukravarcā anūnavarcā ud iyarṣi bhānunā / putro mātarā vicarann upāvasi pṛṇakṣi rodasī ubhe //
column2: With brilliant, purifying sheen, with perfect sheen thou liftest up thyself in light. Thou, visiting both thy Mothers, aidest them as Son: thou joinest close the earth and heaven.109

column1: ūrjo napāj jātavedaḥ suśastibhir mandasva dhītibhir hitaḥ / tve iṣaḥ saṃ dadhur bhūrivarpasaś citrotayo vāmajātāḥ //
column2: O Jâtavedas, Son of Strength, rejoice thyself, gracious, in our fair hymns and songs. In thee are treasured various forms of strengthening food, born nobly and of wondrous help. 110

column1: irajyann agne prathayasva jantubhir asme rāyo amartya / sa darśatasya vapuṣo vi rājasi pṛṇakṣi sānasiṃ kratum //
column2: Agni, spread forth, as Ruler, over living things: give wealth to us, Immortal God. Thou shinest out from beauty fair to look upon: thou leadest us to conquering power. 111

column1: iṣkartāram adhvarasya pracetasaṃ kṣayantam̐ rādhaso mahaḥ / rātiṃ vāmasya subhagāṃ mahīm iṣaṃ dadhāsi sānasim̐ rayim //
column2: To him, the wise, who orders sacrifice, who hath great riches under his control, Thou givest blest award of good, and plenteous food, givest him wealth that conquers all. 112

column1: ṛtāvānaṃ mahiṣaṃ viśvadarśatam agnim̐ sumnāya dadhire puro janāḥ / śrutkarṇam̐ saprathastamaṃ tvā girā daivyaṃ mānuṣā yugā //
column2: The men have set before them for their welfare Agni, strong, visible to all, the Holy. Thee, Godlike One, with ears to hear, most famous, men's generations magnify with praise-songs. 113

column1: ā pyāyasva sam etu te viśvataḥ soma vṛṣṇyam / bhavā vājasya saṃgathe //
column2: Soma, wax great. From every side may vigorous powers unite in thee. Be in the gathering-place of strength. 114

column1: saṃ te payām̐si sam u yantu vājāḥ saṃ vṛṣṇyāny abhimātiṣāhaḥ / āpyāyamāno amṛtāya soma divi śravām̐sy uttamāni dhiṣva //
column2: In thee be juicy nutriments united, and power and mighty foe-subduing vigour. Waxing to immortality, O Soma, win highest glory for thyself in heaven. 115

column1: ā pyāyasva madintama soma viśvebhir am̐śubhiḥ / bhavā naḥ suśravastamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe //
column2: Wax, O most gladdening Soma, great through all thy filaments, and be A friend of most illustrious fame to prosper us. 116

column1: ā te vatso mano yamat paramāc cit sadhasthāt / agne tvāṃkāmayā girā //
column2: May Vatsa draw thy mind away, even from thy loftiest dwelling-place, Agni, with song that yearns for thee. 117

column1: tubhyaṃ tā aṅgirastama viśvāḥ sukṣitayaḥ pṛthak / agne kāmāya yemire //
column2: Agni, best Angiras, to thee all people who have pleasant homes Apart have turned to gain their wish. 118

column1: agniḥ priyeṣu dhāmasu kāmo bhūtasya bhavyasya / samrāḍ eko vi rājati //
column2: In dear homes, Agni, the desire of all that is and is to be, Shines forth the One Imperial Lord.

column1: mayi gṛhṇāmy agre agnim̐ rāyaspoṣāya suprajāstvāya suvīryāya / mām u devatāḥ sacantām //
column2: I TAKE within me Agni first, for increase of my wealth, good offspring, manly strength: So may the Deities wait on me. 2

column1: apāṃ pṛṣṭham asi yonir agneḥ samudram abhitaḥ pinvamānam / vardhamāno mahām̐ ā ca puṣkare divo mātrayā varimṇā prathasva //
column2: Thou art the waters’ back, the womb of Agni, around the ocean as it swells and surges. Waxing to greatness, resting on the lotus, spread forth in amplitude with heaven's own measure. 3

column1: brahma jajñānaṃ prathamaṃ purastād vi sīmataḥ suruco vena āvaḥ / sa budhnyā upamā asya viṣṭhāḥ sataś ca yonim asataś ca vi vaḥ //
column2: Eastward at first was Brahma generated. Vena o’erspread the bright Ones from the summit, Disclosed his deepest nearest revelations, womb of existent and of non-existent. 4

column1: hiraṇyagarbhaḥ sam avartatāgre bhūtasya jātaḥ patir eka āsīt / sa dādhāra pṛthivīṃ dyām utemāṃ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema //
column2: In the beginning rose Hiranyagarbha, born Only Lord of all created being. He fixed and holdeth up this earth and heaven. Worship we Ka the God with our oblation. 5

column1: drapsaś caskanda pṛthivīm anu dyām imaṃ ca yonim anu yaś ca pūrvaḥ / samānaṃ yonim anu saṃcarantaṃ drapsaṃ juhomy anu sapta hotrāḥ //
column2: The Drop leaped onward through the earth and heaven, along this place and that which was before it.I offer up, throughout the seven oblations, the Drop still moving to the common dwelling. 6

column1: namo 'stu sarpebhyo ye ke ca pṛthivīm anu / ye antarikṣe ye divi tebhyaḥ sarpebhyo namaḥ //
column2: Homage be paid to Serpents unto all of them that are on earth, To those that dwell in air, to those that dwell in sky be homage paid. 7

column1: ye vāmī rocane divo ye vā sūryasya raśmiṣu / yeṣām apsu sadas kṛtaṃ tebhyaḥ sarpebhyo namaḥ //
column2: Or those that are in heaven's bright sphere, or those that dwell in the Sun's beams: Serpents, whose home has been prepared in waters, homage unto them! 9

column1: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitiṃ na pṛthvīṃ yāhi rājevāmavām̐ ibhena / tṛṣvīm anu prasitiṃ drūṇāno 'stāsi vidhya rakṣasas tapiṣṭhaiḥ //
column2: Put forth like a wide-spreading net thy vigour: go like a mighty King with his attendants. Thou, following thy swift net, shootest arrows: transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely. 10

column1: tava bhramāsa āśuyā patanty anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ / tapūm̐ṣy agne juhvā pataṅgān asaṃdito vi sṛja viṣvag ulkāḥ //
column2: Forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons: follow them closely glowing in thy fury. Spread with thy tongue the wingèd flames, O Agni: unfettered cast thy firebrands all around thee. 11

column1: prati spaśo vi sṛja tūrṇitamo bhavā pāyur viśo asyā adabdhaḥ / yo no dūre aghaśam̐so yo anty agne mākiṣ ṭe vyathir ā dadharṣīt // ud agne tiṣṭha praty ā tanuṣva ny amitrām̐ oṣatāt tigmahete / yo no arātim̐ samidhāna cakre nīcā taṃ dhakṣy atasaṃ na śuṣkam //
column2: Send thy spies forward, fleetest in thy motion: be, ne’er deceived, the guardian of this people From him who, near or far, is bent on evil, and let no trouble sent from thee o’ercome us. 12 Rise up, O Agni, spread thee out before us, burn down our foes, thou who hast sharpened arrows. Him, blazing Agni! who hath worked us mischief, consume thou utterly like dried-up stubble. 13

column1: ūrdhvo bhava prati vidhyādhy asmad āviṣ kṛṇuṣva daivyāny agne / ava sthirā tanuhi yātujūnāṃ jāmim ajāmiṃ pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn // agneṣ ṭvā tejasā sādayāmi //
column2: Rise, Agni, drive off those who fight against us: make manifest thine own celestial vigour. Slacken the strong bows of the demon-driven: destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger. I settle thee with Agni's fiery ardour.14

column1: agnir mūrdhā divaḥ kakut patiḥ pṛthivyā ayam / apām̐ retām̐si jinvati // indrasya tvaujasā sādayāmi //
column2: Agni is head and height of heaven, the Master of the earth is he: He quickeneth the waters’ seed. I settle thee with the great strength of Indra. 15

column1: bhuvo yajñasya rajasaś ca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacase śivābhiḥ / divi mūrdhānaṃ dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ jihvām agne cakriṣe havyavāham //
column2: Thou art the leader of the rite and region to which with thine auspicious teams thou tendest. Thy light-bestowing head to heaven thou liftest, making thy tongue the oblation-bearer, Agni! 16

column1: dhruvāsi dharuṇāstṛtā viśvakarmaṇā / mā tvā samudra ud badhīn mā suparṇo 'vyathamānā pṛthivīṃ dṛm̐ha //
column2: Steady art thou, sustainer, laid by Visvakarman in thy place. Let not the ocean nor the bird harm thee: unshaking, steady earth. 17

column1: prajāpatiṣ ṭvā sādayatv apā pṛṣṭhe samudrasyeman / vyacasvatīṃ prathasvatīṃ prathasva pṛthivy asi //
column2: Thee let Prajâpati settle on the waters’ back, in Ocean's course, Thee the capacious, widely spread. Thou art the Wide One: spread thee wide 18

column1: bhūr asi bhūmir asy aditir asi viśvadhāyā viśvasya bhuvanasya dhartrī / pṛthivīṃ yaccha pṛthivīṃ dṛm̐ha pṛthivīṃ mā him̐sīḥ //
column2: Thou art the earth, the ground, thou art the all-sustaining Aditi, she who supporteth all the world. Control the earth, steady the earth, do thou the earth no injury. 19

column1: viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya vyānāyodānāya pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya / agniṣ ṭvābhi pātu mahyā svastyā chardiṣā śaṃtamena tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvā sīda //
column2: through-breath, upward-breathing, for high position, for prescribed observance, May Agni keep thee safe with great well-being, with the securest shelter. As aforetime with Angiras, with that Deity lie steady. 20

column1: kāṇḍāt-kāṇḍāt prarohantī paruṣaḥ-paruṣas pari / evā no dūrve pra tanu sahasreṇa śatena ca //
column2: Upspringing from thine every joint, upspringing from each knot of thine,Thus with a thousand, Dûrvâ! with a hundred do thou stretch us out. 21

column1: yā śatena pratanoṣi sahasreṇa virohasi / tasyās te devīṣṭake vidhema haviṣā vayam //
column2: Thou spreading with a hundred, thou that branched with a thousand shoots, Thee, such, with our oblation will we worship, O celestial Brick. 22

column1: yās te agne sūrye ruco divam ātanvanti raśmibhiḥ / tābhir no adya sarvābhī ruce janāya nas kṛdhi //
column2: Thy lights, O Agni, in the Sun that with their beams o’erspread the sky,— With all of those assist thou us to-day to light and progeny. 23

column1: yā vo devāḥ sūrye ruco goṣv aśveṣu yā rucaḥ / indrāgnī tābhiḥ sarvābhī rucaṃ no dhatta bṛhaspate //
column2: Lights of yours in the Sun, O Gods, or lights that are in kine and steeds, O Indra-Agni, with all those vouchsafe us light, Brihaspati! 24

column1: virāḍ jyotir adhārayat / svarāḍ jyotir adhārayat / prajāpatiṣ ṭvā sādayatu pṛṣṭhe pṛthivyā jyotiṣmatīm / viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya vyānāya viśvaṃ jyotir yaccha / agniṣ ṭe 'dhipatis tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvā sīda //
column2: The Far.-Refulgent held the light. The Self-Refulgent held the light. Thee, luminous, may Prajâpati settle upon the back of Earth. Give, to all breathing, all the light, to out-breath, to diffusive breath. Thy Sovran Lord is Agni. With that Deity, as with Angiras, lie firmly settled in thy place. 25

column1: madhuś ca mādhavaś ca vāsantikāv ṛtū agner antaḥśleṣo 'si kalpetāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpa oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthaṅ nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ / ye agnayaḥ samanaso 'ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime vāsantikāv ṛtū abhikalpamānā indram iva devā abhisaṃ viśantu tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruve sīdatam //
column2: Madhu and Mâdhava, the two Spring seasons—thou art the innermost cement of Agni. May Heaven and Earth, may Waters, Plants and Agnis help, separate, accordant, my precedence. May all the Fires ’twixt heaven and earth, one-minded, well-fitted, gather round these two Spring seasons, As the Gods gathering encompass Indra: firm with that Deity, Angiras-like, be seated. 26

column1: aṣāḍhāsi sahamānā sahasvārātīḥ sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ / sahasravīryāsi sā mā jinva //
column2: Thou art Ashâdhâ, Conquering One. Conquer our foemen, conquer thou the men who fain would-fight with us. A thousand manly powers hast thou: so do thou aid and quicken me.27

column1: madhu vātā ṛtāyate madhu kṣaranti sindhavaḥ / mādhvīr naḥ santv oṣadhīḥ //
column2: The winds waft sweets, the rivers pour sweets for the man who keeps the Law: So may the plants be sweet for us. 28

column1: madhu naktam utoṣaso madhumat pārthivam̐ rajaḥ / madhu dyaur astu naḥ pitā // madhumān no vanaspatir madhumām̐ astu sūryaḥ / mādhvīr gāvo bhavantu naḥ //
column2: Sweet be the night and sweet the dawns, sweet the terrestrial atmosphere: Sweet be our Father Heaven to us. 29 May the tall tree be full of sweets for us and, and full of sweets the Sun: May our milch-kine be sweet for us. 30

column1: apāṃ gambhant sīda mā tvā sūryo 'bhi tāpsīn māgnir vaiśvānaraḥ / acchinnapatrāḥ prajā anuvīkṣasvānu tvā divyā vṛṣṭiḥ sacatām //
column2: Seat thyself in the deepness of the waters, lest Sûrya, lest Vaisvânara Agni scorch thee. With wing unclipped, survey created beings: may rain that cometh down from heaven attend thee. 31

column1: trīnt samudrānt sam asṛpat svargān apāṃ patir vṛṣabha iṣṭakānām / purīṣaṃ vasānaḥ sukṛtasya loke tatra gaccha yatra pūrve paretāḥ //
column2: He crept across the three heaven-reaching oceans, the Bull of Bricks, the Master of the Waters. Clad in the world with his, the Well-Made's, vesture, go whither those before thee have departed. 32

column1: mahī dyauḥ pṛthivī ca na imaṃ yajñaṃ mimikṣatām / pipṛtāṃ no bharīmabhiḥ //
column2: May Heaven and Earth, the Mighty Pair, besprinkle this our sacrifice, And feed us full with nourishments. 33

column1: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yato vratāni paspaśe / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā //
column2: Look ye on Vishnu's works whereby the Friend of Indra, close allied, Hath let his holy ways be seen.34

column1: dhruvāsi dharuṇeto jajñe prathamam ebhyo yonibhyo adhi jātavedaḥ / sa gāyatryā triṣṭubhānuṣṭubhā ca devebhyo havyaṃ vahatu prajānan //
column2: Firm art thou, a sustainer. Hence engendered, forth from these wombs at first came Jâtavedas. By Gâyatrî, by Trishtup, by Anushtup, may he who knows bear to the Gods oblation. 35

column1: iṣe rāye ramasva sahase dyumna ūrje apatyāya / samrāḍ asi svarāḍ asi sārasvatau tvotsau prāvatām //
column2: Take thou thine ease for food, for store of riches, for might in splendour, and for strength and offspring. Thou art all-ruling, independent Ruler: both fountains of Sarasvatî protect thee! 36

column1: agne yukṣvā hi ye tavāśvāso deva sādhavaḥ / araṃ vahanti manyave //
column2: O radiant Agni, harness thou thy steeds which are most excellent! They bear thee as thy spirit wills. 37

column1: yukṣvā hi devahūtamām̐ aśvām̐ agne rathīr iva / ni hotā pūrvyaḥ sadaḥ //
column2: Yoke, Agni, as a charioteer, thy steeds who best invoke the Gods: As ancient Hotar take thy seat. 38

column1: samyak sravanti sarito na dhenā antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ / ghṛtasya dhārā abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayo vetaso madhye agneḥ //
column2: Like rivers our libations flow together, cleansing themselves in inmost heart and spirit. I look upon the flowing streams of butter: the golden reed is in the midst of Agni. 39

column1: ṛce tvā ruce tvā bhāse tvā jyotiṣe tvā / abhūd idaṃ viśvasya bhuvanasya vājinam agner vaiśvānarasya ca //
column2: Thee for the praise-verse, thee for sheen, thee for bright splendour, thee for light. This hath become the energetic spirit of all the world and of Vaisvânara Agni. 40

column1: agnir jyotiṣā jyotiṣmān rukmo varcasā varcasvān / sahasradā asi sahasrāya tvā //
column2: Agni, all-luminous with light, splendid with splendour, golden One. Giver of thousands art thou: for a thousand thee.41

column1: ādityaṃ garbhaṃ payasā sam aṅdhi sahasrasya pratimāṃ viśvarūpam / pari vṛṅdhi harasā mābhi mam̐sthāḥ śatāyuṣaṃ kṛṇuhi cīyamānaḥ //
column2: Balm thou with milk the unborn babe Âditya, wearing all forms, creator of a thousand. Spare, him with heat, nor plot against him: give him a hundred years of life while thou art building. 42

column1: vātasya jūtiṃ varuṇasya nābhim aśvaṃ jajñānam̐ sarirasya madhye / śiśuṃ nadīnām̐ harim adribudhnam agne mā him̐sīḥ parame vyoman //
column2: The wind's impetuous rush, Varuna's navel! the horse that springs to life amid the waters! The rivers’ tawny child, based on the mountain, harm not, O Agni, in the loftiest region. 43

column1: ajasram indum aruṣaṃ bhuraṇyum agnim īḍe pūrvacitti namobhiḥ / sa parvabhir ṛtuśaḥ kalpamāno gāṃ mā him̐sīr aditiṃ virājam //
column2: Unwasting Drop, red, eager, pressing forward, Agni I worship with repeated homage. Forming thyself with joints in proper order, harm not the Cow, Aditi widely ruling! 44

column1: varūtrīṃ tvaṣṭur varuṇasya nābhim aviṃ jajñānām̐ rajasaḥ parasmāt / mahīm̐ sāhasrīm asurasya māyām agne mā him̐sīḥ parme vyoman //
column2: Her who is Tvashtar's guardian, Varuna's navel, the Ewe brought forth from out the loftiest region, The Asura's mighty thousandfold contrivance, injure not in the highest sphere, O Agni. 45

column1: yo 'gnir agner adhiy ajāyata śokāt pṛthivyā uta vā divas pari / yena prajā viśvakarmā jajāna tam agne heḍaḥ pari te vṛṇaktu //
column2: The Agni who from Agni had his being, from heat of Earth or also heat of Heaven, Whereby the Omnific One engendered creatures, him may thy fierce displeasure spare, O Agni. 46

column1: citraṃ devānām ud agād anīkaṃ cakṣur mitrasya varuṇasyāgneḥ / āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam̐ sūrya ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca //
column2: The brilliant presence of the Gods hath risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni. The soul of all that moveth not or moveth, the Sun hath filled the air, and earth and heaven. 47

column1: imaṃ mā him̐sīr dvipādaṃ paśum̐ sahasrākṣo medhāya cīyamānaḥ / mayuṃ paśuṃ medham agne juṣasva tena cinvānas tanvo ni ṣīda // mayuṃ te śug ṛcchatu yaṃ dviṣmas taṃ te śug ṛcchatu //
column2: Injure not, thousand-eyed, while thou art building for sacrifice, this animal, the biped.Accept as pith man's counterfeit the victim, Agni: therewith building thy forms, be settled. Let thy flame reach man's counterfeit: let thy flame reach the man we hate. 48

column1: imaṃ mā him̐sīr ekaśaphaṃ paśuṃ kanikradaṃ vājinaṃ vājineṣu / gauram āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānas tanvo ni ṣīda // gauraṃ te śug ṛcchatu yaṃ dviṣmas taṃ te śug ṛcchatu //
column2: Harm not this animal whose hooves are solid, the courser neighing in the midst of coursers. I dedicate to thee the forest Gaura: building thy bodies up with him be settled. Let thy flame reach the Gaura, let thy flame reach him whom we detest. 49

column1: imam̐ sāhasram̐ śatadhāram utsaṃ vyacyamānam̐ sarirasya madhye / ghṛtaṃ duhānām aditiṃ janāyāgne mā him̐sīḥ parame vyoman // gavayam āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānas tanvo ni ṣīda / gavayaṃ te śug ṛcchatu yaṃ dviṣmas taṃ te śug ṛcchatu //
column2: Thousandfold, with a hundred streams, this fountain, expanded in the middle of the waters, Infinite, yielding butter for the people, harm not, O Agni, in the highest region. This wild bull of the forest I assign thee: building thy bodies up therewith be settled. Let thy flame reach the wild hull, etc. (as in 48). 50

column1: imam ūrṇāyuṃ varuṇasya nābhiṃ tvacaṃ paśūnāṃ dvipadāṃcatuṣpadām / tvaṣṭuḥ prajānāṃ prathamaṃ janitram agne mā him̐sīḥ parame vyoman //
column2: This creature clothed in wool, Varuna's navel, the skin of animals quadruped and biped, The first that was produced of Tvashtar's creatures, O Agni, harm not in the highest region. The forest buffalo do I assign thee: building, etc., as above mutato mutando. 51

column1: ajo hy agner ajaniṣṭa śokāt so apaśyaj janitāram agre / tena devā devatām agram āyam̐s tena roham āyann upa medhyāsaḥ / śarabham āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānas tanvo ni ṣīda / śarabhaṃ te śug ṛcchatu yaṃ dviṣmas taṃ te śug ṛcchatu //
column2: From Agni's warmth the he-goat had his being: he looked at first upon his generator. Thereby the Gods at first attained to Godhead: those meet for worship to the height ascended. The forest Sarabha do I assign thee: building, etc. 52

column1: tvaṃ yaviṣṭha dāśuṣo nṛm̐ḥ pāhi śṛṇudhī giraḥ / rakṣā tokam uta tmanā //
