column1: prastareṇa paridhinā srucā vedyā ca barhiṣā / ṛcemaṃ yajñaṃ no naya svar deveṣu gantave // yad dattaṃ yat parādānaṃ yat pūrtaṃ yāś ca dakṣiṇāḥ / tad agnir vaiśvakarmaṇaḥ svar deveṣu no dadhat //
column2: With Darbha-bunch, with fencing-wood, with spoon, with altar, holy grass, With , lead this our sacrifice to go to heaven among the Gods. 64 Our gifts, our charitable grants, our pious works, our fees to priests, May the Omnific's Agni set all this among the Gods in heaven.65

column1: yatra dhārā anapetā madhor ghṛtasya ca yāḥ / tad agnir vaiśvakarmaṇaḥ svar deveṣu no dadhat //
column2: There where all never-failing streams of honey and of butter flow, May Agni, Visvakarman's own, place us in heaven among the Gods. 66

column1: agnir asmi janmanā jātavedā ghṛtaṃ me cakṣur amṛtaṃ ma āsan / arkas tridhātū rajaso vimāno 'jasro gharmo havir asmi nāma // ṛco nāmāsmi yajūm̐ṣi nāmāsmi sāmāni nāmāsmi / ye agnayaḥ prāñcajanyā asyāṃ pṛthivyām adhi / teṣām asi tvam uttamaḥ pra no jīvatave suva //
column2: Agni am who know by birth all creatures. Mine eye is butter, in my mouth is nectar. I am the triple light, the region's meter: exhaustless heat am I, named burnt oblation. 67 Praise-verses, sacrificial texts, and chanted hymns am I in name. Thou art the best of all the Fires among the fivefold race of man That burn upon this earth of ours. Speed thou us on to lengthened life. 68

column1: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca / indra tvā vartayāmasi //
column2: O Indra, for the strength that slays Vritra and conquers in the fight We torn thee hitherward to us. 69

column1: sahadānuṃ puruhūta kṣiyantam ahastam indra saṃ piṇak kuṇārum / abhi vṛtraṃ vardhamānaṃ piyārum apādam indra tavasā jaghantha //
column2: Thou, Indra, much-invoked, didst crush to pieces, Kunâru, handless fiend who dwelt with Dânus. Thou with might, Indra, smotest dead the scorner, the footless Vritra as he waxed in vigour. 70

column1: vi na indra mṛdho jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ / yo asmām̐ abhidāsaty adharaṃ gamayā tamaḥ //
column2: O Indra, beat our foes away, etc. as in VIII. 44

column1: mṛgo na bhīmaḥ kucaro giriṣṭhāḥ parāvata ā jaganthā parasyāḥ / sṛkam̐ sam̐śāya pavim indra tigmaṃ vi śatrūn tāḍhi vi mṛdho nudasva //
column2: Like some dread wild beast roaming on the mountain thou hast approached us from the farthest distance. Whetting thy bolt and thy sharp blade, O Indra, crush thou the foes and scatter those who hate us. 72

column1: vaiśvānaro na ūtaya ā pra yātu parāvataḥ / agnir naḥ suṣṭutīr upa //
column2: To aid us let Vaisvânara come from the distance far away: Come Agni, to our eulogies! 73

column1: pṛṣṭo divi pṛṣṭo agniḥ pṛthivyāṃ pṛṣṭo viśvā oṣadhīr ā viveśa / vaiśvānaraḥ sahasā pṛṣṭo agniḥ sa no divā sa riṣas pātu naktam //
column2: Sought in the sky, sought on the earth, sought after, all plants that grow on ground hath Agni entered. May Agni, may Vaisvânara with vigour, sought for, by day and night from harm preserve us.74

column1: aśyāma te kāmam agne tavotī aśyāma rayim̐ rayivaḥ suvīram / aśyāma vājam abhi vājayanto 'śyāma dyumnam ajarājaraṃ te //
column2: Help its that we may gain this wish, O Agni, gain riches, Wealthy One! with store of heroes. Desiring strength from thee may we be strengthened, and win, Eternal! thine eternal glory. 75

column1: vayaṃ te adya rarimā hi kāmam uttānahastā namasopasadya / yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devān asredhatā manmanā vipro agne //
column2: Approaching with raised hands and adoration, we have this day fulfilled for thee thy longing. Worship the Gods with most devoted spirit as Priest with no unfriendly thought. O Agni. 76

column1: dhāmacchad agnir indro brahmā devo bṛhaspatiḥ / sacetaso viśve devāyajñaṃ prāvantu naḥ śubhe //
column2: Home-hider Agni, Indra, and Brahma, and bright Brihaspati— May the All Gods, one-minded, guard our sacrifice in happy place. 77

column1: tvaṃ yaviṣṭha dāśuṣo nṛm̐ḥ pāhi śṛṇudhī giraḥ / rakṣā tokam uta tmanā //
column2: Guard thou the Sacrificer's men, O Youthfullest, etc., as in XIII. 52

column1: svādvīṃ tvā svādunā tīvrāṃ tīvreṇāmṛtām amṛtena / madhumatīṃ madhumatā sṛjāmi sam̐ somena // somo 'si / aśvibhyāṃ pacyasva / sarasvatyai pacyasva / indrāya sutrāmṇe pacyasva //
column2: SWEET with the sweet, I sprinkle thee with Soma, strong with the strong, the nectar with the nectar, The honey-sweet with what is sweet as honey. Soma art thou. Get dressed for the Asvins. Get dressed for Sarasvatî. Get dressed for Indra the Good Deliverer. 2

column1: parīto ṣiñcatā sutam̐ somo ya uttamam̐ haviḥ / dadhanvā yo naryo apsv antar ā suṣāva somam adribhiḥ //
column2: Hence pour ye forth the flowing juice, Soma, best Sacrificial food. He who, man's friend, hath run within the waters hath with the pressing-stones poured out the Soma. 3

column1: vāyoḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅk somo atidrutaḥ / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā // vāyoḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅk somo atidrutaḥ / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā //
column2: Purified by Vâyu's strainer, Soma that has passed away forward is Indra's proper friend. Purified by Vâyu's strainer, Soma that has passed away backward is Indra's proper friend. 4

column1: punāti te parisrutam̐ somam̐ sūryasya duhitā / vāreṇa śaśvatā tanā //
column2: By means of this eternal sieve may Sûrya's Daughter purify The Soma that flows forth from thee. 5

column1: brahma kṣatraṃ pavate teja indriyam̐ surayā somaḥ suta āsuto madāya / śukreṇa deva devatāḥ pipṛgdhi rasenānnaṃ yajamānāya dhehi //
column2: Soma with Wine, pressed; filtered for the banquet, cleanses priest, noble, brilliancy and vigour. God, with the Bright give Deities enjoyment: give food with flavour to the Sacrificer.6

column1: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy aśvibhyāṃ tvā sarasvatyai tvendrāya tvā sutrāmṇe // eṣa te yonis tejase tvā vīryāya tvā balāya tvā //
column2: Taken upon a base art thou. I take thee for the Asvin Pair. Thee for Sarasvatî. Thee for Indra the Good Deliverer. This is thy home. For splendour thee. Thee for mans’ vigour. Thee for strength. 7

column1: nānā hi vāṃ devahitam̐ sadas kṛtaṃ mā sam̐ sṛkṣāthāṃ parame vyoman / surā tvam asi śuṣmiṇī soma eṣa mā mā him̐sīḥ svāṃ yonim āviśantī //
column2: For each of you is made a God-appointed place: so grant to me a portion in the highest sphere. Surâ the strong art thou. This here is Soma. Entering thine own place do me no mischief. 8

column1: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy āśvinaṃ tejaḥ sārasvataṃ vīryam aindraṃ balam / eṣa te yonir modāya tvānandāya tvā mahase tvā //
column2: Taken upon a base art thou. Splendour of Asvins, Sarasvatî's manly vigour, might of Indra. This is thy home. I take thee for enjoyment. I take thee for delight, take thee for greatness. 9

column1: tejo 'si tejo mayi dhehi / vīryam asi vīryaṃ mayi dhehi / balam asi balaṃ mayi dhehi / ojo 'sy ojo mayi dhehi / manyur asi manyuṃ mayi dhehi / saho 'si saho mayi dhehi //
column2: Thou art lustre: give me lustre, Thou art manly vigour: give me manly vigour. Thou art strength: give me strength. Thou art energy: give me energy. Thou art passion: Give me passion. Thou art conquering might: give me conquering might. 10

column1: yā vyāghraṃ viṣūcikobhau vṛkaṃ ca rakṣati / śyenaṃ patatriṇam̐ sim̐ham̐ semaṃ pātv am̐hasaḥ //
column2: My she, Vishûchikâ, who guards these two, the tiger and the wolf, The lion and the wingèd hawk, may she guard this man from distress. 11

column1: yad āpipeṣa mātaraṃ putraḥ pramudito dhayan / etat tad agne anṛṇo bhavāmy ahatau pitarau mayā // sampṛca stha saṃ mā bhadreṇa pṛṅkta / vipṛca stha vi mā pāpmanā pṛṅkta //
column2: When, a delighted boy, I bruised my mother as I sucked her breast,Free from my debt, O Agni, I become thereby. My parents are by me unharmed. United are ye all: with bliss unite me. Parted are ye, keep me apart from evil. 12

column1: devā yajñam atanvata bheṣajaṃ bhiṣajāśvinā / vācā sarasvatī bhiṣag indrāyendriyāṇi dadhataḥ //
column2: The Asvins, the Physicians, Gods, stretched out the healing sacrifice, Sarasvatî with speech was a Physician, all with heroic powers investing Indra. 13

column1: dīkṣāyai rūpam̐ śaṣpāṇi prāyaṇīyasya tokmāni / krayasya rūpam̐ somasya lājāḥ somām̐śavo madhu //
column2: Symbols of Dîkshâ are grass buds, of Prâyanîya sprouts of corn, Of Soma-purchasing fried grains are symbols, Soma-shoots and meath. 14

column1: ātithyarūpaṃ māsaraṃ mahāvīrasya nagnahuḥ / rūpam upasadām etat tisro rātrīḥ surāsutā //
column2: Âtithya's sign is Mâsara, the Gharma's symbol Nagnahu. Three nights with Surâ poured, this is the symbol of the Upasads. 15

column1: somasya rūpa krītasya parisrut pari ṣicyate / aśvibhyāṃ dudgdhaṃ bheṣajam indrāyaindram̐ sarasvatyā // āsandī rūpam̐ rājāsandyai vedyai kumbhī surādhānī / antara uttaravedyā rūpaṃ kārotaro bhiṣak //
column2: Emblem of purchased Soma is Parisrut, foaming drink effused: Indra's balm milked for Indra by the Asvins and Sarasvatî. 16 The Sacrificer's seat is the throne's symbol, the jar containing Surâ of the Altar. The mid-space is the northern Altar's symbol: the cloth for filtering is the physician. 17

column1: vedyā vediḥ sam āpyate barhiṣā barhir indriyam / yūpena yūpa āpyate praṇīto agnir agninā //
column2: Altar by Altar is produced, power, holy grass by holy grass. The stake is by the stake obtained, by Agni Agni carried forth. 18

column1: havirdhānaṃ yad aśvināgnīdhraṃ yat sarasvatī / indrāyaindram̐ sadas kṛtaṃ patnīśālaṃ gārhapatyaḥ //
column2: The Asvins are the Soma store, Sarasvatî the sacred hearth. For Indra formed is Indra s seat, the Matrons' Hall, the house-lord's fire.19

column1: praiṣebhiḥ praiṣān āpnoty āprībhir āprīr yajñasya / prayājebhir anuyājān vaṣaṭkārebhir āhutīḥ // paśubhiḥ paśūn āpnoti puroḍāśair havīm̐ṣy ā / chandobhiḥ sāmidhenīr yājyābhir vaṣaṭkārān //
column2: Orders he gains by orders, by Âprîs Âprîs of sacrifice, Post-offerings by fore-offerings, and by calls of Vashat Âhutis. 20 By victims he gains victims, by ground rice-cakes sacrificial food, By metres kindling-verses, and Vashat-calls by Inviting prayers. 21

column1: dhānāḥ karambhaḥ saktavaḥ parīvāpaḥ payo dadhi / somasya rūpam̐ haviṣa āmikṣā vājinaṃ madhu //
column2: Grain roasted, gruel, barley-meal, grains of rice roasted, milk and curd Are types of Soma: mingled milk, sweet whey, of sacrificial food. 22

column1: dhānānām̐ rūpaṃ kuvalaṃ parīvāpasya godhūmāḥ / saktūnām̐ rūpaṃ badaram upavākāḥ karambhasya //
column2: wheat of the roasted grains of rice; Jujube the type of barley-meal, and Indra-grains of gruel-groats. 23

column1: payaso rūpaṃ yad yavā dadhno rūpaṃ karkandhūni / saomasya rūpaṃ vājinam̐ saumyasya rūpam āmikṣā //
column2: Symbol of milk are barley-grains, symbol of curd are jujube-fruits. Whey is the type of Soma, and milk-mixture type of Soma's pap. 24

column1: ā śrāvayeti stotriyāḥ pratyāśrāvo anurūpaḥ / yajeti dhayyārūpaṃ pragāthā yeyajāmahāḥ //
column2: The Strophe is the cry, Bid hear? the answer is the antistrophe. Sacrifice! is the Dhâyyâ's form, Pragâthas’ the Yajâmahas. 25

column1: ardhaṛcair ukthānām̐ rūpaṃ padair āpnoti nividaḥ / praṇavaiḥ śastrāṇām̐ rūpaṃ payasā soma āpyate //
column2: By verse-halves comes the Ukthas’ type, Nivids by Padas he obtains. The type of Sastras is obtained by Pranavas, Soma by milk.26

column1: aśvibhyāṃ prātaḥsavanam indreṇaindraṃ mādhyandinam / vaiśvadevam̐ sarasvatyā tṛtīyam āptam̐ savanam //
column2: Gained by the Asvins is the morn's libation, Indra's libation of mid-day by Indra. Sarasvatî obtains the third outpouring, the offering sacred to the Visve Devas. 27

column1: vāyavyair vāyavyān āpnoti satena droṇakalaśam / kumbhībhyām ambhṛṇau sute sthālībhi sthālīr āpnoti //
column2: By Vâyu cups he gains the cups of Vâyu, and by the basket gains the vat for Soma. By the two jars he gains two cleansing-vessels, and by the cooking-pot the pot for cooking. 23

column1: yajurvhir āpyante grahā grahai stomāś ca viṣṭutīḥ / chandobhir ukthāśastrāṇi sāmnāvabhṛtha āpyate // iḍābhir bhakṣān āpnoti sūktavākenāśiṣaḥ / śamyunā patnīsaṃyājānt samiṣṭayajuṣā sam̐sthām //
column2: By sacrificial texts are gained the Grahas, and by the Grahas lauds and laud-arrangements. By metres are obtained Ukthas and praise-songs, and by the Sâma-chant the Avabhritha. 29 Draughts he obtains by pouring out libations, and wishes by the utterance of praises, By Samyu he obtains Patnîsamyâjas, and Consummation by Samishtayajus. 30

column1: vratena dīkṣām āpnoti dīkṣayāpnoti dakṣiṇām / dakṣiṇā śraddhām āpnoti śraddhayā satyam āpyate //
column2: He gains by vow of fasting Consecration, by Consecration gains the priestly guerdon. He gains by priestly guerdon faith: by faith comes knowledge of the truth. 31

column1: etāvad rūpaṃ yajñasya yad devair brahmaṇā kṛtam / tad etat sarvam āpnoti yajñe sautrāmaṇī sute //
column2: So far the type of sacrifice was formed by Brahma, and the Gods. All this he gains, when juice is shed, in the Santrâmanî sacrifice. 32

column1: surāvantaṃ barhiṣadam̐ suvīraṃ yajñam̐ hinvanti mahiṣā namobhiḥ / dadhānāḥ somaṃ divi devatāsu mademendraṃ yajamānāḥ svarkāḥ //
column2: The rite with sacred grass, wine, store of heroes, the mighty ones speed on with adorations. May we, sweet-singing sacrificers, setting Soma mid Gods in heaven, give joy to Indra.33

column1: yas te rasaḥ sambhṛta oṣadhīṣu somasya śuṣmaḥ surayā sutasya / tena jinva yajamānaṃ madena sarasvatīm aśvināv indram agnim //
column2: All essence of thine own in plants collected, all strength of Soma when poured out with Surâ— Therewith impel with joy the sacrifice, Sarasvatî, the Asvins, Indra, Agni. 34

column1: yam aśvinā namucer āsurād adhi sarasvaty asunod indriyāya / imaṃ tam̐ śukraṃ madhumantam indum̐ somam̐ rājānam iha bhakṣayāmi //
column2: That which Sarasvatî poured out for Indra, by Asvins brought from Namuchi the demon, This flowing drop, brilliant and full of sweetness, I drink and feed on here, the King, the Soma. 35

column1: yad atra riptam̐ rasinaḥ sutasya yad indro apibac chacībhiḥ / ahaṃ tad asya manasā śivena somam̐ rājānam iha bhakṣayāmi //
column2: Whatever portion of the savoury fluid is clinging here, what Indra drank with powers, That drop thereof with pure and holy spirit I drink and feed upon, the King, the Soma. 36

column1: pitṛbhyaḥ svadhāyibhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ / pitāmahebhyaḥ svadhāyibhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ / prapitāmahebhyaḥ svadhāyibhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ / akṣan pitaraḥ / amīmadanta pitaraḥ / atītṛpanta pitaraḥ / pitaraḥ śundhadhvam //
column2: To Fathers who claim Svadhâ be Svadhâ and homage! To Grandfathers who claim Svadhâ be Svadhâ and homage! To Great-grandfathers who claim Svadhâ be Svadhâ and homage! The Fathers have eaten. The Fathers have rejoiced. The Fathers have been satisfied, Fathers, be ye purified. 37

column1: punantu mā pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ punantu mā pitāmahāḥ / punantu prapitāmahāḥ pavitreṇa śatāyuṣā // punantu mā pitāmahāḥ somyāsaḥ punantu prapitāmahāḥ / pavitreṇa śatāyuṣā viśvam āyur vy aśnavai //
column2: Cleanse me the Fathers who enjoy Soma! Grandfathers make me clean! May Great-grandfathers cleanse me with a sieve that brings a century. May my Grandfathers cleanse me, may my Great-grand-fathers make me clean. With sieve that brings a century may I obtain full length of life. 33

column1: agna āyūm̐ṣi pavasva ā suvorjam iṣaṃ ca naḥ / āre bādhasva ducchunām //
column2: Agni, thou poorest life: send down upon us food and vigorous strength. Drive thou misfortune far away.39

column1: punantu mā devajanāḥ punantu manasā dhiyaḥ / punantu viśvā bhūtāni jātavedaḥ punīhi mā //
column2: Cleanse me the companies of Gods! May thoughts with spirit make me clean. Cleanse me all things that be! Do thou, O Jâtavedas, make me clean. 40

column1: pavitreṇa punīhi mā śukreṇa deva dīdyat / agne kratvā kratūm̐r anu // yat te pavitram arciṣy agne vitatam antarā / brahma tena punātu mā //
column2: Purify me, O Agni, God, refulgent with thy pure bright sieve, With powers according to thine own. 41 O Agni, may the cleansing sieve, diffused through all thy fiery glow, Holy devotion, make me clean. 42

column1: pavamānaḥ so adya naḥ pavitreṇa vicarṣaṇiḥ / yaḥ potā sa punātu mā //
column2: May Pavamâna with his sieve, Guest of all tribes, cleanse us to-day, He who is Cleanser make us clean. 43

column1: ubhābhyāṃ deva savitaḥ pavitreṇa savena ca / māṃ punīhi viśvataḥ //
column2: Savitar, God, by both of these, libation, purifying power, Purify me on every side. 44

column1: vaiśvadevī punatī devy āgād yasyām imā bahvyas tanvo vītapṛṣṭhāḥ / tayā madantaḥ sadhamādeṣu vayam̐ syāma patayo rayīṇām //
column2: Dear to all Gods hath come the cleansing Goddess, she who contains these many smooth-backed figures. Through her may we in sacrificial banquets taking our pleasure be the lords of riches. 45

column1: ye samānāḥ samanasaḥ pitaro yamarājye / teṣāṃ lokaḥ svadhā namo yajño deveṣu kalpatām //
column2: The Fathers who in Yama's realm are equal and unanimous— Their world is Svadhâ, reverence. To Gods let sacrifice be paid. 46

column1: ye samānāḥ samanaso jīvā jīveṣu māmakāḥ / teṣām̐ śrīr mayi kalpatām asmiṃ loke satam̐ samāḥ //
column2: Equals, unanimous, my folk yet living among those who live— On me be set their glory through a hundred years in this our world.47

column1: dve sṛtī aśṛnavaṃ pitṝṇām ahaṃ devānām uta martyānām / tābhyām idaṃ viśvam ejat sam eti yad antarā pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca //
column2: I have heard mention of two several pathways, way of the Fathers, way of Gods and mortals. On these two roads each moving creature travels, each thing between the Father and the Mother. 48

column1: idam̐ haviḥ prajananaṃ me astu daśavīram̐ sarvagaṇam̐ svastaye / ātmasani prajāsani paśusani lokasany abhayasani / agniḥ prajāṃ bahulāṃ me karotv annaṃ payo reto asmāsu dhatta //
column2: May this my sacrifice bring store of children, with ten brave sons, full-companied, for welfare— Life-winning, winning offspring, winning cattle, winning this world of ours and peace and safety. May Agni make nay progeny abundant. Do ye confer food, milk, and wanly vigour. 49

column1: ud īratām avara ut parāsa un madhyamāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ / asuṃ ya īyur avṛkā ṛtajñās te no 'vantu pitaro haveṣu //
column2: May they ascend, the lowest, highest, midmost, the Fathers who deserve a share of Soma. May Fathers who have gained the world of spirits, gentle and righteous, aid us when we call them. 50

column1: aṅgiraso naḥ pitaro navagvā atharvāṇo bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ / teṣāṃ vayam̐ sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre saumanase syāma //
column2: Our Fathers are Angirases, Navagvas, Atharvans, Bhrigus, who deserve the Soma. May these the holy look on us with favour: may we enjoy their gracious loving-kindness. 51

column1: ye naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ somyāso 'nūhire somapīthaṃ vasiṣṭhāḥ / tebhir yamaḥ sam̐rarāṇo havīm̐ṣy uśann uśadbhiḥ pratikāmam attu //
column2: Our ancient Fathers who deserve the Soma, who came, most noble, to our Soma banquet— With these let Yama, yearning with the yearning, rejoicing eat our offerings at his pleasure. 52

column1: tvam̐ soma pra cikito manīṣā tvam̐ rajiṣṭham anu neṣi panthām / tava praṇītī pitaro na indo deveṣu ratnam abhajanta dhīrāḥ //
column2: Thou, Soma, art preeminent for wisdom: along the straightest path thou art our leader. Our prudent Fathers by thy wisdom, Soma, dealt out among the Gods their share of treasure. 53

column1: tvayā hi naḥ pitaraḥ soma pūrve karmāṇi cakruḥ pavamāna dhīrāḥ / vanvann avātaḥ paridhīm̐r aporṇu vīrebhir aśvair maghavā bhavā naḥ //
column2: For our sage Fathers, Soma Pavamâna, of old performed by thee their sacred duties. Fighting unvanquished, open the enclosures: enrich us with large gifts of steeds and heroes.54

column1: tvam̐ soma pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidāno 'nu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha / tasmai ta indo haviṣā vidhema vayam̐ syāma patayo rayīṇām //
column2: Associate with the Fathers thou, O Soma, hast spread thyself abroad through earth and heaven. So with oblation let us serve thee, Indu, and so let us become the lords of riches. 55

column1: barhiṣadaḥ pitara ūty arvāg imā vo havyā cakṛmā juṣadhvam / ta ā gatāvasā śaṃtamenāthā naḥ śaṃ yor arapo dadhāta //
column2: Fathers who sit on sacred grass, come help us: these offerings we have made for you; accept them. So come to us with most auspicious favour, and give us health and strength without a trouble. 56

column1: āhaṃ pitṛn suvidatrām̐ avitsi napātaṃ ca vikramaṇaṃ ca viṣṇoḥ / barhiṣado ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvas ta ihāgamiṣṭhāḥ //
column2: I have attained the gracious-minded Fathers, have gained a son and progeny from Vishnu. They who enjoy pressed juices with oblation, seated on sacred grass, come oftenest hither. 57

column1: upahūtāḥ pitaraḥ somyāso barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu / ta ā gamantu ta iha śruvantv adhi bruvantu te 'vantv asmān //
column2: May they, the Fathers, worthy of the Soma, invited to their favourite oblations Laid on the sacred grass, come nigh and listen: may they be gracious unto us and bless us. 58

column1: ā yantu naḥ pitaraḥ somyāso 'gniṣvāttāḥ pathibhir devayānaiḥ / asmin yajñe svadhayā madanto 'dhi bruvantu te 'vantv asmān //
column2: May they our Fathers whom the flames have tasted, worthy of Soma, come on God-ward pathways. Enjoying at this sacrifice their portion, may they be gracious unto us and bless us. 59

column1: agniṣvāttāḥ pitara eha gacchata sadaḥ-sadaḥ sadata supraṇītayaḥ / attā havīm̐ṣi prayatāni barhiṣy athā rayim̐ sarvavīraṃ dadhātana //
column2: Fathers whom Agni's flames have tasted, come ye nigh: ye kindly leaders, take ye each your proper place. Eat sacrificial food presented on the grass: grant riches with a multitude of hero sons.60

column1: ye agniṣvāttā ye anagniṣvāttā madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayante / tebhyaḥ svarāḍ asunītim etāṃ yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ kalpayāti //
column2: For those who, burnt with fire or not cremated, joy in their portion in the midst of heaven, May the Self-Ruler form the world of spirits and this their body as his pleasure wills it. 61

column1: agniṣvāttām̐ ṛtumato havāmahe nārāśam̐se somapīthaṃ ya āśuḥ / te no viprāsaḥ suhavā bhavantu vayam̐ syāma patayo rayīṇām //
column2: We call the Agnishvâttas, true to seasons, those who drank Soma in the Nârâsamsa. Prompt to give ear to us be they, the sages, and then let us be lords of wealth and treasure. 62

column1: ācyā jānu dakṣiṇato niṣadyemaṃ yajñam abhi gṛṇīta viśve / mā him̐siṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cin no yad va āgaḥ puruṣatā karāma //
column2: Bowing the bended knee and seated southward, accept ye, all, this sacrifice with favour. Injure us not for any sin, O Fathers, which we through human frailty have committed. 63

column1: āsīnāso aruṇīnām upasthe rayiṃ dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya / putrebhyaḥ pitaras tasya vasvaḥ pra yacchata ta ihorjaṃ dadhāta //
column2: Lapped in the bosom of the purple Mornings give riches to the man who brings oblation. Grant to his sons a portion of your treasure, and, present, give us energy, ye Fathers. 64

column1: yam agne kavyavāhana tvaṃ cin manyase rayim / taṃ no gīrbhiḥ śravāyyaṃ devatrā panayā yujam //
column2: O Agni Kavyavâhana, cause us to praise before the Gods, As our associate meet for lauds, wealth which e’en thou reputest wealth. 65

column1: yo agniḥ kavyavāhanaḥ pitṛn yakṣad ṛtāvṛdhaḥ / pred u havyāni vocati devebhyaś ca pitṛbhya ā //
column2: May Agni, Kavya-bearer, who hath worshipped Fathers true to Law. Announce to Gods and Fathers these our sacrificial offerings. 66

column1: tvam agna īḍitaḥ kavyavāhanāvāḍ ḍhavyāni surabhīṇi kṛtvī / prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣann addhi tvaṃ deva prayatā havīm̐ṣi //
column2: Thou. Agni Kavya-bearer, when entreated, didst bear the offerings which thou madest fragrant, And gayest to the Fathers who did eat them with Svadhâ. Eat, thou God, the gifts we bring thee.67

column1: ye ceha pitaro ye ca neha yām̐ś ca vidma yām̐ u ca na pravidma / tvaṃ vettha yati te jātavedaḥ svadhābhir yajñam̐ sukṛtaṃ juṣasva //
column2: Thou, Jâtavedas, knowest well the number of Fathers who are here and who are absent, Of Fathers whom we know and whom we know not. Accept the sacrifice arranged with portions. 68

column1: idaṃ pitṛbhyo namo astv adya ye pūrvāso ya uparāsa īyuḥ / ye pārthive rajasy ā niṣattā ye vā nūnam̐ suvṛjanāsu vikṣu //
column2: Now let us pay this homage to the Fathers, to those who passed of old and those who followed, Those who have rested in the earthly region and those who dwell among the Mighty Races. 69

column1: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāso agna ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ / śucīd ayan dīdhitim ukthaśāsaḥ kṣāmā bhindanto aruṇīr apa vran //
column2: As in the days of old our ancient Fathers speeding the work of holy worship, Agni! Sought pure light and devotion, singing praises, they cleft the ground and made red Dawns apparent. 70

column1: uśantas tvā ni dhīmahy uśantaḥ sam idhīmahi / uśann uśata ā vaha pitṛn haviṣe attave //
column2: Right gladly do we set thee down, right gladly make thee burn and glow. Gladly bring yearning Fathers nigh to eat the food of sacrifice. 71

column1: apāṃ phenena namuceḥ śira indrod avartayaḥ / viśvā yad ajaya spṛdhaḥ //
column2: Indra, with waters’ foam didst thou wrench off the head of Namuchi, Subduing all contending hosts. 72

column1: somo rājāmṛtam̐ suta ṛjīṣeṇājahān mṛtyum / ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam̐ śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu // adbhyaḥ kṣīraṃ vy apibat kruṅṅ āṅgiraso dhiyā / ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam̐ śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu //
column2: King Soma, pressed, the Drink of Life, left Death behind with Soma-dregs. By Law came truth and Indra-power, the pure bright drinking-off of juice. The power of Indra was this sweet immortal milk. 73 The Snipe of Angiras by thought from out the waters drank up milk. By Law came truth, etc., as in 72

column1: annāt parisruto rasaṃ brahmaṇā vy apibat kṣatraṃ payaḥ somaṃ prajāpatiḥ / ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam̐ śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu //
column2: The Hamsa throned in light drank up by metre Soma from the floods. By Law, etc. 75 Prajâpati by Brahma drank the essence from the foaming food, the princely power, milk, Soma juice. By Law, etc. 76

column1: reto mūtraṃ vi jahāti yoniṃ praviśad rayim / garbho jarāyuṇāvṛta ulvaṃ jahāti janmanā //
column2: The generative part enters the yoni: it leaves aside the retas and the mûtra. The caul-invested embryo leaves by its birth the covering folds. By Law, etc. 77

column1: dṛṣṭvā rūpe vyākarot satyānṛte prajāpatiḥ / aśraddhām anṛte 'dadhāc chraddhām̐ satye prajāpatiḥ //
column2: Viewing both forms Prajâpati gave truth and falsehood different shapes. Prajâpati assigned the lack of faith to falsehood, faith to truth. By Law, etc. 78

column1: vedena rūpe vy apibat sutāsutau prajāpatiḥ //
column2: By holy lore Prajâpati drank up both forms, pressed and unpressed. By Law, etc. 79

column1: dṛṣṭvā parisruto rasam̐ śukreṇa śukraṃ vy apibat / payaḥ somaṃ prajāpatiḥ //
column2: Seeing the farming liquor's sap, Prajâpati with the bright drank nut the bright the milk, the Soma juice. By Law, etc. 80

column1: sīsena tantraṃ manasā manīṣiṇā ūrṇāsūtreṇa kavayo vayanti / aśvinā yajñam̐ savitā sarasvatīndrasya rūpaṃ varuṇo bhiṣajyan //
column2: Wise, with mind, lead, and thread of wool the sages twine an amulet. Sarasvatî, Savitar, Varuna, the Asvins span sacrifice and healed his form for Indra. 81

column1: tad asya rūpam amṛtam̐ śacībhis tasro dadhur devatāḥ sam̐rarāṇāḥ / lomāni śaṣpair bahudhā na tokmabhis tvag asya mām̐sam abhavan na lājāḥ //
column2: This his immortal shape with mighty powers three Deities bestowing gifts compounded. His hair they made with sprouts of grass and barley, and roasted grain with skin and flesh supplied him. 82

column1: tad aśvinā bhiṣajā rudravartanī sarasvatī vayati peśo antaram / asthi majjānaṃ māsaraiḥ kārotareṇa dadhato gavāṃ tvaci // sarasvatī manasā peśalaṃ vasu nāsatyābhyāṃ vayati darśataṃ vapuḥ / rasaṃ parisrutā na rohitaṃ nagnahur dhīras tasaraṃ na vema //
column2: His inner shape Sarasvatî arranges and, borne on bright paths, the Physician Asvins: With Mâsaras and sieve his bone and marrow, as on the Oxen's hide they lay the liquor.83 By thought Sarasvatî with both Nâsatyas forms lovely treasure and a beauteous body. Like shuttle through the loom the steady ferment mixes the red juice with the foaming spirit. 84

column1: payasā śukram amṛtaṃ janitram̐ surayā mūtrāj janayanta retaḥ / apāmatiṃ durmatiṃ bādhamānā ūvadhyaṃ vātam̐ sabvaṃ tad ārāt //
column2: By milk they generated bright immortal, productive seed, by Surâ seed from urine, Chasing afar folly and ill intention, crude food and wind and meat that loads the stomach. 85

column1: indraḥ sutrāmā hṛdayeṇa satyaṃ puroḍāśena savitā jajāna / yakṛt klomānaṃ varuṇo bhiṣajyan matasne vāyavyair na mināti pittam //
column2: Heart with his heart Indra Good Guardian gendered: with rice-cake Savitar gave truth its being. Varuna, doctoring the lungs and liver, forms, as with Vâyu cups, the gall and kidneys. 86

column1: āntrāṇi sthālīr madhu pinvamānā gudāḥ pātrāṇi sudughā na dhenuḥ / śyenasya patraṃ na plīhā śacībhir āsandī nābhir udaraṃ na mātā //
column2: Cooking-pots pouring honey were the entrails: like a well-milking cow the pans were bowels. A hawk's wing was the spleen: through mighty powers the stool as mother was navel and belly. 87

column1: kumbho vaniṣṭhur janitā śacībhie yasminn agre yonyāṃ garbho antaḥ / plāśir vyaktaḥ śatadhāra utso duhe na kumbhī svadhāṃ pitṛbhyaḥ //
column2: The pitcher was the father of the rectum by powers, the womb which first contained the infant. Plain was the hundred-streaming fount as penis: the jar poured forth libations to the Father. 88

column1: mukham̐ sad asya śira it satena jihvā pavitram aśvināsant sarasvatī / capyaṃ na pāyur bhiṣag asya vālo vastir na śepo harasā tarasvī //
column2: the strainer his tongue, his mouth Sarasvatî and Asvins. The Chapya was his rump, his leech the filter, the bladder was his penis keen with ardour. 89

column1: aśvibhyāṃ cakṣur amṛtaṃ grahābhyāṃ chāgena tejo haviṣā śṛtena / pakṣmāṇi godhūmaiḥ kuvalair utāni peśo na śukram asitaṃ vasāte //
column2: Asvins with both cups made his eye immortal, the goat and cooked oblation gave it keenness. With wheat eyelashes and with jujube eyebrows they clothe as ’twere a black and brilliant figure. 90

column1: avir na meṣo nasi vīryāya prāṇasya panth amṛto grahābhyām / sarasvaty upavākair vyānaṃ nasyāni barhir badarair jajāna //
column2: The sheep, the ram to give his nostril vigour. the immortal path of breath by both libations. By Indra-grains and sacrificial jujubes Sarasvatî produced through-breath and nose hairs.91

column1: indrasya rūpaṃ vṛṣabho balāya karṇābhyām̐ śrotram amṛtaṃ grahābhyāṃ / yavā na barir bhruvi kesarāṇi karkandhu jajñe madhu sāraghaṃ mukhāt //
column2: The hull for strength made Indra's form: the immortal bearing for both his ears by two libations. Barley and sacred grass composed his eyebrows: from his mouth came the jujube and sweet honey. 92

column1: ātmann upasthe na vṛkasya loma mukhe śmaśrūṇi na vyāghraloma / keśā na śīrṣan yaśase śriyai śikhā sim̐hasya loma tviṣir indriyāṇi //
column2: Hair of the wolf was on his waist and body: the beard upon his face was hair of tigers. Lions hair were his locks, for fame and beauty, worn on his head, his crest and sheen and vigour. 93

column1: aṅgāny ātman bhiṣajā tad aśvinātmānam aṅgaiḥ sam adhāt sarasvatī / indrasya rūpam̐ śatamānam āyuś candreṇa jyotir amṛtaṃ dadhānāḥ //
column2: The Asvins, Leeches, joined his limbs and body, Sarasvatî put limbs and frame together, Giving the form and vital power of Indra, hundredfold, deathless and delightful lustre. 94

column1: sarasvatī yonyāṃ garbham antar aśvibhyāṃ patnī sukṛtaṃ bibharti / apām̐ rasena varuṇo na sāmnendram̐ śriyai janayann apsu rājā //
column2: Sarasvatî, as Consort of the Asvins, bears in her womb the nobly fashioned Infant. King Varuna with waters’ wealthy essence begetting Indra in the floods for glory. 95

column1: tejaḥ paśūnām̐ havir indriyāvat parisrutā payasā sāraghaṃ madhu / aśvibhyāṃ dugdhaṃ bhiṣajā sarasvatyā sutāsutābhyām amṛtaḥ soma induḥ //
column2: Splendour of victims, powerful oblation, honey and meath with milk and foaming liquor, Healing Sarasvatî effused, and Asvins; from pressed and unpressed Soma, deathless Indu.

column1: kṣatrasya yonir asi kṣatrasya nābhir asi / mā tvā him̐sīn mā mā him̐sīḥ //
column2: BIRTH PLACE of princely power art thou: centre art thou of princely power. Harm not thyself: do me no harm. 2

column1: ni ṣasāda ghṛtavrato varuṇaḥ pastyāsv ā / sāmrājyāya sukratuḥ //
column2: Varuna, Law's maintainer, hath sat down, etc., as in X. 27

column1: mṛtyoḥ pāhi / vidyot pāhi //
column2: Save me from death. Save me from lightning. 3

column1: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / aśvinor bhaiṣajyena tejase brahmavarcasāyābhi ṣiñcāmi / sarasvatyai bhaiṣajyena vīryāyānnādyāyābhi ṣiñcāmi / indrasyendriyeṇa balāya śriyai yaśase 'bhi ṣiñcāmi //
column2: Thee, by the radiant Savitar's impulsion, with arms of Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan, With leech-craft of the Asvins, I besprinkle for splendour, for the lustre of a Brâhman; With leech-craft of Sarasvatî, besprinkle for manly vigour and for food to feed thee; Besprinkle thee, by special power of Indra, for strength of body and for fame and glory. 4

column1: ko 'si katamo 'si kasmai tvā kāya tvā / suśloka sumaṅgala satyarājan //
column2: Thou art Ka. Noblest Ka art thou. Thee for the state and rank of Ka. Sumangala! Susloka! Satyarâjan! 5

column1: śiro me śrīr yaśo mukhaṃ tviṣiḥ keśāś ca śmaśrūṇi / rājā me prāṇo amṛtam̐ samrāṭ cakṣur virāṭ śrotram //
column2: My head be grace, my mouth be fame, my hair and beard be brilliant sheen! My breath be King and deathlessness, mine eye Sole Lord, mine ear the Prince! 6

column1: jihvā me bhadraṃ vāṅ maho mano manyuḥ svarāḍ bhāmaḥ / modāḥ pramodā aṅgulīr aṅgāni mitraṃ me sahaḥ //
column2: My tongue be bliss, my voice be might, my mind be wrath, my rage self-lord! Joys be my fingers, and delight my members, conquering strength my friend!7

column1: bāhū me balam indriyam̐ hastau me karma vīryam / ātmā kṣatram uro mama //
column2: Let my two arms be Indra's power, my hands be deed of manly might, my soul and breast be princely rule! neck 8

column1: pṛṣṭīr me rāṣṭram udaram am̐sau grīvāś ca śroṇī / ūrū aratnī jānunī viśo me 'ṅgāni sarvataḥ //
column2: My ribs be royal government, my belly, shoulders, neck, and hips, Thighs, elbows, knees, the people, yea, my members universally! 9

column1: nābhir me cittaṃ vijñānaṃ pāyur me 'pacitir bhasat / ānandanandāv āṇḍau me bhagaḥ saubhāgyaṃ pasaḥ / jaṅghābhyāṃ pādbhyāṃ dharmo 'smi viśi rājā pratiṣṭhitaḥ //
column2: My navel intellect, etc., etc. ... ... ... ... Duty am I in legs and feet, established King among the folk. 10

column1: prati kṣatre prati tiṣṭhāmi rāṣṭre praty aśveṣu prati tiṣṭhāmi goṣu / praty aṅgeṣu prati tiṣṭhāmy ātman prati prāṇeṣu kṣatre prati tiṣṭhāmi puṣṭe prati dyāvāpṛthivyoḥ prati tiṣṭhāmi //
column2: I take my stand on princely power and Kingship, on cows am I dependent, and on horses. on vital breath On members I depend, and on the body, dependent and on welfare, on heaven and earth and sacrifice dependent. 11

column1: trayā devā ekādaśa trayastrim̐śāḥ surādhasaḥ / bṛhaspatipurohitā devasya savituḥ save / devā devair avantu mā //
column2: May Deities, eleven threes, the three and thirty bounteous Ones Whose House-Priest is Brihaspati, by impulse of bright Savitar, the Gods protect me with the Gods. 12

column1: prathamā dvitīyair dvitīyās tṛtīyais tṛtīyāḥ satyena satyaṃ yajñena yajño yajurbhir yajūm̐ṣi sāmabhiḥ sāmāny ṛgbhir ṛcaḥ puro'nuvākyābhiḥ puro'nuvākyā yājyābhir yājyā vaṣaṭkārair vaṣaṭkārā āhutibhir ahutayo me kāmānt sam ardhayantu bhūḥ svāhā //
column2: May the first Gods with the second, the second with the third, the third with Truth, Truth with Sacrifice, Sacrifice with sacrificial texts, sacrificial texts with Sâmans, Sâmans with praise-verses, praise-verses with fore and after-sentences. fore-sentences with inviting-texts, inviting-texts with Vashat-calls, Vashat calls with oblations, and oblations, fulfil my desires, Earth! All-hail! 13

column1: lomāni prayatir mama tvaṅ ma ānatir āgatiḥ / mām̐saṃ ma upanatir vasv asthi majjā ma ānatiḥ //
column2: My hair is effort and attempt, my skin is reverence and approach. My flesh is inclination, wealth my bone, my marrow reverence. 14

column1: yad devā devaheḍanaṃ devāsaś cakṛmā vayam / agnir mā tasmād enaso viśvān muñcatv am̐hasaḥ //
column2: Gods, Deities, whatever fault of ours have stirred the wrath of Gods, May Agni set me free from that iniquity and all distress. 15

column1: yadi divā yadi naktam enām̐si cakṛmā vayam / vāyur mā tasmād enaso viśvān muñcatv am̐hasaḥ // yadi jāgrad yadi svapna enām̐si cakṛmā vayam / sūryo mā tasmād enaso viśvān muñcatv am̐hasaḥ //
column2: If in the day-time or at night we have committed acts of sin, May Vâyu set me free from that iniquity and all distress.16 If when awake or in our sleep we have committed acts of sin, May Sûrya set me free from that iniquity and all distress. 17

column1: yad grāme yad araṇye yat sabhāyāṃ yad indriye / yac chūdre yad arye yad enaś cakṛmā vayaṃ yad ekasyādhi dharmaṇi tasyāvayajanam asi //
column2: Each fault in village or in wild, company or corporeal sense, Each sinful act that we have done to Sûdra or Arya, or to either's disadvantage, e’en of that sin thou art the expiation. 18

column1: yad āpo aghnyā iti varuṇeti śapāmahe tato varuṇa no muñca / avabhṛtha nicumpuṇa nicerur asi nicumpuṇaḥ / ava devair devakṛtam eno 'yakṣy ava martyair martyakṛtam / pururāvṇo deva riṣas pāhi //
column2: O ever-moving Cleansing Bath, etc. Repeated from III. 48

column1: samudre te hṛdayam apsv antaḥ saṃ tvā viśantv oṣadhīr utāpaḥ / sumitriyā na āpa oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyās tasmai santu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ //
column2: Thy heart is in the flood, etc. Repeated from VIII. 25 To us let Waters, etc. Repeated from VI. 22

column1: drupadād iva mumucānaḥ svinnaḥ snāto malād iva / pūtaṃ pavitreṇevājyam āpaḥ śundhantu mainasaḥ //
column2: As one unfastened from a stake, or cleansed by bathing after toil, As butter which the sieve hath purged, let water clean me from my sin. 21

column1: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari svaḥ paśyanta uttaram / devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam //
column2: Looking upon the loftier light above the darkness we have come To Sûrya, God among the Gods, the light that is most excellent. 22

column1: apo adyānv acāriṣam̐ rasena sam asṛkṣmahi / payasvān agna āgamaṃ taṃ mā sam̐ sṛja varcasā prajayā ca dhanena ca //
column2: The waters I this day have sought, and to their essence have we come. Agni, come hither rich in milk, splendour and brilliancy bestow on me, and progeny and wealth. 23

column1: edho 'sy edhiṣīmahi / samid asi tejo 'si tejo mayi dhehi / samā vavarti pṛthivī sam uṣāḥ sam u sūryaḥ / sam u viśvam idaṃ jagat / vaiśvānarajyotir bhūyāsaṃ vibhūn kāmān vy aśnavai bhūḥ svāhā //
column2: A brand art thou: fain would we thrive. Fuel art thou and splendour: give me splendour. Earth comes again, the Dawn, the Sun. This Universe all comes again. May I possess Vaisvânara's light, may I attain my vast desires. Earth! All-hail!24

column1: abhyā dadhāmi samidham agne vratapate tvayi / vrataṃ ca śraddhāṃ copaimīndhe tvā dīkṣito aham //
column2: O Agni, Master of the Vow, on thee I lay the kindling- stick. To the fast-vow and faith I come. I, consecrated, kindle thee. 25

column1: yatra brahma ca kṣatraṃ ca samyañco carataḥ saha / taṃ lokaṃ puṇyaṃ pra jñeṣaṃ yatra devāḥ sahāgninā //
column2: Fain would I know that holy world where Deities with Agni dwell, Where priestly rank and princely power together in accordance move. 26

column1: yatrendraś ca vāyuś ca samyañco carataḥ saha / taṃ lokaṃ puṇyaṃ pra jñeṣaṃ yatra sedir na vidyate //
column2: Fain would I know that holy world where want and languor are unknown, Where in complete accordance move Indra and Vâyu side by side 27

column1: am̐śunā te am̐śuḥ pṛcyatāṃ paruṣā paruḥ / gandhas te somam avatu madāya raso acyutaḥ //
column2: Let thy shoot be united with his tendril, joint combine with joint. Imperishable sap for joy, thine odour be the Soma's guard! 28

column2: They pour it out, they sprinkle it, they scatter it, they make it pure. In the brown Surâ's ecstasy he says What art thou? What art thou? 29

column1: dhānāvantaṃ karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam / indra prātar juṣasva naḥ //
column2: Indra, at morn accept our cake accompanied with grain and groats, with wheaten bread and hymns of praise. 30

column2: To Indra sing the lofty hymn, Maruts? that slayeth Vritra best, Whereby the Holy Ones created for the God the radiant light that never dies. 31

column1: adhvaryo adribhiḥ sutam̐ somaṃ pavitra ā naya / punīhīndrāya pātave //
column2: Adhvaryu, on the straining cloth pour thou the Soma pressed with stones: Purify it for Indra's drink. 32

column1: yo bhūtānām adhipatir yasmiṃ lokā adhi śritāḥ / ya īśe mahato mahām̐s tena gṛhṇāmi tvām ahaṃ mayi gṛhṇāmi tvām aham //
column2: The Sovran Lord of living things, he upon whom the worlds depend, Mighty, the mighty's King—by him I take thee, take thee on myself.33

column1: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy aśvibhyāṃ tvā sarasvatyai tvendrāya tvā sutrāmṇe / eṣa te yonir aśvibhyāṃ tvā sarasvatyai tvendrāya tvā sutrāmṇe //
column2: Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for the Asvins. This is thy home, etc. 34

column1: prāṇapā me apānapāś cakṣuṣpāḥ śrotrapāś ca me / vāco me viśvabheṣajo manaso 'si vilāyakaḥ //
column2: Guard of my breath and outward breath, the guardian of mine eye and ear, All-healer of my voice, thou. art the mollifier of my mind. 35

column1: aśvinakṛtasya te sarasvatikṛtasyendreṇa sumtrāmṇā kṛtasya / upahūta upahūtasya bhakṣayāmi //
column2: Invited I feed upon thee invited, Whom Asvins, whom Sarasvatî, whom Indra, Good Protector, made. 36

column1: samiddha indra uṣasām anīke purorucā pūrvakṛd vāvṛdhānaḥ / tribhir devais trim̐śatā vajrabāhur jaghāna vṛtraṃ vi duro vavāra //
column2: Kindred in forefront of the Mornings, Indra with forward light, long-active, waxing mighty, With three-and thirty Gods, the Thunder-wielder, smote. Vritra dead and threw the portals open. 37

column1: narāśam̐saḥ prati śūro mimānas tanūnapāt prati yajñasya dhāma / gobhir vapāvān madhunā samañjan hiraṇyaiś candrī yajati pracetāḥ //
column2: Son of Himself, the Praise of Men, the hero, measuring out the sacrificial stations, Rich in bulls’ fat, anointing with sweet butter, wise, bright with gauds of gold, he sacrificeth. 38

column1: īḍito devair harivām̐ abhiṣṭir ājuhvāno haviṣā śardhamānaḥ / puraṃdaro gotabhid vajrabāhur ā yātu yajñam upa no juṣāṇaḥ //
column2: Lauded by Gods, Lord of Bay Steeds, the Helper, showing his greatness. worshipped with oblations. Fort-render, Cowpen-cleaver, Thunder-wielder, may he approach our sacrifice rejoicing 39

column1: juṣāṇo barhir harivān na indraḥ prācīnam̐ sīdat pradiśā pṛthivyāḥ / uruprathāḥ prathamānam̐ syonam ādityair aktaṃ vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ //
column2: May Indra, Lord of Bays, sit by direction eastward on earth, accepting our oblation, And sacred grass, fair, far-spread, widely-stretching, anointed by Âdityas and by Vasus. 40

column1: indraṃ duraḥ kavaṣyo dhāvamānā vṛṣāṇaṃ yantu janayaḥ supatnīḥ / dvāro devīr abhito vi śrayantām̐ suvīrā vīraṃ prathamānā mahobhiḥ // uṣāsānaktā bṛhatī bṛhantaṃ payasvatī sudughe śūram indram / tantuṃ tataṃ peśasā saṃvayantī devānāṃ devaṃ yajataḥ surukme //
column2: To the strong Indra go the sounding Portals, dames with a goodly husband, swiftly moving! Well-manned, divine, wide be the Doors thrown open, expanding in their greatness fir the Hero!41 Dawn and Night, lofty, sapful, richly-yielding, fair-showing, as they weave with varied colour The long-extended thread in concert, worship the God of Gods, the lofty Hero Indra. 42

column1: daivyā mimānā manuṣaḥ purutrā hotārāv indraṃ prathamā suvācā / mūrhdan yajñasya madhunā dadhānā prācīnaṃ jyotir haviṣā vṛdhātaḥ //
column2: The two first pleasant-voiced celestial Hotars, arranging rites for man in sundry places, At head of sacrifice stablishing Indra, increase the eastern light with sweet oblation. 43

column1: tisro devīr haviṣā vardhamānā indraṃ juṣāṇā janayo na patnīḥ / acchinnaṃ tantuṃ payasā sarasvatīḍā devī bhāratī viśvatūrtiḥ //
column2: Thriving by sacrifice may the three Bright Ones, taking delight like wedded dames in Indra, Sarasvatî, Idâ, Bhâratî all-surpassing, with milk preserve our sacred thread unbroken. 44

column1: tvaṣṭā dadhac chuṣmam indrāya vṛṣṇe 'pāko 'ciṣṭur yaśase purūṇi / vṛṣā yajan vṛṣaṇaṃ bhūriretā mūrdhan yajñasya sam anaktu devān //
column2: May Tvashtar coming frail afar, the active, give strength and plenty to strong glorious Indra, And strong, prolific, worshipping, the Mighty at sacrifice's head give the Gods honour. 45

column1: vanaspatir avasṛṣṭo na pāśais tmanyā samañjañ chamitā na devaḥ / indrasya havyair jaṭharaṃ pṛṇānaḥ svadāti yajñaṃ madhunā ghṛtena //
column2: Let the divine Stake, like an Immolator, bind, as one ordered, to himself the victim, And, filling Indra's belly with ablations, season the sacrifice with sweets and butter. 46

column1: stokānā. induṃ prati śūra indro vṛṣāyamāṇo vṛṣabhas turāṣāṭ / ghṛtapruṣā manasā modamānāḥ svāhā devā amṛtā mādayantām //
column2: Indra the Bull, swift conqueror, wildly rushing bull-like to meet the Indu of the droppings— Delighting in a mind that scatters fatness, let the immortal Gods rejoice in Svâhâ. 47

column1: ā yātv indro 'vasa upa na iha stutaḥ sadhamād astu śūraḥ / vāvṛdhānas taviṣīr yasya pūrvīr dyaur na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt // ā na indro dūrād ā na āsād abhiṣṭikṛd avase yāsad ugraḥ / ojiṣṭhebhir nṛpatir vajrabāhuḥ saṃge samatsu turvaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn //
column2: May Indra come to us for our protection, here, lauded Hero, be our feast-companion. May he whose powers are many, waxen mighty, cherish, like Dyaus, the sovran sway of princes. 48 From near or far away may mighty Indra, giver of succour, come for our protection, Lord of men, armed with thunder, with the Strongest, slaying his foes in conflict, in the battles.49

column1: ā na indro haribhir yātv acchārvācīno 'vase rādhase ca / tiṣṭhāti vajrī maghavā virapśīmaṃ yajñam anu no vājasātau //
column2: May Indra come to us with Tawny Coursers, inclined to us, to favour and enrich us. May Maghavan, loud-voiced and wielding thunder, stand by us at this sacrifice, in combat. 50

column1: trātāram indram avitāram indram̐ have-have suhavam̐ śūram indram / hvayāmi śakraṃ puruhūtam indram̐ svasti no maghavā dhātv indraḥ // indraḥ sutrāmā svavām̐ avobhiḥ sumṛḍīko bhavatu viśvavedāḥ / bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ kṛṇotu suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma //
column2: Indra the Rescuer, Indra the Helper, Hero who listens at each invocation, Sakra I call, Indra invoked of many. May Indra, Bounteous Lord, prosper and bless us. 51 May helpful Indra as our Good Protector, Lord of all treasures, favour us with succour, Baffle our foes and give us rest and safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigour. 52

column1: tasya vayam̐ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma / sa sutrāmā svavām̐ indro asme ārāc cid dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu //
column2: May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, may we dwell in his auspicious favour. May helpful Indra as our Good Preserver drive from us even from afar, our foemen. 53

column1: ā mandrair indra haribhir yāhi mayūraromabhiḥ / mā tvā ke cin ni yaman viṃ nā pāśino 'ti dhanveva tām̐ ihi //
column2: Come hither, Indra, with Bay Steeds, joyous, with tails like peacock plumes, Let no men check thy course as fowlers stay the bird: pass o’er them as o’er desert lands. 54

column1: eved indraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhuṃ vasiṣṭhāso abhy arcanty arkaiḥ / sa na stuto vīravad dhātu gomad yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
column2: Verily the Vasishthas hymn with praises Indra the mighty One whose arm wields thunder. Praised, may he guard our wealth in men and cattle. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings. 55

column1: samiddho agnir aśvinā tapto gharmo virāṭ sutaḥ / duhe dhenuḥ sarasvatī somam̐ śukram ihendriyam // tanūpā bhiṣajā sute 'svinobhā sarasvatī / adhvā rajām̐sīndriyam indrāya pathibhir vahān // indrāyendum̐ sarasvatī narāśam̐sena nagnahum / adhātām aśvinā madhu bheṣajaṃ bhiṣajā sute //
column2: Fire hath been kindled, Asvins Twain! the Gharma warmed, the Radiant pressed, Here the Milch-Cow Sarasvatî hath poured bright Soma, Indra's own. 56 When Soma flows Sarasvatî and both the Asvins, Leeches and Body-guards, bear to Indra strength by passage through the realms of air.57 When Soma flowed the Asvins Twain, the Leeches, brought sweet medicine, With Men's Desire Sarasvatî for Indra, Soma, Nagnahu. 58

column1: ājuhvānā sarasvatīndrāyendriyāṇi vīryam / iḍābhir aśvināv iṣam̐ sam ūrjam̐ sam̐ rayiṃ dadhuḥ //
column2: Worshipped, Sarasvatî bestowed on Indra, senses, manly power. The Asvins, through oblations paid, combined food, energy, and wealth. 59

column1: aśvinā namuceḥ sutam̐ somam̐ śukraṃ parisrutā / sarasvatī tām ābharad barhiṣendrāya pātave //
column2: The Asvins brought from Namuchi pressed Soma bright with foaming juice. Sarasvatî with sacred grass brought that to Indra for his drink. 60

column1: kavaṣyo na vyacasvatīr aśvibhyāṃ na duro diśaḥ / indro na rodasī ubhe duhe kāmānt sarasvatī // uṣāsānaktāśvinā divendram̐ sāyam indriyaiḥ / saṃjānāne supeśasā sam añjāte sarasvatyā //
column2: Sarasvatî and Indra with the Asvins Twain milked out desires From heaven and earth, the regions, the resounding and expansive doors. 61 Ye Asvins, Dawn and Night, by day and in the evening, fair of hue, Accordant, with Sarasvatî, deck Indra with surpassing powers. 62

column1: pātaṃ no aśvinā divā pāhi naktam̐ sarasvati / daivyā hotārā bhiṣajā pātām indram̐ sacā sute //
column2: Guard us, O Asvins, through the day, guards us by night, Sarasvatî. Celestial Hotars, Leeches! both guard Indra when the juice is pressed. 63

column1: tisras tredhā sarasvaty aśvinā bhāratīḍā / tīvraṃ parisrutā somam indrāya suṣuvur madam //
column2: The Asvins, and the Three, apart, Sarasvatî, Idâ, Bhâratî, As drink to gladden Indra, poured strong Soma with the foaming juice. 64

column1: aśvinā bheṣajaṃ madhu bheṣajaṃ naḥ sarasvatī / indre tvaṣṭā yaśaḥ śriyam̐ rūpam̐-rūpam adhuḥ sute //
column2: The Asvins, our Sarasvatî, and Tvashtar, when the juice was shed, Gave Indra balm, yea, mead as balm, glory and fame and many a shape. 65

column1: ṛtuthendro vanaspatiḥ śaśamānaḥ parisrutā / kīlālam aśvibhyāṃ madhu duhe dhenuḥ sarasvatī //
column2: Praising with foaming liquor at due times, Indra, , Sarasvatî as cow gave forth sweet beverage with the Asvins Twain. 66

column1: gobhir na somam aśvinā māsareṇa parisrutā / sam adhātam̐ sarasvatyā svāhendre sutaṃ madhu //
column2: Asvins, to Indra ye with cows, with Mâsara and foaming drink Gave, with Sarasvatî—All hail!—the pressed-out Soma juice and mead.67

column1: aśvinā havir indriyaṃ namucer dhiyā sarasvatī / ā śukram āsurād vasu magham indrāya jabhrire // yam aśvinā sarasvatī haviṣendram avardhayan / sa bidheda valaṃ maghaṃ namucāv āsure sacā //
column2: The Asvins and Sarasvatî by wit from fiendish Namuchi Brought unto Indra sacred food, strength, brilliant treasure, ample wealth. 68 That Indra, strong through sacrifice by Asvins and Sarasvatî, Cleft Vala through to win him wealth, with Namuchi of Asura birth. 69

column1: tam indram̐ sacāśvinobhā sarasvatī / dadhānā abhy anūṣata haviṣā yajña indriyaiḥ //
column2: Supporting him in sacrifice with sacred food and mighty powers, Sarasvatî, both Asvins and the cattle hymned that Indra's praise. 70

column1: ya indra indriyaṃ dadhuḥ savitā varuṇo bhagaḥ / sa sutrāmā haviṣpatir yajamānāya saścata //
column2: Indra whom Bhaga, Savitar, and Varuna supplied with power, Lord of the sacrifice, may he, Good Guardian, love the worshipper. 71

column1: savitā varuṇo dadhad yajamānāya dāśuṣe / ādatta namucer vasu sutrāmā balam indriyam // varuṇaḥ kṣatram indriyaṃ bhagena savitā śriyam / sutrāmā yaśasā balaṃ dadhānā yajñam āśata //
column2: Savitar, Varuna bestow gifts on the liberal offerer, Strength, power and treasure which the Good Protector took from Namuchi! 72 Varuna giving sway and power, Savitar grace with happiness, The Good Protector giving strength with fame, obtained the sacrifice. 73

column1: aśvinā gobhir indriyam aśvebhir vīryaṃ balam / haviṣendram̐ sarasvatī yajamānam avardayan //
column2: With cows the Asvins, mighty power, with horses manly vigour, strength, With sacred food Sarasvatî, made Indra, Sacrificer, strong. 74

column1: tā nāsatyā supeśasā hiraṇyavartanī narā / sarasvatī haviṣmatīndra karmasu no 'vata //
column2: May those Nâsatyas, fair of form, the Men who ride on paths of gold, Oblation-rich Sarasvatî, thou, Indra! help us in our rites. 75

column1: tā bhiṣajā sukarmaṇā sā sudughā sarasvatī / sa vṛtrahā śatakratur indrāya dadhur indriyam //
column2: Those Leeches righteous in their deeds, She, rich in milk, Sarasvatî, That Vritra-Mayer hundred-powered, invested Indra with his might. 76

column1: yuvam̐ surāmam aśvinā namucāv āsure sacā / vipipānāḥ sarasvatīndraṃ karmasv āvata //
column2: Ye Asvins and Sarasvatî, joint drinkers of the Sara draught, In Namuchi of Asura birth, give aid to Indra in his deeds. 77

column1: putram iva pitarāv aśvinobhendrāvathuḥ kāvyair dam̐sanābhiḥ / yat surāmaṃ vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatī tvā maghavann abhiṣṇak //
column2: As parents aid a son, etc., as in X. 34

column2: He in whom horses, bulls, oxen, and barren cows, and rams, when duly set apart, are offered up, To Agni, Soma-sprinkled, drinker of sweet juice, Disposer, with thy heart bring forth a pleasant hymn.79 Within thy mouth is poured the offering, Agni, as Soma into cup, oil into ladle. Vouchsafe us wealth, strength-winning, blest with heroes, wealth lofty, praised by men, and full of splendour. 80

column1: aśvinā tejasā cakṣuḥ prāṇena sarasvatī vīryam / vācendro balenendrāya dadhur indriyam //
column2: The Asvins gave, with lustre, sight, Sarasvatî manly strength with breath. Indra with voice and might gave Indra vigorous power. 81

column1: gomad ū ṣu ṇāsatyā aśvāvad yātam aśvinā / vartī rudrā nṛpāyyam //
column2: With kine, Nâsatyas! and with steeds, come, Asvins, Rudras! to the house, the sure protector of its men;

column1: na yat paro nāntara ādadharṣad vṛṣaṇvasū / duḥśam̐so martyo ripuḥ //
column2: Such, wealthy Gods! as none afar or standing near to us may harm, yea, no malicious mortal foe. 83

column1: tā na ā voḍham aśvinā rayiṃ piśaṅgasaṃdṛśam / dhiṣṇyā varivovidam //
column2: Do ye, O longed-for Asvins, lead us on to wealth of varied form, wealth that shall bring us room and rest. 84

column1: pāvakā naḥ sarasvatī vājebhir vājinīvatī / yajñaṃ vaṣṭu dhiyāvasuḥ // codayitrī sūnṛtānāṃ cetantī sumatīnām / yajñaṃ dadhe sarasvatī //
column2: Wealthy in spoil, enriched with hymns, may pure Sarasvatî desire with eager love our sacrifice. S5 She who awakens sounds of joy, inspires our hymns, Sarasvatî, she hath allowed our sacrifice. 85

column1: maho arṇaḥ sarasvatī pra cetayati ketunā / dhiyo viśvā vi rājati //
column2: Sarasvatî, the mighty flood, she with her light illuminates, she brightens every pious thought. 87

column1: indrā yāhi citrabhāno sutā ime tvāyavaḥ / aṇvībhis tanā pūtāsaḥ //
column2: O Indra, marvellously bright, come, these libations long for thee, thus by fine fingers purified. 88

column1: indrā yāhi tūtujāna upa brahmāṇi harivaḥ / sute dadhiṣva naś canaḥ //
column2: Approach, O Indra, hasting thee, Lord of Bay Horses, to the prayer: in our libations take delight. 90

column1: aśvinā pibatāṃ madhu sarasvatyā sajoṣasā / indraḥ sutrāmā vṛtrahā juṣantām̐ somyaṃ madhu //
column2: Accordant with Sarasvatî let the two Asvins drink the meath, May Indra, Vritra-slayer, Good Guardian, accept the Soma meath.

column1: imaṃ me varuṇa śrudhī havam adyā ca mṛḍaya / tvām asvasyur ā cake //
column2: VARUNA, hear this call of mine: be gracious unto us this day. Longing for help I yearn for thee. 2

column1: tvaṃ no agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḍo 'va yāsisīṣṭhāḥ / yajiṣṭho vahnitamaḥ śośucāno viśvā dveṣām̐si pra mumugdhy asmat // sa tvaṃ no agne 'vamo bhavotī nediṣṭho asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau / ava yakṣva no varuṇam̐ rarāṇo vīhi mṛḍīkam̐ suhavo na edhi //
column2: Do thou who knowest Varuna, O Agni, put far away from us the God's displeasure. Best Sacrificer, brightest One, refulgent, remove thou far from us all those who hate us. 4 Be thou the nearest unto us, O Agni, our closest Friend while now this Morn is breaking. Reconcile Varuna to us, be bounteous: show thy compassion and be swift to hear us. 5

column1: mahīm ū ṣu mātaram̐ suvratānām ṛtasya patnīm avase huvema / tuvikṣatrām ajarantīm urūcīm̐ suśarmāṇam aditim̐ supraṇītim // sutrāmāṇaṃ pṛthivīṃ dyām anehasam̐ suśarmāṇam aditim̐ supraṇītim / devīṃ nāvam̐ svaritrām anāgasam asravantīm ā ruhemā svastaye //
column2: We call to succour us the mighty Mother of those whose sway is just, the Queen of Order, Strong-ruler, far-expanding, ne’er decaying, Aditi gracious guide and good protectress. 6 Sinless may we ascend, for weal, this vessel rowed with good oars, divine, that never leaketh, Earth our strong guard, incomparable Heaven. Aditi gracious guide and good protectress. 7

column1: sunāvam ā ruheyam asravantīm anāgasam / śatāritrām̐ svastaye //
column2: May I ascend the goodly ship, free from defect, that leaketh not, Moved by a hundred oars, for weal. 8

column1: ā no mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtair gavyūtim ukṣatam / madhvā rajām̐si sukratū //
column2: O Mitra-Varuna, gracious Pair, with fatness dew our pasturage, With mead the regions of the air.9

column1: pra bāhavā sisṛtaṃ jīvase na ā no gavyūtim ukṣataṃ ghṛtena / ā no jane śravayataṃ yuvānā śrutaṃ me mitrāvaruṇā havemā //
column2: Stretch forth your arms and let our lives be lengthened: with fatness dew the pastures of our cattle. Ye Youthful, make us famed among the people: hear, Mitra-Varuna, these mine invocations. 10

column1: śaṃ no bhavantu vājino haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ svarkāḥ / jambhayanto 'hiṃ vṛkam̐ rakṣām̐si sanemy asmad yuyavann amīvāḥ //
column2: Bless us the Coursers when we call, etc., as in IX. 16

column1: vāje-vāje 'vata vājino no dhaneṣu viprā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ / asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvaṃ tṛptā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ //
column2: Deep-skilled in Law, etc., as in IX. 18

column1: samiddho agniḥ samidhā susamiddho vareṇyaḥ / gāyatrī chanda indriyaṃ tryavir gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: Kindled is Agni with the brand, yea, kindled well, the excellent. The metre Gâyatrî, the steer of eighteen months, give power and life! 13

column1: tanūnapāc chucivratas tanūpāś ca sarasvatī / uṣṇihā chanda indriyaṃ dityavāḍ gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: Tanûnapât whose acts are pure, our bodies’ guard Sarasvatî, Ushnihâ metre and the steer of two years’ age give power and life! 14

column1: iḍābhir agnir īḍyaḥ somo devo amartyaḥ / anuṣṭup chanda indriyaṃ pañcāvir gaur vayo dadhuḥ // subarhir agniḥ pūṣaṇvānt stīrṇabarhir amartyaḥ / bṛhatī chanda indriyaṃ trivatso gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: Agni with offerings, meet for praise, and Soma the immortal God, Anushtup metre and the steer of thirty months give power and life! 15 Agni with goodly grass spread out, deathless with Pûshan at his side, Brihatî metre and a steer of three years’ age give power and life! 16

column1: duro devīr diśo mahīr brahmā devo bṛhaspatiḥ / paṅktiś chanda ihendriyaṃ turyavāḍ gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: The Doors divine, the mighty Regions, Brahma, God Brihaspati, The metre Pankti, here a bull in his fourth year, give power and life 17

column1: uṣe yahvī supeśasā viśve devā amartyāḥ / triṣṭup chanda ihendriyaṃ paṣṭhavāḍ gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: The two young Darns of lovely form, the deathless Universal Gods, The Trishtup metre, here, a bull in his sixth year, give power and life! 18

column1: daivyā hotārā bhiṣajendreṇa sayujā yujā / jagatī chanda indriyam anaḍvān gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: The two celestial Hotars, both Physicians, Indra's close-knit friends, The metre Jagatî, an ox who draws the wain, give power and life! 19

column1: tisra iḍā sarasvatī bhāratī maruto viśaḥ / virāṭ chanda ihendriyaṃ dhenur gaur na vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: The Three, Ida, Sarasvatî, and Bhâratî, the Marut folk, Virâj the metre, here, a cow in milk, a bull, give power and life!20

column1: tvaṣṭā turīpo adbhuta indrāgnī puṣṭivardhanā / dvipadā chanda indriyam ukṣā gaur na vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: Tvashtar the wondrous, full of seed, Indrâgnî furtherers of weal, Dvipadâ metre, and a cow and vigorous bull give power and life! 21

column1: śamitā no vanaspatiḥ savitā prasuvan bhagam / kakup chanda indriyaṃ vaśā vehad vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: Our slaughterer, Vanaspatî, Savitar who promoteth wealth, The metre Kakup, here, a cow who casts her calf, give power and life! 22

column1: svāhā yajñaṃ varuṇaḥ sukṣatro bheṣajaṃ karat / aticchandā indriyaṃ bṛhad ṛṣabho gaur vayo dadhuḥ // vasantena ṛtunā devā vasvavas trivṛtā stutāḥ / rathantareṇa tejasā havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: With Svâhâ mighty Varuna give healing power to Sacrifice! The Atichhandas, Brihat, and a steer and bull give power and life! 23 With the Spring Season may the Gods the Vasus praised with triple hymn And with Rathantara, give life to Indra, splendour, sacrifice. 24

column1: grīṣmeṇa ṛtunā devā rudrāḥ pañcadaśe stutāḥ / bṛhatā yaśasā balam̐ havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: With Summer may the Rudras, Gods, praised in the Pañchadasa hymn With Brihat, give to Indra strength;

column1: varṣābhir ṛtunādityā stome saptadaśe stutāḥ / vairūpeṇa viśaujasā havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: May the Âdityas with the Rains, lauded in Saptadasa hymn And with Vairûpa, with folk, strength, give Indra sacrifice and life. 26

column1: śāradena ṛtunā devā ekavim̐śa ṛbhava stutāḥ / vairājena śriyā śriyam̐ havir indre vayo dadhuḥ // hemantena ṛtunā devās triṇave maruta stutāḥ / balena śakvarīḥ saho havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: With Autumn may the Ribhus, Gods, praised in the Ekavimsa hymn And with Virâja, give with grace to Indra grace, life, sacrifice. 27 With Winter may the Maruts, Gods, praised in the laud of thrice nine parts, The Sakvarîs, with strength give might to Indra, sacrifice and life.28

column1: śaiśireṇa ṛtunā devās trayastrim̐śe 'mṛtā stutāḥ / satyena revatīḥ kṣatram̐ havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //
column2: With Dew-time may the deathless Gods praised in the Thirty-three-part laud, The Revatîs, with truth give sway to Indra, sacrifice and life. 29

column1: hotā yakṣat samidhāgnim iḍas pade 'śvinendram̐ sarasvatīm ajo dhūmro na godhūmaiḥ kuvalair bheṣajaṃ madhu śaṣpair na teja indriyaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar sacrifice with fuel to Agni in the place of libation, to the Asvins, Indra, Sarasvatî. A grey-coloured he-goat with wheat, jujube-fruit and sprouts of rice becomes a sweet salutary remedy, splendour, might, milk, Soma. Let them enjoy sweet butter with foaming liquor. Hotar, present offerings of butter. 30

column1: hotā yakṣat tanūnapāt sarasvatī avir meṣo na bheṣajaṃ pathā madhumatā bharann aśvinendrāya vīryaṃ badarair upavākābhir bheṣajaṃ tokmabhiḥ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja // hotā yakṣan narāśam̐saṃ na nagnahuṃ patim̐ surayā bheṣajaṃ meṣaḥ sarasvatī bhiṣag ratho na candry aśvinor vapā indrasya vīryaṃ badarair upavākābhir bheṣajaṃ tokmabhiḥ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja // hotā yakṣad iḍeḍita ājuhvānaḥ sarasvatīm indraṃ balena vardhayann ṛṣabheṇa gavendriyam aśvinendrāya bheṣajaṃ yavair karkandhubhir madhu lājair na māsaraṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar, Tanûnapât, worship Sarasvatî. A sheep, a ram, a salutary remedy on the honey-sweet path, bearing to the Asvins and Indra heroic strength, with jujube-fruit, Indra-grains, sprouts of rice, becomes a salutary remedy, milk, Soma. Let them enjoy, etc., as in verse 29 Let the Hotar worship Narâsamsa and the Lord Nagnahu. A ram with Surâ a salutary remedy, Sarasvatî the Physician, the golden car of the Asvins, the victim's omentum, with jujube-fruit, Indra-grains, and rice-sprouts, become a salutary remedy, the manly strength of Indra, milk, Soma. Let them, etc. 32 Let the Hotar, magnified with oblations, offering sacrifice, worship Sarasvatî and Indra, increasing them with strength, with a bull and a cow. Strength and medicine to the Asvins and Indra are meath with jujube-fruit, Mâsara with parched grain, milk, Soma. Let them, etc. 33

column1: hotā yakṣad barhir ūrṇamradā bhiṣaṅ nāsatyā bhiṣajāśvināśvā śiśumatī bhiṣag dhenuḥ sarasvatī bhiṣag duha indrāya bheṣajaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja // hotā yakṣad duro diśaḥ kavaṣyo na vyacasvatīr aśvibhyāṃ na duro diśa indro na rodasī dughe duhe dhenuḥ sarasvaty aśvinendrāya bheṣajam̐ śukraṃ na jyotir indriyaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar worship the wool-soft Altar-grass, the Physicians Nâsatyas, the Physicians Asvins. A mare with a foal, a milch-cow is a physician. Sarasvatî the Physician yields medicine to Indra, milk, Soma. Let them enjoy, etc.34 Let the Hotar worship the Doors, the Regions, the resounding, expansive Doors, the Regions, with the Asvins. Indra milks the two milky worlds. The Mulch-cow Sarasvatî yields medicine for the Asvins and Indra, pure light and strength. Milk, Soma. Let them, etc. 35

column1: hotā yakṣat supeśasoṣe naktaṃ divāśvinā samañjati sarasvatyā tviṣim indre na bheṣajam̐ śyeno na rajasā hṛdā śriyā na māsaraṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja // hotā yakṣad daivyā hotārā bhiṣajāśvinendraṃ na jāgṛvi divā naktaṃ na bheṣajaiḥ śūṣam̐ sarasvatī bhiṣak sīsena duha indriyaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar worship the two fair-formed Dawns. At night and by day the Asvins with Sarasvatî compose impetuous power, like healing balm, in Indra, like a falcon, Mâsara with light, thought, and grace. Milk, Soma. Let them enjoy, etc. 36 Let the Hotar worship the two divine Hotars, the Physician Asvins, and Indra. Watchfully by day and night Sarasvatî as Physician, with balms, with lead, yields strength and power. Milk, Soma. Let them enjoy, etc. 37

column1: hotā yakṣat tisro devīr na bheṣajaṃ trayastridhātavo 'paso rūpam indre hiraṇyayam aśvineḍā na bhāratī vācā sarasvatī maha indrāya duha indriyaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar worship the three Goddesses. The three active ones, with three sacrificial elements, lay balm and golden hue on Indra. The Asvins, Idâ, Bhâratî—Sarasvatî with Speech yields might and power to Indra. Milk, Soma. Let them enjoy, etc. 38

column1: hotā yakṣat surerasam ṛṣabhaṃ naryāpasaṃ tvaṣṭāram indram aśvinā bheṣajaṃ na sarasvatīm ojo na hūtir indriyaṃ vṛko na rabhaso bhiṣag yaśaḥ surayā bheṣajam̐ śriyā na māsaraṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar worship Tvashtar full of good seed, the Bull active for men, Indra, the Asvins, Sarasvatî the Physician. Vigour, speed, power, a fierce wolf as physician, fame with Surâ is a medicine, Mâsara with grace. Milk, Soma. Let them enjoy, etc. 39

column1: hotā yakṣad vanaspatim̐ śamitāram̐ śatakratuṃ bhīmaṃ na manyum̐ rājānaṃ vyāghraṃ namasāśvinā bhāmam̐ sarasvatī bhiṣag indrāya duha indriyaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar worship Vanaspatî the Immolator, the Lord of Hundred Powers, and awful Passion, the King, the Tiger, and the Asvins, with reverence. Sarasvatî the Physician yields wrath and power to Indra. Milk, Soma. Let them enjoy, etc.40

column1: hotā yakṣad agnim̐ svāhājyasya stokānām̐ svāhā medasāṃ pṛthak svāhā chāgam aśvibhyām̐ svāhā meṣam̐ sarasvatyai svāha ṛṣabham indrāya sim̐hāya sahasa indriyam̐ svāhāgniṃ na bheṣajam̐ svāhā somam indriyam̐ svāhendram̐ sutrāmāṇam̐ savitāraṃ varuṇaṃ bhiṣajāṃ patim̐ svāhā vanaspatiṃ priyaṃ pātho na bheṣajam̐ svāhā devā ājyapā juṣāṇo agnir bheṣajaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar worship Agni. Of the drops of clarified butter, Svâhâ! Of the fat, omentum, etc., severally, Svâhâ! Svâhâ! the goat for the Asvins. Svâhâ! the ram for Sarasvatî. Svâhâ! the bull for Indra. To the Lion, to his might, power. Svâhâ! Agni the salutary remedy. Svâhâ! Soma, the power. Svâhâ! Indra the Good Deliverer. Savitar, Varuna Lord of Physicians. Svâhâ! Vanaspatî, beloved, food and medicine. Svâhâ! Gods who drink clarified butter. Agni accepting the medicine. Milk, Soma. Let them enjoy, etc. 41

column1: hotā yakṣad aśvinau chāgasya vapāyā medaso juṣetām̐ havir hotar yaja / hotā yakṣat sarasvatīṃ meṣasya vapāyā medaso juṣatām̐ havir hotar yaja / hotā yakṣad indram ṛṣabhasya vapāyā medaso juṣatām̐ havir hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar worship the Asvins with the omentum of a he-goat. Let them enjoy the fat. Hotar, offer the sacrificial oblation. Let the Hotar worship Sarasvatî with the omentum of a ram. Let her enjoy the fat. Hotar offer the sacrificial oblation. Let the Hotar worship Indra with the omentum of a bull. Let him, etc. 42

column1: hotā yakṣad aśvinau sarasvatīm indram̐ sutrāmāṇam ime somāḥ surāmāṇaś chāgair na meṣair ṛṣabhaiḥ sutāḥ śaṣpair ba tokmabhir lājair mahasvanto madā māsareṇa pariṣkṛtāḥ śukrāḥ payasvanto 'mṛtāḥ prasthitā vo madhuścutas tān aśvinā sarasvatīndraḥ sutrāmā vṛtrahā juṣantām̐ somyaṃ madhu pibantu vyantu hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar worship the Asvins, Sarasvatî, Indra the Good Deliverer. These your Somas, pressed, rejoicing with goats, rams, bulls, giving pleasure with rice-shoots, young blades of corn, parched grain, joy-givers adorned with Mâsara, bright, milky, immortal, presented, dropping honey. these let the Asvins, Sarasvatî, Indra the Good Deliverer, Vritra-slayer, accept. Let them drink, rejoice in, enjoy the Soma meath. Hotar, sacrifice. 43

column1: hotā yakṣad aśvinau chāgasya haviṣa āttām adya madhyato meda udbhṛtaṃ purā dveṣobhyaḥ purā pauruṣeyyā gṛbho ghastāṃ nūnaṃ ghāseajrāṇāṃ yavasaprathamānām̐ sumatkṣarāṇām̐ śatarudriyāṇām agniṣvāttānāṃ pīvopavasānāṃ pārśvataḥ śroṇitaḥ śitāmata utsādato 'ṅgād-aṅgād avattānāṃ karata evāśvinā juṣetām̐ havir hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar worship the Asvins. Let them eat of the he-goat, the sacrifice. Let them to-day eat the fat, taken from the middle, before those who hate us, before human handling. Yea, let them eat amid the fodder of fields fresh with moisture, with their expanse of barley, limbs of those tasted by Agni, belonging to the Hundred Rudras, portions covered with fat, from the sides, from the thighs, from the fore-feet from the chine. From every member of the divided victims these two make their repast. Thus let the Asvins accept. Hotar, offer the sacrificial oblation.44

column1: hotā yakṣat sarasvatīṃ meṣasya haviṣa āvayad adya madhyato meda udbhṛtaṃ purā dveṣobhyaḥ purā pauruṣeyyā gṛbho ghasan nūnaṃ ghāseajrāṇāṃ yavasaprathamānām̐ sumatkṣarāṇām̐ śatarudriyāṇām agniṣvāttānāṃ pīvopavasānāṃ pārśvataḥ śroṇitaḥ śitāmata utsādato 'ṅgād-aṅgād avattānāṃ karad evam̐ sarasvatī juṣatām̐ havir hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar worship Vanaspatî. He has held with a very well formed and very strong rope. There where the favourite stations of the Asvins are, of the he-goat the sacrifice; of Sarasvatî, of the ram the sacrifice;

column1: hotā yakṣad indram ṛṣabhasya haviṣa āvayad adya madhyato meda udbhṛtaṃ purā dveṣobhyaḥ purā pauruṣeyyā gṛbho ghasan nūnaṃ ghāseajrāṇāṃ yavasaprathamānām̐ sumatkṣarāṇām̐ śatarudriyāṇām agniṣvāttānāṃ pīvopavasānāṃ pārśvataḥ śroṇitaḥ śitāmata utsādato 'ṅgād-aṅgād avattānāṃ karad evam indro juṣatām̐ havir hotar yaja //
column2: of Indra, of the bull the sacrifice;

column1: hotā yakṣad vanaspatim abhi hi piṣṭatamayā rabhiṣṭayā raśanayādhita / yatrāśvinoś chāgasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra sarasvatyā meṣasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatrendrasya ṛṣabhasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatrāgneḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra somasya priyā dhāmāni yatrendrasya sutrāmṇaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra savituḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra varuṇasya priyā dhāmāni yatra vanaspateḥ priyā pāthām̐si yatra devānām ājyapānāṃ priyā dhāmāni yatrāgner hotuḥ priyā dhāmāni tatraitān prastutyevopastutyevopāva srakṣad rabhīyasa iva kṛtvī karad evaṃ devo vanaspatir juṣatām̐ havir hotar yaja //
column2: there where the favourite stations of Agni are, of Soma, of Indra the Good Deliverer, of Savitar, of Varuna, the favourite places of Vanaspatî, the favourite stations of Gods who drink clarified butter, and of Agni the Hotar, there let him arrange these victims when he has praised and lauded them, and perform when he has made them very strong. Let divine Vanaspatî accept. Hotar, offer oblation. 47 Let the Hotar worship Agni Svishtakrit. Let Agni worship the favourite stations of the Asvins, of the he-goat the sacrifice; of Sarasvatî, of the ram the sacrifice; of Indra, of the bull the sacrifice;

column1: hotā yakṣad agnim̐ sviṣṭakṛtam ayāḍ agnir aśvinoś chāgasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāṭ sarasvatyā meṣasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāḍ indrasya ṛṣabhasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāḍ agneḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāṭ somasya priyā dhāmāny ayāḍ indrasya sutrāmṇaḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāṭ savituḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāḍ varuṇasya priyā dhāmāny ayāḍ vanaspateḥ priyā pāthām̐sy ayāḍ devānām ājyapānāṃ priyā dhāmāni yakṣad agner hotuḥ priyā dhāmāni yakṣat svaṃ mahimānam ā yajatām ejyā iṣaḥ kṛṇotu so adhvarā jātavedā juṣatām̐ havir hotar yaja //
column2: Let him worship the favourite stations of Agni the Hotar. Let him worship his own majesty. Let him win for himself by sacrifice food worthy of sacrifice. Let him, Knower of Beings, perform the sacred rites. Let him accept the sacrificial food. Hotar, offer oblation. 48

column1: devaṃ barhiḥ sarasvatī sudevam indre aśvinā / tejo na cakṣur akṣyor barhiṣā dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: The Grass divine, for the right Gods, Sarasvatî, the Asvins Twain, Give Indra splendour, with the Grass, sight of his eyes and mighty strength! For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Thou, Hotar, offer sacrifice. 49

column1: devīr dvāro aśvinā bhiṣajendre sarasvatī / prāṇaṃ na vīryaṃ nasi dvāro dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja // devī uṣāsāv aśvinā sutrāmendre sarasvatī / balaṃ na vācam āsya uṣābhyāṃ dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja // devī joṣṭrī sarasvaty aśvinendram avardhayan / śrotraṃ na karṇayor yaśo joṣṭrībhāṃ dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: The Doors, the Doors divine, the Two Asvins, Leeches, Sarasvatî— May they give breath to Indra in his nostrils, and heroic strength. For gain of wealth, etc., as in verse 48 May Dawn and Night, the Goddesses, both Asvins, and Sarasvatî Lay, with both Dawns, strength, voice within Indra the Good Deliverer's mouth. For gain of wealth, etc. 51 Both nursing Goddesses, the Pair of Asvins, and Sarasvatî Have with both nurses given strength to Indra, fame, and power to hear. For gain of wealth, etc. 52

column1: devī ūrjāhutī dughe sudughendre sarasvaty aśvinā bhiṣajāvataḥ / śukraṃ na jyoti stanayor āhutī dhatta indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja // devā devānāṃ bhiṣajā hotārāv indram aśvinā / vaṣaṭkāraiḥ sarasvatī tviṣiṃ na hṛdaye matim̐ hotṛbhyāṃ dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: Bringers of strengthening sacrifice, both Goddesses, well-yielding cows, Sarasvatî, both Asvins, the Physicians, these are Indra's guards. Forth from their breasts by sacrifice they give him brilliant light and power. For gain of wealth, etc. 53 Both Gods, the Hotars of the Gods, the Asvins the Physicians and Sarasvatî with Vashat-calls, with the two Hotars have bestowed on Indra brilliant light and power, and planted wisdom in his heart. For gain of , etc. 54

column1: devīs tisras tisro devīr aśvineḍā sarasvatī / śūṣaṃ na madhye nābhyām indrāya dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: Goddesses three, three Goddesses—Asvins, Idâ, Sarasvatî In Indra's midmost navel have laid store of energy and power. For gain of wealth, etc. 55

column1: deva indro narāśam̐sas trivarūthaḥ sarasvatyāśvibhyām īyate rathaḥ / reto na rūpam amṛtaṃ janitram indrāya tvaṣṭā dadhad indriyāṇi vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: God Narâsamsa, Indra thrice-protecting, whose car moves by Sarasvatî and Asvins May Tvashtar lay seed, deathless form in Indra, a fitting place of birth and mighty powers. For gain of wealth, etc. 56

column1: devo devair vanaspatir hiraṇyaparṇo aśvibhyām̐ sarasvatyā supippala indrāya pacyate madhu / ojo na jūtir ṛṣabho na bhāmaṃ vanaspatir no dadhad indriyāṇi vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: God with the Gods, Vanaspatî of golden leaves and goodly fruit Ripens till Indra finds it sweet, with Asvins and Sarasvatî. 57

column1: devaṃ barhir vāritīnām adhvare stīrṇam aśvibhyām ūrṇamradāḥ sarasvatyā syonam indra te sadaḥ / īśāyai manyum̐ rājānaṃ barhiṣā dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: Strewn, soft as wool, in sacrifice, with Asvins and Sarasvatî, The sacred robe of water-plants be, Indra, a fair seat for thee! Together with the sacred grass limy they, for sovranty, bestow King Passion and great power on thee. For gain of wealth, etc.58

column1: devo agniḥ sviṣṭakṛd devān yakṣad yathāyatham̐ hotārāv indram aśvinā vācā vācam̐ sarasvatīm agnim̐ somam̐ sviṣṭakṛt sv"ṣṭa indraḥ sutrāmā savitā varuṇo bhiṣag iṣṭo devovanaspatiḥ sv"ṣṭā devā ājyapāḥ sv"ṣṭo agnir agninā hotā hotre sviṣṭakṛd yaśo na dadhad indriyam ūrjam apacitim̐ svadhāṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: Let the God Agni Svishtakrit worship the Gods as is meet and right for each, the two Hotars, Indra, the Asvins, Vâk with speech, Sarasvatî, Agni, Soma. Svishtakrit has been well worshipped, Indra Good Deliverer, Savitar, Varuna the Physician have been worshipped. The God Vanaspatî, the Gods who drink clarified butter have been well worshipped, Agni by Agni. Let the Hotar Svishtakrit give the Hotar fame, great power, energy, honour, Ancestral libation. 59

column1: agnim adya hotāram avṛṇītāyaṃ yajamānaḥ pacan paktīḥ pacan puroḍāśān badhnann aśvibhyāṃ chāgam̐ sarasvatyai meṣam indrāya ṛṣabham̐ sunvann aśvibhyām̐ sarasvatyā indrāya sutrāmṇe surāsomān //
column2: To-day this Sacrificer cooking viands, cooking sacrificial rice-cakes, binding a goat for the Asvins, a ram for Sarasvatî, a hull for Indra, pressing Surâ and Soma juices for the Asvins, Sarasvatî, and Indra the Good Deliverer, has chosen Agni as Hotar. 60

column1: sūpasthā adya devo vanaspatir abhavad aśvibhyāṃ chāgena sarasvatyai meṣeṇendrāya ṛṣabheṇākṣam̐s tān medastaḥ prati pacatāgṛbhīṣatāvīvṛdhanta puroḍāśair apur aśvinā sarasvatīndraḥ sutrāmā surāsomān //
column2: To-day the divine Vanaspatî has done good service to the Asvins with a goat, to Sarasvatî with a ram, to Indra with a bull. They have eaten these from the marrow onwards, they have accepted the cooked viands, they have waxed strong with the rice-cakes. The Agnis, Sarasvatî, and Indra have drunk the Surâ and Soma draughts. 61

column1: tvām adya ṛṣa ārṣeya ṛṣīṇāṃ napād avṛṇītāyṃ yajamāno bahubhya ā saṃgatebhya eṣa me deveṣu vasu vāryāyakṣyata iti tā yā devā deva dānāny adus tāny asmā ā ca śāssvā ca gurasveṣitaś ca hotar asi bhadravācyāya preṣito mānuṣaḥ sūktavākāya sūktā brūhi //
column2: Thee, to-day, O Rishi, Rishi's son, descendant of Rishis, hath this Sacrificer chosen for many collected, saying: This (Agni) shall win by sacrifice for me choice-worthy treasures among the Gods. O God, what gifts the Gods have given, these do thou desire and approve. And thou art a commissioned Hotar, a human Hotar sent forward for benediction, for good speech, Speak thou good words.
