column2: Who moveth single and alone? Who is brought forth to life again? What is the remedy of cold, or what the great receptacle? 10

column1: sūrya ekākī carati candramā jāyate punaḥ / agnir dhimasya bheṣajaṃ bhūmir āvapanaṃ mahat //
column2: The Sun moves single and alone. The Moon is brought to life again, Fire is the remedy of cold; Earth is the great receptacle. 11

column1: kā svid āsīt pūrvacittiḥ kim̐ svid āsīd bṛhad vayaḥ / kā svid āsīt pilippilā kā svid āsīt piśaṅgilā //
column2: What was the antecedent thought? What was the bird of mighty size? The slippery matron, who was she? Who was the reddish-coloured one? 12

column1: dyaur āsīt pūrvacittiḥ aśva āsīd bṛhad vayaḥ / avir āsīt pilippilā rātrir āsīt piśaṅgilā //
column2: Heaven was the antecedent thought. The Courser was the mighty bird. The slippery matron was the earth, Night was the reddish-coloured one. 13

column1: vāyuṣ ṭvā pacatair avatu / asitagrīvaś chāgaiḥ / nyagrodhaś camasaiḥ / śalmalir vṛddhyā / eṣa sya rāthyo vṛṣā / paḍbhiś caturbhir ed agan / brahmākṛṣṇaś ca no 'vatu / namo 'gnaye //
column2: Vâyu help thee with cooked viands! Blackneck with goats; Nyagrodha with cups; Salmali with increase; this Stallion here, good for the chariot—let him verily come with his four feet. Brahmâkrishna help us! Obeisance to Agni!14

column1: sam̐śito raśminā rathaḥ sam̐śito raśminā hayaḥ / sam̐śito apsv apsujā brahmā somapurogavaḥ //
column2: The car is fitted with the rein, the steed is fitted with the rein. Fitted in waters, water-born, is Brahmâ following Soma's lead. 15

column1: svayaṃ vājim̐s tanvaṃ kalpayasva svayaṃ yajasva svayaṃ juṣasva / mahimā te 'nyena na saṃnaśe //
column2: Steed, from thy body, of thyself, sacrifice and accept thyself. Thy greatness can be gained by none but thee. 16

column1: na vā u etan mriyase na riṣyasi devām̐ id eṣi pathibhiḥ sugebhiḥ / yatrāsate sukṛto yatra te yayus tatra tvā devaḥ savitā dadhātu //
column2: No, here thou diest not, thou art not injured: only by fair paths to the Gods thou guest, May Savitar the God in that world place thee where dwell the pious, whether they have journeyed. 17

column1: agniḥ paśur āsīt tenāyajanta sa etaṃ lokam ajayad yasminn agniḥ sa te loko bhaviṣyati taṃ jeṣyasi pibaitā apaḥ / vāyuḥ paśur āsīt tenāyajanta sa etaṃ lokam ajayad yasmin vāyuḥ sa te loko bhaviṣyati taṃ jeṣyasi pibaitā apaḥ / sūryaḥ paśur āsīt tenāyajanta sa etaṃ lokam ajayad yasmint sūryaḥ sa te loko bhaviṣyati taṃ jeṣyasi pibaitā apaḥ //
column2: Agni was the victim. With him they sacrificed. He won this world in which Agni is. This shall become thy world. This shalt thou win. Drink these waters. Vâyu was the victim. With him they sacrificed. He won this world in which Vâyu is. This shall become, etc., as above. Sûrya was the victim, etc, He won the world in which Sûrya is. This shall become, etc. 18

column1: prāṇāya svāhā / apānāya svāhā / vyānāya svāhā ambe ambike 'mbālike na mā nayati kaś cana / sasasty aśvakaḥ subhadrikāṃ kāmpīlavāsinīm // gaṇānāṃ tvā gaṇapatim̐ havāmahe priyāṇāṃ tvā priyapatim̐ havāmahe nidhīnāṃ tvā nidhipatim̐ havāmahe vaso mama / āham ajāni garbhadham ā tvam ajāsi garbhadham //
column2: To vital breath, Hail! To out-breathing, Hail! To diffusive breath, Hail! Ambâ! Ambikâ! Ambâlikâ! No one is taking me away. The sorry horse will lie beside another, as Subhadrâ, the dweller in Kâmpila.19 Thee we invoke, troop-lord of troops, Thee we invoke, the loved ones’ lord. Thee, lord of treasures, we invoke. My precious wealth! . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 32

column1: dadhikrāvṇo akāriṣaṃ jiṣṇor aśvasya vājinaḥ / surabhi no mukhā karat pra ṇa āyūm̐ṣi tāriṣat //
column2: Now have I glorified with praise strong Dadhikrâvan, conquering steed, Sweet may he make our mouths: may he prolong the days we have to live. 33

column1: gāyatrī triṣṭub jagaty anuṣṭup paṅktyā saha / bṛhaty uṣṇihā kakup sūcībhiḥ śamyantu tvā //
column2: Gâyatrî, Trishtup, Jagatî, and Pankti with Anushtup joined, Brihatî, Kakup, Ushnihâ pacify thee with needle-points! 34

column1: dvipadā yāś catuṣpadās tripadā yāś ca ṣaṭpadāḥ / vicchandā yāś ca sacchandāḥ sūcībhiḥ śamyantu tvā //
column2: Two-footed, those that have four feet, those with three feet and those with five, Metteless, with one metre; these pacify thee with needle-points! 35

column1: mahānāmnyo revatyo viśvā āśāḥ prahūvarīḥ / maighīr vidyuto vācaḥ sūcībhiḥ śamyantu tvā //
column2: May Mahânâmnîs, Revatîs, all far-spread Regions of the sky, Voices, and lightnings from the cloud pacify thee with needle-points! 36

column1: nāryas te patnyo loma vi cinvantu manīṣayā / devānāṃ patnyo diśaḥ sūcībhiḥ śamyantu tvā //
column2: May married dames of human birth skilfully separate thy hair: The Regions, Consorts of the Gods, pacify thee with needle-points!37

column1: rajatā hariṇīḥ sīsā yujo yujyante karmabhiḥ / aśvasya vājinas tvaci simāḥ śamyantu śamyantīḥ //
column2: They, made of silver, gold, and lead, are used as helpers in the work. As lines on the strong Courser's skin may they console and give thee rest. 38

column1: kas tvā chyati kas tvā vi śāsti kas te gātrāṇi śamyati / ka u te śamitā kaviḥ //
column2: Who flays thee? Who dissects thee? Who prepares thy limbs for sacrifice? Who is the Sage that slaughters thee? 40

column1: ṛtavas tvā ṛtuthā parva śamitāro vi śāsatu / saṃvatsarasya tejasā śamībhiḥ śamyantu tvā //
column2: In due time let the seasons as thy Slaughterers divide thy joints, And with the splendour of the Year sacrifice thee with holy rites. 41

column1: ardhamāsāḥ parūm̐ṣi te māsā ā chyantu śamyantaḥ / ahorātrāṇi maruto viliṣṭam̐ sūdayantu te //
column2: Let the Half-months and let the Months, while sacrificing, flay thy limbs: Let Day and Night and Maruts mend each fault in sacrificing thee. 42

column1: daivyā adhvaryavas tvā chyantu vi ca āsatu / gātrāṇi parvaśas te simāḥ kṛṇvantu śamyantīḥ //
column2: Let the divine Adhvaryus flay thy body and dissect thy frame, And let the sacrificing lines prepare thy members joint by joint, 43

column1: dyaus te pṛthivy antarikṣaṃ vāyuś chidraṃ pṛṇātu te / sūyas te nakṣatraiḥ saha lokaṃ kṛṇotu sādhuyā //
column2: May Sky, Earth, Air, and Wind supply each failing and defect of thine: May Sûrya with the Stars of heaven duly prepare a world for thee. 44

column1: śaṃ te parebhyo gātrebhyaḥ śam astv avarebhyaḥ / śam asthabhyo majjabhyaḥ śam v astu tanvai tava //
column2: Well be it with thine upper parts, well be it with the parts below! Well he it with thy bones and with thy marrow and with all thy frame! 45

column1: kaḥ svid ekākī carati ka u svij jāyate punaḥ / kim̐ svid dhimasya bheṣajaṃ kim v āvapanaṃ mahat //
column2: Who moveth singly? etc., as in verse 9

column1: sūrya ekākī carati candramā jāyate punaḥ / agnir dhimasya bheṣajaṃ bhūmir āvapanaṃ mahat //
column2: The Sun moves singly, etc., as in verse 10

column1: kim̐ svit sūryasamaṃ jyotiḥ kim̐ samudrasamam̐ saraḥ / kim̐ svit pṛthivyai varṣīyaḥ kasya mātrā na vidyate //
column2: What lustre is like Sûrya's light? What lake is equal to the Sea?What is more spacious than the Earth? What thing is that which naught can mete? 48

column1: brahma sūryasamaṃ jyotir dyauḥ samudrasamam̐ saraḥ / indraḥ pṛthivyai varṣīyān gos tu mātrā na vidyate //
column2: Brahma is lustre like the Sea. Heaven is a flood to match the Sea. Indra is vaster than the Earth. Beyond all measure is the Cow. 49

column1: pṛcchāmi tvā citaye devasakha yadi tvam atra manasā jagantha / yeṣu viṣṇus triṣu padeṣv eṣṭas teṣu viśvaṃ bhuvanam ā viveśā3m̐ //
column2: Friend of the Gods, I ask, for information, if thou in spirit hast obtained the knowledge, Hath Vishnu this whole Universe pervaded in the three steps wherein the God is worshipped? 50

column1: api teṣu triṣu padeṣv asmi yeṣu viśvaṃ bhuvanam āviveśa / sadyaḥ pary emi pṛthivīm uta dyām ekenāṅgena divo asya pṛṣṭham //
column2: I also am in those three steps of Vishnu wherewith this Universe he permeated. The earth and heaven I circle in a moment and this heaven's summit with a single organ. 51

column1: keṣv antaḥ puruṣa ā viveśa kāny antaḥ puruṣe arpitāni / etad brahmann upavalhāmasi tvā kim̐ svin naḥ prati vocāsy atra //
column2: What are the things which Purusha hath entered? What things hath Purusha contained within him? This riddle we propound to thee, O Brahman. Why dost thou give no answer to my question? 52

column1: pañcasv antaḥ puruṣa ā viveśa tāny antaḥ puruṣe arpitāni / etat tvātra pratimanvāno asmi na māyayā bhavasy uttaro mat //
column2: Within five things hath Purusha found entrance; these Purusha hath within himself connected. This is the thought which I return in answer. Thou art not my superior in wisdom. 53

column1: kā svid āsīt pūrvacittiḥ kim̐ svid āsīd bṛhad vayaḥ / kā svid āsīt pilippilā kā svid āsīt piśaṅgilā //
column2: What was the antecedent thought? etc., as in verse 11 Heaven was the antecedent thought, etc., as in 12

column1: ka īm are piśaṃgilā ka īṃ kurupiśaṃgilā / ka īm āskandam arṣati ka īṃ panthāṃ vi sarpati //
column2: Who, tell me, is the yellowish she? Who is the darkly- yellowish? Who moves with rapid spring and bound? Who glides and winds along the path?56

column1: ajāre piśaṃgilā śvāvit kurupiśaṃgilā / śaśa āskandam arṣaty ahiḥ panthāṃ vi sarpati //
column2: The she-goat, Sir, is yellowish, dark-yellowish is the porcupine. The hare moves swift with leap and bound: the snake creeps winding on the path. 57

column1: katy asya viṣṭhāḥ katy akṣarāṇi kati homāsaḥ katidhā samiddhaḥ / yajñasya tvā vidathā pṛccham atra kati hotāra ṛtuśo yajanti //
column2: How many different forms hath this, how many syllables, burnt-oblations, brands for kindling? Here, of the rites of sacrifice I ask thee. How many Hotars in due season worship? 68

column1: ṣaḍ asya viṣṭhāḥ śatam akṣarāṇy aśītir homāḥ samidho ha tisraḥ / yajñasya te vidathā pra bravīmi sapta hotāra ṛtuśo yajanti //
column2: Sixfold its form, its syllables a hundred, eighty burnt-offerings, just three brands for kindling. To thee I tell the rites of sacrificing. Seven Hotars worship in appointed season. 59

column1: ko asya veda bhuvanasya nābhiṃ ko dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam / kaḥ sūryasya veda bṛhato janitraṃ ko veda candramasaṃ yatojāḥ //
column2: Who knoweth this world's central point? Who knoweth the heaven, the earth, and the wide air between them? Who knows the birthplace of the mighty Sûrya? Who knows the Moon, whence he was generated? 60

column1: vedāham asya bhuvanasya nābhiṃ veda dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam / veda sūryasya bṛhato janitraṃ atho veda candramasaṃ yatojāḥ //
column2: I know the centre of the world about us. I know heaven, earth, and the wide air between them. I know the birthplace of the mighty Sûrya. I know the Moon, whence he was generated. 61

column1: pṛcchāmi tvā param antaṃ pṛthivyāḥ pṛcchāmi yatra bhuvanasya nābhiḥ / pṛcchāmi tvā vṛṣṇo aśvasya retaḥ pṛcchāmi vācaḥ paramaṃ vyoma //
column2: I ask thee of the earth's extremest limit, where is the centre of the world, I ask thee. I ask thee of the Stallion's genial humour, I ask of highest heaven where Speech abideth. 62

column1: iyaṃ vediḥ paro antaḥ pṛthivyā ayaṃ yajño yatra bhuvanasya nābhiḥ / ayam̐ somo vṛṣṇo aśvasya retaḥ brahmāyaṃ vācaḥ paramaṃ vyoma //
column2: This altar is the earth's extremest limit; this sacrifice of ours is the world's centre. This Soma is the Stallion's genial humour, this Brahman highest heaven where Speech abideth.63

column1: subhūḥ svayambhūḥ prathamo 'ntar mahaty arṇave / dadhe ha garbham ṛtviyaṃ yato jātaḥ prajāpatiḥ //
column2: The Strong, the Self-existent One, the First, within the mighty flood Laid down the timely embryo from which Prajâpati was born. 64

column1: hotā yakṣat prajāpatim̐ somasya mahimnaḥ / juṣatāṃ pibatu somam̐ hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Hotar sacrifice to Prajâpati from the Mahiman-Soma. Let him accept. Let him drink the Soma. Hotar, sacrifice. 65

column1: prajāpate na tvad etāny anyo viśvā rūpāṇi pari tā babhūva / yatkāmās te juhumas tan no astu //
column2: Prajâpati, thou only, etc., as in X. 20

column1: aśvas tūparo gomṛgas te prājāpatyāḥ kṛṣṇagrīva āgneyo rarāṭe purastāt sārasvatī meṣy adhastād dhanvor āśvināv adhorāmau bāhvoḥ saumapauṣṇaḥ śyāmo nābhyām̐ sauryayāmau śvetaś ca kṛṣṇaś ca pārśvayos tvāṣṭrau lomaśasakthau sakthyor vāyavyaḥ śvetaḥ puccha indrāya svapasyāya vehad vaiṣṇavo vāmanaḥ //
column2: HORSE, hornless goat, Gomriga, these belong to Prajâpati. A black-necked goat, devoted to Agni, (is to be bound) in front to the forehead (of the horse); Sarasvatî's ewe below his jaws; two goats belonging to the Asvins, with marks on the lower parts of the body, to his fore-legs; a dark-coloured goat, Soma's and Pûshan's, to his navel; a white and a black, sacred to Soma and Varna, to his sides;

column1: rohito dhūmrarohitaḥ karkandhurohitas te saumyā babhrur aruṇababhruḥ śukababhrus te vāruṇāḥ śitirandhro 'nyataḥśitirandhraḥ samantaśitirandhras te sāvitrāḥ śitibāhur anyataḥśitibāhuḥ samantaśitibāhus te bārhaspatyāḥ pṛṣatī kṣudrapṛṣatī sthūlapṛṣatī tā maitrāvaruṇyaḥ //
column2: The red goat, the smoky-red, the jujube-red, these belong to Soma. The brown, the ruddy-brown, the parrot-brown, these are Varuna's. One with white ear holes, one with partly white, one with wholly white, belong to Savitar. One with fore feet white, partly white, wholly white, belongs to Brihaspati. She goats speckled, with small spots, with big spots, these belong to Mitra-Varuna. 3

column1: śuddhavālaḥ sarvaśuddhavālo maṇivālas ta āśvināḥ śyetaḥ śyetākṣo 'ruṇas te rudrāya paśupataye karṇā yāmā avaliptā raudrā nabhorūpāḥ pārjanyāḥ //
column2: The bright-tailed, the wholly bright-tailed, the jewel-tailed, these belong to the Asvins. The white, the white-eyed, the reddish, these are for Rudra Lord of Beasts. Long-eared goats are for Yama; proud ones for Rudra;

column1: pṛśnis tiraścīnapṛśnir ūrdhvapṛśnis te mārutāḥ phalgūr lohitorṇī palakṣī tāḥ sārasvatyaḥ plīhākarṇaḥ śuṇṭhākarṇo 'ddhyālohakarṇas te tvāṣṭrāḥ kṛṣṇagrīvaḥ śitikakṣo 'ñjisakthas ta aindrāgnāḥ kṛṣṇāñjir alpāñjir mahāñjis ta uṣasyāḥ //
column2: Goats speckled, transversely speckled, upward speckled are for the Maruts. The reddish she-goat, the red-haired, the white, these belong to Sarasvatî. The goat with diseased ears, the short-eared, the red eared are Tvashtar's. The black-necked, the white-flanked, one with bright-coloured thighs belong to Indra and Agni. Those with black marks, small marks, large marks belong to Dawn. 5

column1: śilpā vaiśvadevyo rohiṇyas tryavayo vāce 'vijñātā adityai sarūpā dhātre vatsataryo devānāṃ patnībhyaḥ //
column2: Parti-coloured female victims belong to the All-Gods; red-coloured, eighteen mouths old to Vâk; victims without distinguishing marks to Aditi;

column1: kṛṣṇagrīvā āgneyāḥ śitibhravo vasūnām̐ rohitā rudrāṇām̐ śvetā avarokiṇa ādityānāṃ nabhorūpāḥ pārjanyāḥ //
column2: weaned kids sacred to the Consorts of the Gods. 6 Black-necked victims for Agni; white browed for the Vasus; red for Rudra; bright ones for the Âdityas;

column1: unnata ṛṣabho vāmanas ta aindravaiṣṇavā unnataḥ śitibāhuḥ śitipṛṣṭhas ta aindrābārhaspatyāḥ śukarūpā vājināḥ kalmāṣā āgnimārutāḥ śyāmāḥ pauṣnāḥ //
column2: The tall goat, the sturdy, the dwarf, these are Indra-Vishnu's; the tall, the white fore-footed, the black-backed, Indra-Brihaspati's; parrot-coloured the Vâjins’; speckled Agni-Maruts’;

column1: etā aindrāgnā dvirūpā agnīṣomīyā vāmanā anaḍvāha āgnāvaiṣṇavā vaśā maitrāvaruṇyo 'nyataenyo maitryaḥ //
column2: two-coloured, Agni-Soma's; dwarf oxen, Agni-Vishnu's; barren cows, Mitra-Varuna's; partly variegated, Mitra's. 9 Black-necked ones, Agni's;

column1: kṛṣṇagrīvā āgneyā babhravaḥ saumyāḥ śvetā vāyavyā avijñātā adityai sarūpā dhātre vatsataryo devānāṃ patnībhyaḥ //
column2: white, Vâyu's; undistinguished, Aditi's; self-coloured, Dhâtar's; weanlings, the Gods’ Consorts’. 10 Black ones for Earth;

column1: kṛṣṇā bhaumā dhūmrā āntarikṣā bṛhanto divyāḥ śabalā vaidyutāḥ sidhmās tārakāḥ //
column2: tall ones for Sky; brindled ones for Lightning; blotched ones for Stars. 11

column1: dhūmrān vasantāyā labhate śvetān grīṣmāya kṛṣṇān varṣābhyo 'ruṇāñ charade pṛṣato hemantāya piśaṅgāñ chiśirāya //
column2: Smoke-coloured ones he sacrifices to Spring; white to Summer; black to the Rains; red ones to Autumn; speckled to Winter;

column1: tryavayo gāyatryai pañcāvayas triṣṭubhe dityavāho jagatyai trivatsā anuṣṭubhe turyavāha uṣṇihe //
column2: steers of two and a half years to Trishtup; two year old steers to Jagatî; three year olds to Anushtup; four year olds to Ushnih. 13

column1: paṣthavāho virāja ukṣaṇo bṛhatyā ṛṣabhāḥ kakubhe 'naḍvāhaḥ paṅktyai dhenavo 'ticchandase //
column2: draught oxen to Pankti; milch-cows to Atichhandas.14 Black-necked victims sacred to Agni;

column1: kṛṣṇagrīvā āgneyā babhravaḥ saumyā upadhvastāḥ sāvitrā vatsataryaḥ sārasvatyaḥ śyāmāḥ pauṣṇāḥ pṛśnayo mārutā bahurūpā vaiśvadevā vaśā dyāvāpṛthivīyāḥ //
column2: weaned she-kids to Sarasvatî; dark-coloured goats to Pûshan; speckled victims to the Maruts; many-coloured to the All-Gods; barren cows to Heaven and Earth. 15

column1: uktāḥ saṃcarā etā aindrāgnāḥ kṛṣṇāḥ vāruṇāḥ pṛśnayo mārutāḥ kāyās tūparāḥ //
column2: Called contemporary, the dappled belong to Indra-Agni; black ones to Varuna; speckled to the Maruts; hornless he-goats to Ka. 16

column1: agnaye 'nīkavate prathamajān ā labhate marudbhyaḥ sāṃtapanebhyaḥ savātyān marudbhyo gṛhamedhibhyo baṣkihān marudbhyaḥ krīḍibhyaḥ sam̐sṛṣṭān marudbhyaḥ svatavadbhyo 'nusṛṣṭān //
column2: To Agni foremost in place he sacrifices firstling goats; to the consuming Maruts those born of one mother; to the Maruts who perform domestic rites those born after a long time; to the sportive Maruts those born together; to the self-strong Maruts those born in succession. 17

column1: uktāḥ saṃcarā etā aindrāgnāḥ prāśṛṅgā māhendrā bahurūpā vaiśvakarmaṇāḥ //
column2: Called contemporaneous, the dappled belonging to Indra-Agni; those with projecting horns to Mahendra; the many-coloured to Visvakarman. 18

column1: dhūmrā babhrunīkāśāḥ pitṝṇām̐ somavatāṃ babhravo babhrunīkāśāḥ pitṝṇāṃ barhiṣadāṃ kṛṣṇā babhrunīkāśāḥ pitṝṇām agniṣvāttānāṃ kṛṣṇāḥ pṛṣantas traiyambakāḥ //
column2: Smoke-coloured, those of brownish hue, to be offered to the Soma-possessing Fathers; the brown and the smoky-looking to the Fathers who sit on sacred grass; the black and the brownish-looking to the Fathers who have been tasted by Agni; the black and the spotted belong to Tryambaka. 19

column1: uktāḥ saṃcarā etā śunāsīrīyāḥ śvetā vāyavyāḥ śvetāḥ sauryāḥ //
column2: Called contemporaneous, the dappled belong to Suna and Sîra; white ones to Vâyu; white ones to Sûrya. 20

column1: vasantāya kapiñjalān ā labhate grīṣmāya kalaviṅkān varṣābhyas tittirīñ charade vartikā hemantāya kakarāñ chiśirāya vikakarān //
column2: To Spring he offers Kapiñjalas; to Summer sparrows; to the Rains partridges; to Autumn quails; to Winter. Kakaras;

column1: samudrāya śiśumārān a labhate parjanyāya maṇḍūkān adbhyo matsyān mitrāya kulīpayān varuṇāya nākrān //
column2: To the Sea he sacrifices porpoises; to Parjanya frogs; to the Waters fishes; to Mitra Kulîpayas; to Varuna crocodiles.22

column1: somāya ham̐sān ā labhate vāyave balākā indrāgnibhyāṃ kruñcān mitrāya madgūn varuṇāya cakravākān //
column2: To Soma he sacrifices wild geese; to Vâyu female cranes; to Indra-Agni curlews; to Mitra divers; to Varuna Chakravâkas. 23

The tongue-tip for Sarasvatî; I gratify the root of the tongue and the palate with his neigh, Vâja with his jaws, the Waters with his mouth, the Stallion with his testicles, the Âdityas with the beard, Path with his eyebrows, Heaven and Earth with his eyelashes, Lightning with the pupils of his eyes. Hail to the white! Hail to the black! Effectual are his eyelashes, irresistible are his lower eyelashes;

column1: yat te sāde mahasā śūkṛtasya pārṣṇyā vā kaśayā vā tutoda / sruceva tā haviṣo adhvareṣu sarvā tā te brahmaṇā sūdayāmi //
column2: If one, when seated, with excessive urging hath with his heel or with his whip distressed thee, All these thy woes, as with oblation's ladle at sacrifices, with my prayer I banish. 41

column1: catustrim̐śad vājino devabandhor vaṅkrīr aśvasya svadhitiḥ sam eti / acchidrā gātrā vayunā kṛṇota paruṣ-parur anughuṣyā vi śasta //
column2: The four-and-thirty ribs of the swift Courser, kin to the Gods, the slayer's hatchet pierces.Cut ye with skill so that the parts be flawless, and piece by piece declaring them dissect them. 42

column1: ekas tvaṣṭur aśvasyā viśastā dvā yantārā bhavatas tatha ṛtuḥ / yā te gātrāṇām ṛtuthā kṛṇomi tā-tā piṇḍānāṃ pra juhomy agnau //
column2: Of Tvashtar's Courser there is one dissector: this is the custom: two there are who guide him. Such of his limbs as I divide in order, all these, amid the lumps, in fire I offer. 43

column1: mā tvā tapat priya ātmāpiyantaṃ mā svadhitis tanva ā tiṣṭhipat te / mā te gṛdhnur aviśastātihāya chidrā gātrāṇy asinā mithū kaḥ //
column2: Let not thy dear soul burn thee as thou comest, let not the hatchet linger in thy body. Let not a greedy clumsy immolator, missing the joints, mangle thy limbs unduly. 44

column1: na vā u etan mriyase na riṣyasi devām̐ id eṣi pathibhiḥ sugebhiḥ / harī te yuñjā pṛṣatī abhūtām upāsthād vājī dhuri rāsabhasya //
column2: No, here thou diest not, thou art not injured: only by easy paths to Gods thou goest. Both Bays, both Spotted Mares are now thy fellows, and to the Ass's pole is yoked the Courser. 45

column1: sugavyaṃ no vājī svaśvyaṃ pum̐saḥ putrām̐ uta viśvāpuṣam̐ rayim / anāgāstvaṃ no aditiḥ kṛṇotu kṣatraṃ no aśvo vanatām̐ haviṣmān //
column2: May this Steed bring us all-sustaining riches, wealth in good kine, good horses, manly offspring. Freedom from sin may Aditi vouchsafe us; the Steed with our oblations gain us lordship! 46

column1: imā nu kaṃ bhuvanā sīṣadhāmendraś ca viśve ca devāḥ / ādityair indraḥ sagaṇo marudbhir asmabhyaṃ bheṣajā karat / yajñaṃ ca nas tanvaṃ ca prajāṃ cādityair indraḥ saha sīṣadhāti //
column2: We will, with Indra and all Gods to help us, bring these existing worlds into subjection. With the Âdityas, with the band of Maruts, may Indra give us medicine to heal us. Our sacrifice, our bodies, and our offspring may Indra regulate with the Âdityas. 47

column1: agne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhava varūthyaḥ //
column2: O Agni, be our nearest Friend, etc., as in III. 25

column1: taṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ //
column2: To thee then, O Most Bright, etc., as in III. 26

column1: agniś ca pṛthivī ca saṃnate te me saṃ namatām adaḥ / vāyuś cāntarikṣaṃ ca saṃnate te me saṃ namatām adaḥ / ādityaś ca dyauś ca saṃnate te me saṃ namatām adaḥ / āpaś ca varuṇaś ca saṃnate te me saṃ namatām adaḥ / sapta sam̐sado aṣṭamī bhūtasādhanī / sakāmām̐ adhvanas kuru saṃjñānam astu me 'munā //
column2: AGNI and Prithivî, closely connected, may they bring low for me the boon I mention. Vâyu and Firmament, closely connected, may they, etc. Closely connected Dyaus and the Âditya, may they, etc. Closely connected Varuna and Waters, may they, etc. Lord of the seven communities and her who forms all beings, eighth, Make our ways full of pleasantness: may So-and-So and I agree. 2

column1: yathemāṃ vācaṃ kalyāṇīm āvadāni janebhyaḥ / brahmarājanyābhyām̐ śūdrāya cāryāya ca svāya cāraṇāya // priyo devānāṃ dakṣiṇāyai dātur iha bhūyāsam ayaṃ me kāmaḥ sam ṛdhyatām upa mādo namatu //
column2: That I to all the people may address this salutary speech, To priest and nobleman, Sûdra and Arya, to one of our own kin and to the stranger. Dear may I be to Gods and guerdon-giver. Fulfilled be this my hope: be that my portion! 3

column1: bṛhaspate ati yad aryo arhād dyumad vibhāti kratumaj janeṣu / yad dīdayac chavasa ṛtaprajāta tad asmāsu draviṇaṃ dhehi citram // upayāmagṛhīto 'si bṛhaspataye tvā / eṣa te yonir bṛhaspataye tvā //
column2: Give us, Brihaspati, that wondrous treasure, that which exceeds the merit of the foeman, Which shines among the folk effectual, splendid, that, Son of Law, which is with might refulgent. Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for Brihaspati. This is thy home. Thee for Brihaspati, 4

column1: indra gomann ihā yāhi pibā somam̐ śatakrato / vidyadbhir grāvabhiḥ sutam // upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā gomate / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā gomate // indrā yāhi vṛtrahan pibā somam̐ śatakrato / gomadbhir grāvabhiḥ sutam // upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā gomate / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā gomate //
column2: Come hither, Indra, rich in kine! Drink Soma, Lord of Hundred Powers, Effused by braying pressing-stones. Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for Indra, rich in kine. This is thy home. Thee for Indra, rich in kine.5 O Indra, Vritra-slayer, come. Drink Soma, Lord of Hundred Powers, Expressed with stones whose wealth is kine. Taken upon a base art thou, etc., as in verse 4

column1: ṛtāvānaṃ vaiśvānaram ṛtasya jyotiṣas patim / ajasraṃ gharmam īmahe // upayāmagṛhīto 'si vaiśvānarāya tvā / eṣa te yonir vaiśvānarāya tvā //
column2: Vaisvânara the righteous One, the Lord of sacrifice and light, The heat that wasteth not, we seek. Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for Vaisvânara. This is thy home: thee for Vaisvânara. 7

column1: vaiśvānarasya sumatau syāma rājā hi kaṃ bhuvanānām abhiśrīḥ / ito jāto viśvam idaṃ vi caṣṭe vaiśvānaro yatate sūryeṇa // upayāmagṛhīto 'si vaiśvānarāya tvā / eṣa te yonir vaiśvānarāya tvā //
column2: Still in Vaisvânara's grace may we continue: yea, he is King Supreme o’er all things living. Sprung hence to life upon this All he looketh. Vaisvânara hath rivalry with Sûrya. Taken upon a base art thou, etc., as in verse 6

column1: vaiśvānaro na ūtaya ā pra yātu parāvataḥ / agnir ukthena vāhasā //
column2: Hitherward come Vaisvânara to succour us from far away, Agni through laud that brings him near! Taken upon a base, etc, as in verse 6

column1: agnir ṛṣiḥ pavamānaḥ pāñcajanyaḥ purohitaḥ / tam īmahe mahāgayam // upayāmagṛhīto 'sy agnaye tvā varcase / eṣa te yonir agnaye tvā varcase //
column2: Agni is Pavamâna, Sage, the Tribe-Priest of the Races Five: To him of mighty wealth we pray. Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for lustre. This is thy home. Thee for lustre. 10

column1: mahām̐ indro vajrahastaḥ ṣoḍaśī śarma yacchatu / hantu pāpmānaṃ yo 'smān dveṣṭi // upayāmagṛhīto 'si mahendrāya tvā / eṣa te yonir mahendrāya tvā //
column2: May mighty Indra, thunder-armed, may Shodasî protect us well, and slay the wicked man who hateth us. Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for Mahendra. This is thy home. Thee for Mahendra. 11

column1: taṃ vo dasmam ṛtīṣahaṃ vasor mandānam andhasaḥ / abhi vatsaṃ na svasareṣu dhenava indraṃ gīrbhir navāmahe //
column2: As cows low to their calves in stalls so with our songs we glorify This Indra, e’en your wondrous God who checks assault, who joys in the delicious juice. 12

column1: yad vāhiṣṭhaṃ tad agnaye bṛhad arca vibhāvaso / mahiṣīva tvad rayis tvad vājā ud īrate //
column2: Agni's is the most fetching song. Shine mightily, thou rich in light! Like the Chief Consort of a King, riches and strength proceed from thee.13

column1: ehy ū ṣu bravāṇi te 'gna itthetarā giraḥ / ebhir vardhāsa indubhiḥ //
column2: Come, here, O Agni, will I sing verily other songs to thee, And with these drops shalt thou grow strong. 14

column1: ṛtavas te yajñaṃ vi tanvantu māsā rakṣantu te haviḥ / saṃvatsaras te yajñaṃ dadhātu naḥ prajāṃ ca pari pātu naḥ //
column2: The Seasons spread thy sacrifice! the Mouths protect thine offering! May the Year guard our sacrifice for thee and keep our children safe. 15

column1: upahvare girīṇām̐ saṃgame ca nadīnām / dhiyā vipro ajāyata //
column2: There where the mountains downward slope, there by the meeting of the streams The sage was manifest with song. 16

column1: uccā te jātam andhaso divi sad bhūmy ā dade / ugram̐ śarma mahi śravaḥ //
column2: High is thy juice's birth: though sat in heaven, on earth it hath obtained Strong sheltering power and great renown. 17

column1: sa na indrāya yajyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ / varivovit pari srava //
column2: Finder of room and freedom, flow for Indra, meet for worship, flow For Varuna and the Marut host. 18

column1: enā viśvāny arya ā dyumnāni mānuṣāṇām / siṣāsanto vanāmahe //
column2: Striving to win, with him we gain all wealth of the ungodly one, Yea, all the glories of mankind. 19

column1: anu vīrair anu puṣyāsma gobhir anv aśvair anu sarveṇa puṣṭaiḥ / anu dvipadānu catuṣpadā vayaṃ devā no yajñam ṛtuthā nayantu //
column2: May we be prosperous with brave sons, cattle, horses, each wish of ours, and varied blessings, With quadrupeds, and with the men about us. May the Gods guide our sacrifice in season. 20

column1: agne patnīr ihā vaha devānām uśatīr upa / tvaṣṭāram̐ somapītaye //
column2: O Agni, bring thou hitherward the yearning Consorts of the Gods Bring Tvashtar to the Soma-draught. 21

column1: abhi yajñaṃ gṛṇīhi no gnāvo neṣṭaḥ piba ṛtunā / tvam̐ hi ratnadhā asi //
column2: O Neshtar girt by Dames, accept our sacrifice: with Ritu drink, For thou art he who giveth wealth.22

column1: draviṇodāḥ pipīṣati juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata / neṣṭrād ṛtubhir iṣyata //
column2: He with the Ritus fain would drink, Wealth-river, from the Neshtar's bowl. Begin, pay offerings: hasten ye. 28

column1: tavāyam̐ somas tvam ehy arvāṅ chaśvattamam̐ sumanā asya pāhi / asmin yajñe barhiṣy ā niṣadyā dadhiṣvemaṃ jaṭhara indum indra //
column2: Thine is this Soma: come thou near, approach it. Drink thou thereof, benevolent, and cease not. Sit on the sacred grass at this our worship, and take these drops into thy belly, Indra. 24

column1: ameva naḥ suhavā ā hi gantana ni barhiṣi sadatanā raṇiṣṭana / athā mandasva jujuṣāṇo andhasas tvaṣṭar devebhir janibhiḥ sumadgaṇaḥ //
column2: Come unto us, ye swift to listen! as at home, upon the sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves. And, Tvashtar, well content be joyful in the juice with Gods and Goddesses in gladsome company. 25

column1: svādiṣṭhayā madiṣṭhayā pavasva soma dhārayā / indrāya pātave sutaḥ //
column2: In sweetest and most gladdening stream flow pure, O Soma, on thy way, Pressed out for Indra, for his drink. 26

column1: rakṣohā viśvacarṣaṇir abhi yonim ayohatam / druṇā sadhastham āsadat //
column2: Fiend-queller, Friend of all men, he hath in the vat attained unto His place, his iron-fashioned home.

column1: sās tvāgna ṛtavo vardhayantu saṃvatsarā ṛṣayo yāni satyā / saṃ divyena dīdihi rocanena viśvā ā bhāhi pradiśaś catasraḥ //
column2: HALF-YEARS and Seasons strengthen thee, O Agni, the Years and all the Verities and Rishis! Flash forth with thy celestial effulgence: illumine all four regions of the heaven. 2

column1: saṃ cedhyasvāgne pra ca bodhayainam uc ca tiṣṭha mahate saubhagāya / mā ca riṣad upasattā te agne brahmāṇas te yaśasaḥ santu mānye //
column2: Kindle thee, Agni, rake this man to knowledge: rise up erect for great and happy fortune. Agni, be those uninjured who adore thee, thy priests be glorious and none beside them! 3

column1: tvām agne vṛṇate brāhmaṇā ime śivo agne saṃvaraṇe bhavā naḥ / sapatnahā no abhimātijic ca sve gaye gāgṛhy aprayucchan //
column2: The Brahmans present here elect thee, Agni: be thou propitious in our sanctuary. Slayer of rivals, Agni, quell our foemen: watch in thy house with care that never ceases. 4

column1: ihaivāgne adhi dhārayā rayiṃ mā tvā ni kran pūrvacito nikāriṇaḥ / kṣatram agne suyamam astu tubhyam upasattā vardhatāṃ te aniṣṭṛtaḥ //
column2: Even here do thou, O Agni, stablish wealth: let not oppressors injure thee by thinking of thee first. Light be thy task of ruling, Agni, with thy power: may he who worships thee wax strong, invincible. 5

column1: kṣatreṇāgne svāyuḥ sam̐ rabhasva mitreṇāgne mitradheye yatasva / sajātānāṃ madhyamasthā edhi rājñām agne vihavyo dīdihīha //
column2: Kind to the people, grasp thy power, O Agni: contend thou with the Friend by way of friendship. Placed, Agni, in the centre of our kinsmen, flash forth to be invoked by Kings around thee. 6

column1: ati niho ati sridho 'ty acittim aty arātim agne / viśvā hy agne duritā sahasvāthāsmabhyam̐ sahavīrām̐ rayiṃ dāḥ //
column2: Past those who slay, past enemies, past thoughtless men, past those who hate,— Yes, Agni, drive away all woe and trouble: vouchsafe us opulence with men about us. 7

column1: anādhṛṣyo jātavedā anādhṛṣṭo virāḍ agne kṣatrabhṛd dīdihīha / viśvā āśāḥ pramuñcan mānuṣīr bhayaḥ śivebhir adya pari pāhi no vṛdhe //
column2: Holder of sway, shine here refulgent, Agni! invincible, unconquered Jâtavedas. Light all the regions, chasing human terrors: with happy helps guard us to-day for increase.8

column1: bṛhaspate savitar bodhayainam̐ sam̐śitaṃ cit saṃtarām̐ sam̐ śiśādhi / vardhayainaṃ mahate saubhagāya viśva enam anu madantu devāḥ //
column2: Brihaspati, Savitar, give this man knowledge: sharpen him thoroughly though already sharpened. To great and high felicity exalt him: in him let all the Gods rejoice and triumph. 9

column1: amutrabhūyādadha yad yamasya bṛhaspate abhisaster amuñcaḥ / praty auhatām aśvinā mṛtyum asmād devānām agne bhiṣajā śacībhiḥ //
column2: As thou, Brihaspati, from curse hast freed us, from dwelling yonder in the realm of Yama, The Asvins, Leeches of the Gods, O Agni, have chased Death far from us with mighty powers. 10

column1: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari svaḥ paśyanta uttaram / devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam //
column2: Looking upon the loftier light, etc., as in XX. 21

column1: ūrdhvā asya samidho bhavanty ūrdhvā śukrā śocīm̐ṣy agneḥ / dyumattamā supratīkasya sūnoḥ //
column2: Uplifted are the brands that are his fuel: lofty and brilliant are the flames of Agni, Splendidly bright of the Son fair of aspect. 13

column1: tanūnapād asuro viśvavedā devo deveṣu devaḥ / patho anaktu madhvā ghṛtena //
column2: Tanûnapât the Asura, all-possessing, God among Gods, the God with mead and butter shall bedew the paths. 13

column1: madhvā yajñaṃ nakṣase prīṇāno narāśam̐so agne / sukṛd devaḥ savitā viśvavāraḥ //
column2: With mead to sacrifice thou comest, Agni, earnest as friendly- minded Narâsamsa, and Savitar righteous God who brings all blessings. 14

column1: acchāyam eti śavasā ghṛteneḍāno vahnir namasā / agnim̐ sruco adhvareṣu prayatsu // sa yakṣad asya mahimānam agneḥ sa īṃ mandrā suprayasaḥ / vasuś vetiṣṭho vasudhātamaś ca //
column2: He cometh hitherward with power and fatness, the luminous, implored with adoration. While rites proceed the ladles move to Agni. 15 Let him pay worship to this Agni's greatness, daintily fed: he verily gives enjoyments: The wisest Vasu he, and best wealth giver. 16

column1: dvāro devīr anv asya viśve vratā dadante agneḥ / uruvyacaso dhāmnā patyamānāḥ //
column2: Widely expansive, ruling by foundation, the Doors divine— and, after, all— Preserve this Agni's holy works. 17

column1: te asya yoṣaṇe divye na yonā uṣāsānaktā / imaṃ yajñam avatām adhvaraṃ naḥ // daivyā hotārā ūrdhvam adhvaraṃ no 'gner juhvām abhi gṛṇītam / kṛṇutam naḥ sv"ṣṭam //
column2: May Dawn and Night protect—his heavenly Consorts—in a his home this our sacrificial worship. 18 Ye two celestial Hotars, greet with praises this lofty rite of ours, the tongue of Agni. Cause that our sacrifice be well conducted.19

column1: tisro devīr barhir idam̐ sadantv iḍā sarasvatī bhāratī / mahī gṛṇānā //
column2: Upon this grass three Goddesses be seated, Idâ, Sarasvatî, Bhâratî the Mighty glorified with song. 20

column1: tan nas turīpam adbhutaṃ purukṣu tvaṣṭā suvīryam / rāyaspoṣaṃ vi ṣyatu nābhim asme //
column2: This our productive wondrous flow may Tvashtar pour down on this man's kin, and wealth and heroes. 21

column1: vanaspate 'va sṛjā rarāṇas tmanā deveṣu / agnir havyam̐ śamitā sūdayāti //
column2: Vanaspatî, presenting of thyself, send God-ward! Let Agni, Immolator, season our oblation. 22

column1: agne svāhā kṛṇuhi jātavedo indrāya havyam / viśve devā havir idaṃ juṣantām //
column2: Pay sacrifice to Indra, Jâtavedas Agni! with Hail! All Gods accept the gift we offer! 23

column1: pīvoannā rayiṃvṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutām abhiśrīḥ / te vāyave samanaso vi tasthur viśven naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ //
column2: Wise, bright, arranger of his teams, he seeketh men with rich food whose treasures are abundant. They have stood firm of one accord with Vâyu: yea, the men wrought all noble operations. 24

column1: rāye nu yaṃ jajñatū rodasīme rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam / adha vāyuṃ niyutaḥ saścata svā uta śvetaṃ vasudhitiṃ nireke //
column2: The God whom both these worlds brought forth for riches, whom heavenly Dhishanâ for our wealth appointeth— His team of harnessed horses waits on Vâyu and, foremost, on the radiant treasure-holder. 26

column1: āpo ha yad bṛhatīr viśvam āyan garbhaṃ dadhānā janayantīr agnim / tato devānām̐ sam avartatāsur ekaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema //
column2: What time the mighty waters came containing the universal germ, producing Agni, Thence sprang the Gods’ one spirit into being. What God shall we adore with our oblation? 26

column1: yaś cid āpo mahinā paryapaśyad dakṣaṃ dadhānā janayantīr yajñam / yo deveṣv adhi deva eka āsīt kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema //
column2: Who in his might surveyed the floods enclosing productive force and generating Worship, He who is God mid Gods, and none beside him—What God shall we adore with our oblation? 27

column1: pra yābhir yāsi dāśvām̐sam acchā niyudbhir vāyav iṣṭaye duroṇe / ni no rayim̐ subhojasaṃ yuvasva ni vīraṃ gavyam aśvyaṃ ca rādhaḥ //
column2: The teams wherewith thou seekest him who offers, within his house, O Vâyu, to direct him, Therewith send wealth to us with full enjoyment, a hero son and gifts of kine and horses. 28

column1: ā no niyudbhiḥ śatinībhir adhvaram̐ sahasriṇībhir upa yāhi yajñam / vāyo asmin savane mādayasva yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
column2: With thy yoked teams in hundreds and in thousands come to our sacrifice and solemn worship. O Vâyu, make thee glad at this libation. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.29

column1: niyutvān vāyav ā gahy ayam̐ śukro ayāmi te / gantāsi sunvato gṛham //
column2: Drawn by thy team, O Vâyu, come: to thee is offered this, the pure. Thou visitest the presser's house. 30

column1: vāyo śukro ayāmi te madhvo agraṃ diviṣṭiṣu / ā yāhi somapītaye spārho deva niyutvatā //
column2: Vâyu, the bright is offered thee, best of the meath at holy rites. Come thou to drink the Soma juice, God longed-for, on thy team-drawn car. 31

column1: vāyur agregā yajñaprīḥ sākaṃ gan manasā yajñam / śivo niyudbhiḥ śivābhiḥ //
column2: Lover of worship, leader, come Vâyu with thought, to sacrifice, Propitious with propitious teams! 32

column1: vāyo ye te sahasriṇo rathāsas tebhir ā gahi / niyutvānt somapītaye //
column2: With all the thousand chariots that are thine, O Vâyu, come to us, Team-drawn, to drink the Soma juice. 33

column1: ekayā ca daśabhiś ca svabhūte dvābhyām iṣṭaye vim̐śatī ca / tisṛbhiś ca vahase trim̐śatā ca niyudbhir vāyav iha tā vi muñca //
column2: Come thou with one, and ten, O Self-Existent! with two unto the sacrifice, and twenty. Three are the teams and thirty which convey thee. O Vâyu, in this place unyoke thy coursers. 34

column1: tava vāyav ṛtaspate tvaṣṭur jāmātar adbhuta / avām̐sy ā vṛṇīmahe //
column2: Wonderful Vâyu, Lord of Truth, thou who art Tvashtar's Son in-law, Thy saving succour we elect. 35

column1: abhi tvā śūra nonumo 'dugdhā iva dhenavaḥ / īśānam asya jagataḥ svardṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ //
column2: Like kine unmilked we call aloud, Hero, to thee and sing thy praise, Looker on heavenly light, Lord of this moving world, Lord, Indra! of what moveth not. 36

column1: na tvāvām̐ anyo divyo na pārthivo na jāto na janiṣyate / aśvāyanto maghavann indra vājino gavyantas tvā havāmahe //
column2: None other like to thee, of earth or of the heavens, hath been or ever will be born. Desiring horses, Indra, Bounteous Lord! and kine, as men of might we call on thee. 37

column1: tvām id dhi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ / tvāṃ vṛtreṣv indra satpatiṃ naras tvāṃ kāṣṭhāsv arvataḥ //
column2: That we may win us wealth and power, we poets call on only thee. In war men call on thee, Indra! the hero's Lord, in the steed's race-course call on thee. 38

column1: sa tvaṃ naś citra vajrahasta dhṛṣṇuyā maha stavāno adrivaḥ / gām aśvam̐ rathyam indra saṃ kira satrā vājaṃ na jigyuṣe //
column2: As such, O Wonderful, whose hand holds thunder, praised as mighty, Caster of the Stone!Pour on us boldly, Indra, kine and chariot-steeds ever to be the conqueror's strength. 39

column1: kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā / kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā //
column2: What succour will he bring to us, wonderful, ever-prospering Friend? With what most mighty company? 40

column1: kas tvā satyo madānāṃ mam̐hiṣṭho matsad andhasaḥ / dṛḍhā cid āruje vasu //
column2: What, genuine and most liberal draught will spirit thee with juice to burst Open e’en strongly-guarded wealth 41

column1: abhī ṣu ṇaḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām / śataṃ bhavāsy ūtaye //
column2: Do thou who art protector of us thy friends who praise thee With hundred aids approach us. 42

column1: yajñā-yajñā vo agnaye girā-girā ca dakṣase / pra-pra vayam amṛtaṃ jātavedasaṃ priyaṃ mitraṃ na śam̐siṣam //
column2: Sing to your Agni with each song, at every sacrifice, for strength. Come, let us praise the Wise and Everlasting God even as a well-belovèd Friend. 43

column1: pāhi no agna ekayā pāhy uta dvitīyayā / pāhi gīrbhis tisṛbhir ūrjāṃ pate pāhi catasṛbhir vaso //
column2: Protect us, Agni, through the first, protect us through the second hymn. Protect us through three hymns, O Lord of Power and Might; through four hymns, Vasu! guard thou us. 44

column1: ūrjo napātam̐ sa hināyam asmayur dāśema havyadātaye / bhuvad vājeṣv avitā bhuvad vṛdha uta trātā tanūnām //
column2: The Son of Strength; for is he not our Friend? Let us serve him for offering our gifts. In battles may he be our help and strengthener, yea, be the saviour of our lives. 45

column1: saṃvatsaro 'si parivatsaro 'sīdāvatsaro 'sīdvatsaro 'si vatsaro 'si / uṣasas te kalpantām ahorātrās te kalpantām ardhamāsās te kalpantāṃ māsās te kalpantām ṛtavas te kalpantām̐ saṃvatsaras te kalpatām / pretyā etyai saṃ cāñca pra ca sāraya / suparṇacid asi tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvaḥ sīda //
column2: Thou art Samvatsara; thou art Parivatsara; thou art Idâvatsara; thou art Idvatsara; thou art Vatsara. Prosper thy Dawns! Prosper thy Day-and-Nights! Prosper thy Half-months, Months, Seasons, and Years! Combine them for their going and their coming, and send then forward on their ordered courses. In eagle's shape thou art piled up and layered. With that divinity, Angiras-like, lie steady.

column1: hotā yakṣad samidhendram iḍas pade nābhā pṛthivyā adhi / divo varṣmant sam idhyata ojiṣṭhaś carṣaṇīsahāṃ vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: ON the earth's centre, at libation's place let the Priest worship Indra with the kindling-stick. The mightiest of the lords of men is kindled on the height of heaven. Let him enjoy the butter. Hotar, worship. 2

column1: hotā yakṣat tanūnapātam ūtibhir jetāram aparājitam / indraṃ devam̐ svarvidaṃ pathibhir madhumattamair narāśam̐sena tejasā vetv ājyasya hotar yaja // hotā yakṣad iḍābhir indram īḍitam ājuhvānam amartyam / devo devaiḥ savīryo vajrahastaḥ puraṃdaro vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: the conqueror never overcome, Indra, the God who finds heaven's light on paths most rich in pleasant sweets, with Narâsamsa all aglow. Let him enjoy, etc., as in verse 1 With viands let the Hotar worship Indra immortal, praised, receiver of oblations. The God, the equal of the Gods in vigour, the thunder-wielder, breaker-down of castles. Let him enjoy, etc. 4

column1: hotā yakṣad bariṣīndraṃ niṣadvaraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ naryāpasam / vasubhī rudrair ādityaiḥ suyugbhir barhir āsadad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest worship Indra, Bull who sitteth on sacred grass, doer of manly actions. Let him be seated on the grass with Vasus and Rudras and Âdityas for companions. Let him enjoy, etc. 5

column1: hotā yakṣad ojo na vīryam̐ saho dvāra indram avardhayan / suprāyaṇā asmin yajñe vi śrayantām ṛtāvṛdho svāra indrāya mīḍhuṣe vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest sacrifice. The Doors have strengthened Indra, his force and conquering might and vigour. At this our worship let the Doors be opened, easy to pass, the strengtheners of Order: wide let them open out for bounteous Indra. Let them enjoy, etc. 6

column1: hotā yakṣad uṣe indrasya dhenū sudughe mātarā mahī / savātarau na tejasā vatsam indram avardhatāṃ vītām ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest sacrifice to Night and Morning, the teeming Cows of Indra, Mighty Mothers. Indra their calf with lustre have they strengthened, even as two mothers of a calf in common. Let them enjoy, etc. 7

column1: hotā yakṣad daivyā hotārā bhiṣajā sakhāyā haviṣendraṃ bhiṣajyataḥ / kavī devau pracetasāv indrāya dhatta indriyaṃ vītām ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest worship both the heavenly Hotars, Friends, Leeches, healing Indra with oblation. The sages, Gods preëminent for wisdom bestow on Indra his surpassing power. Let them enjoy, etc.8

column1: hotā yakṣat tisro devīr na bheṣajaṃ trayas tridhātavo 'pasa iḍā sarasvat bhāratī mahīḥ / indrapatnīr haviṣmatīr vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest offer sacrifice to the three Goddesses and balm. Let the three triple active Ones, let Idâ and Sarasvatî and Bhâratî the mighty Dames, Consorts of Indra, who receive our sacrificial offerings, enjoy the butter, etc. 9

column1: hotā yakṣat tvaṣṭāram indraṃ devaṃ bhiṣajam̐ suyajaṃ ghṛtaśriyam / pururūpam̐ suretasaṃ maghonam indrāya tvaṣṭā dadhad indriyāṇi vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest worship Tvashtar radiant Indra, Physician good at sacrifice, graced with butter, Multiform and prolific, rich and bounteous. Let Tvashtar, giving wondrous powers to Indra, enjoy, etc. 10

column1: hotā yakṣad vanaspatim̐ śamitāram̐ śatakratuṃ dhiyo joṣṭāram indriyam / madhvā samañjan pathibhiḥ sugebhiḥ svadāti yajñaṃ madhunā ghṛtena vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest worship him, the Forest-Sovran, the Immolator, Lord of Hundred Powers, the lover of the prayer, the friend of Indra. Balming with mead, may he on easy pathways sweeten our sacrifice with savoury butter. Let him enjoy, etc. 11

column1: hotā yakṣad indram̐ svāhājyasya svāhā medasaḥ svāhā stokānām̐ svāhā svāhākṛtīnām̐ svāhā havyasūktīnām / svāhā devā ājyapā juṣāṇā indra ājyasya vyantu hotar yaja //
column2: with Hail! to Gods of drops; with Hail! to Gods of offerings paid with Svâhâ; with Hail! to Gods of sacrificial hymns. All hail! May butter-drinking Gods and Indra rejoicing taste the butter. Hotar, worship. 12

column1: devaṃ barhir indram̐ sudevaṃ devair vīravat stīrṇaṃ vedyām avardhayat / vastor vṛtaṃ prāktor bhṛtam̐ rāyā barhiṣmato 'ty agād vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja // devīr dvāra indram̐ saṃghāte vīḍvīr yāmann avardhayan / ā vatsena taruṇena kumāreṇa ca mīvatāpārvāṇam̐ reṇukakāṭaṃ nudantāṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: Vigorous, strewn by Gods upon the altar the right Gods’ sacred Grass hath strengthened Indra. Cut in the day, cherished by night it hath surpassed those who have sacrificial Grass with wealth. For gain of riches let him taste. Pay sacrifice. 13 Firm, closely joined, the Doors divine have strengthened Indra in the rite. Pressed by a calf or tender boy may they drive off the courser as he tosses up the sand. For gain of wealth let then enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 14

column1: devī uṣāsānaktendraṃ yajñe prayaty ahvetām / daivīr viśaḥ prāyāsiṣṭām̐ suprīte sudhite vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja // devī joṣṭrī vasudhitī devam indram avardhatām / ayāvy anyāghā dveṣām̐sy ānyā vakṣad vasu vāryāṇi yajamānāya śikṣite vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
column2: Morning and Night, the Goddesses, have called on Indra as the rite advanced. May they well-pleased and ordered well make the Celestial Tribes come forth. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay sacrifice.15 Two Goddesses, wealth-givers, kind, have heightened radiant Indra's strength. One drives away hatreds and sins;

column1: devī ūrjāhutī dughe payasendram avardhatām / iṣam ūrjam anyā vakṣat sagdhim̐ sapītim anyā navena pūrvaṃ dayamāne purāṇena navam adhātām ūrjam ūrjāhutī ūrjayamāne vasu vṛyāṇi yajamānāya śikṣite vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
column2: the other shall bring the Sacrificer boons and treasure. Instructed, let them both enjoy, for gain of wealth. Pay sacrifice. 16 Bringers of strengthening sacrifice, the Goddesses, the teeming Cows, have prospered Indra with their milk. Let one bring food and energy, the other feast and banqueting. Bringers of strengthening sacrifice, allotting the several portions they have put together old energy with new and new with olden, strengthening boons and treasures for the Sacrificer. Instructed, let them, etc., as in verse 15

column1: devā devyā hotārā devam indram avardhatām / hatāghaśam̐sāv ābhārṣṭāṃ vasu vāryāṇi yajamānāya śikṣitau vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
column2: The two Celestial Hotars, Gods, have heightened radiant Indra's might. Freed from slain sinners these have brought the Sacrificer wealth and boons. Instructed, let them, etc. 18

column1: devīs tisras tisro devīḥ patim indram avardhayan / aspṛkṣad bhāratī divam̐ rudrair yajñam̐ sarasvatīḍā vasumatī gṛhān vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: Goddesses three, three Goddesses have heightened their Lord Indra's strength. One, Bhâratî, hath touched the sky, Sarasvatî the sacrifice with Rudras, and, enriched with wealth, Idâ the homesteads of the folk. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 19

column1: deva indro narāśam̐sas trivarūthas tribandhuro devam indram avardhayat / śatena śitipṛṣṭhānām āhitaḥ sahasreṇa pra vartate mitrāvaruṇed asya hotram arhato bṛhaspati stotram aśvinādhvaryavaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
column2: The radiant Indra, Praise of Men, thrice-shielding, borne on three car-seats, hath heightened radiant Indra's strength. Set on a hundred white-backed cows, yea, on a thousand forth he goes. Mitra and Varuna alone deserve to be his Hotar-Priests, Brihaspati his Chanter, and the Asvins his Adhvaryavas. For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 20

column1: devo devair vanaspatir hiraṇyaparṇo madhuśākhaḥ supippalo devam indram avardhayat / divam agreṇāspṛkṣad āntariksaṃ pṛthivīm adṛmhīd vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
column2: Vanaspatî, a God with Gods, with golden leaves, sweet boughs, fair fruit, hath heightened radiant Indra's strength. Sky with his summit hath he touched, and firmament, and stablished earth. For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay sacrifice.21

column1: devaṃ barhir vāritīnāṃ devam indram avardhayat / svāsastham indreṇāsannam anyā barhīm̐ṣy abhy abhūd vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
column2: The grassy robe of water-plants, divine, hath heightened Indra's strength. This, the fair seat where Indra sits, hath topped all other sacred grass. For gain of wealth let it enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 22

column1: devo agniḥ sviṣṭakṛd devam indram avardhayat / sv"ṣṭaṃ kurvant sviṣṭakṛt sv"ṣṭam adya karotu no vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
column2: Agni, Fair-offering-maker, bright, hath heightened radiant Indra's strength. To-day may Svishtakrit, Fair-offering-maker, paying good sacrifice, for us perform it. For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 23

column1: agnim adya hotāram avṛṇītāyaṃ yajamānaḥ pacan paktīḥ pacan puroḍāśaṃ badhnann indrāya chāgam / sūpasthā adya devo vanaspatir abhavad indrāya chāgena / aghat taṃ medastaḥ prati pacatāgrabhīd avīvṛdhat puroḍāśena //
column2: To-day the Sacrificer hath elected—dressing messes of cooked food and a rice-cake, binding a goat for Indra—Agni as his Hotar. To-day divine Vanaspatî hath with a goat served Indra well. He hath eaten from the fat, he hath accepted the cooked food, he hath waxed strong with the rice-cake. Thee, to-day, O Rishi, etc., as in XXI. 61

column1: hotā yakṣat samidhānaṃ mahad yaśaḥ susamiddhaṃ vareṇyam agnim indraṃ vayodhasam / gāyatrīṃ chanda indriyaṃ tryaviṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja // hotā yakṣat tanūnapātam udbhidaṃ yaṃ garbham aditir dadhe śucim indraṃ vayodhasam / uṣṇihaṃ chanda indriyaṃ dityavāhaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest worship Agni, Indra, kindled, splendidly kindled, excellent strength-giver, Lending him mighty power, Gâyatrî metre, a cow aged eighteen months, and vital vigour. Let him enjoy the butter. Hotar, worship. 25 Let the Priest serve with sacrifice him who breaks forth, Tanûnapât, the germ which Aditi conceived, pure Indra who bestoweth strength, Bringing him mighty power, the Ushnih metre, an ox of two years old, and vital vigour. Let him enjoy;

column1: hotā yakṣad īḍenyam īḍitaṃ vṛtrahantamam iḍābhir īḍyam̐ sahaḥ somam indram̐ vayodhasam / anuṣṭubhaṃ chanda indriyaṃ pañcāviṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja // hotā yakṣat subarhiṣaṃ pūṣaṇvantam amartyam̐ sīdantaṃ barhiṣi priye 'mṛtendraṃ vayodhasam / bṛhatīṃ chanda indriyaṃ trivatsaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest sacrifice to Soma, Indra, adorable, adored, best Vritra-slayer, strength-giver, might, to be adored with viands, Bringing him mighty power, Anushtup metre, a cow of thirty months, and vital vigour. Let him enjoy, etc 27 Let the Priest worship Indra, strength-bestower, immortal, with fair grass, allied with Pûshan, seated on sacred grass, dear, everlasting, Bringing him mighty power, Brihatî metre, a steer of three years’ age and vital vigour. Let him enjoy, etc. 28

column1: hotā yakṣad vyacasvatīḥ suprāyaṇā ṛtāvṛdho dvāro devīr hiraṇyayīr brahmāṇam indraṃ vayodhasam / paṅktiṃ chanda ihendriyaṃ turyavāhaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest worship the wide-opening Portals, easy to pass, divine, Law-strengthening, golden, Indra, the Brahman Priest, the strength-bestower,Bringing him mighty power, the Pankti metre, a bullock four years old, and vital vigour. Let them enjoy the butter. Hotar, worship. 29

column1: hotā yakṣat supeśasā suśilpe bṛhatī ubhe naktoṣāsā na darśate viśvam indraṃ vayodhasam / triṣṭubhaṃ chanda ihendriyaṃ paṣṭhavahaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vītām ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest worship lofty Night and Morning, well-decked, of varied hue, lovely to look on, Indra the Universal, strength-bestower, Bringing him mighty power, the Trishtup metre, a bullock four years old, and vital vigour. Let them enjoy the butter. Hotar, worship. 30

column1: hotā yakṣat pracetasā devānām uttamaṃ yaśo hotārā daivyā kavī sayujendraṃ vayodhasam / jagatīṃ chanda indriyam anaḍvāhaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vītām ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest worship both celestial Hotars, the Gods’ best glory, sages famed for wisdom, the two companions, Indra strength-bestower, Bringing him mighty power, Jagatî metre, an ox that draws the wain, and vital vigour. Let them enjoy the butter. Hotar, worship. 31

column1: hotā yakṣat peśasvatīs tisro devīr hiraṇyayīr bhāratīr bṛhatīr mahīḥ patim indraṃ vayodhasam / virājaṃ chanda ihendriyaṃ dhenuṃ gāṃ na vayo dadhad vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest sacrifice to three well-decorated Goddesses, gold-decked, great, lofty, Bhâratîs, Indra their Lord who giveth strength, Bringing him mighty power, Virâj the metre, and a cow in milk. Let him enjoy the butter. Hotar, worship. 32

column1: hotā yakṣat suretasaṃ tvaṣṭāraṃ puṣṭivardhanam̐ rūpāṇi bibhrataṃ pṛthak puṣṭim indraṃ vayodhasam / dvipadaṃ chanda indriyam ukṣāṇaṃ gāṃ na vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja // hotā yakṣad vanaspatim̐ śamitāram̐ śatakratum̐ hiraṇyaparṇam ukthinam̐ raśanāṃ bibhrataṃ vaśiṃ bhagam indraṃ vayodhasam / kakubhaṃ chanda ihendriyaṃ vaśāṃ vehataṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest worship Tvashtar the prolific, strengthener of growth, maintaining varied growth and form, Indra who giveth vital force, Bringing him Dvipad metre, mighty power, and an ox full-grown. Let him enjoy the butter. Hotar, sacrifice. 33 Let the Priest serve with sacrifice the Forest Lord Vanaspatî, the Immolator, hundred-powered, praise-worthy, golden-leafed, who wears the girdle, loved, the gracious Lord, Indra who gives the strength of life, Giving him Kakup metre, mighty power, a barren, a calf- slipping cow, and vital vigour. Let him enjoy the butter. Hotar, sacrifice. 34

column1: hotā yakṣat svāhākṛtīr agniṃ gṛhapatiṃ pṛthag varuṇaṃ bheṣajaṃ kaviṃ kṣatram indraṃ vayodhasam / aticchandasaṃ chanda indriyaṃ bṛhad ṛṣabhaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
column2: Let the Priest offer worship to the Svâhâkriti Goddesses, to Agni Household Lord apart, to Varuna the Leech and Sage. might, Indra who bestoweth strength, Bringing him Atichhandas metre, great and mighty power, a strong bull, his prime, and vital vigour. Let them enjoy the butter. Hotar, sacrifice.35

column1: devaṃ barhir vayodhasaṃ devam indram avardhayat / gāyatryā chandasendriyaṃ cakṣur indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja // devīr dvāro vayodhasam̐ śucim indram avardhayan / uṣṇihā chandasendriyaṃ prāṇam indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja // devī uṣāsānaktā devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devī devam avardhatām / anuṣṭubhā chandasendriyaṃ balam indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
column2: The Grass divine hath added might to radiant Indra strength-giver, Laying in Indra wondrous power and sight and strength by Gâyatrî. For gain of wealth let him enjoy the butter. Offer sacrifice. 36 The Doors divine have magnified bright Indra, who bestoweth strength. With Ushnih laying mighty power in Indra, vital breath and force. For gain of wealth let them enjoy the butter. Offer sacrifice. 37 Morning and Night, divine Ones, have strengthened bright Indra, strength-giver, the Goddesses advanced the God, With the Anushtup laying power in Indra, strength and vital force. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 38

column1: devī joṣṭrī vasudhitī devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devī devam avardhatām / bṛhatyā chandasendriyam̐ śrotram indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja // devī ūrjāhutī dughe sudughe payasendraṃ vayodhasaṃ devī devam avardhatām / paṅktyā chandasendriyam̐ śukram indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
column2: Kind, bounteous, and divine, they have strengthened bright Indra, force-giver, the Goddesses advanced the God, Laying in Indra power and force and hearing with the Brihatî. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 39 Bringers of strengthening sacrifice, the Goddesses, two teeming cows, have heightened Indra's power with milk, Laying bright power in Indra with Pankti, and vital energy. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 40

column1: devā daivyā hotārā devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devau devam avardhatām / triṣṭubhā chandasendriyaṃ tviṣim indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja // devīs tisras tisro devīr vayodhasaṃ patim indram avardhayan / jagatyā chandasendriyam̐ śūṣam indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
column2: The Gods, two heavenly Hotars, have strengthened bright Indra, force-giver, those Gods have magnified the God, With Trishtup giving Indra power, impetuous might, and vital strength. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 41 Goddesses three, three Goddesses have heightened their Lord Indra's strength, his who bestoweth vital force, Laying in Indra power and might and vital strength with Jagatî. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 42

column1: devo narāśam̐so devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devo devam avardhayat / virājā chandasendriyam̐ rupam indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja // devo vanaspatir devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devo devam avardhayat / dvipadā chandasendriyaṃ bhagam indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja // devaṃ barhir vāritīnāṃ devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devaṃ devam avardhayat / kakubhā chandasendriyaṃ yaśa indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
column2: The God, the Praise of all men, hath strengthened bright Indra force-giver, the God hath magnified the God, Laying in Indra with Virâj beauty and power and vital force. For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 43 The God the Forest Sovran hath strengthened bright Indra, force-giver, the God hath magnified the God, With Dvipad storing Indra with fortune and power and vital strength. For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay sacrifice.44 The Grass divine of water-plants hath helped bright Indra force-giver, the God hath magnified the God, Laying in Indra mighty power with Kakup, fame and vital strength. For gain of wealth let it enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 45

column1: agnim adya hotāram avṛṇītāyaṃ yajamānaḥ pacan paktīḥ pacan puroḍāśaṃ badhnann indrāya vayodhase chāgam / sūpasthā adya devo vanaspatir abhavad indrāya vayodhase chāgena / aghat taṃ medastaḥ prati pacatāgrabhīd avīvṛdhat puroḍāśena //
column2: Agni, the God who makes fair rites, hath strengthened Indra force-giver, the God hath magnified the God, Laying with Atichhandas power in Indra, sway, and vital strength. For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay sacrifice. 46 To-day the Sacrificer hath elected, etc., as in verse 23

column1: agnaye gāyatrāya trivṛte rāthantarāyāṣṭākapāla indrāya traiṣṭubhāya pañcadaśāya barhatāyaikādaśakapālo viśvebhyo devebhyo jāgatebhyaḥ saptadaśebhyo vairūpebhyo dvādaśakapālo mitrāvaruṇābhyām ānuṣṭubhābhyām ekavim̐śābhyāṃ vairājābhyāṃ payasyā bṛhaspataye pāṅktāya triṇavāya śākvarāya caruḥ savitra auṣṇihāya trayastrim̐śāya raivatāya dvādaśakapālaḥ prājāpatyaś carur adityai viṣṇupatnyai carur agnaye vaiśvānarāya dvādaśakapālo 'numatyā aṣṭākapālaḥ //
column2: To Agni of the Gâyatrî, of the Trivrit hymn and of the Rathantara Sâman is to be offered a rice-cake on eight potsherds; to Indra of the Trishtup, the Pañchadasa hymn and the Brihat Sâman one on eleven potsherds; to the All-Gods of the Jagatî, the Seventeenfold hymn and the Vairûpa Sâman, one on twelve potsherds; to Mitra-Varuna of the Anushtup, the Ekavimsa hymn, and the Vairâja Sâman, a mess of curdled milk; to Brihaspati of the Pankti metre, the Trinava hymn, and the Sâkvara Sâman, an oblation of rice boded in milk;

column1: deva savitaḥ pra suva yajñaṃ pra suva yajñapatiṃ bhagāya / divyo gandharvaḥ ketupūḥ ketaṃ naḥ punātu vācaspatir vājaṃ naḥ svadatu //
column2: OUR sacrifice, God Savitar! speed onward: speed to his share the sacrifice's patron. May the Celestial Gandharva, cleanser of thought and will, make clean our thoughts and wishes. The Lord of Speech sweeten the words we utter! 2

column1: tat savitur vareṇyaṃ bhargo devasya dhīmahi / dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayat //
column2: May we attain that excellent glory of Savitar the God: So may he stimulate our prayers. 3

column1: viśvāni deva savitar duritāni parā suva / yad bhadraṃ tan na ā suva //
column2: Savitar, God, send far away all troubles and calamities, And send us only what is good. 4

column1: vibhaktāram̐ havāmahe vasoś citrasya rādhasaḥ / savitāraṃ nṛcakṣasam //
column2: We call on him distributer of wondrous bounty and of wealth, On Savitar who looks on men. 5

column1: brahmaṇe brāhmaṇaṃ kṣatrāya rājanyaṃ marudbhyo vaiśyaṃ tapase śūdraṃ tamase taskaraṃ nārakāya vīrahaṇaṃ pāpmane klībam ākrayāyā ayogūṃ kāmāya pum̐ścalūm atikruṣṭāya māgadham //
column2: For Brahman (Priesthood) he binds a Brahman to the stake; for Kshatra (Royalty) a Râjanya; for the Maruts a Vaisya; for Penance a Sûdra; for Darkness a robber;

column1: nṛttāya sūtaṃ gītāya śailūṣaṃ dharmāya sabhācaraṃ nariṣṭhāyai bhīmalaṃ narmāya rebham̐ hasāya kārim ānandāya strīṣukhaṃ pramade kumārīputraṃ medhāyai rathakāraṃ dhairyāya takṣāṇam //
column2: for Sport a chatterer; for Laughter an artist; for Pleasure a woman-lover; for Desire a damsel's son; for Dexterity a car-builder;

column1: tapase kaulālaṃ māyāyai karmāram̐ rūpāya maṇikāram̐ śubhe vapam̐ śaravyāyā iṣukāram̐ hetyai dhanuṣkāraṃ karmaṇe jyākāraṃ diṣṭāya rajjusarjaṃ mṛtyave mṛgayum antakāya śvaninam //
column2: for Action a bowstring-maker; for Fate a rope-maker; for Death a hunter; for the Finisher a dog-leader; For Rivers a fisherman;

column2: for Serpents and Genii an untrustworthy man; for Dice a gambler; for Excitement a non-gambler; for Pisâchas a woman who splits cane; for Yâtudhânas a woman who works in thorns;

column2: for Nirriti a younger brother who has married before his elder; for Misfortune the husband of a younger sister whose elder sister has not been married; for Representation a woman who embroiders; for Agreement a woman who deals in love-charms; for Garrulity a by-sitter;

column1: utsādebhyaḥ kubjaṃ pramude vāmanaṃ dvārbhyaḥ srāmam̐ svapnāyāndham ardhamāya badhiraṃ pavitrāya bhiṣajaṃ prajñānāya nakṣatradarśam āśikṣāyai praśninam upaśikṣāyā abhipraśninaṃ maryādāyai praśnavivākam //
column2: for Unrighteousness a deaf man; for Purifying Medium a physician; for Insight an astrologer; for Craving for Knowledge an inquisitive man; for Desire of extra Knowledge an extra-inquisitive man;
