column2: for Keenness a goatherd; for Refreshment a ploughman; for Sweet Beverage a preparer of Surâ; for Weal a house-guard; for Well-being a possessor of wealth;

column1: bhāyai dārvāhāraṃ prabhāyā agnyedhaṃ bradhnasya viṣṭapāyābhiṣektāraṃ varṣiṣṭhāya nākāya pariveṣṭāraṃ devalokāya peśitāraṃ manuṣyalokāya prakaritāram̐ sarvebhyo lokebhya upasektāram avaṛtyai badhāyopamanthitāraṃ medhāya vāsaḥpalpūlīṃ prakāmāya rajayitrīm //
column2: for Highest Heaven a high steward; for the World of Gods a carver; for the World of Men a distributer; for All-Worlds a pourer-out: for Poverty, Affliction a stirrer-up of strife; for Sacrifice a washerwoman;

column1: ṛtaye stenahṛdayaṃ vairahatyāya piśunaṃ viviktyai kṣattāram aupadraṣṭryāyānukṣattāraṃ bālāyānucaraṃ bhūmne pariṣkandaṃ priyāya priyavādinam ariṣṭyā aśvasādam̐ svargāya lokāya bhāgadughaṃ varṣiṣṭhāya nākāya pariveṣṭāram //
column2: for the Beloved a sweet speaker; for Safety the rider of a horse; for the World of Svarga a dealer-out of portions; for Highest Heaven a high steward; For Passion an iron-smelter;

column1: manyave 'yastāpaṃ krodhāya nisaraṃ yogāya yoktāram̐ śokāyābhisartāraṃ kṣemāya vimoktāram utkūlebhyas triṣṭhinaṃ vapuṣe mānaskṛtam̐ śīlāyāñjanīkārīṃ nirṛtyai kośakārīṃ yamāyāsūm //
column2: for Quiet an unyoker; for Up-hill and Down-hill one who stands on three legs; for Form a conceited man; for Virtue a female ointment-maker; for Nirriti a female scabbard-maker;

column1: yamāya yamasūm atharvabhyo 'vatokām̐ saṃvatsarāya paryāyiṇīṃ parivatsarāyāvijātām idāvatsarāyātītvarīm idvatsarāyātiṣkadvarīṃ vatsarāya vijarjarām̐ saṃvatsarāya paliknīm ṛbhubhyo 'jinasaṃdham̐ sādhyebhyaś carmamnam //
column2: for the Parivatsara one who has not borne a child; for the Idâvatsara one who exceeds; for the Idvatsara one who transgresses; for the Vatsara one who is worn out; for the Samvatsara one with grey hair;

column1: sarebhyo dhaivaram upasthāvarābhyo dāśaṃ vaiśantābhyo baindaṃ naḍvalābhyaḥ śauṣkalaṃ pārāya mārgāram avarāya kevartaṃ tīrthebhya āndaṃ viṣamebhyo mainālam̐ svanebhyaḥ parṇakaṃ guhābhyaḥ kirātam̐ sānubhyo jambhakaṃ parvatebhyaḥ kimpūruṣam //
column2: for Fords an Âuda; for shallows a Mainâla;for Sounds a Bhilla; for Caverns a Kirâta; for Mountain-heights a destructive savage; for Mountains a wild man;

column1: bībhatsāyai paulkasaṃ varṇāya hiraṇyakāraṃ tulāyai vāṇijaṃ paścādoṣāya glāvinaṃ viśvebhyo bhūtebhyaḥ sidhmalaṃ bhūtyai jāgaraṇam abhūtyai svapanam ārtyai janavādinaṃ vy`ṛddhyā apagalbham̐ sam̐śarāya pracchidam //
column2: for Colour a goldsmith; for Balance a merchant; for Repentance a sluggard; for All Spirits a leper; for Prosperity a watchful man;

column1: akṣarājāya kitavaṃ kṛtāyādinavadarśaṃ tretāyai kalpinaṃ dvāparāyādhikalpinam āskandāya sabhāsthāṇuṃ mṛtyave govyaccham antakāya goghātaṃ kṣudhe yo gāṃ vikṛntantaṃ bhikṣamāṇa upatiṣṭhati duṣkṛtāya carakācāryaṃ pāpmane sailagam //
column2: for the die Krita one who contemplates his adversary's ill luck, for the Tretâ a gamble-manager; for the Dvâpara a chief manager; for Askanda one who will not leave the gambling-hall; for Mrityu one who approaches cows; for Antaka a Cow-killer;

column1: pratiśrutkāyā artanaṃ ghoṣāya bhaṣam antāya bahuvādinam anantāya mūkam̐ śabdāyāḍambarāghātaṃ mahase vīṇāvādaṃ krośāya tūṇavadhmam avarasparāya śaṅkhadhmaṃ vanāya vatapam anyato'raṇyāya dāvapam //
column2: For Echo a reviler; for Noise a snarler; for End a very talkative man; for Endless a mute; for Sound a drummer;

column1: narmāya pum̐ścalūm̐ hasāya kāriṃ yādase śābalyāṃ grāmaṇyaṃ gaṇakam abhikrośakaṃ tān mahase vīṇāvādaṃ pāṇighnaṃ tūṇavadhmaṃ tān nṛtāyānandāya talavam //
column2: for Might these, the head-man of a village, an astrologer, and a watchman; a lute-player; a hand-clapper, a flutist, these for Dance; for Pleasure a musician; For Fire a fat man;

column1: agnaye pīvānaṃ pṛthivyai pīṭhasarpiṇaṃ vāyave cāṇḍālam antarikṣāya vam̐śanartinaṃ dive khalatim̐ sūryāya haryakṣaṃ nakṣatrebhyaḥ kirmiraṃ candramase kilāsam ahne śuklaṃ piṅgākṣam̐ rātryai kṛṣṇaṃ piṅgākṣam //
column2: for Sky a bald-head; for the Sun a green-eyed man; for Stars a spotty man; for the Moon a leper; for Day a white yellow-eyed man;

column1: ataitān aṣṭau virūpān ā labhate 'tidīrghaṃ cātihrasvaṃ cātisthūlaṃ cātikṛśaṃ cātiśuklaṃ cātikṛṣṇaṃ cātikulvaṃ cātilomaśaṃ ca / aśūdrā abrāhmaṇās te prājāpatyāḥ / māgadhaḥ pum̐ścalī kitavaḥ klībo 'śūdrā abrāhmaṇās te prājāpatyāḥ //
column2: Now he ties up the eight following variform men: one too tall, one too short, one too stout, one too thin, one too white, one too black, one too bald, one too airy. These must be neither Sûdras nor Brâhmans, and must be dedicated to Prajâpati. A minstrel, a harlot, a gambler, and a eunuch—neither of Sûdra nor Brâhman caste—are to be dedicated to Prajâpati.

column1: sahasraśīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasrākṣaḥ sahasrapāt / sa bhūmim̐ sarvata spṛtvāty atiṣṭhad daśāṅgulam //
column2: PURUSHA hath a thousand heads, a thousand eyes, a thousand feet. Pervading earth on every side he fills a space ten fingers broad. 2

column1: puruṣa evedam̐ sarvaṃ yad bhūtaṃ yac ca bhāvyam / utāmṛtatvasyeśāno yad annenātirohati //
column2: Purusha is in truth this All, what hath been and what yet shall be; Lord, too, of immortality which waxes greater still by food. 3

column1: etāvān asya mahimāto jyāyām̐ś ca pūruṣaḥ / pādo 'sya viśvā bhūtāni tripād asyāmṛtaṃ divi //
column2: So mighty in his grandeur; yea, greater than this is Purusha. All creatures are one fourth of him, three fourths eternal life in heaven.4

column1: tripād ūrdhva ud ait puruṣaḥ pādo 'syehābhavat punaḥ / tato viṣvaṅ vy akrāmat sāśanānaśane abhi //
column2: With three fourths Purusha rose up: one fourth of him again was here. Thence he moved forth to every side over what eats not and what eats. 5

column1: tasmād virāḍ ajāyata virājo adhi pūruṣaḥ / sa jāto aty aricyata paścād bhūmim atho puraḥ //
column2: From him Virâj was born; again Purusha from Virâj was born. When born, he spread to west and east beyond the boundaries of earth. 6

column1: tasmād yajñāt sarvahutaḥ sambhṛtaṃ pṛṣadājyam / paśūm̐s tām̐ś cakre vāyavyān āraṇyā grāmyāś ca ye //
column2: From that great General Sacrifice the dripping fat was gathered up. He formed the creatures of the air and animals both wild and tame. 7

column1: tasmād yajñāt sarvahuta ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire / chandām̐si jajñire tasmād yajus tasmād ajāyata //
column2: From that great General Sacrifice Richas and Sâma hymns were born: Therefrom were spells and charms produced; the Yajus had its birth from it. 8

column1: tasmād aśvā ajāyanta ye ke cobhayādataḥ / gāvo ha jajñire tasmāt tasmāj jātā ajāvayaḥ //
column2: From it were horses born, from it all cattle with two rows of teeth From it were generated kine, from it were goats and sheep produced. 9

column1: taṃ yajñaṃ barhiṣi praukṣan puruṣaṃ jātam agrataḥ / tena devā ayajanta sādhyā ṛṣayaś ca ye //
column2: They balmed as victim on the grass Purusha born in earliest time. With him the Deities and all Sâdhyas and Rishis sacrificed. 10

column1: yat puruṣaṃ vy adadhuḥ katidhā vy akalpayan / mukhaṃ kim asya kau bāhū kā ūrū pādā ucyete //
column2: When they divided Purusha how many portions did they make?What was his mouth? what were his arms? what are the names of thighs and feet? 11

column1: brāhmaṇo 'sya mukham āsīd bāhū rājanyaḥ kṛtaḥ / ūrū tad asya yad vaiśyaḥ padbhyām̐ śūdro ajāyata //
column2: The Brâhman was his mouth, of both his arms was the Râjanya made. His thighs became the Vaisya, from his feet the Sûdra was produced. 12

column1: candramā manaso jātaś cakṣoḥ sūryo ajāyata / śrotrād vāyuś ca prāṇaś ca mukhād agnir ajāyata //
column2: The Moon was gendered from his mind, and from his eye the Sun had birth; Vâyu and Prâna from his ear, and from his mouth was Agni born. 13

column1: nābhyā āsīd antarikṣam̐ śīrṣṇo dyauḥ sam avartata / padbhyāṃ bhūmir diśaḥ śrotrāt tathā lokām̐ akalpayan //
column2: Forth from his navel came mid-air; the sky was fashioned from his head; Earth from his feet, and from his ear the Quarters. Thus they formed the worlds. 14

column1: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā devā yajñam atanvata / vasanto 'syāsīd ājyaṃ grīṣma idhmaḥ śarad dhaviḥ //
column2: When Gods performed the sacrifice with Purusha as offering Spring was the butter, Autumn the oblation, Summer was the wood. 15

column1: saptāsyāsan paridhayas triḥ sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ / devā yad yajñaṃ tanvānā abadhnan puruṣaṃ paśum //
column2: Then seven were his enclosing-sticks, his kindling-brands were three times seven, When Gods, performing sacrifice, bound as their victim Purusha. 16

column1: yajñena yajñam ayajanta devās tāni dharmāṇi prathamāny āsan / te ha nākaṃ mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ //
column2: Gods, sacrificing, sacrificed the victim: these were the earliest holy ordinances. The Mighty Ones attained the height of heaven, there where the Sâdhyas, Gods of old, are dwelling.17

column1: adbhyaḥ sambhṛtaḥ pṛthivyai rasāc ca viśvakarmaṇaḥ sam avartatāgre / tasya tvaṣṭā vidadhad rūpam eti tan martyasya devatvam ājānam agre //
column2: In the beginning he was formed, collected from waters, earth, and Visvakarman's essence. Fixing the form thereof Tvashtar proceedeth. This was at first the mortal's birth and godhead. 18

column1: vedāham etaṃ puruṣaṃ mahāntam ādityavarṇaṃ tamasaḥ parastāt / tam eva viditvāti mṛtyum eti nānyaḥ panthā vidyate 'yanāya //
column2: I know this mighty Purusha whose colour is like the Sun, beyond the reach of darkness. He only who knows him leaves Death behind him. There is no path save this alone to travel. 19

column1: prajāpatiś carati garbhe antar ajāyamāno bahudhā vi jāyate / tasya yoniṃ pari paśyanti dhīrās tasmin ha tasthur bhuvanāni viśvā //
column2: In the womb moves Prajâpati: he, never becoming born, is born in sundry figures. The wise discern the womb from which he springeth. In him alone stand all existing creatures. 20

column1: yo devebhya ātapati yo devānāṃ purohitaḥ / pūrvo yo devebhyo jāto namo rucāya brāhmaye //
column2: He who gives light and heat to Gods, first, foremost Agent of the Gods, Born ere the Gods—to him the bright, the holy One, be reverence 21

column1: rucaṃ brāhmyaṃ janayanto devā agre tad abruvan / yas tvaivaṃ brāhmaṇo vidyāt tasya devā asan vaśe //
column2: Thus spake the Gods at first, as they begat the bright and holy One: The Brahman who may know thee thus shall have the Gods in his control. 22

column1: śrīś ca te lakṣmīś ca patnyāv ahorātre pārśve nakṣatrāṇi rūpam aśvinau vyāttām / iṣṇann iṣāṇāmuṃ ma iṣāṇa sarvalokaṃ ma iṣāṇa //
column2: Beauty and Fortune are thy wives: each side of thee are Day and Night. The constellations are thy form: the Asvins are thine open jaws. Wishing, wish yonder world for me, wish that the Universe be mine.

column1: tad evāgnis tad ādityas tad vāyus tad u candramāḥ / tad eva śukraṃ tad brahma tā āpaḥ sa prajāpatiḥ //
column2: the Sun is That; Vâyu and Chandramâs are That. The Bright is That; Brahma is That, those Waters, that Prajâpati. 2

column1: sarve nimeṣā jajñire vidyutaḥ puruṣād adhi / nainam ūrdhvaṃ na tiryañcaṃ na madhye pari jagrabhat //
column2: All twinklings of the eyelid sprang from Purusha, resplendent One. No one hath comprehended him above, across, or in the midst. 3

column1: na tasya pratimā asti yasya nāma mahad yaśaḥ / hiraṇyagarbha ity eṣaḥ / mā mā him̐sīd ity eṣā / yasmān na jāta ity eṣa //
column2: There is no counterpart of him whose glory verily is great. In the beginning rose Hiranyagarbha, etc. Let not him harm me, etc. Than whom there is no other born, etc. 4

column1: eṣo ha devaḥ pradiśo 'nu sarvāḥ pūrvo ha jātaḥ sa u garbhe antaḥ / sa eva jātaḥ sa janiṣyamāṇaḥ pratyaṅ janās tiṣthati sarvatomukhaḥ //
column2: This very God pervadeth all the regions; yea, born aforetime, in the womb he dwelleth. He verily born and to be born hereafter meeteth his offspring, facing all directions. 5

column1: yasmāj jātaṃ na purā kiṃ canaiva ya ābabhūva bhuvanāni viśvā / prajāpatiḥ prajayā sam̐rarāṇas trīṇi jyotīm̐ṣi sacate sa aiḍaśī //
column2: Before whom naught whatever sprang to being; who with his presence aids all living creatures, Prajâpati, rejoicing in his offspring, he, Shodasî, maintains the Three great Lustres. 6

column1: yena dyaur ugrā pṛthivī ca dṛḍhā yena sva stabhitaṃ yena nākaḥ / yo antarikṣe rajaso vimānaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema //
column2: By whom the heavens are strong and earth stands firmly, by whom light's realm and sky-vault are supported; By whom the regions in mid-air were measured. What God shall we adore with our oblation?7

column1: yaṃ krandasī avasā tastabhāne abhy aikṣetāṃ manasā rejamāne / yatrādhi sūra udito vibhāti kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema // āpo ha yad bṛhatīḥ / yaś cid āpaḥ //
column2: To whom, supported by his help, two armies embattled look while trembling in their spirit, Where over them the risen Sun is shining. What God shall we adore with our oblation? What time the mighty waters, etc. He in his might surveyed, etc. 8

column1: venas tat paśyan nihitaṃ guhā sad yatra viśvaṃ bhavaty ekanīḍam / tasminn idam̐ saṃ ca vi caiti sarvam̐ sa otaḥ protaś ca vibhūḥ prajāsu //
column2: The Sage beholdeth That mysterious Being wherein this All hath found one only dwelling. Therein unites the Whole, and thence it issues: far-spread it is the warp and woof in creatures. 9

column1: pra tad voced amṛtaṃ nu vidvān gandharvo dhāma vibhṛtaṃ guhā sat / trīṇi padāni nihitā guhāsya yas tāni veda sa pituḥ pitāsat //
column2: Knowing Eternity, may the Gandharva declare that station, parted, kept in secret. Three steps thereof in mystery are hidden: he who knows these shall be the father's father. 10

column1: sa no bandhur janitā sa vidhātā dhāmāni veda bhuvanāni viśvā / yatra devā amṛtam ānaśānās tṛtīye dhāmann adhy airayanta //
column2: He is our kin, our Father and Begetter: he knows all beings and all Ordinances, In whom the Gods obtaining life eternal have risen upward to the third high station. 11

column1: parītya bhūtāni parītya lokān parītya sarvāḥ pradiśo diśaś ca / upasthāya prathamajām ṛtasyātmanātmānam abhi saṃ viveśa //
column2: Having encompassed round existing creatures, the world; and all the Quarters and Mid-quarters, Having the first-born Child of Order he with his Self into The Self hath entered.12

column1: pari dyāvāpṛthivī sadya itvā pari lokān pari diśaḥ pari svaḥ / ṛtasya tantuṃ vitataṃ vicṛtya tad apaśyat tad abhavat tad āsīt //
column2: Having gone swiftly round the earth and heaven, around the worlds, around the sky, the Quarters, Having spread out the lengthened thread of Order, he views, and he becomes and is That Being. 13

column1: sadasas patim adbhutaṃ priyam indrasya kāmyam / saniṃ medhām ayāsiṣam̐m svāhā //
column2: To the Assembly's wondrous Lord, to Indra's lovely Friend who gives Wisdom. have I drawn near in prayer. 14

column1: yāṃ medhāṃ devagaṇāḥ pitaraś copāsate / tayā mām adya medhayāgne medhāvinaṃ kuru svāhā //
column2: That wisdom which the Companies of Gods, and Fathers, recognize, Even with that intelligence, O Agni, make me wise to-day. All-hail! 15

column1: medhāṃ me varuṇo dadātu medhām agniḥ prajāpatiḥ / medhām indras ca vāyuś ca medhāṃ dhātā dadātu me svāhā //
column2: Varuna grant me wisdom! grant it Agni and Prajâpati! Wisdom may Indra, Vâyu grant. May the Creator grant it me. All-hail! 16

column1: idaṃ me brahma ca kṣatraṃ cobhe śriyam aśnutām / mayi devā dadhatu śriyam uttamāṃ tasyai te svāhā //
column2: Let these the Priests and Nobles both enjoy the splendour that is mine. Best splendour may the Gods bestow on me. To thee, that splendour, hail!

column1: asyājarāso damām aritrā arcaddhūmāso agnayaḥ pāvakāḥ / śvitīcayaḥ śvātrāso bhuraṇyavo vanarṣado vāyavo na somāḥ //
column2: His be the fires, eternal, purifying, protectors of our homes, whose smoke is shining, White, waxing in their strength, for ever stirring, and seated in the wood: like winds are Somas. 2

column1: harayo dhumaketavo vātajūtā upa dyavi / yatante vṛthag agnayaḥ // yajā no mitrāvaruṇā yajā devām̐ ṛtaṃ bṛhat / agne yakṣi svaṃ damam //
column2: Gold-coloured, bannered with the smoke, urged by the wind, aloft to heaven Rise, lightly borne, the flames of fire. Bring to us Mitra-Varuna, bring the Gods to the great sacrifice; Bring them, O Agni, to thine home. 4

column1: yukṣvā hi devahūtamām̐ aśvām̐ agne rathīr iva / ni hotā pūrvyaḥ sadaḥ //
column2: Yoke, Agni, as a charioteer, thy steeds who best invoke the Gods: As ancient Hotar take thy seat. 5

column1: dve virūpe carataḥ svarthe anyānyā vatsam upa dhāpayete / harir anyasyāṃ bhavati svadhāvāñ chukro anyasyāṃ dadṛśe suvarcāḥ //
column2: To fair goals travel Two unlike in semblance: each in succession nourishes an infant. One bears a Godlike Babe of golden colour: bright and fair-shining is be with the other. 6

column1: ayam iha prathamo dhāyi dhātṛbhir hotā yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyaḥ / yam apnavāno bhṛgavo virurucur vaneṣu citraṃ vibhvaṃ viśe-viśe //
column2: Here by ordainers was this God appointed first Invoker, best at worship, to be praised at rites, Whom Apnavâna and the Bhrigus caused to shine, bright-coloured in the wood, spreading to every house. 7

column1: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇy agniṃ trim̐śac ca devā nava cāsaparyan / aukṣan ghṛtair astṛṇan barhir asmā ād id dhotāraṃ ny asādayanta //
column2: Three times a hundred Gods, and thrice a thousand, and three times ten, and nine have worshipped Agni, For him spread sacred grass, balmed him with butter, and stablished him as Priest and Sacrificer.8

column1: mūrdhānaṃ divo aratiṃ pṛthivyā vaiśvānaram ṛta ā jātam agnim / kavim̐ samrājam atithiṃ janānām āsann ā pātraṃ janayanta devāḥ //
column2: Him, messenger of earth and head of heaven, Agni Vaisvânara, born in holy Order, The Sage, the King, the Guest of men, a vessel fit for their mouths, the Gods have generated. 9

column1: agnir vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanad draviṇasyur vipanyayā / samiddhaḥ śukra āhutaḥ //
column2: May Agni slay the foemen,—fain for riches, through the love of song Kindled, bright, served with sacrifice. 10

column1: viśvebhiḥ somyaṃ madhv agna indreṇa vāyunā / pibā mitrasya dhāmabhiḥ //
column2: With the All-Gods, with Indra and with Vâyu drink the Soma mead, O Agni, after Mitra's laws. 11

column1: ā yad iṣe nṛpatiṃ teja ānaṭ śuci reto niṣiktaṃ dyaur abhīke / agniḥ śardham anavadyaṃ yuvānam̐ svādhyaṃ janayat sūdayac ca //
column2: When splendour reached the Lord of men to speed him, down from the heaven was shed the brilliant moisture. Agni brought forth to light and filled with spirit the youthful host benevolent and blameless. 12

column1: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāny uttamāni santu / saṃ jāspatyam̐ suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭhā mahām̐si // tvām̐ hi mandratamam arkaśokair vavṛmahe mahi naḥ śroṣy agne / indraṃ na tvā śavasā devatā vāyuṃ pṛṇanti rādhasā nṛtamāḥ //
column2: Show thyself strong for mighty bliss, O Agni; most excellent be thine effulgent splendours. Make easy to maintain our household lordship and trample down the might of those who hate us. 13 We have elected thee as most delightful for thy beams’ glow: hear our great laud, O Agni. The best men praise thee as the peer of Indra in strength, mid Gods, like Vâyu in thy bounty. 14

column1: tve agne svāhuta priyāsaḥ santu sūrayaḥ / yantāro ye maghavāno janānām ūrvān dayanta gonām //
column2: O Agni who art worshipped well, dear let our princes be to thee, Our wealthy patrons who are governors of men, who part in gifts their stalls of kine.15

column1: śrudhi śrutkarṇa vahnibhir devair agne sayāvabhiḥ / ā sīdantu barhiṣi mitro aryamā prātaryāvāṇo adhvaram //
column2: Hear, Agni who hast ears to hear, with all thy train of escort Gods. Let Mitra, Aryaman, seeking betimes our rite, seat them upon the sacred grass. 16

column1: viśveṣām aditir yajñiyānāṃ viśveṣām atithir mānuṣāṇām / agnir devānām ava āvṛṇānaḥ sumṛḍīko bhavatu jātavedāḥ //
column2: The Freedom of all Gods who merit worship, freely received as Guest in all men's houses, Agni who hath secured the Gods’ high favour, may he be gracious to us, Jâtavedas. 17

column1: maho agneḥ samidhānasya śarmaṇy anāgā mitre varuṇe svastaye / śreṣṭhe syāma savituḥ savīmani tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
column2: In great enkindled Agni's keeping and, for bliss, free from all sin before Mitra and Varuna, May we share Savitar's best animating help. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day. 18

column1: āpaś cit pipyu staryo na gāvo nakṣann ṛtaṃ jaritāras ta indra / yāhi vāyur na niyuto no acchā tvam̐ hi dhībhir dayase vi vājān //
column2: Like barren cows, moreover, swelled the waters: singers thy holy cult, O Indra. Come thou to us as to his team comes Vâyu. Thou through our solemn hymns bestowest bounty. 19

column1: gāva upāvatāvataṃ mahī yajñasya rapsudā / ubhā karṇā hiraṇyayā //
column2: Ye Cows, protect the fount. The two mighty Ones bless the sacrifice. The handles twain are wrought of gold. 20

column1: yad adya sūra udite 'nāgā mitro aryamā / suvāti savitā bhagaḥ //
column2: Now when the Sun hath risen to-day may sinless Mitra, Aryaman, Bhaga, and Savitar speed us forth. 21

column1: ā sute siñcata śriyam̐ rodasyor abhiśriyam / rasā dadhīta vṛṣabham //
column2: Pour on the juice the ornament which reaches both the heaven and earth;Supply the liquid to the Bull. Thou in the first old time. See, Vena. 22

column1: ātiṣṭhantaṃ pari viśve abhūṣañ chriyo vasānaś carati svarociḥ / mahat tad vṛṣṇo asurasya nāmā viśvarūpo amṛtāni tasthau //
column2: As he was rising up they all revered him: self-luminous he travels, clothed in splendour. That is the Bull's, the Asura's lofty nature: he, Omniform, hath reached the eternal waters. 23

column1: pra vo mahe mandamānāyāndhaso 'rcā viśvānarāya viśvābhuve / indrasya yasya sumakham̐ saho mahi śravo nṛmṇaṃ ca rodasī saparyataḥ //
column2: I laud your Mighty One who joyeth in the juice, him who is good to all men, who pervadeth all; Indra whose conquering strength is powerful in war, whose fame and manly vigour Heaven and Earth revere. 24

column1: bṛhann id idhma eṣāṃ bhūri śastaṃ pṛthuḥ svaruḥ / yeṣām indro yuvā sakhā //
column2: Great is their fuel, strung their laud, wide is their sacrificial post Whose Friend is Indra, ever young. 25

column1: indrehi matsy andhaso viśvebhiḥ somaparvabhiḥ / mahām̐ abhiṣṭir ojasā //
column2: Come, Indra, and delight thee with the juice at all the Soma feasts, Conqueror, mighty in thy strength. 26

column1: indro vṛtram avṛṇoc chardhanītiḥ pra māyinām aminād varpaṇītiḥ / ahan vyam̐sam uśadhag vaneṣv āvir dhenā akṛṇod rāmyāṇām //
column2: Leading his band, Indra encompassed Vritra; weak grew the wily leader of enchanters. He who burns fierce in forests slaughtered Vyamsa, and made the milch-kine of the nights apparent. 27

column1: kutas tvam indra māhinaḥ sann eko yāsi satpate kiṃ ta itthā / saṃ pṛcchase samarāṇaḥ śubhānair voces tan no harivo yat te asme // mahām̐ indro ya ojasā / kadā cana starīr asi / kadā cana pra yucchasi //
column2: Whence comest thou alone, thou who art mighty, Indra, Lord of the Brave? What is thy purpose? Thou greetest us, encountering us the Bright Ones. Lord of Bay Steeds, say what thou hast against us. Indra, great in his power and might. Ne’er art thou fruitless. Never art thou neglectful.28

column1: ā tat ta indrāyavaḥ panantābhi ya ūrvaṃ gomantaṃ titṛtsān / sakṛtsvaṃ ye puruputrāṃ mahīm̐ sahasradhārāṃ bṛhatīṃ dudukṣan //
column2: Those men extolled that deed of thine, O Indra, those who would fain burst through the stall of cattle, Fain to milk her who bare but once, great, lofty, whose sons are many and her streams a thousand. 29

column1: imāṃ te dhiyaṃ pra bhare maho mahīm asya stotre dhiṣaṇā yat ta ānaje / tam utsave ca prasave ca sāsahim indraṃ devāsaḥ śavasāmadann anu //
column2: To thee the Mighty One I bring this mighty hymn, for thy desire hath been gratified by my laud. In Indra, yea, in him victorious through his might, the Gods have joyed at feast and when the Soma flowed. 30

column1: vibhrāḍ bṛhat pibatu somyaṃ madhv āyur dadhad yajñapatāv avihrutam / vātajūto yo abhirakṣati tmanā prajāḥ pupoṣa purudhā vi rājati //
column2: May the Bright God drink glorious Soma-mingled mead, giving the sacrifice's lord uninjured life; He who, wind-urged, in person guard our offspring well, hath nourished them with food and shone o’er many a land. 31

column1: ud u tyaṃ jātavedasaṃ devaṃ vahanti ketavaḥ / dṛśe viśvāya sūryam̐ svāhā //
column2: His bright rays bear him up aloft, the God who knoweth all that lives, Sûrya, that all may look on him. 32

column1: yenā pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantaṃ janām̐ anu / tvaṃ varuṇa paśyasi //
column2: Pure Varuna, with that same eye wherewith thou lookest upon one Actively stirring mid the folk— 33

column1: daivyāv adhvaryū ā gatam̐ rathena sūryatvacā / madhvā yajñam̐ sam añjāthe // taṃ pratnathā / ayaṃ venaḥ / citram devānām //
column2: Ye two divine Adhvaryus, come hither upon a sun-bright car: Bedew our sacrifice with stead. Thou in the first old time. See, Vena. The brilliant presence. 34

column1: ā na iḍābhir vidathe suśasti viśvānaraḥ savitā deva etu / api yathā yuvāno matsathā no viśvaṃ jagad abhipitve manīṣā //
column2: Loved of all men, may Savitar through praises offered as sacred food come to our synod, That ye too, through our hymns, ye ever youthful, may gladden at your visit all our people.35

column1: yad adya kac ca vṛtrahann udagā abhi sūrya / sarvaṃ tad indra te vaśe //
column2: Whatever, Vritra-slayer! thou Surya hast risen on to-day, That, Indra, all is in thy power. 36

column1: taraṇir viśvadarśato jyotiṣkṛd asi sūrya / viśvam ā bhāsi rocanam //
column2: Swift, visible to all art thou, O Sûrya, maker of the light, Illuming all the radiant realm. 37

column1: tat sūryasya devatvaṃ tan mahitvaṃ madhyā kartor vitatam̐ saṃ jabhāra / yaded ayukta haritaḥ sadhasthād ād rātrī vāsas tanute simasmai //
column2: This is the Godhead, this the might of Sûrya: he hath withdrawn what spread o’er work unfinished. When he hath loosed his horses from their station, straight over all Night spreadeth out her garment. 38

column1: tan mitrasya varuṇasyābhicakṣe sūryo rūpaṃ kṛṇute dyor upasthe / anantam anyad ruśad asya pājaḥ kṛṣṇam anyad dharitaḥ saṃ bharanti //
column2: In the sky's lap the Sun this form assumeth that Varuna and Mitra may behold it. His Bay Steeds well maintain their power eternal, at one time bright, and darksome at another. 39

column1: baṇ mahām̐ asi sūrya baḍ āditya mahām̐ asi / mahas te sato mahimā panasyate 'ddhā deva mahām̐ asi // baṭ sūrya śravasā mahām̐ asi satrā deva mahām̐ asi / mahnā devānām asuryaḥ purohito vibhu jyotir adābhyam //
column2: Verily, Sûrya, thou art great; truly, Âditya, thou art great. As thou art great indeed thy greatness is admired: yea, verily thou, God, art great. 40 Yea, Sûrya, thou art great in fame: thou, evermore, O God, art great. Thou by thy greatness art the Gods’ Home-Priest, divine, far-spread, unconquerable light. 41

column1: śrāyanta iva sūryaṃ viśved indrasya bhakṣata / vasūni jāte janamāna ojasā prati bhāgaṃ na dīdhima //
column2: Turning, as ’twere, to meet the Sun, enjoy from Indra all good things. When he who will be horn is born with power we look to treasures as our heritage. 42

column1: adyā devā uditā sūryasya nir am̐hasaḥ pipṛtā nir avadyāt / tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
column2: To-day, ye Gods, when Sûrya hath ascended, deliver us front trouble and dishonour. This boon may Varuna and Mitra grant us, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.43

column1: ā kṛṣṇena rajasā vartamāno niveśayann amṛtaṃ martyaṃ ca / hiraṇyayena savitā rathenā devo yāti bhuvanāni paśyan //
column2: Throughout the dusky firmament advancing, laying to rest the immortal and the mortal, Borne on his golden chariot he cometh, Savitar, God, beholding living creatures. 44

column1: pra vāvṛje suprayā barhir eṣām ā viśpatīva bīriṭa iyāte / viśām aktor uṣasaḥ pūrvahūtau vāyuḥ pūṣā svastaye niyutvān //
column2: Soft to the tread the sacred grass is scattered: these go like Kings amid the band around them, At the folk's early call on Night and Morning,—Vâyu, and Pûshan with his team to bless us. 45

column1: indravāyū bṛhaspatiṃ mitrāgniṃ pūṣaṇaṃ bhagam / ādityān mārutaṃ gaṇam //
column2: Indra, Vâyu, Brihaspati, Mitra, Agni, Pûshan, Bhaga, Âdityas, and the Marut host. 46

column1: varuṇaḥ prāvitā bhuvan mitro viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ / karatāṃ naḥ surādhasaḥ //
column2: Be Varuna our chief defence, let Mitra guard us with all aids: Both make us rich exceedingly! 47

column1: adhi na indreṣāṃ viṣṇo sajātyānām / itā maruto aśvinā // taṃ pratnathā / ayaṃ venaḥ / ye devāsaḥ / ā na iḍābhiḥ / viśvebhiḥ somyaṃ madhu / omāsaś carṣaṇīdhṛtaḥ //
column2: Regard us, Indra, Vishnu, here, ye Asvins, and the Marut host, us who are kith and kin to you. Thou in the first old time. See, Vena. O ye eleven Gods. Loved of all men, may Savitar. With the All-Gods. Ye Visvedevas who protect. 48

column1: agna indra varuṇa mitra devāḥ śardhaḥ pra yanta mārutota viṣṇo / ubhā nāsatyā rudro adha gnāḥ pūṣā bhagaḥ sarasvatī juṣanta //
column2: O Agni, Indra, Varuna, and Mitra, give, O ye Gods, and Marut host, and Vishnu. May both Nâsatyas, Rudra, heavenly Matrons, Pûshan, Sarasvatî, Bhaga accept us. 49

column1: indrāgnī mitrāvaruṇāditim̐ svaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyāṃ marutaḥ parvatām̐ apaḥ / huve viṣṇuṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇaspatiṃ bhagaṃ nu śam̐sam̐ savitāram ūtaye //
column2: Indra, Agni, Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the Waters, Mountains, Maruts, Sky, and Earth and Heaven, Vishnu I call, Pûshan and Brahmanaspati, and Bhaga, Samsa, Savitar that they may help. 50

column1: asme rudrā mehanā parvatāso vṛtrahatye bharahūtau sajoṣāḥ / yaḥ śam̐sate stuvate dhāyi pajra indrajyeṣṭhā asmām̐ avantu devāḥ //
column2: With us are raining Rudras, clouds accordant in call to battle at the death of Vritra, The strong, assigned to him who sings and praises. May Gods with Indra as their chief protect us.51

column1: viśve adya maruto viśva ūtī viśve bhavantv agnayaḥ samiddhāḥ / viśve no devā avasā gamantu viśvam astu draviṇaṃ vājo asme // viśve devāḥ śṛṇutemam̐ havaṃ me ye antarikṣe ya upa dyavi ṣṭha / ye agnijihvā uta vā yajatrā āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam //
column2: Turn yourselves hitherward this day, ye Holy, that fearing in my heart I may approach you. Protect us, Gods, let not the wolf destroy us. Save us, ye Holy, from the pit and falling. 52 This day come all the Maruts, etc., as in XVIII. 31 Listen, All-Gods, to this mine invocation, ye who inhabit heaven and air's mid-region. All ye;

column1: devebhyo hi prathamaṃ yajñiyebhyo 'mṛtatvam̐ suvasi bhāgam uttaṃam / ād id dāmānam̐ savitar vy `ūrṇuṣe 'nūcīnā jīvitā mānuṣebhyaḥ //
column2: For thou at first producest for the holy Gods the noblest of all portions, immortality. Thereafter as a gift to men, O Savitar, thou openest existence, life succeeding life. 55

column1: pra vāyum acchā bṛhatī manīṣā bṛhadrayiṃ viśvavāram̐ rathaprām / dyutadyāmā niyutaḥ patyamānaḥ kaviḥ kavim iyakṣasi prayajyo //
column2: I with a lofty song call hither Vâyu all-bounteous, filler of his car, most wealthy. Thou, Sage, with bright path, Lord of harnessed horses, impetuous, promptly honourest the prudent. 56

column1: indravāyū ime sutā upa prayobhir āgatam / +indavo vām uśanti hi //
column2: These, Indra-Vâyu, have been shed, etc., as in VII. 8

column1: mitram̐ huve pūtadakṣaṃ varuṇaṃ ca riśādasam / dhiyaṃ ghṛtācīm̐ sādhantā //
column2: Mitra of holy strength I call, and foe-destroying Varuna, Who make the oil-fed rite complete. 58

column1: dasrā yuvākavaḥ sutā nāsatyā vṛktabarhiṣaḥ / ā yātam̐ rudravartanī //
column2: Nâsatyas, Wonder-workers, yours are these libations with clipt grass. Come ye whose paths are bright with glow. 59

column1: taṃ pratnathā / ayaṃ venaḥ // vidad yadī saramā rugṇam adrer mahi pāthaḥ pūrvyam̐ sadhryak kaḥ / agraṃ nayat supady akṣarāṇām acchā ravaṃ prathamā jānatī gāt //
column2: When Saramâ had, found the mountain's fissure, that vast and ancient place she plundered . In the floods’ van she led them forth, light-footed: she who well knew came first unto their lowing.60

column1: nahi spaśam avidann anyam asmād vaiśvānarāt puraetāram agneḥ / em enam avṛdhann amṛtā amartyaṃ vaiśvānaraṃ kṣaitrajityāya devāḥ //
column2: For nowhere did they find another envoy to lead the way than this Vaisvânara Agni. The Gods immortal strengthened the immortal Vaisvânara to win the land in battle. 61

column1: ugrā vighaninā mṛdha indrāgnī havāmahe / tā no mṛḍāta īdṛśe //
column2: The strong, dispellers of the foe, Indra and Agni, we invoke: May they be kind to one like me. 62

column1: upāsmai gāyatā naraḥ pavamānāyendave / abhi devām̐ iyakṣate //
column2: Sing forth to Indu, O ye men, to him as he is purified, Fain to pay worship to the Gods. 63

column1: ye tvāhihatye maghavann avardhan ye śāmbare harivo ye gaviṣṭau / ye tvā nūnam anumadanti viprāḥ pibendra somam̐ sagaṇo marudbhiḥ //
column2: Drink Soma, Indra, handed with the Maruts who, Boon Lord! strengthened thee at Ahi's slaughter, ’Gainst Sambara, Lord of Bays! in winning cattle, and now rejoice in thee, the holy singers. 64

column1: janiṣṭhā ugraḥ sahase turāya mandra ojiṣṭho bahulābhimānaḥ / avardhann indraṃ marutaś cid atra mātā yad vīraṃ dadhanad dhaniṣṭhā //
column2: Thou vast born mighty for victorious valour, exulting, strongest, full of pride and courage. There, even there the Maruts strengthened Indra when his most rapid Mother stirred the Hero. 65

column1: ā tū na indra vṛtrahann asmākam ardham ā gahi / mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ //
column2: O thou who slewest Vritra, come, O Indra, hither to our side, Mighty One with thy mighty aids. 66

column1: tvam indra pratūrtiṣv abhi viśvā asi spṛdhaḥ / aśastihā janitā viśvatūr asi tvaṃ tūrya taruṣyataḥ // anu te śuṣmaṃ turayantam īyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśuṃ na mātarā / viśvās te spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtraṃ yad indra tūrvasi //
column2: Thou in thy battles, Indra, art subduer of all hostile bands. Father art thou, all-conquering, cancelling the curse: vanquish the men who fight with us. 67 Heaven and Earth cling close to thy victorious might As sire and mother to their child. 68

column1: yajño devānāṃ praty eti sumnam ādityāso bhavatā mṛḍayantaḥ / ā vo 'rvācī sumatir vavṛtyād am̐hoś cid yā varivovittarāsat //
column2: The sacrifice obtains the Gods’ acceptance, etc., as in VIII. 4

column2: For you have flowed, through noble ministration, pressed by Adhvaryus, bright sweet-flavoured juices. Drive on thy team and come thou hither, Vâyu: drink for thy rapture of the sap of Soma. 71

column2: Ye Cows, protect, etc., as in verse 14

column2: He hath filled heaven and earth and the great realm of light, when at his birth the skilful held him in their hold. He like a steed is led forth to the sacrifice, Sage, graciously inclined, that he may win us wealth. 76

column2: Call hither with the song and lauds the two best slayers of the foe, Delighting even in our hymn. 77

column2: All Sons of Immortality shall listen to the songs we sing, And be exceeding good to us. 78

column1: brahmāṇi me matayaḥ śam̐ sutāsaḥ śuṣma iyarti prabhṛto me adriḥ / ā śāsate prati haryanty ukthemā harī vahatas tā no accha //
column2: Mine are devotions, hymns, sweet are libations. Strength stirs, and hurled forth is my rocky weapon. They call for me, for me their lauds are longing. To their libations these my Bay Steeds bear me.79

column1: anuttam ā te maghavan nakir nu na tvāvām̐ asti devatā vidānaḥ / na jāyamāno naśate na jāto yāni kariṣyā kṛṇuhi pravṛddha //
column2: Nothing, O Bounteous Lord, stands firm before thee: among the Gods not one is found thine equal. None born or springing into life comes near thee. Do what thou hast to do, exceeding mighty! 80

column1: tad id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭhaṃ yato jajña ugras tveṣanṛmṇaḥ / sadyo jajñāno ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yaṃ viśve madanty ūmāḥ //
column2: In all the worlds That was the Best and Highest whence sprang the mighty God of splendid valour. Quickly when born he overcomes his foemen, he in whom all who lend him aid are joyful. 81

column1: imā u tvā purūvaso giro vardhantu yā mama / pāvakavarṇāḥ śucayo vipaścito 'bhi stomair anūṣata //
column2: May these my songs of praise exalt thee, Lord, who hast abundant wealth. Men skilled in holy hymns, pure, with the hues of fire, have sung them with their lauds to thee. 82

column1: yasyāyaṃ viśva āryo dāsaḥ śevadhipā ariḥ / tiraś cid arye ruśame parīravi tubhyet so ajyate rayiḥ //
column2: Good Lord of wealth is he to whom all Âryas, Dâsas here belong. E’en over unto thee, the pious Rusama Pavîru, is that wealth brought nigh. 83

column1: ayam̐ sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudra iva paprathe / satyaḥ so asya mahimā gṛṇe śavo yajñeṣu viprarājye //
column2: He, with his might advanced by Rishis thousandfold, hath like an ocean spread himself. His majesty is praised as true at solemn rites, his power where holy singers rule. 84

column1: adabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyubhiṣ ṭvam̐ śivebhir adya pari pāhi no gayam / hiraṇyajihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākir no aghaśam̐sa īśata // ā no yajñaṃ divispṛśaṃ vāyo yāhi sumanmabhiḥ / antaḥ pavitra upari śrīṇāno 'yam̐ śukro ayāmi te //
column2: Protect our habitation, Savitar, etc., as in verse 69 Come, Vâyu, drawn by fair hymns, to our sacrifice that reaches heaven. Poured on the middle of the straining-cloth and dressed, this bright drink hath been offered thee. 86

column2: Indra and Vâyu, fair to see and swift to hear, we call to us, That in assembly all, yea, all the folk may be benevolent to us and free from malady.87

column1: ṛdhag itthā sa martyaḥ śaśame devatātaye / yo nūnaṃ mitrāvaruṇāv abhiṣṭaya ācakre havyadātaye //
column2: Yea, specially that mortal man hath toiled for service of the Gods, Who quickly hath brought near Mitra and Varuna to share his sacrificial gifts. 38

column1: ā yātam upa bhūṣataṃ madhvaḥ pibatam aśvinā / dugdhaṃ payo vṛṣaṇā jenyāvasū mā no mardhiṣṭam ā gatam //
column2: Approach ye, and be near to us. Drink, O ye Asvins, of the mead. Draw forth the milk, ye mighty, rich in genuine wealth! Injure us not, and come to us. 89

column1: praitu brahmaṇas patiḥ pra devy etu sūnṛtā / acchā vīraṃ naryaṃ paṅktirādhasaṃ devā yajñaṃ nayantu naḥ //
column2: May Brahmanaspati draw nigh, may Sûnritâ the Goddess come, And Gods bring to our rite which gives the fivefold gift the Hero, lover of mankind. 90

column1: candramā apsv antar ā suparṇo dhāvate divi / rayiṃ piśaṃgaṃ bahulaṃ puruspṛham̐ harir eti kanikradat //
column2: Within the Waters runs the Moon, he with the beauteous wings, in heaven. To yellow-hued abundant wealth, object of many a man's desire, loud-neighing goes the tawny Steed. 91

column1: devaṃ-devaṃ vo 'vase devaṃ-devam abhiṣṭaye / devaṃ-devam̐ huvema vājasātaye gṛṇanto devyā dhiyā //
column2: Singing their praise with godlike hymn let us invoke each God for grace, Each God to bring you help, each God to strengthen you. 92

column2: Agni Vaisvânara, set in heaven, with mighty splendour hath shone forth. Increasing in his power on earth, benevolent, he quells the darkness with his light. 93

column1: indrāgnī apād iyaṃ pūrvāgāt padvatībhyaḥ / hitvī śiro jihvayā vāvadac carat trim̐śat padā ny akramīt //
column2: First, Indra Agni! hath this Maid come footless unto those with feet. Stretching her head and speaking loudly with her tongue, she hath gone downward thirty steps.94

column1: devāso hi ṣmā manave samanyavo viśve sākam̐ sarātayaḥ / te no adya te aparaṃ tuce tu no bhavantu varivovidaḥ //
column2: For of one spirit are the Gods with mortal man, co-sharers all of gracious gifts. May they increase our strength hereafter and to-day, providing ease and ample room. 95

column2: Indra who quells the curse blew curses far away, and then in splendour came to us. Indra, refulgent with the Marut host! the Gods eagerly strove to win thy love. 96

column1: pra va indrāya bṛhate maruto brahmārcata / vṛtram̐ hanati vṛtrahā śatakratur vajreṇa śataparvaṇā // asyed indro vāvṛdhe vṛṣṇyam̐ śavo made sutasya viṣṇavi / adyā tam asya mahimānam āyavo 'nu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā // imā u tvā / yasyāyam / ayam̐ sahasram / ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇaḥ //
column2: To Indra, to your mighty Chief, Maruts, sing forth a mighty prayer. Let Satakratu, Vritra-slayer, kill the fiend with hundred-knotted thunderbolt. 97 Indra increased his manly strength at sacrifice, in the wild rapture of this juice; And living men to-day, even as of old, sing forth their praises to his majesty. May these. Good Lord of wealth. He with his might. Stand up erect.

column1: yaj jāgrato dūram udaiti daivaṃ tad u suptasya tathaivaiti / dūraṃgamaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotir ekaṃ tan me manaḥ śivasaṃkalpam astu //
column2: THAT which, divine, mounts far when man is waking, that which returns to him when he is sleeping, The lights’ one light that goeth to a distance, may that, my mind, be moved by right intention. 2

column1: yena karmāṇy apaso manīṣiṇo yajñe kṛṇvanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ / yad apūrvaṃ yakṣam antaḥ prajānāṃ tan me manaḥ śivasaṃkalpam astu //
column2: Whereby the wise and thoughtful in assemblies, active in sacrifice, perform their duties, The peerless spirit stored in living creatures, may that, my mind, be moved by right intention. 3

column1: yat prajñānam uta ceto dhṛtiś ca yaj jyotir antar amṛtaṃ prajāsu / yasmān na ṛte kiṃ cana karma kriyate tan me manaḥ śivasaṃkalpam astu //
column2: That which is wisdom, intellect, and firmness, immortal light which creatures have within them, That without which men do no single action, may that, my mind, be moved by right intention. 4

column1: yenedaṃ bhūtaṃ bhuvanaṃ bhaviṣyat parigṛhītam amṛtena sarvam / yena yajñas tāyate saptahotā tan me manaḥ śivasaṃkalpam astu //
column2: Whereby, immortal, all is comprehended, the world which is, and what shall be hereafter, Whereby spreads sacrifice with seven Hotars, may that, my mind, be moved by right intention. 5

column2: Wherein the Richas, Sâmans, Yajur-verses, like spokes within a car's nave, are included, And all the thought of creatures is inwoven, may that, my mind, be moved by right intention. 6 Controlling men, as, with the reins that guide them, a skilful charioteer drives fleet-foot horses, Which dwells within the heart, agile, most rapid, may that, my mind, be moved by right intention. 7

column1: pituṃ nu stoṣaṃ maho dharmāṇaṃ taviṣīm / yasya trito vy ojasā vṛtraṃ viparvam ardayat //
column2: Now will I glorify great strength's upholder, Food, By whose invigorating might Trita rent Vritra limb from limb.8

column2: Do thou, in truth, Anumati, assent and grant us happiness. Urge us to strength and energy: prolong the days we have to live. 9

column1: anu no 'dyānumatir yajñaṃ deveṣu manyatām / agniś ca havyavāhano bhavataṃ dāśuṣe mayaḥ // sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā / juṣasva havyam āhutaṃ prajāṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ //
column2: Anumati this day approve our sacrifice among the Gods! Oblation-bearing Agni be, and thou, bliss to the worshipper! 10 O broad-tressed Sinîvâlî, thou who art the sister of the Gods, Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, grant us progeny. 11

column1: pañca nadyaḥ sarasvatīm api yanti sasrotasaḥ / sarasvatī tu pañcadhā so deśe 'bhavat sarit //

column2: O Agni, thou the earliest Angiras, the Seer, hast, God thyself, become the Gods’ auspicious Friend. After thy holy ordinance the Maruts, sage, active through wisdom, with their glittering spears, were born. 15

column1: uttānāyām ava bharā cikitvānt sadyaḥ pravītā vṛṣaṇaṃ jajāna / aruṣastūpo ruśad asya pāja iḍāyās putro vayune 'janiṣṭa //
column2: Lay this with care on her who lies extended: straight, when impregned, hath she brought forth the Hero. With his bright pillar—radiant is his lustre—in our skilled task is born the Son of Idâ. 15

column1: pra manmahe śavasānāya śūṣam āṅgūṣaṃ girvaṇase aṅgirasvat / suvṛktibhi stuvata ṛgmiyāyārcāmārkaṃ nare viśrutāya // pra vo mahe mahi namo bharadhvam āṅgūṣyam̐ śavasānāya sāma / yenā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ padajñā arcanto aṅgiraso gā avindan //
column2: Like Angiras a gladdening laud we ponder to him who loveth song, exceeding mighty. Let us sing glory to the far-famed Hero who must be praised with fair hymns by the singer.17 Unto the Great One bring great adoration, a chant of praise to him the very potent, Through whom our sires, Angirases, singing praises, and knowing well the places, found the cattle. 18

column1: icchanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somaṃ dadhati prayām̐si / titikṣante abhiśastiṃ janānām indra tvad ā kaś cana hi praketaḥ //
column2: The friends who offer Soma long to find thee: they pour forth Soma and present their viands. They bear, Unmoved, the cursing of the people, for all our wisdom comes from thee, O Indra. 19

column1: na te dūre paramā cid rajām̐sy asyā tu pra yāhi harivo haribhyām / sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā yuktā grāvāṇaḥ samidhāne agnau //
column2: Not far for thee are mid-air's loftiest regions: start hither, Lord of Bays, with both Bay Horses. Pressed for the Firm and Strong are these libations. The pressing-stones are set, the fire is kindled. 20

column1: aṣāḍhaṃ yutsu pṛtanāsu paprim̐ svarṣām apsāṃ vṛjanasya gopām / bhareṣujām̐ sukṣitim̐ suśravasaṃ jayantaṃ tvām anu madema soma //
column2: Invincible in fight, saviour in battles, guard of our camp, winner of light and water, Born amid hymns, well-housed, exceeding famous, victor, in thee may we rejoice, O Soma. 21

column1: somo dhenum̐ somo arvantam āśum̐ somo vīraṃ karmaṇyaṃ dadāti / sādanyaṃ vidathyam̐ sabheyaṃ pitṛśravaṇaṃ yo dadāśad asmai //
column2: To him who worships Soma gives a milch cow, a fleet steed, and a man of active knowledge, Skilled in home duties, competent in council, meet for the court, the glory of his father. 22

column1: tvam imā oṣadhīḥ soma viśvās tvam apo ajanayas tvaṃ gāḥ / tvam ā tatanthorv antarikṣaṃ tvaṃ jyotiṣā vi tamo vavartha //
column2: These herbs, these milch-kine, and these running waters, all these, O Soma, thou hast generated. The spacious firmament hast thou expanded, and with the light thou hast dispelled the darkness. 23

column1: devena no manasā deva soma rāyo bhāgam̐ sahasāvann abhi yudhya / mā tvā tanad īśiṣe vīryasyobhayebhyaḥ pra cikitsā gaviṣṭau //
column2: Do thou, God Soma, with thy God-like spirit, victorious, win for us a share of riches. Let none prevent thee: thou art Lord of valour. Provide for these and those in fight for cattle. 24

column1: aṣṭau vy akhyat kakubhaḥ pṛthivyās trī dhanva yojanā sapta sindhūn / hiraṇyākṣaḥ savitā deva āgād dadhad ratnā dāśuṣe vāryāṇi //
column2: The earth's eight points his brightness hath illumined, three desert regions, and the Seven Rivers.God Savitar the gold-eyed hath come hither, giving choice treasures to the man who worships. 25

column1: hiraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā vicarṣaṇir ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī antar īyate / apāmīvāṃ bādhate veti sūryam abhi kṛṣṇena rajasā dyām ṛṇoti // hiraṇyahasto asuraḥ sunīthaḥ sumṛḍīkaḥ svavā yātv arvāṅ / apasedhan rakṣaso yātudhānān asthād devaḥ pratidoṣaṃ gṛṇānaḥ //
column2: Savitar, golden-handed, swiftly moving, goes on his way between the earth and heaven, Drives away sickness, bids the Sun approach us, and spreads the bright sky through the darksome region. 26 May, he, gold-handed Asura, kind leader, come hitherward to us with help and favour. Driving off Râkshasas and Yâtudhânas, the God is present, praised in hymns at evening. 27

column1: ye te panthāḥ savitaḥ pūrvyāso 'reṇavaḥ sukṛtā antarikṣe / tebhir no adya pathibhiḥ sugebhī rakṣā ca no adhi ca brūhi deva //
column2: O Savitar, thine ancient dustless pathways are well established in the air's mid-region. O God, come by those paths so fair to travel: preserve thou us from harm this day and bless us. 28

column1: ubhā pibatam aśvinobhā naḥ śarma yacchatam / avidriyābhir ūtibhiḥ //
column2: Drink our libations, Asvins twain, grant us protection, both of you, With aids which none may interrupt. 29

column1: apnasvatīm aśvinā vācam asme kṛtaṃ no dasrā vṛṣaṇā manīṣām / adyūtye 'vase ni hvaye vāṃ vṛdhe ca no bhavataṃ vājasātau //
column2: Make ye our speech effectual, O Asvins, and this our hymn, ye mighty Wonder-workers. In luckless game I call on you for succour: strengthen us also on the field of battle. 30

column1: dyubhir aktubhiḥ pari pātam asmān ariṣṭebhir aśvinā saubhagebhiḥ / tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
column2: With undiminished blessings, O ye Asvins, through days and nights on every side protect us. This prayer of ours may Varuna grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven. 31

column1: ā kṛṣṇena rajasā vartamāno niveśayann amṛtaṃ martyaṃ ca / hiraṇyayena savitā rathenā devo yāti bhuvanāni paśyan //
column2: Throughout the dusky firmament, etc., as in XXXIII. 43

column1: ā rātri pārthivam̐ rajaḥ pitur aprāyi dhāmabhiḥ / divaḥ sadām̐si bṛhatī vi tiṣṭhasa ā tveṣaṃ vartate tamaḥ // uṣas tac citram ā bharāsmabhyaṃ vājinīvati / yena tokaṃ ca tanayaṃ ca dhāmahe //
column2: Night! the terrestrial realm hath been filled with the Father's power and might. Thou spreadest thee on high unto the seats of heaven: terrific darkness cometh nigh.33 O Dawn enriched with ample wealth, bestow on us that wondrous gift Wherewith we may support children and children's sons. 34

column1: prātar agniṃ prātar indram̐ havāmahe prātar mitrāvaruṇā prātar aśvinā / prātar bhagaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇaspatiṃ prātaḥ somam uta rudram̐ huvema //
column2: Agni at dawn, and Indra we invoke at dawn, and Varuna and Mitra and the Asvins twain, Bhaga at dawn, Pûshan and Brahmanaspati, Soma at dawn, Rudra may we invoke at dawn. 35

column1: prātarjitaṃ bhagam ugram̐ huvema vayaṃ putram aditer yo vidhartā / ādhraś cid yaṃ manyamānas turaś cid rājā cid yaṃ bhagaṃ bhakṣīty āha //
column2: May we invoke strong early-conquering Bhaga, the Son of Aditi, the great Arranger, Thinking of whom the poor, yea, even the mighty, even the King says, Let me share in Bhaga. 36

column1: bhaga praṇetar bhaga satyarādho bhagemāṃ dhiyam ud avā dadan naḥ / bhaga pra ṇo janaya gobhir aśvair bhaga pra nṛbhir nṛvantaḥ syāma //
column2: Bhaga our guide, Bhaga whose gifts are faithful, favour this prayer and give us wealth, O Bhaga. Bhaga, increase our store of kine and horses: Bhaga, may we be rich in men and heroes. 37

column1: utedānīṃ bhagavantaḥ syāmota prapitva uta madhye ahnām / utoditā maghavan sūryasya vayaṃ devānām̐ sumatau syāma //
column2: So may felicity be ours at present, and when the day approaches, and at noontide; And may we still, O Bounteous One, at sunset be happy in the Deities’ loving-kindness. 38

column1: bhaga eva bhagavām̐ astu devās tena vayaṃ bhagavantaḥ syāma / taṃ tvā bhaga sarva ij johavīti sa no bhaga puraetā bhaveha //
column2: May Bhaga verily he Bliss-bestower, and through him, Gods! may happiness attend us. As such, O Bhaga, all with might invoke thee: as such be thou our Champion here, O Bhaga. 39

column1: sam adhvarāyoṣaso namanta dadhikrāveva śucaye padāya / arvācīnaṃ vasuvidaṃ bhagaṃ no ratham ivāśvā vājina ā vahantu //
column2: To this our worship may the Dawns incline them, and come to the pure place like Dadhikrâvan. As strong steeds draw a chariot shay they bring us hitherward Bhaga who discovers treasure. 40

column1: aśvāvatīr gomatīr na uṣāso vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ / ghṛtaṃ duhānā viśvataḥ prapītā yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
column2: May friendly Mornings dawn on us for ever, with wealth of kine, of horses, and of heroes, Streaming with all abundance, pouring fatness. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.41

column1: pūṣan tava vrate vayaṃ na riṣyema kadā cana / stotāras ta iha smasi //
column2: Secure in thy protecting care, O Pûshan, never may we fail: We here are singers of thy praise. 42

column1: pathas-pathaḥ paripatiṃ vacasyā kāmena kṛto abhy ānaḍ arkam / sa no rāsac churudhaś candrāgrā dhiyaṃ-dhiyam̐ sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā //
column2: I praise with eloquence hire who guards all pathways. He, when his love impelled him, went to Arka. May he vouchsafe us gear with gold to grace it: may Pûshan make each prayer of ours effective. 43

column1: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇur gopā adābhyaḥ / ato dharmāṇi dhārayan //
column2: Vishnu the undeceivable Protector strode three steps, thenceforth Establishing his high decrees. 44

column1: tad viprāso vipanyavo jāgṛvām̐saḥ sam indhate / viṣṇor yat paramaṃ padam // ghṛtavatī bhuvanānām abhiśriyorvī pṛthvī madhudughe supeśasā / dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajare bhūriretasā //
column2: This, Vishnu's station most sublime, the singers ever vigilant. Lovers of holy song, light up. 45 Filled full of fatness, compassing all things that be, wide, spacious, dropping meath, beautiful in their form, The Heaven and the Earth by Varuna's decree, unwasting, rich in seed, stand parted each from each. 46

column1: ye naḥ sapatnā apa te bhavantv indrāgnibhyām ava bādhāmahe tān / vasavo rudrā ādityā uparispṛśaṃ mograṃ cettāram adhirājam akran //
column2: Let those who are our foemen stand afar from us: with Indra and with Agni we will drive them off. Vasus, Âdityas, Rudras have exalted me, made me preëminent, mighty, thinker, sovran lord. 47

column1: ā nāsatyā tribhir ekādaśair iha devebhir yātaṃ madhupeyam aśvinā / prāyus tāriṣṭaṃ nī rapām̐si mṛkṣatam̐ sedhataṃ dveṣo bhavatam̐ sacābhuvā //
column2: Come, O Nâsatyas, with the thrice eleven Gods: come, O ye Asvins, to the drinking of the meath. Prolong our days of life, and wipe out all our sins: ward off our enemies; be with us evermore. 48

column1: eṣa va stomo maruta iyaṃ gīr māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ / eṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayāṃ vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
column2: May this your praise, may this your song, O Maruts, sung by the poet, Mâna's son, Mândârya,Bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance. 49

column1: sahastomāḥ sahacchandasa āvṛtaḥ sahapramā ṛṣayaḥ sapta daivyāḥ / pūrveṣāṃ panthām anudṛśya dhīrā anvālebhire rathyo na raśmīn //
column2: They who were versed in ritual and metre, in hymns and rules, were the Seven godlike Rishis. Viewing the path of those of old, the sages have taken up the reins like chariot-drivers. 50

column1: āyuṣyaṃ varcasyam̐ rāyaspoṣam audbhidam / idam̐ hiraṇyaṃ varcasvaj jaitrāyā viśatād u mām //
column2: Bestowing splendour, length of life, increase of wealth, and conquering power, This brightly shining gold shall be attached to me for victory. 51

column1: na tad rakṣām̐si na piśācās taranti devānām ojaḥ prathamajam̐ hy etat / yo bibharti dākṣāyaṇam̐ hiraṇyam̐ sa deveṣu kṛṇute dīrgham āyuḥ sa manuṣyeṣu kṛṇute dīrgham āyuḥ //
column2: This gold no demons injure, no Pisâchas; for this is might of Gods, their primal offspring. Whoever wears the gold of Daksha's children lives a long life among the Gods, lives a long life among mankind. 52

column1: yad ābadhnan dākṣāyaṇā hiraṇyam̐ śatānīkāya sumanasyamānāḥ / tan ma ā badhnāmi śataśāradāyāyuṣmān jaradaṣṭir yathāsam //
column2: This ornament of gold which Daksha's children bound, with benevolent thoughts, on Satânîka, I bind on me for life through hundred autumns, that I may live till ripe old age o’ertakes me. 53

column1: uta no 'hir budhnyaḥ śṛṇotv aja ekapāt pṛthivī samudraḥ / viśve devā ṛtāvṛdho huvānā stutā mantrāḥ kaviśastā avantu //
column2: Let Ahibudhnya also hear our calling, and Aja-Ekapâd and Earth and Ocean.All Gods Law-strengtheners, invoked and lauded, and Texts recited by the sages, help us! 54

column1: imā gira ādityebhyo ghṛtasnūḥ sanād rājabhyo juhvā juhomi / śṛṇotu mitro aryamā bhago nas tuvijāto varuṇo dakṣo am̐śaḥ //
column2: These hymns that drop down fatness, with the ladle I ever offer to the Kings Âdityas. May Mitra, Aryaman, and Bhaga hear us, the mighty Varuna, Daksha, and Amsa. 55

column1: sapta ṛṣayaḥ pratihitāḥ śarīre sapta rakṣanti sadam apramādam / saptāpaḥ svapato lokam īyus tatra jāgṛto asvapnajau satrasadau ca devau //
column2: Seven Rishis are established in the body: seven guard it evermore with care unceasing. Seven waters seek the world of him who lies asleep: two sleepless Gods are feast-fellows of him who wakes. 56

column1: ut tiṣṭha brahmaṇaspate devayantas tvemahe / upa pra yantu marutaḥ sudānava indra prāśūr bhavā sacā //
column2: O Brahmanaspati, arise. God-fearing men, we pray to thee. May they who give good gifts, the Maruts, come to us. Indra, be thou most swift with them. 57

column1: pra nūnaṃ brahmaṇaspatir mantraṃ vadaty ukthyam / yasminn indro varuṇo mitro aryamā devā okām̐si cakrire //
column2: Now Brahmanaspati speaks forth aloud the solemn hymn of praise. Wherein Indra and Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, the Gods have made their dwelling-place. 58

column1: brahmaṇaspate tvam asya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayaṃ ca jinva / viśvaṃ tad bhadraṃ yad avanti devā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ // ya imā viśvā / viśvakarmā / yo naḥ pitā / annapate 'nnasya no dehi //
column2: O Brahmanaspati, be thou controller of this our hymn, and prosper thou our children. All that the Gods regard with love is blessèd. Loud may we speak, with brave sons, in assembly. He who sate down. Mighty in mind. Father who made us. A share of good, O Lord of Food.

column1: apeto yantu paṇayo 'sumnā devapīyavaḥ / asya lokaḥ sutāvataḥ //
column2: BEGONE the Panis, hence away, rebellious, scorners of the Gods! The place is his who poured the juice. 2

column1: savitā te śarīrebhyaḥ pṛthivyāṃ lokam icchatu / tasmia yujyantām usriyāḥ //
column2: Let Savitar approve a spot upon the earth for thy remains: And let the bulls be yoked for it. 3

column1: vāyuḥ punātu / savitā punātu / agner bhrājasā / sūryasya varcasā / vi mucyantām usriyāḥ //
column2: Let Vâyu purify. Let Savitar purify. With Agni's glitter. With Savitar's lustre. Let the bulls be unyoked. 4

column1: aśvatthe vo niṣadanaṃ parṇe vo vasatiṣ kṛtā / gobhāja it kilāsatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam // savitā te śarīrāṇi mātur upastha ā vapatu / tasmai pṛthivi śaṃ bhava //
column2: The Holy Fig Tree is your home, your mansion is the Parna Tree: Winners of cattle shall ye be if ye regain for me this man. 5 Let Savitar lay down thy bones committed to the Mother's lap. Be pleasant to this man, O Earth. 6

column1: prajāpatau tvā devatāyām upodake loke ni dadhāmy asau / apa naḥ śośucad agham //
column2: Here in the God Prajâpati, near water, Man, I lay thee down: May his light drive mishap from us. 7

column1: paraṃ mṛtyo anu parehi panthāṃ yas te anya itaro devayānāt / cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi mā naḥ prajām̐ rīriṣo mota vīrān //
column2: Go hence, O Death, pursue thy special pathway apart from that which Gods are wont to travel. To thee I say it who hast eyes and hearest: Touch not our offspring, injure not our heroes.8

column1: śaṃ vātaḥ śam̐ hi te ghṛṇiḥ śaṃ te bhavantv iṣṭakāḥ / śaṃ te bhavantv agnayaḥ pārthivāso mā tvābhi śūśucan //
column2: Pleasant to thee be wind and sun, and pleasant be the bricks to thee. Pleasant to thee be the terrestrial fires: let them not scorch thee in their flames. 9

column1: kalpantāṃ te diśas tubhyam āpaḥ śivatamās tubhyaṃ bhavantu sindhavaḥ / antarikṣam̐ śivaṃ tubhyaṃ kalpantāṃ te diśaḥ sarvāḥ //
column2: Prosper for thee the regions and the waters, and let the seas for thee be most propitious. Auspicious unto thee be Air. Prosper all Quarters well for thee! 10

column1: aśmanvatī rīyate sam̐ rabhadhvam ut tiṣṭhata pra taratā sakhāyaḥ / atra jahīmo 'śivā ye asañchivān vayam uttaremābhi vājān //
column2: On flows the stony flood: hold fast each other, keep yourselves up, my friends, and pass the river. Here let us leave the powers that brought no profit, and cross the flood to Powers that are auspicious. 11

column1: apāgham apa kilviṣam apa kṛtyām apo rapaḥ / apāmārga tvam asmad apa duḥṣvapnyam̐ suva //
column2: Drive away evil, drive away fault, sorcery, and guiltiness. Do thou, O Apâmârga, drive the evil dream away from us. 12

column1: sumitriyā na āpa oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyās tasmai santu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ //
column2: To us let waters and the plants be friendly, to him who hates us, whom we hate, unfriendly. 13

column1: anaḍvāham ā rabhāmahe saurabheyam̐ svastaye / sa na indra iva devebhyo vahniḥ saṃtaraṇo bhava // ud vayaṃ tamasas pari svaḥ paśyanta uttaram / devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam //

column1: imaṃ jīvebhyaḥ paridhiṃ dadhāmi maiṣāṃ nu gād aparo artham etam / śataṃ jīvantu śaradaḥ purūcīr antar mṛtyuṃ dadhatāṃ parvatena //
column2: Here I erect this rampart for the living: let none of these, none other, reach this limit. May they survive a hundred lengthened autumns, and may they bury Death beneath this mountain. 16

column1: agna āyūm̐ṣi pavasva ā suvorjam iṣaṃ ca naḥ / āre bādhasva ducchunām //
column2: Agni, thou pourest life, etc., as in XIX. 38

column1: āyuṣmān agne haviṣā vṛdhāno ghṛtaprsatīko ghṛtayonir edhi / ghṛtaṃ pītvā madhu cāru gavyaṃ piteva putram abhi rakṣatād imānt svāhā //

column2: These men have led about the ox, have duly carried Agni round, And raised their glory to the Gods. Who will attack them with success? 19

column1: kravyādam agniṃ pra hiṇomi dūraṃ yamarājyaṃ gacchatu ripravāhaḥ / ihaivāyam itaro jātavedā devebhyo havyaṃ vahatu prajānan //
column2: I drive Corpse-eating Agni to a distance: sin-laden let him go to Yama's kingdom. Here let this other, Jâtavedas, carry oblation to the Deities, foreknowing. 20

column1: vaha vapāṃ jātavedaḥ pitṛbhyo yatrainān vettha nihitān parāke / medasaḥ kulyā upa tānt sravantu satyā eṣām āśiṣaḥ saṃ namantām̐ svāhā //
column2: Carry the fat to Fathers, Jâtavedas, where, far away, thou knowest, them established. Let rivulets of marrow flow to meet them, and let their truthful wishes be accomplished. All-hail! 21

column1: syonā pṛthivi no bhavānṛkṣarā niveśanī / yacchā naḥ śarma saprathāḥ // apa naḥ śośucad agham //
column2: Pleasant be thou to us, O Earth, without a thorn, our resting-place. Vouchsafe us shelter reaching far. May thy light drive mishap from us. 22

column2: Born art thou, Agni, from this man: let him again be born from thee, For Svarga's world, the man I name. All-hail!

column1: ṛcaṃ vācaṃ pra padye mano yajuḥ pra padye sāma prāṇaṃ pra padye cakṣuḥ śrotraṃ pra padye / vāg ojaḥ sahaujo mayi prāṇāpānau //
column2: REFUGE I take in Speech as Rich: refuge in Mind as Yajus-text; refuge in Breath as Sâma-chant; refuge in Hearing and in Sight. Speech-energy endowed with strength, inbreath and outbreath are in me. 2

column1: yan me chidraṃ cakṣuṣo hṛdayasya manaso vātitṛṇaṃ bṛhaspatir me tad dadhātu / śaṃ no bhavatu bhuvanasya yas patiḥ //
column2: Whatever deeply-sunk defect I have of eye, or mind, or heart, that way Brihaspati amend! Gracious to us be he, Protector of the world. 3

column1: bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ / tat savitur vareṇyaṃ bhargo devasya dhīmahi / dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayat //
column2: Earth! Ether! Heaven! May we attain that excellent, etc., as in III. 33

column2: With what help will he come to us etc., as in XXVII. 39 What genuine, etc., as in XXVII. 40

column1: kayā tvam na ūtyābhi pra mandase vṛṣan / kayā stotṛbhya ā bhara //
column2: O Hero, with what aid dost thou delight us, with what succour bring Riches to those who worship thee? 8

column1: indro viśvasya rājati / śaṃ no astu dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade //
column2: Indra is king of all that is: may weal attend our bipeds and our quadrupeds. 9

column1: śaṃ no mitram̐ śaṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavatv aryamā / śaṃ na indro bṛhaspatiḥ śaṃ no viṣṇur urukramaḥ //
column2: Gracious he Mitra unto us, and Varuna and Aryaman; Indra, Brihaspati be kind, and Vishnu of the mighty stride. 10

column2: Pleasantly blow the wind for us, may Sûrya warm us pleasantly. Pleasantly, with a roar, the God Parjanya send the rain on us. 11

column1: ahāni śaṃ bhavantu naḥ śam̐ rātrīḥ prati dhīyatām / śaṃ na indrāgnī bhavatām avobhiḥ śaṃ na indrāvaruṇā rātahavyā / śaṃ na indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau śam indrāsomā suvitāya śaṃ yoḥ //
column2: May days pass pleasantly for us, may nights draw near delightfully. Befriend us with their aids Indra and Agni, Indra and Varuna who taste oblations. Indra and Pûshan be our help in battle, Indra and Soma give health, strength, and comfort. 12

column1: śaṃ no devīr abhiṣṭaya āpo bhavantu pītaye / śaṃ yor abhi sravantu naḥ //
column2: May the celestial Waters, our helpers, be sweet for us to drink, And flow with health and strength to us.13

column1: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasas tasya bhājayateha naḥ / uśatīr iva mātaraḥ //
column2: Pleasant be thou to us, O Earth, etc., as in XXXV. 21 Ye, Waters, are, etc., as in XL 50

column1: tasmā araṃ gamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha / āpo janayathā ca naḥ //
column2: Give us a portion, etc., as in XI. 51 To you we gladly come, etc., as in XI. 52, 17

column1: dyauḥ śāntir antarikṣam̐ śāntiḥ pṛthivī śāntir āpaḥ śāntir oṣadhayaḥ śāntiḥ / vanaspatayaḥ śāntir viśve devāḥ śāntir brahma śāntiḥ sarvam̐ śāntiḥ śāntir eva śāntiḥ sā mā śāntir edhi //
column2: Sky alleviation, Air alleviation, Earth alleviation, Plants alleviation, Trees alleviation, All-Gods alleviation, Brahma alleviation, Universe alleviation, just Alleviation alleviation—may that alleviation come to me! 18

column1: dṛte dṛm̐ha mā mitrasya mā cakṣuṣā sarvāṇi bhūtāni sam īkṣantām / mitrasyāhaṃ cakṣuṣā sarvāṇi bhūtāni samīkṣe / mitrasya cakṣuṣā sam īkṣāmahe //
column2: Caldron, strengthen me. May all beings regard me with the eye of a friend. May I regard all beings with the eye of a friend. With the eye of a friend do we regard one another. 19

column1: dṛte dṛm̐ha mā / jyok te saṃdṛśi jīvyāsaṃ jyok te saṃdṛśi jīvyāsam //
column2: Do thou, O Caldron, strengthen me. Long may I live to look on thee. Long may I live to look on thee. 20

column1: namas te harase śociṣe namas te astv arciṣe / anyām̐s te asmat tapantu hetayaḥ pāvako asmabhyam̐ śivo bhava //
column2: Homage to thee the lightning flash, homage to thee the thunder's roar! Homage, O Bounteous Lord, to thee whereas thou fain wouldst win to heaven! 22

column1: yato-yataḥ samīhase tato no abhayaṃ kuru / śaṃ naḥ kuru prajābhyo 'bhayaṃ naḥ paśubhyaḥ //
column2: From whatsoever trouble thou desirest, give us safety thence. Give to our children happiness and to our beasts security. 23

column2: To us let Waters and let Plants be friendly, etc., as in VI. 23

column1: tac cakṣur devahitaṃ purastāc chukram uc carat / paśyema śaradaḥ śataṃ jīvema śaradaḥ śatam̐ śṛṇuyāma śaradaḥ śataṃ pra bravāma śaradaḥ śatam adīnāḥ syāma śaradaḥ śataṃ bhūyaś ca śaradaḥ śatāt //
column2: Through hundred autumns may we see that bright Eye, God-appointed, rise, A hundred autumns may we live. Through hundred autumns may we hear; through hundred autumns clearly speak: through hundred autumns live content; a hundred autumns, yea, beyond a hundred autumns may we see.

column1: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade nārir asi //

column2: Ye who were born the earliest of creation, Ants divine, may I duly prepare for you this day the head of Makha on the place of earth where the Gods sacrificed. For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha!5 Only so large was it at first. Duly may I prepare for you this day the head of Makha on earth's place where the Gods sacrificed. For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha! 6

column2: Indra's effective might are ye. Duly may I prepare for you this day the head of Makha on earth's place where the Gods sacrificed. For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha! For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha! For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha! 7

column2: Thee for the True. Thee for the Good. Thee for the place of happy rest.For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha! For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha! For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha! 11

column1: anādhṛṣṭā purastād agner ādhipatya āyur me dāḥ / putravato dakṣiṇata indrasyādhipatye prajāṃ me dāḥ / suṣadā paścād devasya savitur ādhipatye cakṣur me dāḥ / āsrutir uttarato dhātur ādhipatye rāyaspoṣaṃ me dāḥ / vidhṛtir upariṣṭād bṛhaspater ādhipatye ojo me dāḥ / viśvābhyo mā nāṣṭrābhyas pāhi / manor aśvāsi //
column2: Unconquerable, eastward, in Agni's overlordship, give me life. Rich in sons, southward, in Indra's overlordship give me offspring. Fair-seated, westward, in God. Savitar's overlordship, give me sight. Range of hearing, northward, in Dhâtar's overlordship, give me increase of wealth. Arrangement, upward, in Brihaspati's overlordship, give me energy. From all destructive spirits guard us. Thou art Manu's mare. 13

column2: It moveth; it is motionless. It is far distant; it is near. It is within This All; and it surrounds This All externally. 6

column1: yas tu sarvāṇi bhūtāny ātmann evānupaśyati / sarvabhūteṣu cātmānaṃ tato na vi cikitsati //
column2: The man who in his Self beholds all creatures and all things that be, And in all beings sees his Self, thence doubts no longer, ponders not. 7

column1: yasmint sarvāṇi bhūtāny ātmaivābhūd vijānataḥ / tatra ko mohaḥ kaḥ śoka ekatvam anupaśyataḥ //
column2: When, in the man who clearly knows, Self hath become all things that are,What wilderment, what grief is there in him who sees the One alone? 8

column1: sa pary agāc chukram akāyam avraṇam asnāviram̐ śuddham apāpaviddham / kavir manīṣī paribhūḥ svayaṃbhūr yāthātathyato 'rthān vy adadhāc chāśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ //
column2: He hath attained unto the Bright, Bodiless, Woundless, Sinewless, the Pure which evil hath not pierced. Far-sighted, wise, encompassing, he self-existent hath prescribed aims, as propriety demands, unto the everlasting Years. 9

column1: andhaṃ tamaḥ pra viśanti ye 'saṃbhūtim upāsate / tato bhūya iva te tamo ya u saṃbhūtyām̐ ratāḥ //
column2: Deep into shade of blinding gloom fall Asambhûti's worshippers. They sink to darkness deeper yet who on Sambhûti are intent. 10

column1: anyad evāhuḥ saṃbhavād anyad āhur śaṃbhavāt / iti śuśruma dhīrāṇāṃ ye nas tad vicacakṣire //
column2: One fruit, they say, from Sambhava, another from Asambhava. Thus from the sages have we heard who have declared this lore to us. 11

column1: saṃbhūtiṃ ca vināśaṃ ca yas tad vedobhayam̐ saha / vināśena mṛtyuṃ tīrtvā saṃbhūtyāmṛtam aśnute //
column2: The man who knows Sambhûti and Vinâsa simultaneously, He, by Vinâsa passing death, gains by Sambhûti endless life.12

column1: andhaṃ tamaḥ pra viśanti ye 'vidyām upāsate / tato bhūya iva te tamo ya u vidyāyām̐ ratāḥ // anyad evāhur vidyāyā anyad āhur avidyāyāḥ / iti śuśruma dhīrāṇāṃ ye nas tad vicacakṣire //
column2: To blinding darkness go the men who make a cult of Nescience. The devotees of Science enter darkness that is darker still. 13 Different is the fruit, they say, of Science and of Nescience. Thus from the sages have we heard who have declared this lore to us. 14

column1: vidyāṃ cāvidyāṃ ca yas tad vedobhayam̐ saha / avidyayā mṛtyuṃ tīrtvā vidyayāmṛtam aśnute //
column2: The man who knoweth well these two, Science and Nescience, combined, O’ercoming death by Nescience by Science gaineth endless life. 15

column1: vāyur anilam amṛtam athedaṃ bhasmāntam̐ śarīram / o3m krato smara klibe smara kṛtam̐ smara //
column2: My breath reach everlasting Air! In ashes let my body end. OM! Mind, remember thou; remember thou my sphere; remember thou my deeds.16

column1: agne naya supathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān / yuyodhy asmaj juhurāṇam eno bhuyiṣṭhāṃ te namaktiṃ vidhema //
column2: By goodly path lead us to riches, Agni, thou God who knowest all our works and wisdom. Remove the sin that makes us stray and wander: most ample adoration will we bring thee. 17

column1: hiraṇmayena pātreṇa satyasyāpihitaṃ mukham / yo 'sāv āditye puruṣaḥ so 'sāv aham // o3m khaṃ brahma //
column2: The Real's face is hidden by a vessel formed of golden light. The Spirit yonder in the Sun, the Spirit dwelling there am I. OM! Heaven! Brahma!
